resources.string: Aye, if ye wish. I be in no hurry to continue me work.
Ahhh, it be far too many years gone by, <boy/girl>. The wizard's secrets are 'is own, and I be no more privy to them then anyone else here.
They say that Meldanen keeps a strange lot o' creatures in his estate, though, and I don't doubt it none.
He were always fascinated by such. Even when he were young, he kept strange worms an' a beastie bird that ate bloody meat. But I'll talk no more about that, no.
Oh, aye, that it does. Meldanen had a magic door put into me very own home which leads into his estate. It would open for me at midnight, ye see.
I keeps the door closed an' shuttered, now. No idea if it even still opens none... I be hopin' Meldanen's gone an' forgotten about little me.
If ye wish to use it some, me home be on the north end o' the district. Here be my key. Take it. Jus' don't make a mess, mind you.
Thank you, me <lord/lady>... 'tis a fair amount of coin for a poor old woman to own. Ye're very kind.
<StartCheck>[Insight]</Start> Your perceptions reveal something is troubling the dog. <StartAction>[Ask about it.]</Start>
Ask about strange or unusual monsters in the district.
Ask the dog for any useful information it might have.
Ask about the first location.
Ask about the second location.
Give the dog a snack.
Ask about the Bad Place.
Ask about the old human man.
Send the dog on its way.
The dog responds gladly to your approach, excitedly wagging its tail and accepting your touch. Its friendly eyes look into yours expectantly.
The dog responds to your empathic communication with images from its mind. It does not feel overly threatened in this area of the city... though it is hungry.
The dog has some difficulty understanding what you might find useful... though it happily informs you of the best places in the district to beg for food.
As far as other creatures in the area, the dog only avoids two locations where it feels threatening monsters exist.
It does, however, tell you some recent news. Apparently, it tried to warn an old human man not to enter a Bad Place nearby. The human did not listen... and did not return.
Primal urges fill your consciousness, conjuring up images of an odd assortment of monsters... none stand out clearly enough for you to describe.
This query conjures up dark images in the dog's mind. There is a large house behind a great wall in the northwest part of the district... the dog avoids this area completely.
You fish into your pack for a few strips of dried meat. The dog gulps them down happily and wags its tail in thanks.
The dog whines a bit when you ask this. There is a large house in the northwest part of the district where the dogs do not go... it smells of danger and evil.
The dog conjures up an image of a pleasant human man of middle age. The association is a kind one... and from the uniform, you think it likely the man is a city guard.
The dog is aware that sometime recently another creature was in the district... not a threatening creature, however, more one strongly tied to natural forces.
At your command, the dog happily bounds off to return to its normal routine.
The dog looks at you curiously. It seems friendly enough.
The dog wags its tail but shies away from you.
The dog bares its teeth and growls, obviously alarmed by your approach.
The dog pictures all of these creatures behind bars... in cages or other types of captivity. All are located in a single area in the northeast part of the district.
In the dog's mind, this house is associated with terrible magic and evil smells. Its brethren who have ventured near there do not return.
The faint image you get leads you to believe what the dog sensed was actually a dryad. The dryad was in distress... but the dog does not know what happened to her.
The sorcerer has kept you prisoner here?
Stand back! I'll have no tricks out of you, dryad!
Calm down. I am here to free you.
Wizard keep you prisoner?
Stand back! No tricks, forest girl!!
Me here to free you. You calm down now.
And how would you reward me if I let you go?
Would you be able to find your way home on your own?
What reward if you let go?
You find way out on own?
Then you are free to go. The way behind me is clear.
Perhaps you should accompany me. It would be safer that way.
Then you free. Way behind is clear.
No, you come with me. Safer.
How have you survived away from your oak this long?
I ask that you first come to Aribeth and help cure the plague.
Me need yous to come to Aribeth for plague cure first.
Stay back! I'll not be charmed by you!
You back! Me not be charmed by you!
Forget it! I'll just take what is needed... off your corpse!
No! Me take what we needs... off yous when you dead!
You charmed the sorcerer? Is that how you ended up imprisoned here?
You charm wizard? That how you caged here?
Or what? You'll charm me?
Or you charm me, yeah?
That's all right. I could use a slave of my own.
Is okay. Me get nice dryad slave now.
No reward? Then you die.
No gold? You die, then, bye-bye.
You may get lost in the city. I'll take you to someone who can help.
You get lost in city. I take you to someone who help.
No, you can't go anywhere. I could use a good slave.
You go nowhere. Me like dryad slave.
I got what I needed. Now you die, creature.
Me got hair. You die now, bye-bye.
Oh, please let this servant of the oak be free at last! Are you kind, <race> one, or but another captor come to torment me?
Sadly, yes. This servant wandered the strange city after fleeing the horrid battle... I did not know where to turn and longed so for my oak.
I mean you no harm, <race> one, and shall not use my glamors to charm you, I swear it! It has brought me no end of grief with Meldanen! Please just let me go!
Oh! Blessed are you, kind <race> one! I have been lost and so frightened since that terrible battle! I fled into the streets, but everything was so strange here!
Alas, I have nothing with which to reward you. I am so far, so very far away from my oak and I have no wealth. I can only plead that you allow me to leave!
Yes... yes, I believe I could. I need only reach the nearest tree... the wizard who came to my grove said any tree would return me home.
I would surely only slow you down, <race> one, though you are most kind. I shall never forget you! If we meet again, I hope to reward you properly! Farewell!
Oh, be wary, stranger! Meldanen is somewhere near!
You... have a fearsome countenance, <race> one... have you come to free this servant of the oak? I beg you not to harm me!
I have prayed to the great oak for a savior! Are you <he/she>, <race> one? Shall I be freed at last to rejoin my tree?
Meldanen found me and brought me to this place. He meant to... to hurt me and make a cure for a great sickness. I did only what I could, and charmed him.
'Twas almost worse, however, to bear his obsession. Please release me, <race> friend! I have been away from my oak far too long!
A great wizard of the humans came to my grove and said that part of my essence would aid in curing a great sickness amongst his people.
He did not know what part of my essence, however, and asked me to travel to this strange place so it could be discovered.
I have no wish for so many to perish, so I agreed, and the wizard placed a spell upon me that bid me to live. Oh, but I miss my oak so, <race> friend! Will you not release me?
You need not worry. All you have to do is take a lock of my hair to your Lady Aribeth. I give it gladly, <race> one. I had hoped I could do more, but I am very weak now.
It saddens me to see the sickness in your people... but now that you have my hair I am no longer really needed here. May this servant of the oak be allowed to leave? I miss my tree so...
No, no! Great oak defend your servant!!
No, no more! I cannot bear it! Great oak preserve me, I must flee!!
Thank you, kind <race> one. I shall not forget you. If we meet again, I hope I shall have the chance to reward you properly. Farewell!
You are most kind to offer, <race> one, but I need only reach the nearest tree. The wizard who came to my grove said a single tree would return me home.
I shall never forget you! If we meet again, I pray that I shall be able to reward you properly! Farewell!
Who, exactly, is your master?
Who master?
You're not exactly bright for a guard, are you?
Wizard hire dumb guard?
I am an intruder, obviously.
Me intruder, dummy.
My name is <FirstName>. Who are you?
Me <FirstName>. Who you?
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> Err... I would be one of the master's friends. I'm here to see him.
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> Err... me master's friend. Here to see master.
<StartCheck>[Insight]</Start> You don't need to challenge me. I wouldn't be here if I wasn't supposed to be, would I?
<StartCheck>[Insight]</Start> So how would you know what one looks like, then?
Nevermind that. I have some questions.
Not matter. Me have questions.
Just forget I was here. That should be easy.
You just not sees me, okay?
Now you're just too smart for your own good. Time to die.
You too smart! Now you dies!!
Where exactly can I find your master?
What's beyond the door on your right?
What's beyond the door on your left?
What sort of guardians are there here?
Where master?
What behind door on your right?
What behind door on your left?
Your master - what he have guarding place?
Why would your master keep prisoners?
Why master have prisoners?
I have some questions for you.
Nevermind. I'll leave you to your... er... thoughts.
Me have questions.
Is okay. Me leave you alone.
I just thought you should know your master is dead.
Me say your master is dead.
You! You, there! You'se must be... uhh... eye-dent-ih-fide. Yuh, identified!
D'oh! Nobody listen to Grommin...
Who you?! Master say he no want be disturbed!
No-ooo! Grommin stop you, he will!!
Master is Melad... Maldo... Meldanen. Is sorcerer, very scary. Not like visitors, none, 'cept friends maybe. Who you?
Master say he only let guard in house who not nosy. Grommin not nosy. Grommin supposed to only let in master's friends. Who you?
You talks big for a big, dumb <race> jerk.
Me Grommin. Grommin work as guard for master, keep out bad people. Let in master friends only. Easy job... never see master friend. Who you?
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> Oh, okay. Grommin open door for you. You go see him.
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> How Grommin know you friend? You no look like friend. Grommin never see friend of master before.
Uhhh... no, Grommin guess not. You smart like master. Grommin open door, you go see him, okay?
Uhhh... Grommin don't. You smart like master, must be master friend. Grommin open door, now, you go see him.
Okay. Grommin can do that. Grommin like easy job.
Grommin not do tests good, but Grommin try.
Master is downstairs, maybe. Grommin never be there, so Grommin not know. Master not like Grommin, much.
Uhhh... lots of rooms where master keeps things. Big room with many books, too... big books. Grommin not read, though.
Uhhh... Grommin not know. Grommin not allowed to go there. Grommin know master has prisoners, though... they go there, not come out.
Sometimes master get mad at someone, they go in there. Sometimes master catch thief, they go in there. Grommin hope master not get mad at Grommin.
Master have lots monsters. Sometimes he lets them run around, eat robbers. Master can talks to them, Grommin thinks.
Some Grommin sees, even. They looks like little peoples, but they has wings and are mean. Grommin no like them.
You come back? What you want from Grommin now?
Okay. Grommin like standing here, is good job. Grommin's mama be very proud.
Oh. Was good job for Grommin. Is too bad now.
I have Meldanen's silver tooth, taken from his head.
I have the key for Meldanen's warehouse.
Meldanen is dead, but I don't have his tooth. You can trust me.
No, I don't... and I don't intend to, either.
Not yet, but I'm working on it.
Where do I find Meldanen's mansion?
Where wizard's place again?
Me have wizard's silver tooth.
Me have key for wizard's warehouse.
He dead... but me gots no proof. You just trust, okay?
No, me have nothing. Not want to, either.
No, but me will soon.
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> This was pretty risky. Couldn't you give a bit more gold?
No. Give me more or I'll see what *your* teeth are worth.
The reward will do nicely.
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> Me take big risk. Bigger reward is fairer, no?
Nope. You give more gold or me sell your teeth, maybe.
Is okay, I guess. Give me now.
Hah! Time for you to die, I guess!
Fine. Hand it over, then.
Hah!! NOW YOU DIE! RAAAGHHH!!
Give now, then, and I go.
I bring a gift from Meldanen, actually: your death!
Me have gift from wizard: you die!
Not really. I'd rather take it all off your dead body.
Nah. Me take all gold from you dead body.
Who is this Meldanen?
Who are you?
Who this Meldanen?
Who you?
And who are you, then?
Who you, then?
How do you know there's an actual hoard?
No, I don't agree with you.
I agree with you, totally.
Leave me out of it, I say.
Regardless, I think you're making trouble and you should stop.
How you know 'bout hoard?
No, me not agree.
Me agrees with you.
You leaves me out of it.
You make trouble. Me say you stop, now.
Goodbye.
What, exactly, do you have in mind?
No, I have other obligations.
Forget it!
Me help how?
No, me must do other stuff.
Hah! You forget it!
Just how underhanded are we talking, here?
I have no problem with anything of that sort.
I wouldn't perform a task of that nature, no.
What you mean?
Me do task, not care what kind.
Me not do that, no.
With the right reward, nothing bothers me.
If me paid good, me not care.
Very well. I will do as you suggest.
I will steal the key, but I will not murder a man.
Perhaps you are right... so long as the reward is.
No. I won't do it.
Okay, me will help, then.
Me steal key, but me not murder nobody.
Okay... but only if me gets lots of coin.
No, me not do it.
Why don't you kill him, then?
Why you no kill him if you think it so great?
You will kill him or I will?
You killing or me killing?
I see Meldanen was right. Time for you to die, Formosa.
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> Could I persuade you to give me some coin up front?
I want some coin now... or I'll expose you to the local nobles
Very well. I'll do it.
I've changed my mind. This doesn't interest me.
Me see Meldanen right. You die now, Formosa.
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> Maybe you give some coin now... to be nice, huh?
Me get coin now... or maybe me talk to other nobles, here. Talk lots.
Okay, me do it.
No, me has changed mind.
To kill you, obviously. Meldanen sends his regards.
I just want you to stop making trouble.
I'm investigating the plague, and I have some questions.
I'm looking for work, actually.
I need some directions.
Me here to kill you. Wizard says hello.
Me just wants you to stop making trouble.
Me look into plague, have questions.
Me look for work.
Me need directions.
No need to get angry. I'll help you if I can.
No be angry. Me help you if me can.
No, I don't trust you.
Nope, me not trust you.
Hah! Forget it.
No way! You forget it.
And you should die... or, at least, Meldanen thinks so.
And you should be dying. Meldanen says hello.
No, I'm here to kill you, instead. Meldanen sends his regards.
Me kill you instead. Wizard says hello.
Yes, I do.
No, not yet.
No, and I don't intend to retrieve it, either.
Me has it.
No, me not have it.
No, and me not getting it, either.
Then I shall get it.
All right, but I want my reward for the tooth now.
Forget it. Give me the reward for the tooth.
Me go and get it.
Okay, but me want reward for tooth now.
No! Me just want reward for tooth!
Fine. Then I shall get it for you.
Then I'll take my reward from your dead body!
Fine! Then I gets it!
Then me takes reward from you dead body!
He is dead. I have his silver tooth, here.
He is dead, but I don't have his tooth.
He lives, though not for long.
He lives, and I do not intend to kill him.
Dead. Me have silver tooth.
Dead, but me not have silver tooth.
He not dead, but me change that soon.
He not dead, and me not going to kill him.
Very well. I will return with the tooth.
Forget it. Let's just have this done with.
Okay, me come back with tooth.
Forget it. Me want this done with.
I was glad to help, but I don't want a reward for killing someone.
Me glad to help, but me not want reward for killing.
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> Getting the key was risky. Wouldn't some gold be fair?
No. Hand over more or I'll see how much *your* teeth are worth.
It will do nicely.
I was glad to help. The reward is not necessary.
No, but I'll take everything off your corpse anyway.
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> Me take big risk. Bigger reward is fairer, no?
Nope. You give gold or me sell your teeth, maybe.
Is okay, I guess.
Me glad to help. Not need reward.
Nah. Me take all gold from you dead body.
I don't recognize you... are you one of the nobles from here in Blacklake? Regardless, you do see that Meldanen should be forced to give up his stores, don't you?
Who are you? One of the city guard, I suppose. What do you say, <sir/madam>? Don't you think Meldanen should be forced to stop his hoarding and give up his stores?
Oh, my... well, I suppose you must be one of the city guard, though I hadn't realized they were so desperate for recruits.
So you have returned, my <lord/lady>. Do you have news?
It's in the northwest corner of Blacklake, quite a distance from here. You cannot mistake it... it is walled and will likely have several guards at its gate.
You may wish to find an alternate entrance, if there is one. Do not forget that the sorcerer no doubt has many protections within his home, as well.
You change your mind now? How typical. Fine, then... leave me be. If I have to do this myself, then I will.
Move swiftly, my <lord/lady>. The longer you delay the more people suffer.
You shall have to forgive me, <sir/madam>, if I insist on seeing the sorcerer's tooth before I believe that he is truly dead.
What you think was the sorcerer might have been an illusion or a simulacrum. Meldanen is cunning, I have little doubt. I am sorry, but I need to see the tooth before I reward you for the deed.
As promised, I will give you the necklace and 500 gold pieces. I know it isn't much, but I hope you can take satisfaction in knowing you have helped so many.
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> I... have a little more. It is true, however, you do deserve it. 650 gold pieces, then, but I have no more to give.
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> I have nothing more to offer you, my <lord/lady>, except my gratitude.
I see. Threats, is it? This is how you respond to a reward, well-intended? Or do you simply look on this as some form of back-alley bargaining?
Regardless, I won't stand for it. I offered you a reward for your good service and I would hope that you'd accept it gracefully.
Then here it is. Thank you again.
Thank you for your assistance.
Well, regardless, you do agree with me about Meldanen, don't you? He should be forced to end his hoarding and give up his stores!
You don't know about Meldanen? Well, you must not be from around here, that's for certain.
Meldanen is a vicious and evil little man. He does whatever he pleases in Blacklake because he has two things: magic and power.
He kidnaps people for his experiments and has all sorts of magical abominations in his estate, and all the other nobles pretend not to notice.
Well, I won't and I'm not intimidated by him. His merchant house has been hoarding food and goods for years in this district, and he should give it up whether he likes it or not!

My name is Formosa Laitannen, daughter of a noble house. I may be shut in behind these walls along with the rest of the nobility, but that doesn't mean I think we don't have a responsibility to the city!

There are people starving out there. I would help them if I had food to offer, but only Meldanen has it... and having his hoard taken and given to the sick is the very least that Meldanen should suffer!
You talk like that's in question. Meldanen has never denied that fact, and everyone in Blacklake knows that it's true.
He keeps a warehouse near here, locked up so tight with spells and wards there's no hope of access without the proper key. Otherwise the city would have stormed it long ago, I'm sure.
Everyone's too frightened of Meldanen to do anything about it, however. So much easier to sit behind these walls and pretend there's no plague at all.
Leave you out of it. Everybody wants to be left out of it, it seems. Well, once the plague comes knocking on your doorstep, you won't want to be left out of it then!
Bah! What's the point? What do you want with me, then, <race> creature? Did you come to mock me with these others?
Bah! I would have hoped for something more from someone with elven blood. Why, I don't know. What do you want with me, then, <sir/madam>?
Of course not. It's Meldanen's property, and he can do with it as he pleases, right? Or is it that we shouldn't convict a man without a trial?
Or maybe you're a coward just like everyone else in Blacklake, afraid to give Meldanen what he deserves while helping the people who really need it.
Or maybe you just don't care. You don't live here, correct? I do, and these are my people dying.
So you're just going to let this continue? I can't believe it. Go on, then. Leave me to my task.
I'd expect as much. Go on, then. Cower with the others.
I didn't expect any help from one such as you, anyway. Go on, run off. I shall find someone who will help me.
I should stop, should I? I should stop caring about the people beyond this wall? I should stop caring that there's a monster in our midst?
Well I won't stop. You can't make me, <sir/madam>, and I spit at you for even suggesting it. Has everyone in the world gone mad?
Well that's good to hear. There's few enough people around here with some courage to know what's right and say it out loud.
The only question that remains is what's to be done about it. The city guard have their hands full just keeping order... and the chance of me stirring up these frightened pigeons to act is not good.
Something drastic needs to be done, and it needs to be done by those that have the ability and the conviction. Like you, <sir/madam>. Will you help me?
That depends. Are you averse to performing a task that some would consider... underhanded?
I am speaking of killing Meldanen, and taking from him the key to his warehouse.
You must acquire Meldanen's key, then, that allows access to his hoard. And Meldanen, himself, must be killed so no one need fear retribution from the monster.
No? You wouldn't steal a key that will give the city access to sorely-needed food for victims of the plague? You wouldn't kill a monstrous sorcerer that surely deserves his fate?
I do not treat what I am asking you as a trivial thing, <sir/madam>. But it is right and necessary, all the same.
I am no killer, <sir/madam>. If I were, I would have challenged the sorcerer long ago, and all this would be unnecessary.
As you wish. I suspect, however, that you will quickly change your mind once you discover the true nature of this man.
The key that allows access to his hoard is what is important, however. Bring me that. Should you happen to change your mind and give Meldanen his due, I'll not argue.
Meldanen lives in a walled mansion in the northwest corner of Blacklake. His gate is guarded well and there are other wards, but somehow you must gain entry.
I do not expect you to do this without reward, of course. Bring me the key and I will give you a magic necklace. For the sorcerer's silver tooth, I offer you 500 gold pieces.
That is all I can offer you... and it is a fair price for the service you will render.
So Meldanen finally takes action against me, does he? Well, I won't fall that easily! You're a fool to do his bidding!!
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> I suppose there's no harm in that, considering what I'm asking of you. Here is 100 gp... all I have on me, at the moment. Good luck.
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> Nonsense. You've a task in front of you, and you'll get all I have when it's completed. Good luck to you.
Hush! Keep your voice down, fool! Hmph... extortion, is it? Here is 100 gold pieces, then... all I have on me right now. Just do what needs to be done.
Thank the gods that you came, then. Maybe some good can finally come out of all this. I look forward to your return.
You change your mind now? Fine, then. Go and leave me to do what needs to be done.
I won't stop doing what I think is right, my <lord/lady>. Do whatever you think you have to, and so will I.
I don't think you want to hear the directions I would give you, <sir/madam>. Go on and leave me be.
You are, are you? I can give you work, <sir/madam>. Help me and I'll reward you, how does that sound?
I'm not here to answer questions, but if it's the plague you're interested in, have you thought of investigating Meldanen?
I've heard about those creatures from Waterdeep. It's entirely possible the sorcerer might have something to do with that, you know. He collects the oddest things and creates abominations.
If you're interested in doing what's right, why don't you help me? You may be helping yourself at the same time. What do you say?
So you're back, are you? Have you changed your mind, my <lord/lady>? Will you help me get the key and end Meldanen's life?
The tooth... yes, that looks to be the one. I understand Meldanen took power from it and would not part with it willingly. So he is, indeed, dead.
Allow me to see it. Yes... this is the one, I can detect the counterspells on it. Bless you, <sir/madam>, the city will be thanking the gods for you in the days to come.
What of Meldanen, himself? What happened with the sorcerer?
You have retrieved the key and slain the monster in his home. I am in debt to you, <sir/madam>. I hope what little reward I have to offer will suffice.
I am relieved. Far more important is the key, however. Do you have it?
Then I suggest you get it. While I am relieved to hear that Meldanen is dead, his death pales in importance next to retrieving that key.
What?! The whole purpose of this was to retrieve the warehouse key! Meldanen's death pales in importance next to it!
I am relieved to hear that. Keep the tooth and bring it back with the key. I hope to see you soon.
You shall get the reward when I have the key. No sooner. It is what is truly important, here.
This is an outrage! I shall fight you, blackguard!
If I am to reward you, I need proof of the sorcerer's death. You may have slain a simulacrum or an illusion... I cannot be sure, otherwise.
If you wish, <sir/madam>, keep the key and return with the sorcerer's tooth. Then I shall reward you for both.
As you wish, <sir/madam>. The people may fear Meldanen's retribution and fear to enter the warehouse... hopefully I can change their mind.
I am relieved to hear it. I shall await your return.
You have helped far more than I thought anyone would. Now I must go and collect others to enter the warehouse. Farewell, my <lord/lady>.
Treacherous fool! I'll fight you if I must!!
You are very generous. Take the necklace, regardless... I will not see you completely unrewarded, despite what you say.
As promised, here is the necklace. I know it is not much, but hopefully it will suffice.
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> I suppose you are correct. Here is 250 gold pieces, then... I trust that is fair enough?
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> I will need what gold I have, thank you. You have earned the necklace... be grateful for that alone.
I see. Threats, is it? This is how you respond to a reward, well-intended? Or do you simply look on this as some form of back-alley bargaining?
Regardless, I won't stand for it. I offered you a reward for your good service and I would hope that you'd accept it gracefully.
Then here it is. Thank you again.
Nonsense. Take it, my <lord/lady>... you have earned it. Perhaps you can do some good with it elsewhere.
Oh, you must be one of those new guards, yes? Good luck to you, <sir/madam>.
The Wailing Death has claimed so many lives. It's such a waste.
Stay away from me! You look like the sort who might carry the plague.
Why are you wearing no clothes? You look as foolish as Formosa acts.
Eh? Are you some naked clown the Formosa girl has hired?
Oh, look... someone's running about the square without their clothes on.
Oh, stop waving that about, will you? I won't be intimidated.
Must you walk about with your weapon flashing everywhere, hmm?
Oh, do put that away, will you?
You wouldn't happen to have any news from outside the district, my good <man/woman>, would you?
How do you do, my <lord/lady>? I trust everything is well?
Hello. Is there something you need, <sir/madam>?
I can't wait until this whole plague business is done with.
Don't touch me! You're ugly enough to be one of the plague stricken.
Stand away from me, you, before I call the guard!
Oh, dear. Yet another <race> lout in Blacklake. Shameful.
The guards let more <race> kind into Blacklake, did they?
Oh, do go away. I'll not catch the plague from just any old <race> type, no sir.
I knew that Formosa girl was going to get herself into trouble with all that talk about the sorcerer. Tsk.
Well, they just better not let the poor into Blacklake, now, that's all I have to say!
I don't wish to end up like Formosa. No, <sir/madam>, not me.
Err... no, no, I have nothing against Meldanen. No need to ask me twice.
Take a word of advice: ignore Formosa and her ranting. She'll just get us all into trouble, she will.
I can't believe how she's going on about the sorcerer! She'll get us all killed!
Meldanen is not one to be trifled with. He's the wealthiest and most powerful noble in the district... and a sorcerer, too, I hear.
Foolish girl. Somebody should shut her up, I say!
Oh dear... this is just all going to bring the plague down upon us, isn't it?
What does she want, anyway? To give all of the sorcerer's wealth to the poor? Ludicrous!
Meldanen dead! Have you heard? Unbelieveable!
You don't think that Formosa actually had something to do with the sorcerer's death, do you? No, no, that's too silly...
Well, I say good riddance! That Meldanen was a nuisance to us all!
I hear the sorcerer had all sorts of evil creatures in his home. I think it's high time someone killed him!
Formosa dead! Shocking!!
So... ahhh... Formosa is dead, is she? Err... good job, <sir/madam>...
Who's this Formosa? I have no idea who you're talking about.
I have no intention of sparing you, but all the pleading is quite amusing.
Make me an offer and I'll consider it.
I'm here to free the dryad you stole, sorcerer.
Who this Formosa? Me not know.
Me kill you anyway, though begging sounds funny.
Me here to free dryad you steal, wizard.
Make me offer and me think about it, maybe.
To kill you, I suppose. And it's high time I got back to it.
I'm simply here looking for some coin.
I meant no harm. You attacked me, remember?
Killing, mostly. Now me get back to it.
Me look for coin. Duh.
Me not here to kill you. You attack me, no?
What do you have in mind, exactly?
And what's to stop me from just taking all you own anyway?
Too much bother. I'd rather kill you.
What task?
What stop me from taking all you gots anyway?
Is too much thinking. You die now.
And what's to stop me from taking your coin anyway?
I would need your silver tooth as well as the key to your warehouse.
Give me more and I'll deal with Formosa for you.
What stop me from robbing after you'se dead?
Me need silver tooth... plus key for warehouse.
You give more gold and me kill Formosa for you, maybe.
No, just give me the dryad and your gold and I'll leave you be.
No, you give dryad and gold and you live. That my deal.
Give up the dryad, as well. Then I'll do it.
No, I'm not killing anyone... I came for the dryad. Just go.
Give dryad, too. Then me will do it.
No, me no kill anyone. Me come for dryad, you just go.
I doubt you even have more coin. Sorry, no deal.
Maybe you have no more gold. Is no deal.
Fine. I'll take them and your gold... and you flee before I change my mind.
Okay. Me take them and gold, and you run away.
Nevermind, then. I may spare you... but I need your silver tooth and the warehouse key.
No, no. Is no good. Maybe me spare you, but me needs silver tooth and warehouse key.
You know, I don't have to do this. Pay me more and I'll take care of Formosa for you.
You pay me more coin, you knows, and I could kills Formosa.
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> Don't you think saving your life is worth a little more gold than that?
You better dig a little deeper... your life is on the line, fool.
It will have to do, then.
It doesn't matter... I won't let you live, regardless.
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> You no think saving your life worth more?
You pay more or me getting very angry.
Me take it.
It no matter... me kill you, anyways.
I was only kidding. Your gold will do.
I bet you have more than you're saying. I'll just search your corpse!
Because I enjoy it, of course.
Me only kidding. Ha ha! Gold is good.
Me bet you have more gold. Me search corpse!
Me enjoys killing! Raaaauuugh!!
Hmmm. You must have magic, seeing as you're a sorcerer.
You gots magic stuff?
I want the key to your warehouse, as well. You can live.
Me want warehouse key, too. You live.
That's right. Give me the dryad and you can go.
Yes. Give dryad and you go.
Sounds like this Formosa wants to kill you. Pay me more and I'll deal with her for you.
This Formosa want you dead? Pay more and I kill her for you.
So you have the dryad, then? Unbelievable!
You have dryad here?! Me cannot believe it!
Well... there is the matter of the dryad in the cage.
There is matter of dryad in cage, there.
No, Formosa did send me, actually. Now you die.
No, Formosa send me. Now you die.
Just gold? You're a sorcerer... you must have magic.
Gold? You wizard, you have magic, no?
No, I'd rather kill you.
No, me rather kill you.
Forget it. The dryad is all that's important... just leave.
No... dryad is all that important. You just go.
Just give me the tooth and key. Keep your gold and run.
Just give tooth and key. Keep gold and go.
Nevermind the tooth. Just the key and your gold will do.
No tooth. Just give key and gold.
Fine. The gold and the dryad, and you go free.
Okay. Gold and dryad, and you lives.
You believe you can just invade my home, do you?! I am not so easily assassinated!
Formosa sent you to kill me, didn't she?! Didn't she?! Why are you here?!
That fool elven woman didn't send you? Then why are you here?
No! I will kill you, fool, I will!!
I did not steal her! I found her wandering the streets and took her in. It was my plan originally to concoct a cure for this plague from her and sell it to the highest bidder.
Since then, however, her... charms... have weakened my judgment and prevented my research. Bah! No doubt it is best she is taken, or I could not rid myself of her influence.
Spare my life and I'll give you 500 gp. It is all I have... and surely more than Formosa could possibly have paid you.
My estate is well-guarded. You expect me to believe you came here simply by accident? Your type seeks coin and treasure, yes?
Well if it's coin you seek, I have plenty. I am more than willing to offer it to you in exchange for a task, perhaps?
I have 500 gold pieces now... take that and kill Formosa before she convinces some other fool to try to kill me. When you return, I'll pay you another 500 gp.
Nothing. I have little doubt you have looted my home already. But... if you kill Formosa for me I can give you even more gold later... gold you won't get any other way.
N-nothing. It... is all the coin I have here, however. Please, I beg you for mercy!
So the wench did send you. Bah! Fine... I shall rip out my silver tooth and give you both it and the key. I am not above purchasing my life.
I can give you the 500 gold pieces now. If you deal with Formosa and return, I can get another 500 gold pieces by then and pay you that as well.
As you wish. You'll find the elven wench preaching in the square in the southeast part of the district. I truly wish I could see the look on her face!
As you wish. I am not above buying my life and fleeing my home, after all.
You are... unexpectedly merciful. I suppose I should be grateful. Here is the key to the dryad's cage... take her. I will hope not to see you again.
Here is the 500 gold pieces and the key to the dryad's cage. You will get the rest of your gold when I am certain that Formosa is dead. I shall see you then.
I suppose I shall take what mercy you will give. Very well... AGGGHHK!... h-here... is my tooth... and the key to the warehouse as well.
No! Don't kill me, please! I'll give you anything!!
I am leaving. Now begone.
Here is 500 gp, which is all I have... and the key to the dryad's cage. Take her... take her and get out. I hope not to see you again.
It has come to my attention that Formosa is, indeed, dead as we agreed. Well done.
You are a companion of <CUSTOM1003>, then? Yes, so it must be.
I have heard that the elven wench has been permanently and thankfully silenced, and I am very relieved... and grateful to <CUSTOM1003>, of course.
Here is the 500 gold pieces that I promised, though it was not easy to acquire. This is sufficient, I hope.
What? But... I have nothing else of value! Why would you do this?!
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> Err... yes, of course... but this is simply all the wealth I can obtain. I could get no more even if I tried.
I... I... I have no more coin. Please... just take the gold and leave, I beg you!
Here it is. Now leave... I hope I will not see you again.
Some. I devote most of my time to research, however, and not creating magic trinkets. No doubt you've helped yourself to what I own.
But I have gold you won't find here in my home. Yes, and magic too. What do you say to that?
So... are you saying, then, that Formosa did not send you? You... you will spare me if I give you the key to the Dryad's cage?
You are... here for the dryad? Yes... yes, I found her wandering the streets and took her in. At first it was my plan to use her to find a cure for the plague and sell it to the highest bidder.
You... you have come for the dryad, not for me? So she is indeed one of the Waterdhavian beasts, as I suspected.
I had thought at first to use her to formulate a cure for the plague, and then sell it to the highest bidder and make a fortune.
Some, yes, but you have without a doubt helped yourself to what little I possess. I spend most of my time in research.
Or did the elven wench not tell you that before she hired you? Regardless, while I have no items to offer, gold I have plenty of.
So the elven wench did send you, after all... just not to kill me. Or is that your doing? Regardless, I suppose I should be thankful for your mercy.
Here is the key to the warehouse. It also unlocks the dryad's cage... take her. Now I shall flee before someone more ruthless than you breaks into my home.
And here is my ransom: 500 gold pieces. The warehouse key also opens the dryad's cage. Take her... take her and get out. I hope not to see you again.
I suppose I shall take what mercy you will give. Very well... AGGGHHK!... h-here... is my tooth... a-and the key to the warehouse.
As for the dryad... the warehouse key also opens her cage. Take it... and take her and get out. I hope I shall not see you again.
I suppose I should be thankful at your mercy. Here... take the key that the wench wants. Just take it.
Th-thank you, then, for your mercy... such as it is. I shall have to repay the wench someday soon for this indignity.
I suppose that makes you a burglar of some sort? Come to rob me, have you?
Could I ask you some questions?
Me want ask questions.
Goodbye.
Are you aware of any strange creatures in the area?
Have you heard any rumors concerning the plague?
Do you know of anything interesting going on in Blacklake?
You know 'bout strange creatures around?
You hear plague rumors, maybe?
You know 'bout weird stuff here?
So there's been nothing odd about the zoo, then?
<StartCheck>[Insight]</Start> Is it possible that some creatures might have gained access to the zoo, somehow?
Nothing weird about zoo?
Anything peculiar that you can think of?
I'd be interested in work, if you know of anything.
Any places in Blacklake you think I should visit?
Any weird stuff?
Me want work.
Places in Blacklake I should go to?
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> Come now, telling me won't do any harm.
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> Tell me. Will hurt nobody.
I'm investigating the plague. Perhaps you can help me?
Me look into plague. Maybe you help?
I want to ask you something else.
Me have other question.
Can I ask you some directions?
Me need directions.
Where is the nearest inn?
Where is the nearest temple?
Is there a place to buy equipment nearby?
Me look for place to sleep.
Me look for temple.
Me need place to buy stuff.
Actually, I'd rather ask you about something else.
No, me have other question.
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> I'm with the city guard, I don't mean any harm.
Get out of my way! I'll go where I please!
I was just leaving.
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> Me city guard. Mean no harm.
You get out of way! Me goes where me want!!
Me is going, now.
My dear, dear lady, are you sure you couldn't tell me?
Gee, pretty lady, you sure you not say? Me curious...
Back again, are you? Something you need?
Fare you well, <sir/madam>.
I'm sure you know the way out.
Yes, leave me be.
Ah. This should be interesting.
Oh, I suppose there's no harm. I haven't seen a soul for days with all that's going on.
Well... it's not like you have the plague or anything. Go on, then.
Oh, all right. (sigh) It's not like there's much else going on, with the plague and all.
Merciful heavens, no. Well... there are the creatures at the zoo, of course. They have all been there since before the plague, however.
Nothing that you wouldn't have heard elsewhere, <sir/madam>. To be honest, what little chat I've had with the neighbours has been about anything *but* the plague.
We nobles have been keeping to ourselves, mostly, but I do try to keep up on the latest gossip, if that's what you mean.
Well... there is the business with Meldanen. But talking about him is never a good idea.
Well, that girl Formosa is looking for people who will listen to her. She's down in the southeast square trying to stir up folks against Meldanen.
I don't know. That tavern, the Board Laid Bare? It has quite a scandalous reputation, I hear.
I'm looking for a housekeeper. Mine died of the plague, I hear. No good?
Is there something else you wanted to know?
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> I suppose there's no way for the wizard to know, is there? Well... word is that Meldanen recently accquired a young woman for his amusement.
He won't let her out, and the rumors say that she's rather strange... perhaps not quite human. The gods only know what he wants with her. Rather sordid business, no?
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> It would do more harm than you know. Meldanen's a fearsome man... I wouldn't mind if he turned up dead one day, myself.
Not that I've heard. Mind you, we nobles have been keeping to ourselves, lately. The zoo's in the northeast if you want to see for yourself.
Is there something else you need, then?
Err... perhaps, I don't know. Sureshot... or, that is, Lord Montgomery... is in charge of the zoo and I haven't heard a peep from him since the whole plague business began.
Perhaps you might want to speak to him. The zoo's in the northeast part of the district if you haven't already been.
I am no expert on the plague, <sir/madam>. There is no plague in Blacklake, after all. But I will answer what I can.
What were you looking for, then?
I can show you the way out. (sigh) Oh, go ahead.
What do you want to know?
That much is obvious.
Hmph. Angling for an invitation, are we? Well you can't stay here. The Board Laid Bare by the south gate is the nearest place.
I'm afraid there isn't one in the area. We were trying to raise coin for a temple devoted to Sune... but I'm sure you're not interested in that.
No. But you can buy equipment at the Board Laid Bare, I hear. It's by the south gate.
Is there something else?
Why have you intruded? Get out! Out! Evil dog!
Not one step closer or I shall scream! Why have you invaded my home?!
What is this? Has the city fallen apart, now? Get out of here this instant!
Get out of my home! Thief! Vagrant! Where is the watch when you need them?!
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> I... suppose you can be trusted. A woman on her own in these dangerous times has to be cautious, you understand.
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> I don't trust the look of you! Get out this instant!!
Get out, before I call the watch on you!
What was it you wanted, then, <sir/madam>?
Around *here*? Oh... you mean around the district.
It was bound to happen. (sigh)
At any rate, if you want you can see for yourself. Meldanen's estate is in the northwest. I wouldn't advise going there, though... he won't see you.
I never said that, however. His mansion is in the northwest part of the district... but I'd avoid it like the plague.
We'd all like to see the wizard gone, but what are *we* supposed to do about it? Perhaps you'd like to help her, I don't know.
Are you a prisoner here?
Stand back! I'll have no tricks out of you!
I'm certainly no servant of the wizard, no.
You kept in prison?
Stand back! No tricks!!
Me no servant of wizard.
How do I know you're actually a prisoner, that this isn't some ruse?
I'd appreciate some information, first.
What reward would I get for letting you go?
Would you be able to find your way out on your own?
I'm not here to rescue you. Get out of my way.
How I know you not lying?
Me have questions, first.
Is there reward for letting you go?
You find way out on own?
Me no rescuer. Get lost.
I never said that. Killing you would be more fun! Ha ha ha!!
Just like that. Go, I said.
I don't know. Is there anything in it for me for helping you?
Me never say that! Hurting you gonna be fun! HA ha Ha!!
Why not? Go, I says.
Don't know. What in it for me?
I don't trust you. Time to die!
No believe! Die! Die!!
Yes, I could use some information.
You're of no use to me. Get lost.
Yes, tell me. That good.
You no use to me, then. Go.
Then go. The way behind me is clear.
Perhaps you should accompany me. It would be safer that way.
Then go. Way behind is clear.
No, you come with me. Safer.
Just how did you end up prisoner here?
What do you know about this place?
All right. I'm done with you now.
How you end up in prison?
What you know of this place?
Me done with you.
But why would he keep you prisoner? A member of city guard?
Do you know where Meldanen could be found?
Why he keep you? You city guard.
Me look for Meldanen.
You're Samuel? Captain Thurin sent me to look for you.
You Samuel? Captain Thurin sends me.
What's this? Am I finally to be rescued, or are you another of the wizard's servants?
You... you aren't another of the wizard's servants, are you? Is this another of his tricks?
Don't... don't hurt me! Please! I haven't tried to escape the wizard's damned prison, I haven't!
I am. My name is Samuel... an inspector for the city guard, until that mad wizard took me prisoner.
I am unarmed and no threat to you, I'm sure. My name is Samuel... an inspector from the city guard... and a prisoner of the wizard, unfortunately.
That's a relief. My name is Samuel... an inspector for the city guard. I was beginning to think no one would ever free me.
You mean... I can just go? Just like that?
Of course. I'll tell you whatever I know, though it probably isn't much.
I've no reason to lie to you. I've no weapons... I'm completely at your mercy, in fact. If you would release me, I'm sure my captain would even reward you.
I've no money of my own... but my captain might reward you. Otherwise all I can offer you is some information about this place.
Yes... yes, I believe I could. I'd try to, at least.
Lying? About what? Oh... about being a prisoner.
Ahhhh!! Help me, someone!
Thank you, <sir/madam>. I'm sure I can find my way out of here. I only wish I could take revenge on that damnable wizard!
That's not necessary, <sir/madam>, though I appreciate the offer. I would only slow you down, I'm sure.
*Sigh* I was just poking around the estate, actually, looking into some rumors I'd heard of Meldanen acting even more strangely than usual.
I don't remember much. The west wing, here, seems to be used mainly for Meldanen's experiments and storage. I think he lives below.
I don't know. Meldanen wouldn't ordinarily do this... lots of other things, perhaps, but not take a guard hostage. I don't know what he's up to.
I think the way to the lower floor is at the end of the hall, through a room on the right. That's where Meldanen went, at any rate.
Once you leave this place, seek out Captain Thurin. I'm sure he will want to thank you for finding me. Fare you well!
I didn't find anything, but it appears I was correct. Meldanen captured me and ranted on about how I was trying to steal something from him.
I've no idea what he was talking about... but he seemed convinced that I was up to no good and wouldn't let me go.
He did? It's good to know he didn't abandon me... I was almost afraid that, well... nevermind. Thank you for coming to release me.
Help me! Get me out of here!
Meldanen and his kind are a scourge.
Today he experiments on magical creatures. Tomorrow he will experiment on your children.
Our bellies are empty while Meldanen hoards food.
If he denies us bread, we should deny him breath.
Is the plague not enough? Need we starve as well? Meldanen thinks so.
This is what happens when farmers become sorcerers and sorcerers become farmers. It isn't natural.
Every man, elf, and dwarf deserves to eat, not just the rich.
You have the power to do something about it. Rise up, rise up and share your power.
He became rich from our labor. It's only fair that we should not be left to starve.
Meldanen has locked himself away, playing with his magical beasts. It's time for him to come out and pay his due. Pay it with his hide!
Might I ask your name, friend?
May I ask you some questions?
Who are you?
I would ask a question of you.
Tell me who you are.
Yeah, whatever. I have a question.
Who you?
Me have questions.
Goodbye.
I am called <FirstName>.
My name is <FullName>. Pleased to meet you, Captain Thurin.
You don't need to know who I am.
Me is <FirstName>.
Me called <FullName>. Is nice to meet you.
You no need know me.
What kind of problems are you referring to?
I'm looking for work, if you know of anything.
I have some questions about the plague.
I need some directions.
Me have questions about plague.
Me look for work.
Me need directions.
What problems?
Perhaps you could tell me who you are?
Who you?
Do you have any idea where he could be?
Have you had your men search for him?
Do you know where he was last seen?
What would the reward be if he was found?
I could look for him.
Sorry, but I'm not interested in this.
Think where he be, maybe?
You have guard look around?
You knows where he seen last?
What reward for finding, maybe?
Me could looks for him.
Me have no interest. Too busy.
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> All right... but don't you think I should get some coin up front for my trouble?
Fine. But I want some coin now... or your friend might be dead when I find him.
I'll find him if I can.
I'll find Samuel and return him safely, I promise.
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> Me think some coin for trouble good idea, no?
You give some coin now. Or friend not be healthy when me finds him.
Me do that.
Me finds Samuel, me promise.
No. Have you heard anything more of Samuel, yet?
I'm sorry, but... I'm afraid that Samuel died when he was being freed from Meldanen's prison.
He was in Meldanen's prison, but he was killed. Them's the breaks.
Not yet, but I'm working on it.
Yeah, yeah, I'll get around to it eventually.
No. Maybe you hears something new?
Me sorry... but he die when me freeing him from Meldanen prison...
Me free him from Meldanen prison, but he die on way. (belch!) Oh well.
No, but me working on it.
Me get around to it sometime, maybe.
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> Are you sure you can't afford more? This is your friend I found, after all.
This is hardly a reward. You had better dig deeper, or else...
Thank you. That will be fine.
No, there's no need for the reward. I was happy to do it.
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> Me thinks you afford more. Samuel you friend, no?
No good reward. Me thinks you dig deeper or me gets angry...
This is okay.
No, me no need reward. Me happy to help.
Has there been anything odd happening in Blacklake?
Are you aware of any strange creatures in the area?
Any weird stuff in Blacklake?
You know 'bout monsters 'round here?
Go ahead.
No, let me ask you something else.
Yuh. You tells me.
Me ask something else.
<StartCheck>[Insight]</Start> It's not a threat. Just an encouragement to keep him alive should he be injured when I find him.
If you had the manpower to do that, you wouldn't need me in the first place.
Nevermind, then. I'll look for him.
You can tries, if you likes.
Okay, me looks for him, then.
Greetings, citizen.
Farewell, my good <man/woman>.
Farewell.
As you wish.
I am Thurin, captain of the guard here in Blacklake, good <man/woman>... and you are?
I am Thurin, captain of the guard in the Blacklake district, <sir/madam>. Might I know who is asking?
The name is Thurin, captain of the guard here in Blacklake, if you must know. Are you going to tell me who you are, then?
Pleased to meet you, <FirstName>. (sigh) You'll have to forgive my mood. I am beset by problems, it seems. What can I do for you?
Then introductions are over with. I have my own problems, <FirstName>... is there something that you wanted?
You as well, <FullName>. (sigh) If only I were not beset by problems, that is. What can I do for you?
Thank you. I have plenty of problems I must contend with today, <FullName>... what can I do for you?
I am beset by enough problems, so I suppose it really doesn't matter. What would you have of me, stranger?
I am in no mood to play games, especially today. I trust you have no immediate need for the guard, correct? Then good day.
Certainly, though I have plenty of problems to deal with today and very little time to chat. What do you wish to know?
If you must. I have my own problems, however, and I am not very talkative. What do you wish to know?
Considering that I have my own problems, that hardly makes me feel any more charitable. Ask, if you must.
There's not much I can tell you about the plague, <sir/madam>. It's all we can do, currently, to keep Blacklake cordoned off from the rest of the city.
I'm sure someone else can provide you with directions. As I said, I have my own problems.
Well, beyond trying to keep the plague out of the district, one of my men seems to have disappeared without a trace.
Work? If you're looking for work, perhaps you could be of assistance.
I don't even think you would understand. Oh, why not?
Some of my men seem to think Samuel is drunk in some gutter, somewhere. The old man drank, certainly... but he's never disappeared. It would take something more to do that.
I don't have the manpower. Right now, it's all I can do to hold down the gates and keep Blacklake calm. I've told my men to keep on the lookout... but nothing so far.
Samuel was one of my inspectors... my best one, in fact. He may have been looking into something, but if he was he never told anyone what he was doing.
I would gladly pay 300 gold pieces if someone found Samuel and he was returned, unharmed. That is all I can afford, however.
I see. (sigh) I truly didn't expect any help, at any rate. I suppose Samuel will turn up at some point, eventually.
Thank you at any rate. Now, if you will excuse me, I have other matters to attend to.
Now, then... leave me be, if you cannot be of any service.
Would you? I suppose, at this point, I can't be too picky about whom I ask for help. If you could look for Samuel, <sir/madam>, it would be quite a relief.
If you do find him, tell him to return if he can. At the very least, I would like to be certain of his fate.
Greetings again, <CUSTOM1005>. Have you had any progress? Have you found Samuel?
Greetings. You must be with <CUSTOM1005>, correct?
Thank you, thank you! Godspeed, my <lord/lady>!
Thank you, <sir/madam>. I can only hope that you find him safe.
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> I... suppose that would be expected. I shall simply have to hope that you live up to your word. Here you go, then... and good luck in your search.
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> I have no guarantee that you will even look for Samuel at all once we part ways. You will see the reward when I see him, and that's all.
I see. Now tell me why I shouldn't have you arrested for threatening an officer of the law.
I certainly hope that you find Samuel soon.
With that kind of attitude, <sir/madam>, Samuel may very well never be found.
Unfortunately not. Neither I nor any of my men have anything new to report. I remain confident, however, that he will turn up eventually.
Ah, I see. Meldanen, was it? That explains much. Thank you for the attempt... it is good to know what happened, even if the news was the worst.
Dead?! Ah, I see how you work. Everything neatly points to Meldanen. How convenient. I'll follow the evidence, but if it turns out you were involved, I'll see you hang.
I shall have to see about dealing with the sorcerer, himself, then. Meldanen will not get away with this!
And you appear very upset by it. Hmph. At any rate, it appears that Meldanen is the real culprit, here.
I see that <CUSTOM1005> has given you my ring. Does that mean the task is yours, now? Tell me, then, have you any news of Samuel?
I suppose it's only natural that additional help is needed to find Samuel. Tell me, has there been any progress?
Samuel has already made it back to the barracks. I was quite surprised to hear what had happened to him... I didn't think the sorcerer had the gall in him.
Here is the 300 gold pieces reward. It's a bit more than the guard can afford right now, obviously, but you've certainly earned it. Samuel is a close friend, after all.
Is that supposed to be intimidating? Considering that you've helped me greatly, I'll just forget that threat. Here is your 300 gp... take it and go.
Now, if you'll excuse me, there's still much for me to deal with today.
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> True. I can add a bit of my own gold... 375 gp, then. But that is all I can afford.
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> I am far from wealthy, <sir/madam>, and as I said that is all the guard can spare.
Thank you once again... you've helped far more than I would have hoped. Now, if you'll excuse me, there's still much for me to deal with today.
Take it, then. I wish I could pay you more.
You are far too kind, my <lord/lady>. I shall make sure the guard knows of your service.
I'm sorry, but I really must be leaving. Excuse me.
I can't say that I feel good about it... all those poor souls desperate to get into this area, not even caring that they would spread the disease here.
I wish I could do something more and not sit here safely... but I suppose I have enough problems of my own.
Besides the local nobles getting paranoid enough to turn on each other, nothing truly odd, no.
Well, now, I suppose that's not exactly true. There is something odd that happened, if you want to hear about it.
No. There are some odd creatures at the zoo, but nothing running about loose. I'm sure my men would have reported that.
What do you wish to know?
I suppose that in itself wouldn't be so odd, considering the times, but I know this man too well. He's an old friend of mine named Samuel... and he wouldn't just leave.
I know where he's not. He hasn't reported back to his barracks, and his family hasn't seen him. He also hasn't left Blacklake... not by the gates, anyway.
Would you? I would be more than happy to have the aid of someone trustworthy in finding Samuel. Thank you, my <lord/lady>.
Fine. Here's 100 gp. I want my friend back: alive. Don't disappoint.
You don't want to test that, <sir/madam>. Just find him... if he's harmed, I'll hold you responsible, is that understood? Go, then.
I hear that the sorcerer is dead. I shall have to take some men and make certain for myself. Farewell, <sir/madam>.
I hear that the sorcerer is dead. I shall have to take some men and make certain for myself. You, <sir/madam>, I hope not to see again.
I am a member of the city guard under Aribeth. I think I can enter.
Me city guard. Aribeth my boss. Me can go in.
Goodbye.
Who lives here?
Who live here?
You'll stand aside and let me enter, or it's your head.
You move and me go in, or me get angry.
Fine. Can I ask you some questions, then?
Okay. Me ask you questions?
How about 200 gp? Would that change your mind?
We're both <race>, how about 100 gp? Would that change your mind?
<StartCheck>[Strength]</Start> You don't want trouble with me, fool. Think very carefully.
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> I SAID that I serve Lady Aribeth! You risk her wrath if you don't stand aside! Meldanen be damned, think of yourself!
Then I'll have to do this the hard way. Time to die, fool.
Me give 200 gp. That change mind?
We both <race> kind. Me give 100 gp. That change mind?
<StartCheck>[Strength]</Start> You no want trouble with me. You think, now.
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> Me SAY me serve Aribeth! She lay beatings on you if you not move! Damn Meldanen, cover yer own big butt!
Then me do this hard way. Now you die!!
Let me ask you something else, then.
Me ask something else, then.
Is there some way I could arrange to meet with Meldanen?
Maybe me could meets with Meldanen?
Perhaps I could arrange a meeting with the owner?
Maybe me could meets with owner?
Have you heard anything about strange creatures hereabouts?
<StartCheck>[Insight]</Start> Have you been feeling any symptoms of the plague, yet? If not, you will soon.
What exactly goes on here?
What will it take for me to get inside?
What go on here?
You hear about weird creatures 'round here?
What it take for me to get in?
Maybe he acquired some new creature very recently?
Maybe he get new monster lately?
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> No, no, I want to hear this. Is this creature dangerous?
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> No, no, me want to hear this. Is monster dangerous?
Tell me now. I won't ask you twice.
Tell now. Me won't ask twice.
That's it. You've been asking for this... time to die!
Now you done it. Time to die!!
Is this... guest... of Meldanen's still here?
She still here?
<StartCheck>[Persuade/Bluff]</Start> Not yet. You're in danger, however. That's why I came.
Of course not. Forgive me... let me ask you something else.
Are you sure? Let me open you up and find out...
Sorry, <sir/madam>. Nobody is allowed into the residence. Very strict orders, you understand.
Yes, move along, <sir/madam>.
On your way.
Get moving before I help you along!
Sorry, <sir/madam>, but I can't let you in. My employer likes his privacy.
Go on, get out of here, you! You certainly won't be allowed in here.
This is none other than the home of the noble Meldanen, one of the greatest sorcerers in the city!
The man enjoys his privacy, as well, so you'll do well to just keep on walking. You don't bother him, he won't bother you, heh.
I don't care if you're Lord Bloody Nasher, himself, and neither would Lord Meldanen. You're not getting in.
Oh yeah? How about you just slink back to the castle and I'll forget you said that, little <man/woman>.
Oh? Who wants to know? The town simpleton, is it?
You think you can put a question together? Ha ha!
Oh, fine, fine. Go ahead and ask what you like.
Don't take all day. My time is valuable.
Hah! Like I'm afraid of some <race> rabble. That'll be the day. Just move along, little <boy/girl>, ha ha!
What?! Attack the fool!!
Hmmm, yes, that would do nicely. Don't really care what happens to the rich fool, personally.
Go on in, then. I'll pretend I didn't see anything.
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> Hmph. Well, I... ah, that is... I suppose one shouldn't (cough!) impede the city guard. No, <sir/madam>.
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> Hah! I'm sorry, but... are you trying to *intimidate* me? Ha ha ha ha!! Oh, that's rich.
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> Lady Aribeth has far more important things to worry about than my lecherous employer. At least I hope she does. Nobody gets in. Get lost.
No. He doesn't meet with anyone. And before you ask, he doesn't have visitors... period. Now go.
You think a smart guy like him would want to meet with a moron like you? You think you'd have something to discuss? Hah!
(sigh) If that's all you're wondering about, you may as well forget it. Lord Meldanen sees no one except a select few friends.
And they don't even come through the front gate. So that makes my job very easy. I don't let anyone in... period.
Lord Meldanen lives here, of course. He's one of them sorcerer types, so some strangeness is expected. Lots of it, actually.
But that's okay. We don't go inside the mansion... well, except for that dunce, Grommin... so the strangeness can just stay in there for all we care.
Beyond that, it's nothing you need concern yourself about. Local folks are just superstitious, that's all.
Lord Meldanen has lots of strange creatures. It's sort of his hobby, or something. You'd have to be more specific.
W-what do you mean? There's no plague in Blacklake!
Well, no, no creatures that I can think of. Though there is that... uh, but I shouldn't really mention that. Nevermind.
I don't care how many times you ask me. You can't bully me around, that's for sure.
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> No, not dangerous. I wouldn't even call her a creature, really. She's quite pretty... just, I don't know... odd.
No idea what Lord Meldanen might want with her... heh, besides the obvious. I guess even a sorcerer gets lonely, eh?
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> Never you mind. I ain't discussing Lord Meldanen's business.
I don't know. I think so. We haven't seen her leave, that's for sure.
Uh... er, yes, of course...
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> It... it's that sorcerer's magics, ain't it? I just knew it! He's gone an' given us the plague!!
I ain't going to stand around to die! I'm getting out of here!! Run, ruuuunnnn!!
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> I don't believe a word of it. What do you take me for, a fool? You're not getting in.
Go on in. Isn't that what you wanted?
Aiiieee!! Get away from me!!
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> L-look, I don't want any trouble from her Ladyship. This just isn't worth the risk. I have to work in this city. I'll allow you to enter.
I am a member of the city guard under Aribeth's command.
Me is member of city guard.
Goodbye.
Have you heard any rumors about where they might be?
Have you heard anything at all about the creatures?
Anything of interest I should know about in Blacklake?
Do you hear stuff about where monsters is?
You hears anything about creatures, maybe?
Something goin' on in Blacklake?
So, none of the nobles have reported seeing anything strange?
<StartCheck>[Insight]</Start> Maybe you have heard of someone who might know more? Someone who's acting strangely.
So, nobody see strange stuff?
Who is Meldanen?
Anyone you know of in the Blacklake district who needs help?

Meldanen? Who Meldanen?
Me city guard. Anyone need help from city guard?
You know good places to go here?

<StartCheck>[Insight]</Start> Don't you find it sort of strange that the 'accident' happened as soon as the creatures made it into the city?
You know maybe who set monsters free?
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> Come now, telling me won't do any harm.
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> Tell me. Will hurt nobody.
I've been commanded to find the Waterdhavian creatures. Have you heard anything about them?
Me supposed to find Waterdeep monsters. You hear something?
I want to ask you something else.
Me have other question.
I need some directions.
Me need directions.
Where is the nearest tavern?
Where is the nearest temple?
Is there a place to buy equipment nearby?
Are there any places of interest in the Blacklake district that I should visit?
Me look for place to drink.
Me look for temple.
Me need place to buy stuff.
Any place that has fun stuff?
Why is it closed off?
Why it closed?
You will let me pass or I'll get very angry, fool.
Me pass or me gets very mad with you.
Seeing as I am under Aribeth's personal command, you may want to re-think that tone.
Me under Aribeth's personal command, you. Speak nice.
Fine, I'm going.
Okay, me go.
That's right.
Yeah? So?
Let me through the gate, then.
Lets me through gate.
Who's Samuel?
Who Samuel?
Greetings citizen. The Blacklake district has been cordoned off to everyone but the city guard and the nobility.
Fare you well. Perhaps we'll speak again.
Yes, yes. On your way, then.
Begone and good riddance.
Sorry about that. I think I have heard about you, after all. The city guard has so many new recruits that it's all but impossible to keep track.
Hmmph. The city guard has so many new recruits, I can't even keep up. I think I heard of you, though.
So you're one of those mercenaries under Aribeth? And they expect me to keep all these new recruits straight. Ahhhh, fine, fine, I guess you can pass.
Sorry. No tales of monsters running about the district. Not that I've heard, anyway.
Only that there was some accident when they were brought in, and now they're fled or lost or something. We aren't supposed to panic people by talking about that, though.
Well, there's that whole situation with Meldanen. Glad he isn't my problem. He's a strange one.
Do you have a speech impediment? Oh, nevermind.
He's one of the noblemen, supposedly a wizard. Scary reputation. I, uh... probably shouldn't say much more than that, though.
Hmph. It's just a district of rich nobles who aren't even suffering from the plague like the rest of the city. I wouldn't worry too much about them, myself.
You could always visit the zoo. It's run by some of the nobility and there is quite a selection of exotic animals.
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> All right, I guess there's no harm. It's not like I'm going to be struck by a lightning bolt or anything, heh.
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> Sorry, but I'm not risking that sorcerer finding out I've been chatting about him. Better a quiet mouse than a loud toad, you know.

Well, it's not as if they come out to the gate to gossip with me and have tea, you know. Most of them are huddled in their big mansions terrified that the plague's going to enter Blacklake regardless of what we do.
Is there something else you need, then?
Acting strangely? Well... I suppose Meldanen would certainly qualify, although acting strange is nothing new for him. He's a wizard, they say... sort of an odd bird amongst the nobility.
People have been saying that Meldanen's hoarding food. Some think that he should share some of it with the common folk. I don't know. I wouldn't go messing with Meldanen, myself.
I'm not really privy to that kind of information. I haven't a clue.
Something else?
Yeah, sure, but what does that mean to me? That all happened in the City Core, long ways from here.
I don't really want to talk about this anymore. It's not really my business.
Stop right where you are, citizen. Commoners are not allowed to enter the Blacklake district.
Move along, you! The Blacklake district is off limits to all commoners. Especially filth like you.
I suppose it wouldn't hurt to tell someone. Especially a pretty lass like yourself... Sune knows I don't, uh... well, nevermind.
I just heard that they're supposed to cure the plague or somesuch. I think it'd be a desperate fool who'd believe that. Monsters don't cure plagues.
Where do you need to go?
Make it quick.
What else do you want to know?
I wouldn't be surprised if you got lost often. Oh, nevermind.
Try the Board Laid Bare. It's just north of here and should have everything you need.
There are no temples in the Blacklake district. Nobility doesn't have time to be pious.
Not many shops in the area. Err... I guess you could try the Board Laid Bare. It's a tavern just north of here.
You could always visit the zoo. It's run by some of the nobility and there is quite a selection of exotic animals.
Is there something else?
Did you not hear what I said? Only guards and nobles are allowed into the Blacklake area. Period. Now begone.
To keep the plague from reaching Neverwinter's most prominent citizens. So far we've been successful.
That will change, of course, if we start letting every peasant that approaches the gate through. So return whence you came.
(sigh) How do I explain this in the simplest fashion?
You must be pulling my leg. You're *<race>*...
Right. Sorry to hold you up, <sir/madam>.
Keep your tunic on, already.
Fine. Just don't make any trouble in the district.
But no... like I said, I've heard no stories of any strange monsters in Blacklake.
Fact is, Meldanen's been hoarding food. Or so claims Formosa, one of the louder noblewomen in Blacklake.
She says the food should be used to feed the city, wants to force the sorcerer to give it up. She's been stirring up quite a bit of trouble over it.

If you want to know more about it, you should talk to Formosa. You'll hear her screeching soon enough, I'd think, if you go near the district's main square. I wouldn't mind someone trying to rein her in, myself.
Anything else you needed to know?
Although I did hear tell that old Samuel went missing last week. No trace of him. Poor sod probably fell into the lake.
Oh, just one of the older guards. I hear Thurin's been looking for him, though. If you're really interested you could talk to him... he'll be patrolling about, no doubt.
I am acting as a guard. I need information.
Me like a guard. Me gots questions.
Goodbye.

How widespread is the plague here?

Me ask different questions.

Back to other stuff in the area.

Bloodsailors? Who that?
So they are pirates?
So they just pirates?
Who is their leader now?
Who lead them now?
Where would he hide?
Where me find him?
His men can't like that kind of attention.
Pirates not like attention like that.
Vengaul is putting on a show?
Vengaul put on show? What you mean? Juggling?
You don't want to hang around here, friend. The plague was here, and damned if I know who it'll take next.
Who are you? Bandits? City Guard? Doesn't matter. Plague treats us the same. You don't want to stay here, friend.
What are you, another mugger? You stay here and the plague will take your kind just like mine. There's comfort in that, I guess.
You've got questions? Well, so do I. What good are you, guard, when everyone around me is dying of plague? Answer me that.
How wide does it look? I've already said how it affected me and my home. What more do you want? Should we go count corpses?
The Helmites claim their blessings are a cure. Bunch of crap. Everyone I know is dying, or will be.
Farewell. Please leave my home as you found it.
What is it you want to know? Couldn't you just stumble around on your own?
Well, if plague is your interest, it's pretty much everywhere. Really, I'm not sure what you are looking for. A tavern? A shop?
Maybe... look, I don't want to talk out of turn. I really shouldn't... and what does it matter... we're all going to die, anyway.
I guess there's Jim Seedy's place, the Seedy Tavern. It's in the north end of the district. Good luck getting past the bouncer.
I suppose you would be looking for the Twenty in a Quiver in the center of the district. It's always well stocked.
That's for the best. I've got mourning to do, and I don't need more people dropping dead while I do it.
I've got no time for questions. What point is there in my answers, I'll be dead in a week. Just like everyone else.
Frankly, I don't care. Push your way through plague-infested homes if you want. I hope you rot like you deserve.
Just get out! Like I should be scared of burglars when we're all going to die of plague anyway!
Not sure why you are here. I said my piece. Now I'm just waiting for the plague to take what little I have left in this world.
Not anymore. The plague has shut everything down. No ships are allowed in or out, and port offices are closed. Too many have died...
What else did you want to ask about? It's not the largest of districts.
Important people? How would I know? I'm just some guy waiting to die. I'm a long way from whoever the Bloodsailors are calling boss this week.
Who are the... ? Wow, you must be new. The Bloodsailors run the docks. Any ship that travels without their okay doesn't get far.
What answers do you expect from me? Are you so stupid that you think any of this matters? We'll all be dead soon enough.
I lost my mother... she rotted away from the inside as I watched. The plague left her mindless at the end...
I've lost a brother and countless friends. They became hollow shells of themselves. Mindless... They were healthy and they were young...
My father just died. At the end, his eyes were dead... nothing... The plague kills who you are, not just your body.
My sisters... all of them... dead. What chance did they have? The first infected the others as they tried to comfort her.
I see all my friends either dying or in mourning for someone who died. The plague kills outright, but it's almost worse for the survivors.
My children... all dead. Why should I live when everything that mattered to me is gone? They just withered away...
So you see, I don't think I have much use for a guard. If you have questions, go ahead. I suppose you have reports to file, or something.
I don't know why they stay open with the threat of plague around but... well... I don't put much stock in rumors.
Most legitimate business is done in the City Core, anyway. This area is left for whatever petty criminal wants to set up shop.
I guess. They don't seem to make much of a secret about it. Their leader is pretty open about that stuff. If he's still leader.
Their namesake, Vengaul Bloodsail. He's the reason they are allowed to operate. I think he used to know Lord Nasher, of all people!
He keeps them from being just a band of cutthroats. I think he prefers to think himself a dashing rogue. Seems a little old for it.
I wouldn't know. Maybe... no, I don't put much stock in rumors...
I suppose I might as well say, though I don't know much. I hear there's some kind of infighting going on with the Bloodsailors.
I don't much like you. You want answers, go find them yourself. I hear there's something happening at the Seedy Tavern. I don't want to know what.
Now, if we are through, maybe you could get out of my house.
There have been notices of some sort of auction at the Seedy Tavern. Vengaul Bloodsail himself is putting on some sort of show, or something.
I know. There's talk of... well, you can guess what angering pirates will get you. I overheard a man named Callik in the Golden Apple tavern... well...
I think that's all I'm going to say about that. I may be going to die of plague, but I want to do it with my legs intact.
Uh, noooooo, I don't mean juggling, you idiot. I think it's an auction. It's caused a lot of fuss. A lot of people want gold for it.
He likes to do things flashy. I think it's an auction or something. I guess it's caused a lot of fuss. Lots of people want gold for it.
Someone said it had something to do with the plague, but everything seems like it has something to do with the plague. People are scared.
I am acting as a guard. I need information.
Me like a guard. Me got's questions.
Goodbye.
Any places here that is interesting?
How widespread is the plague here?
I need infomation about the Docks district.
Have you heard of anything odd? Any rumors?
How big is plague spread here?
Me wants information about Docks.

You know about cure attempts maybe?
I want to ask something else.
Me ask different questions.

Important places. Anything like that?

Who run this place? You know about them?
A tavern or inn.

Me just wants ask few questions.
Don't tell me where to go. I do what I want.
