Back to other stuff in the area.
Who are the Bloodsailors?
Bloodsailors? Who that?
So they are pirates?
So they just pirates?

Who lead them now?
Where would this Vengaul hide?
Where me find him this Vengaul?
His men can't like that kind of attention.
Pirates not like attention like that.
Vengaul is putting on a show?
Vengaul put on show? What you mean? He spin plates?
Greetings to you. May I ask what you expect to find here? I don't want to be rude, but I would like to be alone with my sorrow.
Why are you here? Unless you want to join in my mourning, I doubt you will find anything of use in my home.
What gives you the right to enter my home? You won't find anything here except people waiting to die.
You are a guard? Is that supposed to impress me? What can you do? You can't lock up the plague. You can't tell me why it's happening.
There are dead everywhere. So many that you start to forget names. There's so much... So many people gone...
I know there isn't one. The guards... Nasher... they just watch us die. Only the Helmites bother to try anything... worthless though it seems...
Farewell. Please leave my home as you found it.
Information about the Docks, hmm? What do you want to know? Where the best places to lay down and die are?
I can name the exact spots where a dozen or so people fell as I watched. Other than that, what are you looking for?
What does it matter? I mean, you ask these things like they mean something, and I just can't...
If you are the type they let in, Jim Seedy's tavern is in the north central area. It's always busy with people I don't want to know.
Twenty in a Quiver. I think they are still open. I don't have much use for what they sell, though. Not anymore.
Good. The less people I have around, the less I have to cry for when they die.
Why should I care about your questions? People are dying all around and I should entertain the burglars in my home?
I can't stop you... but why you bother to threaten when we're all going to die anyway, I just don't know.
Please, just leave me. We're all going to die anyway. You don't need to hurt me.
Why are you back? What could I possibly tell you? I'm just another person waiting to die of the plague.
The plague has closed most things. So many dead... No ships can leave, port offices are closed...
What else do you want? I really don't have much interest in your problems right now.
The important people are the ones still alive. Beyond that, I don't give a damn who the Bloodsailors are calling boss this week.
Some guard you are, not knowing who the biggest bunch of criminals in the district are. The Bloodsailors run the docks. All ships go through them.
I don't have much patience for dullards right now. I'll be dead soon enough and I don't want to spend my time coddling you.
My mother... dead. The plague killed her from the inside out. Her eyes went dark long before she stopped breathing...
My brothers... gone. Dead to this damned plague. Their bodies burned to stop the spread. They may as well have never existed....
My father... gone. He fought it, but that just made it all the more sad when he didn't know who I was anymore. He just rotted away...
My sister and her child... gone. Nothing I could do except comfort them and hope I didn't get it too. Now I wish I had.
Friends... their families... dying all around me. I don't know if I'll live to see my own folks again... I don't know...
My child... my beautiful child... taken while I watched. I couldn't do anything except cry. It took her... she's gone...
So, I really don't think I need a guard. If you have questions, get them over with. Then go arrest some copperthief or something.
Most places have shut down, but the Seedy Tavern... well, I'm not one to talk about rumors.
Even the guards have pretty much given up on this area to thieves. You are the first I've seen, and I'm not suitably impressed.
They aren't as cutthroat as they could be, I guess. I don't think it fits the style of their leader. If a criminal can have style.
The Bloodsailors were formed by Vengaul Bloodsail. I heard he used to know Lord Nasher. I don't believe a word of it.
He does keep a tight leash on his thugs. I've never seen a Bloodsailor in a mugging. Not in uniform, anyway.
I couldn't tell you. I only know what gets passed as rumor and, frankly, I don't care that much anymore.
I'm sorry. Maybe there's a point to some of what I heard... I don't know. Something about fighting amongst the Bloodsailors.
I think that's all I can take. Maybe there's something happening at the Seedy Tavern, but I don't like you enough to care.
If that's all, please just leave me to mourn.
Vengaul Bloodsail is advertising some sort of show, and he isn't being subtle. Even I heard about it.
There was a man... Callik was his name. He was in the Golden Apple, and he was mad about it. He was saying he would... well...
He was talking about violence, like there isn't enough death around. I'm not saying anything more about him. I'll die soon enough anyway.
No, not spinning plates, you ass. I think it's an auction, and he's been so flashy, you'd almost think he wants the guards to know about it.
At the Seedy Tavern. An auction, maybe? He does things flashy. It's almost like he wants the guards to hear about it.
There's lots of people scrambling for gold, so whatever is there, it's big. Might have something to do with the plague, but I couldn't say.
I like your uniform. Can't leave until I get one.
Let's have at it, Bloodsailor! Let's see how well you fight!
All right, all right, I'm going.
What do you Bloodsailors do? Anything illegal?
Nice uniforms. Where can I get one?
We should trade. Give me a uniform and I don't call the guards.
So how do I join?
I'm willing to help you on that. Come on!
I go where I please. Will you try and stop me?
Sorry to have bothered you. Goodbye.
Yeah, yeah, now get ready to fight!
Sorry for bothering. Bye.
Me go where me want. You stop me?
Uniform nice. Where me get one?
What Bloodsailors do? Illegal stuff?
Me help you die! Come on!
So how me join?
We trade. Get me uniform and me not call guards.
Me go, me go.
Let's go, Bloodsailor! You and me fight!
Me like uniform. Not leave until me get one.
Whatever. Now we fight!
I've had enough of tourists. Get lost, or every pirate in a Bloodsailor uniform will kick your tail back to the Beggar's Nest.
I'll warn you once. We are not wandering thugs or underfed bandits. You want a Bloodsailor in battle, you'd better be ready.
What are you doing bothering me, then? Turn yourself around and walk the other way.
Nothing that would concern you. How about you just move along. You wouldn't want to accidentally end up dead.
You can't. Simple as that. A Bloodsailor gets his uniform when he joins, and only gives it up when he dies.
HAHA! The guards know better than to wander the docks! No, nobody's gonna help you if you keep pushing me.
This isn't a social club, and we don't take just any old fool. Now get lost, before you make me angry.
This is Bloodsailor territory, at least for a day or two more. Come near the ship and you'll be killed. Simple enough?
Then die like a dog!
Who are you?
Who am you?
What happened here?
What happen here?
Farewell.
Me go now.
You burned down your own home?
You burn own home? You stupid?
Is there anything I can do for you?
Me do anything for yous?
That's tough luck, all right.
Oh well. That too bad, me guess.
Gone... all gone... There's nothing left.
There's nothing left here... all gone...
Does my name matter? I was Jace, but I'm nothing now. It's all gone. My home, my family. They burned it.
They were sick, you see. They got the Wailing. I took every precaution, but they still got it. I couldn't do anything to help.
My children. My wife. All dead. My home? Diseased. What could I do? I burned it. I burned it all.
Yes, that's what I get. Indifference. Who cares about my life... my family, when the whole city is plagued. The Wailing... it's everywhere.
This is nothing... we're all nothing. What is my suffering compared to that? It means nothing.
Should I sleep in the bed they died in? Live in the walls that saw them wither? I don't know much about plagues, but I know they spread.
We stayed sheltered, gave all the proper offerings, and my family still died. It got in somehow. How could I live there?
No... I don't know. Cure the Wailing Death? How about that? Heh... wouldn't that be something... if it were cured now... too late.
Even if I didn't get it... I saw my family in every shadow. How could I live there now?
No, you can't do anything for me. I've nothing left.
I'll consider that. Thanks.
Aribeth would not want the area abandoned.
Any word on the cause of the unrest?
Aribeth probably not want area left alone.
What cause unrest?
Me consider that. Bye.
Have you heard anything about some strange creatures?
You hear about strange creature things?
From what I've heard, the Docks district is almost settled down, even with the plague still a concern for most.
Still no change in the condition of the Docks district.
You are <FullName>, aren't you? I've heard of the work you've already done for Neverwinter. Impressive, but I wouldn't go charging ahead.
I'm advising that everyone stay clear of the Docks district. Not that other areas of the city are any friendlier.
You're one of the new recruits I was expecting, right? Well, travel in the Docks district is not recommended.
Word is that the area is barely under rule of law. I'd stay in the City Core, if I were you.
Plague, obviously. It's just like riots in other areas. I don't see a need to endanger my men by looking deeper than that.
My job is to keep the flow of people down. If you or she want to go walk with the plagued, that's your business.
It's your risk to take. More power to you if you can help in there, I guess.
Good to see someone making a difference. Gods know, we need all the help we can get.
I assume you mean the Waterdhavian beasts that were lost? I have heard nothing, and I have been told nothing. What more can I say?
There was some rumor about someone like you finding something, but if the Neverwinter Nine don't see fit to brief me, it ain't my business.
I don't have the men to search for them, and I wouldn't know what to do if I found them. Dump them on Aribeth, I suppose.
Why is this area so dangerous?
Any way I can help out?
Goodbye.
Why this area bad?
Me help somehow?
Bye.
Have you seen any strange creatures?
You see strange animal things at all?
What in the hells are you doing here? Not that I don't mind the help, but I thought we were locked down tight.
Patrol where you want and see where you get. Nothing but animals trapped in here. Stinking thieving peasant animals.
Damned if I know what settled them down, but I ain't seen any trouble for a while now.
This is the docks. Don't go blabbing it, but everyone knows that the docks are controlled by pretty shifty characters.
With the chaos of the plague, everyone seems to be acting like animals. The streets are thick with thieves. Thick!
Just don't attract attention to us here. I don't want a mob killing me before the plague can, after all.
You want to play hero, fine with me, but as far as I'm concerned, the animals in this district can have each other.
Careful in the Docks. There's lots of lowlife thugs. Should just barricade the lot of them.
Whatever was getting the locals all worked up seems to be over, I guess. No trouble here at all besides the plague.
Citizen, identify yourself!
Wait. You a new recruit? Aribeth saddle you with this job? Well, good luck if you're supposed to patrol in here. You'll need it.
What, you think a grunt like me might have found Aribeth's precious Waterdhavian things? That's what you are asking, isn't it?
Bah! I got a briefing about those, all right, and then I was stuck here! Why tell me about them if I'm not gonna be looking?!
The only thing I'll see while I'm standing here is more blasted thieves. Let 'em all rot, I says.
Goodbye.
I will have a blessing.
What good do your blessings do?
Has there been any sign of a break in the plague?
What can you tell me about the Seedy Tavern?
You know about Seedy Tavern at all?
There any break in plague?
What your blessings do?
Me have blessing, I guess.
Bye.
<StartCheck>[Insight]</Start> But the body still dies. How does that give hope?
Greetings. Are you in need of a blessing? I would not travel the docks without it, lest you tempt the fates.
Another time, then. I will be here, as will all of the devout under Desther and Helm.
Very good. Let your mind be at ease and know that tomorrow will bring a cure.
If this plague is a spiritual one, which Desther strongly suspects, then the healing must begin with the soul.
The worth of the blessings is immeasurable. Even as the Wailing takes the body, the mind knows there is hope.
The Wailing continues to take lives, but Desther has decreed that we brothers shall not rest while the city is in crisis.
If the spirit is willing, Neverwinter will survive. People must believe and have hope, and so our blessings will continue.
It is a den of corruption. I would not trust the word of any who frequent there. Lies and false hopes are their playground.
Graciously, they keep to themselves, only allowing entry to uniformed members and those willing to part with their ill-gotten coins.
Another time, my slow-witted friend. I will be here, as will the devout under Desther and Helm.
Very good. It may be redundant to say, but let your mind be clear of thought. Hope will bring a cure.
Well... it's complex. Even in death people must realize that... that there is purpose to all things.
You seem strong in your faith. You understand how important belief is, and how reaffirming it will be when our blessings beat the plague.
I can't expect you to understand, but just imagine how reaffirming it will be when our blessings beat the plague.
What seems to be the trouble?
What wrong?
I've no time for this. Goodbye.
Me not have time. Bye.
Who was this man?
Who the man?
You paid with an amulet?
You pay with neck thing?
I suppose I could look into it for you.
Maybe me look into it.
How valuable is "valuable?"
How valuable you mean?
Masterson? I believe I have an amulet of yours.
You Masterson? Me have your amulet.
What do you know about the docks?
What you know about docks?
I have your amulet here.
Me find your amulet.
I'll see what I can do.
Maybe me find it. Me look.
I need you to repeat some things.
You maybe repeat some things?
Here you go. I am pleased to return it.
Take it. Me glad to give it back.
I'd like a reward for returning it.
Me want reward for giving it back.
Now, let's talk about adequate payment, fool.
Now we talk payment. Big payment.
Actually, I think I'll keep it.
Maybe me just keep it.
That will be fine. Thank you.
That good enough.
I want more. Don't make me angry.
You give more or me get violent!
Me worth more, don't you think?
You must agree I am worth more?
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> Come now, you know I'll use it well.
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> You know me use it good. Come on.
Give it to me or die! I won't ask again!
Give me the amulet or me hurt you! Now!
I meant no harm. I'll leave.
Me not want to scare. Me leave.
I won't help for free.
Me not help for free.
We'll be all right. Bad things don't happen to our class of people.
Ah, yes, hello there. I am, eh, Hemmel Masterson. This is my wife Agnes, and our manservent Morden.
I wonder, by chance, if you've seen a man named Callik? He has an amulet of mine and he, ah, seems to have forgotten us.
Forgotten? I TOLD you he was not to be trusted.
I'm quite aware of what you said, my dear. Now, if you will just let me speak to this nice <man/woman>.
Well, it's embarrassing. You see, we were led to believe that passage out of Neverwinter could be had here. We were fleeing the quarantine.
I arranged for transport that would leave from the docks. I traded an heirloom amulet to a man who swore he was honest.
Hemmel, I can swear that you are competent, but that doesn't make it true.
A strapping gent. Callik was his name. He said he was soon to come into his own ship.
Probably stealing that as well. Honestly, Hemmel, you can be such a fool.
My dear, he seemed honest enough. He may yet return. It has only been... a day...
That amulet was a valuable heirloom. It was a high price, but for the safety of my loved ones, I decided not to quibble.
I told you it was a ruse. This Callik made vague promises and you handed over everything.
Nothing is proven, dear. Still, I would like assurances. It was a valuable amulet, after all. Passed down by my forefathers.
I don't expect someone like you to understand. That amulet was a valuable heirloom. It was a sacrifice, but I was concerned for my family.
Eh, yes, very well. Goodbye. We'll just... wait here for mister Callik then. Yes. That's what we'll do.
Oh, well done Hemmel. That shall be your stirring farewell to the Masterson family amulet.
My dear, do shut up.
Hello again, <CUSTOM400>. I hope you have good news for me? I've seen no sign of Callik or my amulet.
Well, I should perhaps say that its value is primarily sentimental. It has been on our mantel for generations.
Only because you are too much the coward to take it up, Hemmel.
Well, I suppose the thing has some other uses, but it's been years since a Masterson has stooped to dungeon delving.
I would be most appreciative if you could. Mr Callik does appear to be... taking an inordinate amount of time.
Not to strain your limited faculties, but I would appreciate your assistance. Mr Callik does seem to be... taking his time.
He said he would ready a ship, but when he left he went inland. He did drop some sort of auction notice.
You've probably got one already, knowing the area as you must. It doesn't do me much good... I'm a stranger here.
Here, you can have it. I'm not familiar with the area so it does me no good anyway.
Please, return my amulet if you find it. It will have the Masterson crest. I've given up on breaking quarantine; I just want back what's mine.
Are you with <CUSTOM400>? I hope so. I've seen no sign of Callik or my amulet and I need help.
I guess I don't have much choice... I can't fight. I suppose it was foolish to risk our lives for it.
Very little, I'm afraid. I came here... well... I came here hoping to circumvent the quarantine on Neverwinter.
If you need, though I don't know if there's anything else I can add.
Wonderful! Snatched from fate and returned to family Masterson! You see, Agnes? We Mastersons get things done!
And I am happy to take it. Here, some gold for your trouble. You may even live to spend it.
Now, I just have to get out of here. We can't break quarantine, but if we barricade the manor...
A... reward. Well, I suppose that would be fair. It's better than not getting it back at all, I guess.
I will give you 500 gold. I think that is more than sufficient. That Mr. Callik didn't look too tough.
I... I can't do anything about that... I'm no fighter, as Agnes will attest. I can only ask that you reconsider.
I will be here... I've nowhere else to go, really. I cannot even know if you really have it.
Yes, that's it. You're joking with your ribald middleclass wit. Very good. Now please... return my amulet when you find it.
You look reasonable, and we <race> folk have to help each another. Here. 500 gold and something from the Masterson armory.
I suppose I could be convinced to pay a fair price. Here, take this 500 gold and something from the Masterson armory.
Here, I'll give you 200 gold. Please, just take it and go.
Allow me to express my thanks, and my relief. Now, if you don't mind, we're off to barricade the manor.
I am more that willing to agree that you are worth more but I really don't have much else with me.
That is debatable, but the point is irrelevant. I don't have much else with me to give you.
Please! There's no point! I don't have much. I don't carry a bank with me! I don't have much more!
Unless... well... The amulet. I have the amulet. Please, don't make me give it up.
Hemmel, just give the nice thug whatever <he/she> wants and we can go home.
You are NOT helping, dear!
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> I suppose... I guess you might as well take it. I guess it was foolish to risk our lives for it...
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> But... no. No, I can't. I may not be an adventurer, and I may not use it, but it's mine!
Let's just go, Hemmel. You have more toys at home.
Hemmel, don't antagonize the nice thug!
The glaring eyes of my wife wish to remind me that she did say the man was not to be trusted, but perhaps he is only delayed.
I beg of you, please find some measure of kindness within you.
My wife may disagree with my appraisal of him, but he swore he would return.
I mean, he seemed honest. It has only been... a day...
The suspicions of my wife have alarmed me. I would like assurances that he is returning. The amulet is valuable to me, after all.
That is, if I can suffer the glares of my wife. As if losing the Masterson family amulet wasn't enough...
I hope... I hope you understand.
Take it then. I will make do...
I suppose I could manage some form of payment. I'll have to see the amulet first, of course. I've already been swindled once. Will you help?
Hemmel is such a boy. He'd have us stand here for ages thinking his precious heirloom will return. Hmph!
Hemmel, the locals are pestering me. Could we please leave!
The Master is very attached to his... things.
Don't go drawing attention to me. Can't keep a coin in your purse for all the thieves out today.
Plague and thieves... if the city weren't in quarantine I'd have fled long ago.
Feh! Don't tell ME there's a cure in the works. Just letting us peasants die, they are!
That Desther and his bunch, they talk a lot, but I've yet to see their blessings help anyone.
I suppose things could be worse. Not sure HOW exactly, but I'm sure they could be.
That Nasher, I've heard he's working day and night on a cure for the Wailing. Gives me hope.
I know there will be a cure. Know why? Because nobles have the Wailing too.
Don't know why there's been so much crime lately. It's not like they can steal a cure, eh?
Things are settling down. Don't know what happend, but I'm glad my purse is safe now.
Things are calmer now. There's still the plague, of course, but the Helmites will take care of that.
You just stroll somewhere else.
Do I look like a fool? I could see you casing me.
This for the auction at Seedy Tavern?
I don't like stalkers. You'd better start running.
What can you tell me about the auction?
What do you need gold for?
You'll stroll into a grave! Why are you following people!
Goodbye.
What's your name?
Know why thieves are so thick in this area?
Why thieves everywhere here?
What your name?
Bye.
You stroll to grave! Why you follow people?
Me no fool. Me see you watching to rob!
You stroll and walk somewheres else.
What you need gold for?
This for Seedy Tavern auction? What you know?
Me not like stalkers! You start running!
What you know about auction.
I've already warned you about following me.
Me already warn you about following.
You stop following! Me not warn again!
You will stop following me. I won't warn you again!
Tell me about Vengaul and the Bloodsailors.
You tells about Vengaul and Bloodsailors.
What do you know about the Seedy Tavern?
Whats you know about Seedy Tavern?
Mostly? What do you mean by that?
What you mean, mostly?
What? I ain't following nobody... just... uh... strolling. Yeah, that's it.
Oh, no problem. Don't you worry. I'll just be on my way then. Yes, on my way... Nice stuff you got there...
I wasn't... I didn't mean... Blast it! I'll never make the gold at this rate!
Look, I don't want any trouble. I was just looking for an easy mark. Obviously that ain't you, so I'll just be going.
You know about that? Nobody's supposed to know. Everybody does though. Like it was leaked out or something.
I don't know, I just heard that a plague cure was coming up for auction in the Seedy Tavern. Just let me get back to work...
I'll never be able to afford it at this rate. Could steal the whole district and not have enough, I bet.
Just trying to stay alive! Just trying!
Who, me? I don't know much about it. It's at the Seedy Tavern. It's funded by Bloodsailors... that means Vengaul is involved somehow.
I ain't doing nothing, friend. Just sitting on the corner...
Don't have one. Nope. Just some nameless guy on the corner. Nothing to get concerned about...
Don't know anything about anything... just standing on a corner.
Just you move along, hmm... I ain't got time for paupers... I need some high rollers...
You should, ah, be careful with that gear of yours... looks expensive... worth a bit... yeah.
Gotta wait for the moment... should I... they look pretty tough... I don't know...
That's a fine looking weapon there... worth a lot, I bet... better keep an eye on it.
Evening... mighty fine gear you have there... got to be worth a pretty penny, I imagine...
Get along, you pauper... gotta find someone with the stuff... expensive stuff...
Gotta find a mark... come to daddy...
Here, I'll give you my copy of the notice. I can't afford to go anyway. Just don't hurt me.
What? I never... I mean... aw, I'm sorry. I just gotta get some gold together... I wasn't going to do anything to you.
Nothing anyone else couldn't tell you. It's in the north central of the district, and it's where the black market usually is.
Well, anyone that stays around here for long hears about Vengaul Bloodsail. He's flashy, and he likes showing off. The bloodsailors are his... pirates, mostly.
A guy like me can't even get in there. They've got a brick wall of a bouncer that won't let anyone in that isn't a Bloodsailor.
Them uniforms is hard to come by. Of course, maybe if I got enough gold together, she might say different. I don't know.
Well, it's a big group. One guy can't run the whole thing. Vengaul, he's a showman, but he needs some organizers too.
I hear that his first lieutenant is hot under the collar right now. Callik's his name... but I ain't saying anything else... I don't know anything else.
The Seedy Tavern
I'll take a look at your normal items.
Me just look at normal stuff.
Let's have a look at some of your special items.
Me want to see special things.
Why is the auction not going ahead?
Why auction not on?
Another time, perhaps.
Maybe laters.
Weapons.
Armor.
Miscellaneous.
Miscel... Miscsca... uh... Other things!
Show me your assorted stuff.
Show me your selection of armor.
Show me your miscellaneous items.

<StartAction>Purchase the magic longsword for 10 coins.</Start>
<StartAction>Purchase the magic morning star for 5 coins.</Start>

<StartAction>Purchase the magical breastplate for 15 coins.</Start>

<StartAction>Purchase magical leather armor for 5 coins.</Start>
Show me what weapons you have.
Show me weapon stuffs.
<StartAction>Purchase the magical cloak for 14 coins.</Start>
<StartAction>Purchase magical sash for 6 coins.</Start>
Blasted Vengaul! I've paid good money for some of these things, and now he's late getting the show going!
Come on, people! I've stuff to sell! Don't make me carry it all home! There's not going to be an auction.
Would you know a "special item" if you saw one? Ah, what do I care? If you have the coins, I'll sell to ya.
I've a number of things. Would you like weapons, armor, or my miscellaneous goods?
No time for me. I've got to move this stuff out and go restock. I won't be here forever.
Ah, heck with it. Anyone want to buy some things? I've got Smugglers' Coin specials.
Because my premier item isn't here. Vengaul said he had a great showpiece item for sale, and now he's not here.
It just isn't worth the fuss of an auction if I don't have something to excite people and drive prices up.
I've got to recover costs, so Vengaul can just sit on his "integral to the plague cure" item, for all I care.
I have a magical breastplate. It's medium armor for 15 Smugglers' Coins.
I've a magic double axe. It's an exotic weapon. It's very nice. It's 15 Smugglers' Coins.
I've a magical cloak, which was made by the nymphs and a steal at 14 Smugglers' Coins.
I've a magic longsword. It's a martial weapon, and is very nice. It's 10 Smugglers' Coins.
I've a magic morning star. It's a simple weapon and is quite nice. It's 5 Smugglers' Coins.
So, would you like to make a purchase?
I've no weapons left. Something else, perhaps?
Excellent. Would you like something else?
I have no armor left. Something else, perhaps?
I have a magical shield for 9 Smugglers' Coins.
I have a suit of magical leather, which is a lovely suit of light armor for 5 Smugglers' Coins.
So, what would you like?
I've a magical sash, look at it shimmer. It's a good deal at 6 Smugglers' Coins.
So, what will you have?
Nothing left in my miscellaneous box. Something else perhaps?
Great. Do you want something else?
Thank you. What else will you have?
I'll make it worth your while to let me in.
What if I join a group you let in?
How about five Smugglers' Coins. Not too shabby.
I've a few Smugglers' Coins, the currency of the black market.
My dear lady, I'm sure we can come to some... agreement.
My services, in any way you see fit to use them.
I can offer gold.
Let me in! Aribeth decreed I must keep the peace!
Is this a black market tavern?
How can I join one of these groups if you don't let me in?
Who do I have to be to get in?
What me have to do to get in?
This black market tavern?
You let me in! Me keep the peace!
Me make it worth your while.
How me join if you not let me in?
Me give gold?
Maybe me work for yous?
Well, me pretty studly. Maybe we make... agreement?
Me have some Smugglers' Coins.
Me got five Smugglers' Coins. That good?
Me not have much. How me join group?
What is it now? More rabble trying to crash the tavern? Let's have a look at you.
You with that other one? Or was it you? Ah, I don't care any more. Door's open.
Look, like I said before, either join a group we let in, or pony up some Smugglers' Coins.
Step up to the door and let's have a look at you, shall we?
I don't recognize you, do I? No, I don't. No admittance to nonmembers.
Worth my while, eh? Do you even know what that means? Pony up, and let's see what you can offer.
Fair enough. The door is open to you and yours. Just don't make trouble.
Hmmm... you're putting one over on me. Get lost, and don't come back unless you've joined a group I let in.
I don't risk my neck for less than five Smugglers' Coins. Get them or join a group allowed in. Beat it.
I have better men than you doing my laundry. Give me Smugglers' Coins or join a group allowed in. Meanwhile, get lost.
I have no need of lackeys. Find some Smugglers' Coin or join a group I let in. Now beat it.
Sorry, I only take black market Smugglers' Coins. Find some or join a group allowed in. Good luck, and get lost.
Well you can just keep it out there. She and her city guard mercenaries aren't thought of too highly here.
If you have to ask, then you aren't welcome. This is a private establishment. Members or members of like-minded groups only.
None of my business. Either you get a uniform I recognize, or... maybe slip me a few Smugglers' Coins. Now beat it.
Hmm, I sees a Bloodsailor uniform. Good enough, but watch yourself. You or any friends make trouble and out you go.
Look, I've about had it with fools trying my patience. No more slack. Get a uniform or get lost.
Is it busy in here tonight?
Have you heard about anything odd happening?
Farewell.
Busy in here?
You hear anything odd happen?
Bye.
I don't want any trouble in here. We'll bounce you out without a second thought.
You behave in here. Things are rough enough without bringing the chaos on the streets in here.
Boy howdy, you don't know how busy! I'm run off my feet! Everybody is desperate to get in, for some reason.
Nothing yet, and they always warn the person working the door. Just supposed to be an auction tonight.
Must be something good on the block for so many people to show up, though.
Keep it quiet while you're here, hmm? Don't need any trouble.
Not much happening here now. Auction never happened and the crowds are going home.
I don't give out charity.
None of your business, fool.
Why is this district so dangerous?
Do you know how to enter the Seedy Tavern?
I am here to keep order. I can say no more.
I cannot afford to give you anything. I am sorry.
Here's a couple gold for you.
Here, you take a few gold.
Me can't afford to give you golds.
Me not give out charity.
Me here to keep order. That all me will say.
How me get in Seedy Tavern black market?
Why this district so dangerous?
Not your business fool.
Back again to Festiliard? I am popular tonight. Do you seek knowledge from the beggar about the path ahead?
I was treated rudely, so I will say little. Bridges have been burned with me.
Spare a coin, friend?
Ah, you waste nothing on those that don't serve, but how can you know my worth, hmm? Perhaps I know things...
I'm not really interested in coin, but I'm interested in you. What do you need here? This isn't a friendly place.
But my business is the streets. I keep low to them, and hear much. A pity you do not value this.
Very well, I say nothing and do nothing. But...
To walk amongst pirates you must look the part. How to do that? Well, you are big and strong. Go ask them.
Ah, you need the cure, and the auction is what you seek. The streets are mine from the underside. I know things...
Ah, but how will you keep that order? Will you kill, or bully... or cure? Yes, you would want a cure...
Have you the currency of thieves? Or the garb of a guild? Old Seedy's tavern will not open without.
But what do I know of these things? Merchants quiver with currency, and pirates keep their uniforms as close as their ships.
I am but a beggar among kings... and in the service of both. Good day to you.
Ah, I don't know if you can afford it or not, but your rebuff was polite. You treat knowledgeable strangers well.
Ah, you are generous. Someone that knows the value of a coin to a stranger. A stranger that might know something.
A show, a challenge, but the players are in revolt. You willl want to attend. The market holds what you seek.
Tell me where he is or me kill you!
Tell me where he is or I will kill you!
I want to find him. I can't promise he'll be safe.
If you help me find him, I will spare his life.
Idiot! He was playing with people's lives!
Lord Nasher? Why would he come?

This game not so funny to Vengaul's men, I bets.
Help me find, and me spare him.
Me want find him, but me not promise he be okay.

Who is it now? More people to threaten me? I shouldn't have said anything. I just hoped someone would help... but I can't trust anyone with Vengaul gone!
You have returned. What more can I tell you? What more do you think I know?
Thank you for saving me... if that is indeed what you have done. I do not know you, or your motives.
Vengaul is on the run, so he'll go to where he thinks he's safe. He'll either go to the Silver Sails or the Aqueducts. I think both places lead to an underground cache of his.
If you are the type to do something like that, you'll probably kill me anyway! I won't doom my beloved Vengaul too!
I don't know how to enter the Aqueducts and I won't give you my k... I mean, I won't help you get into the Silver Sails!
So you hope to entice me by saying you may or may not kill him? I suppose it is the only honesty I have seen today.
Take this locket. It was a present from him. He said it was a key, and it would let me enter the Silver Sails if I needed to find him.
The Silver Sails is in the west central area of the Docks. There's a passage inside. Vengaul said it is safe... for him, at least.
I want to believe. He really did mean for his auction to help... he just wanted the right amount of flash as well. Very well... find him.
He plays with lives all the time, as does Nasher. That's what rulers do. The stakes were just a bit too high this time.
The two of them are old rivals. They were always looking for ways to show up the other. Vengaul figured Nasher couldn't get out of this one.
I can't fight you any more than I could my previous captors. At least they had reason to hold me. I know very little about you.
It is good to hear a kind voice. These men have not been gentle, and I fear their questions were growing ever more insistent.
I have no answer. You have me at a disadvantage, though, and I must trust that you will not harm me.
I am Dara'nei, and I am at your mercy. I'd hoped you were sent by Vengaul, but I haven't heard from him. His auction was called off.
I have a question first, if you don't mind? Who do you serve? I won't say anything if you intend to use it against people I care about.
Very well. As I said, my name is Dara'nei. I am... in service to Vengaul Bloodsail, the Scarlet Blade and foil of Lord Nasher Alagondar.
Vengaul Bloodsail, the Scarlet Blade. He is the former leader of the mutinous Bloodsailors, and he is my betrothed. We have been apart for far too long.
More than I care to, at this point. I wish Vengaul had never found that creature. It has caused no end of trouble.
How can I trust you when you when you won't do me this simple courtesy? Is it so much to ask?
If that is your attitude then I refuse to say any more. I cannot allow my petty life to endanger my beloved Vengaul.
They why would you bother to save me? Perhaps you don't even know the answer, but I cannot trust someone so openly threatening.
I see. I begin to understand what your interest in Vengaul and his Bloodsailors may be. Ask your questions. I will try to answer.
Farewell. I will remain here. Vengaul will find me when the time is right to do so. If his game doesn't get even further out of hand...
These were Callik's men. He was Vengaul's Lieutenant, and he wanted them to interrogate me and find out where Vengaul is hiding.
It would seem that Callik is no longer willing to follow my Vengaul, but I certainly didn't think he would stoop to this.
I will answer if I am able.
It would appear that they have grown tired of Vengaul. His methods of doing things are sometimes... difficult to understand.
They don't respect his grandiose plans like they used to. He has always stressed how things should be done with style, but now they just want profit.
Callik, Vengaul's lieutenant. He didn't approve of this auction, so now he's trying to seize the Bloodsailors for his own. He doesn't appreciate artful schemes.
Callik will kill Vengaul if he finds him. The Bloodsailors will become a much more vicious group under him. Vengaul always maintained some civility.
He couldn't wait for his men to finish with me. He's probably made a guess as to where Vengaul is, and has gone to try and find him.
I can't say for certain, but he is an old pirate and set in his ways. He said I would know where to find him, and I have a few ideas.
I have already given you my locket. Vengaul said it was a key, and it would let me enter the Silver Sails if I needed to find him.
Vengaul gave me a locket. He said it was a key for the Silver Sails, and that I should go there if I needed him.
I have already given out my locket to <CUSTOM427>. Find that person and you'll have found my locket.
Look for Vengaul yourself. I won't help you find him and I won't give you my k... I mean, I won't help you enter the Silver Sails!
Vengaul said it was a Cockatrice brought from Waterdeep and that it had a connection to the plague. He even claimed it was part of a cure.
He found it in the streets while the city guards were busy with the plague and whatever mess happened at the Academy. It would have been lost if not for him.
He was going to make sure it was returned to the appropriate city officials, but first he would invite Lord Nasher to this "auction." It was a game to Vengaul.
See, Vengaul wanted Nasher to have to come to this stupid little tavern and admit in front of everyone that he had been outdone, that he needed Vengaul.
He would have just given the Cockatrice back after that. It was all about the game to him.
No, his game with Nasher has become a bit more serious than he would have liked. The stakes were too high this time.
See, Vengaul's men never sent the message to Lord Nasher. Instead, his most trusted lieutenant plotted to kill him. It's all a mess now.
Vengaul would have given the creature back. He's not the kind to let innocents suffer. It just got out of hand.

Tell me where you got it! Now!

Callik and Vengaul are probably filthy pirates I'll end up killing.

Where this Seedy Tavern be?

Well, yes, actually. A Smugglers' Coin, I think it's called. I get them from time to time. Odd looking things.
Don't be rude. Callik and Vengaul bring them in once in a while. Nice boys, those two.
No trouble. No trouble.
Oh, no. Callik is a gentleman. Keeps a clean house right near the northeast corner of the district.
Don't know. Callik has a house in the northeast corner of the district, if you want to call on him. I'm quite busy.
That nice Callik leaves them once in a while. Nice boys, him and Vengaul.
I suppose. Jerol usually gets them anyway. I get them occasionally from Callik and Vengaul. Nice boys.
Don't be talking filth on my shift! Oh! Such language!
Oh, I don't get out much now. It's too dangerous. Wasn't always like this though.
There's old Jim Seedy's tavern, but I've never been inside. I prefer a good neighborhood pub, and they are all business.
Don't know. People really seem to be desperate for money, though. I'm mostly concerned about the plague, myself.
Looks like things may be picking up. People seem a little less desperate for money, and are spending a little too.
Don't be talking filth on my shift! Oh! Such language!
Mmm, no, I give them to Jerol in the Twenty in a Quiver. Callik and Vengaul don't leave them very often.
Oh, I couldn't take gold from you. I just give them to Jerol. He quite likes them, I guess.
Again, Callik and Vengaul don't leave them very often, so I kind of want to hang on to it for now.
I... I guess I don't have much choice. I'm not a fighter. If you want anything else, you get it your own damn self.
Oh no, Ive been threatened once already tonight. I'm not talking to anyone else. You want something, get it yourself.
He's the owner of the Twenty in a Quiver market. You'll find it east of here, on the way to the other side of the district.
He owns the Twenty in a Quiver market. It's east of here, closer to the other side of the Docks district.
He owns the Twenty in a Quiver store. It's east of here, closer to the other side of the Docks district.
Oh, it ain't for me to say, but it just seems like it's more for meetings than social things. They have auctions there too, now and then.
Oh, it's on the north edge of the Docks. Right in the middle of the north edge. You can't miss it.
Intruders! Get them!

Welcome to my humble store. Before we continue, I draw your attention to my guards, and my many warning devices.
I hold nothing against those that make their living as thieves, but I will not be a target. I need to make a living too.
I have the standard selection of gear. I have other things as well, but they are probably not of interest to you. You are a guard, aren't you?
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> The majority of my special stock is in the market facilities of Seedy Tavern... if you have the right coins to pay. Smugglers' Coins.
I happen to have a small supply. 150 gold per coin. Steep, I know, but if you need them, you'll pay.
They are in short supply, but... perhaps you will do me a favor some day, hmm? I shall tell you a possibility.
Gilda at the Golden Apple. I get the occasional coin from her. She does not know what they are, bless her.
There you might get one... or two... My price will not lower, but I will help you this way. Good luck.
A pleasure doing business. Do come back again.
But I am out of these special items. I have no more. I am sorry.
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> I really don't think you'd be interested. Guards like you don't usually enter the Seedy Tavern as customers. Your type usually kicks in the door and raises hell.
The building is no secret. It's in the center of the northern edge of this district. Anything in there, however, is no business of yours.
Where's the auction going to be?
Straighten up, I am here at the behest of Aribeth and Lord Nasher.

Hello. I've said too much already, but I suppose I can risk answering a few questions if you really need the information.
That was quite the display with Jalek. He's a bit off, even for a Bloodsailor, but he's a good man. Smarter than he seems, too.
You've gained his confidence, though, and that means I can risk talking to you, but keep your questions quiet, all right? Vengaul's absence has everyone on edge.
Hmm? Leave me be, I got nothing to say. Can't be seen with the likes of you.
I said I can't be seen speaking with you. Get lost.
Look, you moron, I'll say it slow. I cannot be seen with you. Go away.
Looks like things are settling down. There's no reason for you to talk to me. Good job, but please leave.
You with that person that went toe to toe with Jalek? A strange display, but it gained Jalek's confidence. Now I can risk speaking with you.
There a problem with this person, Christov? You want I should set them straight?
Thanks Jalek, but I'm fine. They were just leaving.
Now look, you've got Jalek thinking I know you. Move along, before he starts asking questions.
Jalek is violent, but smarter than he looks, so I couldn't be seen talking to anyone he didn't know. Vengaul's absence has everyone on edge.
Very well, but take this key to get downstairs. It is the only copy I have. You'll still have to get by the Chef, though.
I'm sure you do. I won't be able to answer most of them, but you may ask.
Ask what you will, though you have probably already figured out most of what I might say.
My mission within the Bloodsailors is not focused on what you seek, but I will try to answer.
Reasonable questions, if we keep our answers hushed. I am Christov, and I am here for the same reason you are: investigating the Bloodsailors.
In truth, I'm not from Neverwinter, and the group I represent is hoping to locate some old allies of the Bloodsailors. Longterm goals.
Jalek has been assigned to be my watchman, meaning he watches me and everything I do. It is part of the initiation into the Bloodsailors.
If I struck up a conversation with someone he didn't recognize, he would have to determine how I knew the other person. He would not ask gently.
I worry for others, mostly. I know you don't want any undue attention. I certainly don't.
Your concerns are more immediate, and I will attempt to not get in your way, if you do the same for me.
Ask what you will, but do not speak too loudly.
Well enough. I think you will be fine in the main area here, but if you go downstairs Bloodsailor guards will attack on sight.
Nobody is allowed downstairs now. There is much going on. Perhaps we should speak more of this.
Most of the people here came for the auction that was supposed to happen. Vengaul apparently spread rumors that he had part of a plague cure.
Looks like it's been cancelled, and I think I know why. You'll have to get downstairs to find out more. It's Bloodsailor business.
Vengaul has not arrived, and I doubt that he will. He might have meant to cause some suspense, but he rarely lets a crowd grow impatient.
Vengaul is a showman. He does not like to disappoint, especially after taking such pains to make sure the auction was well-known.
Vengaul is an old style swashbuckler. He prefers the glory of a well-constructed spectacle. A few of his men disapprove vigorously.
You see, some of them feel that they could be far more effective if they stopped worrying about public opinion and such.
Perhaps. If the rumor was true and he really has some kind of cure, he might draw attention to it in order to increase bidding on it.
That, or maybe he wanted someone very important to hear of it. He's had a long history of trying to bait Lord Nasher into action.
Regardless, it appears his plans have been changed. I do not think Vengaul is fully in control of the situation any more.
I don't know. I have heard rumblings... His lieutenant Callik is an impatient and greedy man... I can't say much more about this.
There may have been some... steps taken to try and oust the old man. You should seek your answers downstairs. I'm sorry, I can't say anymore.
Very well. I've already given out the key I had for downstairs. If you don't have it, you'll have to find another way past the door, and deal with Chef.
I'll pass. I'm not looking for trouble.
I'm just looking for information. I'll gladly pay.
I'll match you drink for drink, no problem!
Ehh, I've changed my mind.

Damnedest thing I ever saw. You are okay with me and Christov. You bet.
Well, more nosey little people in my business. You want to try your luck? Drink for drink? Earn my respect?!

All right then! Let's start off with a little Neverwintan Sailor Spirit. A bathtub special here at the Seedy Tavern. Go!
Ah, that's pretty good. You're not so flimsy after all. How about some Dockside Dunn's, a rank bit of swill if I ever had some!
Whoa! All right! That's not too bad. Round three then! Orc Blood Brew, and no plugging your nose!
Eh, should'a sat down when you had the chance. You just aren't up to snuff, as far as I'm concerned.
You're with that <CUSTOM401>, aren't you? I tell you, that was one tough nut. Damndest thing I ever saw. Right, Christov?
Party is pretty much over in here. Not much point in sticking around.
You bet you will, but deep pockets don't get you much here. We respect strength. Can you go drink for drink or not?!
There's supposed to be an auction, but I don't know much about it. Who knows what Vengaul has planned?
Nobody said it would come easy.
Don't know. He's late, I think. Callik went to talk to him, or something. He didn't look pleased.
Callik is the second in command of the Bloodsailors. He's not as friendly as Vengaul. Yeah, that's for certain.

So should you be in that uniform or not? I don't think you're up to our standards, not unless you match me drink for drink! Up for it?
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> All right then, I suppose you are okay... but do you have what it takes, I wonder?

Well how about that! You got it down! I guess you're all right. I don't care who you are, if you can drink like that, you're okay by me.
Now, how about some... oh... Thayvian Fire Juice? Burns in ways you don't want to know! Are you crazy enough to play?!
Well I'll be a... How about that?! So... you want to keep going with some... Catoblepas Death Cheese Wine?! Or have you had enough?

Well... looks like we're getting... serious. All right then, from the bowels of the earth, a downright poisonous brew... Dark Elven T'Keela.
Okay... Not that I'm queasy... but do you want to quit... or try a... a Screaming Harpy! You can't imagine... the horror...
Yeah, I think you've proven yourself to me. I mean, everything after the Dwarven Red Eye was just to see how crazy you are.
Nope, I don't have to worry about you one bit. Hey, you should talk to my buddy Christov. Show him how to loosen up. He's too serious.

Oh hell... okay... you want to play games... *hic*... okay... The meanest... the foulest... black bile of the earth... A bottle... of Scurrd.
Son of a...

Heh... I knew you couldn't... uh...

A good <day/night> to you.

You know... there's not a single Vengaul loyalist in the room... I wonder if he's even here.
Callik ain't here, is he? He doesn't like this one bit, I hear. Must be getting tired of being in Vengaul's shadow.
I heard Vengaul's on the way out. Too flashy. Wants everything to be a grand adventure. Glory hound.
Last I saw Vengaul he was carrying some kinda cage. Why's he walking his pets when there's business to be done?
I heard it's just part of a cure. Gotta have the means to process it. Some thug buys it and it'll go to waste.
I bet there ain't no cure. I mean, how did Vengaul get a cure when Nasher and them can't?
Vengaul better not be telling his damned stories again. You don't jerk around a city full of the dying.
I sold everything. All of it. This better be a cure. I'm ruined if it isn't. I'm dead if it isn't.
I wish the damn thing would start. Have they got the goods or not?
Auction turned out to be a bust. Guess us simple thugs are stuck to die of the plague.
Callik is gone. Looks like Vengaul is sticking around as leader after all. Never had my doubts... no sir...
Who are you? What do you do?
Who is you? What you do?
You wish a password?
You want password?
Can I ask about the Tavern and what's below it?
Me maybe ask about Tavern and what's under it?
The password is "Cornerstone."
Password is "Cornerstone," or something.
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> If you don't care, how about just forgetting it?
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> If you think this silly, how about we just forget it?
Well, handsome, maybe we can... work something out?
Aw, come on handsome. Pretty please let me through?
Goodbye.
Will some gold make you forget you need a password?
Maybe you take gold and forget you need password?
You'll let me pass or I'll feed you your spine!
You let me pass or me kill you!
I don't know the password.
Me not know password.
How about 50 gold to look the other way?
You take 50 gold to forget me?
How about 100 gold to look the other way?
You take 100 gold to forget me?
200 gold should get you to forget me, hmm?
You forget me for 200 gold, maybe?
I was only testing. I meant nothing by it.
Me just kidding. Me a kidder.
All right, someone better tell me why that door's been opened, or so help me, I'll have the guards in here real fast!
Now don't go bothering me. I didn't want this job and I don't need this job. Just say the password and get moving, like all the rest.
Right, so who opened that door? I can't let anyone through without the password, whether they have a key or not.
Don't bother me, all right? I did my part with the door and I don't care who goes through now.
Of course, it's not like I care that much. Why they got the chef to guard this stupid door, I'll never know.
Who, me? I'm the chef, and these Bloodsailors have me guarding the door because they've lost too many regular members to the plague.
None of it matters to me. I'd rather be cooking. Now, if you have the password, you'd better spit it out.
Yes, fool, a password. If that door gets opened before I've heard a password, I'm supposed to call the guards. Now, out with it.
Don't bother me again. It's bad enough I have to stand around here all day.
Look, I'm just the chef. I'm replacing a Bloodsailor that died of plague. If you have business downstairs, fine. Just give me the password and go.
And don't ask me about any key or whatnot. If you know the password then you'll have your own damn key. I don't have one.
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> You know, I think you are right. To hell with this password crap. I'm no guard! I'm no doorman!
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> No, I don't think that would be the best thing for me to do. I'm no guard, but these Bloodsailors are rough customers.
Right, good enough for me. In fact, that's good enough for the night. Anyone else with you, they can go on in as well.
I'm done with caring about their stupid door. I did my part, and now I'm done.
You want to go through that door, you go right ahead. In fact, I'll even tell anyone that asks that you knew the password.
What? No thank you! I'm not fighting over this! Guards! Guards!
They can watch their own bloody doors. Damn right.
Of course, you'll still need to open the door. I don't know nothing about that. If you should be down there, you probably have your own key.
Then you are... not supposed to be here? Son of a... ! Guards! I was just supposed to watch the door! I'm not fighting anyone!
Then get lost, and don't bother me again. If you don't know the password, then you aren't supposed to be here.
I don't know about that. The fact that you need to ask means you shouldn't be here.
Does that mean you know the password or not?
Well now, I've never been able to say no to a pretty face. Ah, what the hell. I'm no guard. Why did they even ask me to do this?
No offense, madam, but... I work around food a lot and I can't afford to lose my appetite.
I don't like you much. In fact, I think that offer is an insult... can you do better?
I guess that would be all right. I kind of like you, and what am I doing guarding a door anyway? I'm a chef!
You know, since that door is already open, you are probably in a lot of trouble if you don't know the password.
No, I don't think I want to risk my neck for that amount. I don't much like you. Can you do better?
I think that would suffice. I mean, why are they asking me to guard the door anyway? I'm a chef. A chef!
You have a deal, you unsightly thug! What the hell are they doing asking me to guard the door anyway? I'm a chef!
I think that would be a good deal. I mean, why are they asking me to guard the door, anyway? I'm a chef!
I think your offer should get a lot better. Yes, I think this is worth a lot more to you.
I think that's a little low. I'm getting the feeling that you shouldn't be here, and my looking away is worth more than that.
Could I ask you some questions?
Me want ask questions.
Goodbye.
Anything odd happening here?
You know odd things about here?
I want to ask about the Bloodsailors.
I want to ask about the auction.
Me ask about Bloodsailor guys.
Me ask about auction.
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> Come now, telling me won't do any harm.
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> You tell me and it okay. Will hurt nobody.
Know anything about the plague?
You knows stuff about plague?
What locations are important in the Docks district?
Where important places in Docks?
Tell me about the Seedy Tavern.
Tell me about the Golden Apple.
Tell me about the Twenty in a Quiver.
I'm looking for basic services. General stuff.
What you know about Seedy place?
You tells about Golden Apple.
You tells about Twenty in the Quiver.
Me look for all kinds of stuff. Service stuff.
I'd rather ask you about something else.
Me have other question.
Back to my questions about locations.
Back to stuff about places.
What do you mean when you say "strange?"
What you mean, "strange?"
We both have <race> blood. Why not give me a break?
Me <race> blood like you. You tell me, okay?
<StartCheck>[Flirt]</Start> You tell me, okay, nice man? You really nice man.
<StartCheck>[Flirt]</Start> Come now, handsome. You can tell me, can't you?
Tell me about Vengaul.
You tell about Vengaul.
Tell me about Callik.
You tell about Callik.
Is that why he's not here tonight?
That why Vengaul not here?
Does he have the backing to do that?
He gots support for that? That a big fight.
Where is his house?
Where Callik's house be?
Well met, friend. Fine night in the inn, eh. Right busy, it is.
Good on you. See you around.
All right then. Farewell.
Good riddance to bad rubbish.
Can you understand my answers? You seem a bit slow.
I've the time, sure enough. What do you want to know?
Eh, if you make it quick.
Bah, make it quick and get lost.
Well, just look around you. Bloodsailors looking all rough, some auction thing taking too long, and damned if I have seen any Bloodsailor brass here all night.
Their business ain't my concern, especially their infighting... I really shouldn't say any more. I don't swim well, especially in a sack filled with rocks.
Nobody seems to know what was going to happen here. Vengaul Bloodsail himself was organizing it, but he's late. It may be cancelled.
Well, concentrate hard and maybe you'll remember what I say.
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> I suppose you're right. They are probably too busy to worry about me telling tales anyway.
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> Sorry, but I'm just not getting involved. Callik wants to challenge Vengaul, that's his business, not mine and not yours.
What do you want? Come on now, I've got time if you're quick.
Go on, why are you bothering me? I've no interest in you.
No, and I don't care to. I ain't even thinking about it. Of course, I guess I showed up here... well, we're all here for strange reasons.
Ain't much anywhere now. Plague shut most things down. I suppose you can ask, but there ain't much I can tell you.
Will my answers help? You sound like you would get lost a lot.
The Golden Apple? A fine little tavern. Not much happens there, though. The Seedy Tavern is where you want to be for action.
Eh, it's the only place that's doing any business now. Lots of this and that, though most of the black market stuff there ends up here.
Eh, you'll be stuck shopping here or the Twenty in a Quiver. Most other places are gone because of the plague.
This place? This is where everything happens. It's where they usually set up the black market, but things are a little strange right now.
There's still the Golden Apple and the Twenty in a Quiver. A couple other places, I guess. I just stay here at the Seedy, myself.
All right. Where did you want to ask about?
The Golden Apple is in the northwest of the district if you are interested. That puts it southwest of here.
It's a little southeast of the Seedy Tavern here. Kinda middle northeast of the district, I guess.
You'll have to go to the City Core if you are looking for things like temples and mage towers.
Well, I suppose there's not really any harm in me talking with you. I can just lay low a while if I get myself in trouble.
Ugh... no thank you, madam, I really am not interested in... discussing this with you. If Callik wants to challenge Vengaul, that's his business.
I suppose I could say a few things. I'll just lay low for a while after so I don't get in trouble.
You are a pretty one, aren't you. Not the brightest star in the sky, but still a sparkler. I'll talk with you a while.
The Bloodsailors weren't always a rough group to deal with, but things have changed. Callik isn't letting Vengaul's decisions go unchallenged anymore.
I heard that there was a plague cure for sale. Rumors were all over, and I think some people were afraid the guards would hear.
I don't know how they didn't. It was like Vengaul wanted them to know. He's flashy. A risk taker. Some of his men don't like it.
All of his plans usually involve getting as much notice as possible. He's more concerned with image than profit. That doesn't please some of his men.
Ah, the well-loved leader and founder of the Bloodsailors. Well, not so well-loved these days, I hear. See, he likes to show off.
I hear he's been getting some trouble from his officers. They want to be a little more rough, and a lot less flashy.
Callik... well, Callik is not a nice man. He's much more concerned with gold than he is with any show of bravado or style.
He's very efficient getting gold out of his victims, but he's a hard man to work for. If not for Vengaul, he'd be even worse.
Some of the Bloodsailors prefer working for him, and I think it's getting to the point where he's going to challenge Vengaul.
Oh, the Vengaul I know likes confrontation. He wouldn't run from a fight. I think whatever was supposed to happen up here has been changed.
Ain't my business, like I said, but I saw some of Callik's boys going downstairs, and now the basement is locked up tight.
Something is going on... I just don't know what.
Callik is pretty powerful right now. A lot of the Bloodsailors wouldn't mind making a little more profit instead of playing for show.
In fact, Callik has taken over running the black market. He's one of the few guys I've seen with a key to get downstairs.
I thought he'd be here. Not like him to sit in his house while something is happening. He'd really like to embarrass Vengaul.
Hmm? I think it was in the far northeast corner of the district. I wouldn't go poking around there, though. Not unless you want trouble.
Can I ask questions about who you are?
Me ask about who you am?
Could I ask you something about this tavern?
Me ask something about this bar place?
I'll be leaving.
Me go now.
Who are you?
Who is you?
What are you doing here?
What you doing here?
What was that about the Bloodsailors?
What about Bloodsailors?
Do you know what is planned for downstairs?
What happening downstairs?
Have you noticed anything odd around here?
You seen strange stuff around here?
Back to the inn... anything strange?
Back to inn stuff. Anything strange here?
Why is that so bad? What's in Scurrd?
Why that bad? What in Scurrd stuff?
Why not?
What not make sense?
The auction won't go ahead?
Auction not happening?
How do I get down there?
How me get down there?
Thanks. Er, how did you know all of this?
Thanks and stuff. Hey, how you know this, anyway?
Greetings and well met. Come to sit a bit in the heat, have you? Good for the skin.
A shame. I hope the <day/night> treats you well. Come back anytime.
Oh, by all means. I'd like that.
I suppose. I spend most of my time here, now. Waiting out the plague, you see. Could be in worse places, I wager.
Ulfnog is my given name. It is unremarkable to your ears, no doubt, but I quite like it. It serves me well.
Enjoying the heat, as I said. And the dark. It is quite pleasant in here once the door is closed. It shuts out the world.
I don't much like the bustle downstairs. Them Bloodsailors are far too serious these days. They used to be... well, I'm droning on.
I am a traveler. Unfortunately I happened to be in Neverwinter when the plague began. I haven't stepped outside this inn for weeks.
Well, it's just that they used to be more fun. They had a right nonsensical bent to them that kept you on your toes.
I know the plague probably has something to do with that, but there's more. It's like their leaders are taking them in a new direction.
Ah, I've just had too much time to dwell on it, stuck here hiding from the plague. What do I care how uptight they get?
Hello again. The heat draw you back? It keeps me here and happy, let me tell you.
You realize you are asking a half-naked dwarf in a hot-room what he thinks is strange, don't you? My answer could be hopelessly skewed.
Hmm? Some fool auction, I think. I even heard there was some part of a cure on the block. Doesn't make sense, though...
Odd or strange? Well, them Bloodsailors have an unwholesome attachment to their ale. Not good dwarven ale, mind you, but foul and perverse mixings.
Not that you could appreciate what I mean. Hell, you're the crazy fool that drank the Scurrd. Gods help anyone who willingly drinks the Scurrd.
I mean, they actually convinced someone to drink Scurrd. Scurrd! That'll take the tar off their shingles!
I'd stay away from that Jalek down there, myself. He likes the hard stuff, and I mean hard to take.
If I won't drink it, what makes you think I'll sully my mouth discussing it? Scurrd is Scurrd. That's all that should need be said.
Changes... shakeups... the Bloodsailors are upside-down. Some are allowed in the basement now, and some aren't. Almost like they've split in two.
Well, why is the auction here? Something like that would command a huge price. Why bother with the thugs that gathered their coppers?
I mean, if you expect a big bidder, the only reason to have the auction here is to have all the people see who that bidder is.
I think someone was trying to show off, and now it looks like the show has been cancelled.
Don't think so. Vengaul Bloodsail himself was supposedly behind it, and he's late. Very late... and there's some other odd things...
I think there's been a shift in power. Vengaul hasn't been seen for a bit and... well, there's some questionable things happening in the basement.
Do they still have their poor chef guarding the door? I bet he doesn't appreciate his pantry being locked up any more than I do.
Not a lot happening in the tavern now, what with the shakeup in the Bloodsailors over. Nice and quiet in the dark.
I overheard the password to get by him. You'll still need a key or some stout picks, though. They don't even let him open the door himself.
The password is "Cornerstone." At least it ain't some maryweather pompous nickname or somebody's dog. I hate it when thugs get cute like that.
You can learn a lot in a small dark room. Don't let anyone tell you different.
The current is too strong to return the way you came.
What's the big problem? You were going to auction the thing yourself!
I won't let you squander this opportunity! That thing is worth a fortune!
Cur! Bounder! You are not half the man your father was!
There is a great commotion from the passage ahead. The sounds of a battle ring loud against the stone.
Don't you start with that, old man! This is just about business!
Life is measured by more than wealth, my boy. A well schemed plot keeps your name in the history books!
That was showmanship. Make them think the prize is lost and they respect you all the more when they get it.
What is this, Vengaul? More of your old guard? Loyalists?
Er... yes! Yes, this is my second wave, come to fight you! Adventurers all, we will defeat you!
I don't care who they are! Your foolish rule is over tonight!
Who the devil are you?
At them! Yes, that's the spirit!
Vengaul Bloodsail has got your back! Arrows away!
Let nothing stop you! Callik is a whelp of a man!
Yes, fight with all your skill!
Yes.
No.
Take the boat downstream?
Your actions caused no end of chaos!
You'll be paying a high price this time. I can't let you live.
Just trying to intimidate you a bit. No harm meant.
You've hurt too many people with this.
Sounds like Nasher would appreciate you being dead.
Just for a laugh, really.
I demand you give me the Waterdhavian creature! And your weapons!
Now you'll hand it over for the good of everyone.
You have something that doesn't belong to you.
I've come for the Cockatrice, Vengaul.
Very well. Get going then.
Me want the cocka... the cuckoo... the birdy!
You have something not yours!
You cause trouble fooling around!
Best for everyone if you hand it over now!
You give me Waterdhavi-creature! And your weapons!
I not let you live this time.
Just joking, really.
Maybe Nasher like you dead.
You hurt too many with this!
Me just toy with you. No harm meant.
Okay. You get going then.
Well fought! You have proven quite the force, defeating Callik like that. The lad was giving me trouble. No sense of style.
Still, I gather from your well-fortified self that I am in further trouble, am I not?
Nonsense. I merely issued a statement or two. How people choose to react to that is not my concern.
I stumbled upon the remains of a fine little bird that Nasher and his lackeys carelessly lost. Imagine my surprise at seeing some dog in the street carrying it. I merely wished to put it to good use.
That's a blanketing statement. Why, may I ask, do you deem it necessary to kill me?
Well, a great deal of harm was taken. I'll just take my leave. You'll find what you need in my absence, I am sure.
That wasn't my doing. Desperate people do desperate things. Would you kill the baker if they rioted over bread?
You'll pardon me if I just leave? My lieutenants will more than oblige your bloodlust. The spoils of victory to the winners!
You don't know the old boy like I do. We've been at each other's throats for years. He'd not want me caged or dead.
This whole thing would have been an insult, to be sure, but deep inside, Nasher likes these little confrontations
"Just for a laugh" then, I'll do my best to escape. I've no reason to die here. Not when I would've returned the beast anyway.
The remains of the creature are in a crate. Send it to Nasher with my regards, though I doubt he'll have time for a scoundrel like you.
My weapons? You are certainly intent on making this a conflict. Very well, my friend, a fight you shall have.
Of course I will. Oh, don't look so surprised. What am I going to do with some mangy bird? Besides, I know full well how important the feathers of this beast are.
My fun was in making Nasher want it. Since he won't play and my men have largely abandoned me, the ruse is over.
The remains of the beast are in a crate. Take the feathers, and my blessings. I have friends suffering from the plague too, you know. Nasher knows who I mean.
I suppose from your perspective you are correct. Since you are the dominant force in the room, I bow to your wisdom.
Of course, of course. I expected as much, though I was also hoping that Nasher would make an appearance.
As you will. Farewell, my friend. Our paths will cross again, I am sure.
I'm keeping my eye on you.
The Silver Sails Trading Company. No Entry! Vermin Infestation.
Is Lord Nasher well?
What needs to be done?
Farewell for now.
Spare me your lies. He is either deathly ill or dead.
I suppose I am still restricted from entering the castle?
Tell Lord Nasher that I wish him a speedy recovery.
I have another Waterdhavian creature. Do you want it?
Nasher has shown no interest in me. He remains hidden.
Farewell, then.
Perhaps I could speak with Lord Nasher?
<StartCheck>[Insight]</Start> Is Lord Nasher not well?
I found a Waterdhavian creature. Where should I take this?
Can you tell me anything about the plague?
Does he fear the plague so much?
I have just joined his service under Aribeth.
Me serve! Lemme in!
Scaredy-cat. Worry 'bout plague like baby.
Me need ask about sick.
Me find thingy! Water-whosian animal! Where does me take it?
Me gots another Water-whosian animal! You want?
Me speak with Big Nasher?
Bah! Nasher no-show!
I go bye bye thens.
Give him wishes to gets better.
Now let me enter big castle?
He probably dead. You big liar.
What left to do?
Nasher still sick or better?
I goodbye now.
The four creatures! All four of the Waterdhavian creatures have been returned! Aribeth has them now! If this was your doing, we owe you a great debt!
Please, don't waste time speaking with me. Return to Aribeth as soon as you are ready to proceed. The cure awaits!
I don't know... he was so weak. I know they were working on the cure, but I didn't hear how it turned out.
That's when all the hells broke loose. I hope they are all right.
You need to go speak to Aribeth. Honestly, I don't know how you can stand around here delaying the cure after spending so much effort collecting the components!
I'm sorry, I didn't mean to get anxious, but we are so close. Please, go to Aribeth as soon as you are ready.
You have done much for Neverwinter. Please see this through.
Three of the Waterdhavian creatures have been returned to Aribeth. Fenthick and Desther assure us that we are close to a cure!
Lord Nasher will be among the first to sample it, of course. His rejuvenation will inspire people... They need inspiring.
I will not waste your time, <FullName>. Lord Nasher feels you have proven too valuable to harass with idle chatter.
For his health, and for everyone in Neverwinter... please continue your efforts.
Hello. Word of your deeds has spread. Nasher might have even stooped to meeting with you, but he is... under the weather.
As I have indicated, it must remain closed for fear of the plague. This is for your safety, and others...
As you may have gathered, we do not fear the plague getting in, so much as... getting out.
Of course. Your efforts mean we are closer than ever to a cure... not that Lord Nasher has the...
*sigh* Only the closest to him know the extent of his sickness. If the people knew...
He wishes that the people not see him in this... condition. You understand, I hope? They have enough to fear.
Continue your efforts, please. We need all the help we can get in these dark times.
I know of you. You're <FullName>, and your actions have helped Neverwinter. Strange that your manner is so unpleasant.
Lord Nasher appreciates your efforts. He would tell you himself, if he were able. You'll just have to accept my word.
I have not been instructed as to the proper handling of such things. Aribeth is who you should talk to.
I assure you that Lord Nasher would like nothing more than to greet all those that have entered his service.
Unfortunately, matters of state keep him isolated, for now. He is very involved in the search for a cure.
Keep up the good work. Perhaps... perhaps you will become one of our more trusted allies yet.
That's not possible. The castle must remain quaran... eh... that is, Lord Nasher is very involved in the search for a cure.
Lord Nasher is... otherwise occupied with plague matters. I'm sorry, but I can't say any more than that for now.
As I have said, only the proven allies of Neverwinter will have access to the castle in this dark time.
Back! Castle Never is closed by order of Lord Nasher. Not like you rabble would be graced with an audience anyway.
To protect the castle against plague it is closed to all but Lady Aribeth. That is all I can say.
I doubt you have such a thing. Aribeth and Desther are organizing the search for the beasts. Take it to her.
I can't say anything more. To ease panic, only our proven allies are kept briefed on the state of affairs.
Stand down, citizen. Castle Never is sealed by order of Lord Nasher. No one is allowed within.
On Lord Nasher's behalf I welcome you to the gates of Castle Never. Unfortunately, however, I cannot allow you entry.
I doubt YOU would have such a thing. Take whatever mongrel beast you've found to Aribeth and Desther. They will know what to do with it.
By the gods, you sound dim! Look, I'll say this slowly and unnecessarily loud: ONLY TRUSTED PEOPLE ALLOWED IN.
Greetings to you! I have heard well of you, <FullName>. Your actions help Neverwinter no end.
Hmm... <FullName>, isn't it? Word on the street is you have been helping Neverwinter through this crisis.
Can you even grasp our situation? The plague is already in the castle. Nasher has proven just as vulnerable as everyone else.
Er, yes, you leave. Keep up the good work and... try not to forget how to breathe or something.
Greetings. Nasher would offer thanks to you in person if he were able, but he is... under the weather.
<FullName>! Lord Nasher offers thanks for your actions, and regrets that he can't greet you personally. He is... under the weather.
We rest our hopes on the dimmest of lights. Oh well, do what you can.
What are you, a complete moron? Don't just stand here like an idiot! You've collected the components! Get back to Aribeth so they can start on the cure!
I need to ask a few questions.
Can you maybe answer questions for me?
Goodbye.
How bad the plague be in here?
What do you know about all the zombies?
I need infomation about the Beggar's Nest.
Have you heard of anything odd? Any rumors?
You knows anything about walking dead guys?
Me wants information about Beggar's Nest.
Maybe you hear about odd stuff or rumors?
When did they first start showing up?
I want to ask something else.
Me ask different questions.
How bad has the effect of the plague been?
Are there any safe places?
Where is there safe places?
Anything strange besides the plague and undead then?
Okay, so anything besides plague and undead?
What do you know about the gang?
What you knows about gang?
What do you know about the cult?
What you know about cult?
Tell me about the Shining Serpent.
Tell about Shining Serpent place.
Tell me about the Helmite shrine.
Tell about Helmite shrine.
When they start not being all dead?
Anything strange happen around that time?
You sees strange things around then, maybe?
Not to be questioning someone with the manner of a noble, but... may I ask why you have entered me home?
What do you want? I ain't looking for a fight, friend, so please don't hurt me.
What do you want? You've the look of a bandit to you, so... uh... please don't hurt me.
I suppose I can try, if it will get you to leave. Should I speak slow, or maybe use hand signals...?
If that will get you to leave without hurting me, I will answer what I can.
I don't want to know anything about any walking dead. That is just... it's not right!
I guess... I guess it was not that long ago... the plague had been going for a month, I think. I've kind of lost track of the days, though.
Goodbye. Please, leave me in peace.
That's it? Couldn't you just... wander around, or something? What do you need to know?
Now there's dead people walking around. Dead people! What is someone like me supposed to do about that?
