This is the "poor district," so when plague first broke out, we were pretty much just walled in. No notice was really taken until it spread outside.
What do you want me to say? I haven't seen much of anything. I've been boarded up in here, trying not to get the plague.
How can you ask that? What kind of life do you lead where plague and walking dead are no longer strange?
Some sort of plague-y undead-walky town, that's where you live. <He/She> asks me what's strange besides plague and undead... yeesh.
Something strange *other* than plague and undead? I never thought I would be considering something like that, but... maybe...
The Beggar's Nest has its share of strange people. Just plain mean ones too. There's a gang that's always been a problem. And a cult.
They call themselves the Sword Coast Boys. Copperthieves, mostly. No real troublemakers... except maybe for that Drawl guy.
He is their leader, but for all I know, they could all be dead to plague. They used to hang out in the north end of the Nest, I think.
Nothing, and I don't want to know anything. Bunch of Cyric worshippers, I think. Not a sane one in the bunch.
Don't know what's happened to them in this plague. I wouldn't feel bad about losing them, though.
Well, until you barged in I thought my home was safe. I suppose you mean places where the zombies can't go?
The Shining Serpent might be all right. The Helmite shrine might be good too. I don't know for sure. I've been in here for days.
I don't go there much. Can't afford to. Nice place. I'd bet they have some decent defenses up. Harben Ashensmith takes quite the interest in it.
Harben is the man to talk to if you actually want to do something in this district. The Shining Serpent is in the south central area of the Nest.
Don't know much about it. It used to be a communal shrine to whatever god you would like to appease that day.
Just after the plague began, the Helmites arrived and set up shop. I would guess that it's safe. It's holy ground, after all.
The shrine is in the south east area of the Nest, not too far from the Shining Serpent, actually.
We've lost a lot of people, but I guess it's bad in other areas now too, so we're all in the same boat.
I just stay in here, trying not to get too close to people. I didn't even let the Helmites in. You... you I doubt I could stop even if I wanted.
I guess there was something... I think... I remember. A bunch of guards did a search of the area one day. They were looking for something.
They never said what, but I got the feeling it was an animal or something. They had cages. That's all I know.
Seems pretty safe all over, now. Something took care of all the zombies, that's for sure. I gotta thank whoever it was.
I know they are gone, and that's enough for me. I don't care who or what got rid of them, but I'm grateful.
At least the zombies have stopped. I don't know who took care of that, but I'm grateful.
I need to ask a few questions.
Can yous maybe answer questions for me?
Goodbye.
How bad is plague here?
Can you tell me anything about the zombies?
I wanted to ask about the Beggar's Nest.
Have you heard of anything odd? Any rumors?
You tells anything about walking dead guys?
Me want ask about Beggar's Nest.
Maybe you hear about odd stuff or rumors?
When did they first start showing up?
I want to ask something else.
Me ask different questions.
Has the effect of the plague been bad here?
Are there any safe places?
Where is there safe places?
Anything strange besides the plague and undead then?
Okay, so anything besides plague and undead?
What do you know about the gang?
What you knows about gang?
What are these Dark Sun followers?
Dark Sun followers? What they?
Tell me about the Shining Serpent.
Tell about Shining Serpent place.
Tell me about the Helmite shrine.
Tell about Helmite shrine.
When they start not being all dead?
Anything strange happen around that time?
You sees strange things around then, maybe?
What can I do for you, my <Lord/Lady>? I pray you are not here to hurt me.
What do you want here? I've got nothing you couldn't get elsewhere. Please leave me.
What do you want, bandit? I've nothing to steal. I'm just trying to stay safe in my home.
Are you so daft you couldn't find someone more important to ask? I've been boarded up in here... what would I know?
I can't stop you asking. Just hurry up so I can lock and block the door again.
I don't want to know anything about any walking dead. That is just... it's not right!
I don't know... not too long ago... A while after the plague.
Goodbye, then. Please, try not to lead anything here, plague or otherwise.
I can try to answer, if you wish. I don't know what I can offer that you couldn't find somewhere else.
I'm no fighter, no guard. That's the walking dead out there. At least I can see them, I suppose. Not like the plague.
Oh, hundreds... all dead. Thousands, maybe? I don't know. You can't count all the dead. It's been a nightmare, and no one helps.
I haven't left my home in days... longer, maybe. I don't dare go outside. I'll be dead if I do. I know it.
I don't know how to answer that. Stranger than plague or undead? I don't even want to think of what might be stranger than that.
I shouldn't have to deal with this, you know? I'm just a normal person. You can go find trouble if you want... I just want to be safe.
Never... I never thought I would dare consider there was something more strange than what has happend to us here.
I guess... I guess there were some odd people... but nobody that would compare to so many dead. A gang... and maybe those Dark Sun followers.
The Sword Coast Boys are what they call themselves. Some good children fell in with them... now they'll end up in stocks.
The worst of the lot is Drawl. The rest... just babies. I think they spend most of their time in the north west of the Nest.
Shh... they follow Cyric. I stay the heck away from them. The whole lot are out of their minds. Just crazy.
I hope the plague took them. Not a decent one of the lot. I can't tell you where they were based, and I don't care to know.
I don't know... I don't know anywhere that's safe. That's why I'm in here, trying to not be noticed. Walking dead... plague... it's too much.
I suppose you could try the Shining Serpent... or the Helmite shrine. I don't even know if they are still standing...
It's a tavern and inn... I know they always talk pretty tough. Seems like they would put up a fight. Harben Ashensmith is there a lot.
South central is where it is. Harben would make sure people are safe if he's there. He's who you talk to if you want to get things done.
It's really a community shrine, for whatever tribute you want to leave. No specific god was worshipped there. Not until the Helmites arrived.
They only arrived a while after the plague began.They seem nice, but I don't know any of them personally. They fixed the place up nice, though
It's in the south east area of the Nest, not far from the Serpent. I'd go there. Holy ground, you know.
I think it started here... and nobody really cared until it spread. Now it's everywhere... the whole city. You just can't get away from it.
I've been trying to stay away from people... trying to keep healthy. I haven't seen anyone else in days... weeks... It's horrible.
Maybe. I don't know. There were... There were a bunch of guards that searched the whole Nest. They wanted something.
Maybe an animal? They had cages. Never caught anything. Well... some caught the plague. Lots of guards have died here, even before the zombies.
If you just mean safe against the zombies, I think you might not have to worry. I've been watching from in here... they seem to be gone.
I know they are gone, and that's enough for me. I don't care who or what got rid of them, but I'm grateful.
I mean, at least the zombies seem to have gone away, but the plague is still there... I can't see it, but I know it's there.
What have you seen?
What you see?
Are you ignoring your duty as a guard?
You ignore duty as guard?
Are the undead related to the plague?
Undead because of plague?
Where is that? Is that where the undead come from?
Where Great Graveyard? That where undead from?
Goodbye.
Bye bye.
Who can help, then?
So who would be able to help?
You look like officer material. Well, your orders won't do much here. I've told my men to hold position.
Look, I ain't wasting what hours I have left alive talking to beggars or thugs. You hear me?
I see there are not as many undead around, but we ain't taking any chances. We're staying here.
What is it? I'm getting tired of explaining myself. My men are not risking themselves down there and that's final.
I'll greet you warmly, but don't expect us to follow you down there. My men aren't undead hunters. We're not fools.
I ain't saying anything to you. If I'm seen talking to potential looters or thugs, I'll be out on my ear.
You the replacements? Good for you. Do what you want. I've told my men to hold position.
You want to walk the wall, go ahead. We'll kill undead if we see 'em, but I'm not going looking for trouble.
What do you think we've seen? Dead everywhere. If I wanted to face undead I'd have been an idiot adventurer.
What do you know of it? You're no veteran. You've just arrived. This kind of fight is not our job.
My men keep order, they don't fight abominations. This is bad magic, and I don't have the means to fight it.
Never liked working near the Great Graveyard. Guess the plague just filled it too damn full.
Go where you want. My men will hold the wall. At least it's safe up here.
The Great Graveyard is north of the Beggar's Nest. Go if you want. I don't want to know anything about it.
How the hell would I know? What do I know about undead? Or plague? This is not my problem.
What I know is that undead attack relentlessly. Whoever is behind this wants us dead. Period. I won't walk into it like a fool.
My men are supposed to keep the peace, not fight undead. I won't order them against these abominations. Find help elsewhere.
I don't know. Check at the Shining Serpent. I hear some fool is holding court like he's an authority on undead.
Harben Ashensmith is there too. Now he's a man I respect. You talk to him about this stuff, and he'll straighten you out.
I wish I had clear answers about the zombies in this district.
I'd better get to it. Goodbye.
Is anyone fighting back against the undead?
What are the "Warrens?"
Where are the undead coming from?
I'm walking blind! I need more infomation about the undead!
I'll manage without it, thanks. Goodbye.
Need more informations about zombies and stuff!
No want booze. Bye.
What is "Warrens?" You speak stupid.
Anyone fight dead? Anyone not cowards?
They say there's cause for celebration, that the undead are back to their dirt-naps, so to speak. Good on you if you saved the day.
I am here to serve, though I can't offer much. The greatest tragedy is the interruption of my beer supply.
Need a drink? Times is tough, and a body could use a little lubrication to keep it movin'.
I don't blame you. Been crazy around these parts. First the plague, then this. We'll all be walking the Warrens before we're through.
Good luck. We live through this and we'll tie one on. Then we'll tie another one to that and watch them twirl.
Harben Ashensmith is here, and the celebrated undead hunter, Drake. He won my "Eat the Most Pickled Eggs" jamboree, two years running.
He'll deny it, won't even let you ask, but just you think about that when he's being "oh so serious."
Oh, Desther's Helmites are in the district somewhere too. Set up a sanctuary, I think.
Sorry. Local superstition. "The Warrens of the Damned, burrowing deep beneath the dead to the very doormat of the Hells."
It's about the crypts beneath the Great Graveyard. People imagine the worst because they are out of sight. It's nothing.
The dying. Seriously, they don't seem concentrated anywhere, and people that die of plague seem to rise from where they fall.
There's more near the Great Graveyard in the north. I mean, go figure, the place is full of the dead.
Keep safe. The more warm bodies we have, the better.
Ohhh-kay. Watch your head out there. Sounds like it's been hit a few times.
Sorry, my slow-witted friend. Local superstition about the Warrens of the Damned that lead to the Hells or some such.
Farewell.
You don't agree with some people's methods of helping?
How bad is it getting in this district?
So who would you trust? Where is the safest place?
You lost a guard? Who was it?
You lose a man? But aren't they big?
So who you trust then? Where safest place?
This district really that bad?
You not think some people help good enough?
I go now. Bye.
Are there any safe locations?
Any safe places?
Where did you see him last?
Where he last go?
Is there a reason for the undead infestation?
You know why undead now everywhere?
Have you heard anything about Waterdhavian creatures?
You hear anything about Waterdhavi-whasis creature things?
Back to my previous questions.
Back to other questions, okay?
It was a Yuan-Ti named Gulnan who caused it all.
Snake lady Gulnan cause dead to walk and stuff.
The Beggar's Nest should be fine now.
Beggar's Nest all safe now.
Goodbye.
Bye bye thens.
Don't know what's been happening, but the undead have dropped off completely. Not much for us to do here now.
The plague is still a concern, of course, but there are things being done elsewhere for that. I just hope I don't get used to the stink of burning dead before we beat it. Ugh...
Rioters and Looters! We will have ORDER! Do not let them pass!
Didn't think I'd be doing so much talking today. Not to live people, anyway.
Greetings. Come to join the legions of the damned, have you? The Beggar's Nest be the closest thing to the Hells on Faerun.
Go ahead and patrol. I won't risk any more of my men against zombies, but you can stick your ugly neck out if you want.
I'd get yourself to the Shining Serpent. There's too many undead... and some citizens are just as vicious.
It's not for me to say. If you want a safe location, I'll tell you about the sanctuary Desther's Helmites set up in the southwest.
I'll also tell you, however, that I wouldn't go there. Sure, the zombies avoid it, but I just don't put much stock in them Helmite blessings.
We're okay if we stay barricaded, but damnation, why did they have to start burning corpses upwind. Ugh! And why did the dead have to start getting restless?
You'll be looking for Harben Ashensmith. He knows what's what. Probably at the Shining Serpent, the safest place in the district.
It's in the south central area of the Nest. That's where I'd go. Bunch of realists, looking for solid ways to survive.
A promising young guard named Walters. A local boy that grew up in the Beggar's Nest. A shame... He worked hard...
He pulled himself up, he did, and didn't join a gang like most his of friends. Now he's probably dead to a zombie.
Zombies are everywhere. I advise caution, my friend. You look like you might have potential, and there's been enough death here already.
Zombies are all over. If you want to patrol, you go ahead, but take care. Enough people have died already.
As you wish, but maybe you should go by the Shining Serpent tavern. They could look after you a bit.
How very astute of you. No... no, Walters didn't get lost like that. He's missing somewhere. Probably hurt or killed.
Bad enough that I won't lose another guard in a hopeless fight. Let the undead walk. We'll pick them off from fortified places like the gate here.
A couple, I suppose, but it depends on what you call safe. I don't put much stock in what some people are spouting.
Last I saw he was heading out to patrol. Couldn't tell him not to. He's got old friends in this district, I guess.
He usually patrols near the northeast end of the Nest. Even without the zombies there's some shady types over there.
Myself, I prefer a sword in my hand to some foolish hope in my head. I'd recommend you talk to Harben Ashensmith in the Shining Serpent instead.
If there is a reason behind any of this, nobody is telling me. First the plague, and now this. I got no answers.
Aribeth got you hunting for those? I was briefed by Lady Aribeth but she didn't tell me much about it. Nothing useful, anyway.
They were for a spell or something, right? Bah! I won't risk my men on a scavenger hunt. Search if you want. Nothing to do with me.
Ask what you will.
A Yuan-Ti? Well what the hell was one of those doing in Neverwinter? Wait... was that one of the Waterdhavian beasts brought in? Damn them all!
I know we need a cure and all, but I lost good men to that zombie horde. Blast it, who let that snake beast loose? I'd better get some answers when I file my report.
Good luck to you, wherever duty takes you. Make sure you keep Aribeth apprised of what you've found.
I should hope so. You took a big risk wandering around in there. It could have turned out much worse. Thanks for all your effort.
Farewell. Wish me luck.
Is there anywhere I should go, specifically?
Is this area quarantined? Do you let anyone in or out?
Is this the last outpost of city guards?
Beggar's Nest closed? You stop sick by stopping people?
Where to go in area? Where good to learn?
I go. Bye bye.
You last guards? There any in Beggar's Nest?
Have you heard anything about the Waterdhavian creatures?
You know stuff about Waterdhavi-whasis creatures?
Who is Harben Ashensmith?
Who this Harben guy?
Are you with <CUSTOM11>? I am told the Beggar's Nest is much safer now because of their efforts.
I am told the Beggar's Nest is significantly safer, thanks to your efforts, <FullName>.
Such work will earn you great respect here in Neverwinter.
<FullName>, I've heard of what you are doing in Neverwinter. I'm sure you'll sort out the Beggar's Nest in no time.
Are you what we hire for guards nowadays? I guess we take what we can get around the Beggar's Nest.
I will, but I don't hold much hope for the district. It's the worst hit by the plague and now the undead are killing everything...
There's a tavern. The Shining Serpent. It's in the south central of the Beggar's Nest. Harben Ashensmith is there, organizing people.
As a guard, you'll be allowed to pass. Other than that, we've tried to keep it sealed. The plague is worst in the Nest, and now there's undead...
The Helmites were allowed in to establish a shrine. I hear they continue to grant blessings. I doubt they counted on the undead infestation though.
There are some on the other side of the gate. They were supposed to keep the plague victims from rioting, but now they must contain the undead.
It's an impossible job. We don't have the manpower to maintain patrols. Hopefully you will be able to help us with that.
Greetings. You must be a new recruit. No one else is foolish enough to approach the gate to the Beggar's Nest.
Good to see you. You must be one of the fine new recruits with the guards. No one else comes near the Beggar's Nest.
Good luck. You'll need it, genius.
"Where good to learn?" I don't know if anyone can help you with that. You seem a little... slow.
It's a nightmare in there. Zombies are everywhere. We're keeping the City Core secure, but damned if we can do much for the Nest.
Aribeth has you looking for those, hmm? Sorry, I can't help you. I haven't heard anything about them. They are probably all dead.
Of course, being dead hasn't stopped all the zombies in the Nest. You can't count on anything to make sense right now.
Ah yes, I had heard you were making progress finding them. Aside from what you have done, I can't say I have heard anything good.
Maybe you'll be able to help some more, but I'm not as hopeful as I once was. I figure the creatures are all dead.
The zombie threat is keeping people in their homes, so there haven't been many confrontations between the guards and people trying to break quarantine.
You should speak to Harben Ashensmth. He's been organizing people to keep them safe. He's in the Shining Serpent tavern, south central area of the district.
He's a friend of the guards. I'm not sure of his official rank. He doesn't like to use it much. He prefers to stand with the rank and file.
He'll be able to give you more information than I can. If he's still there and alive, that is.
Watch who you threaten, fool!
I have no idea who that is and I don't care!
Not my problem. Good luck. You'll need it.
He's probably not coming back.
Shouldn't you go look for him?
I'll tell him if I see him. Good luck.
Sorry, I haven't seen him.
Hector? Yeah, he's here. A little out of sight though.
I saw him, but I didn't bring him with me.
He's got to be dead. There's no way he'd survive.
There may be a Helmite blessing sanctuary somewhere. I could lead you.
I could escort you to the Shining Serpent. It's supposedly safe.
Your wagon is shot. You'd better make a run for it.
Tough break. Goodbye and good luck.
Well that's just rude. Don't make many friends, do you?
Easy, I'm not your enemy.
I no hurt you. What you mad for?
You talk too much! Me hit if you keep yelling!
He dead, me think. No way he live.
Me see him, but not bring him here.
Him here with us. You just don't sees him.
I don't sees him.
Me don't knows him and me don't cares!
Dat tough. Bye bye.
Your wagon broke pretty good. Better run for it.
Me lead yous to Shining Serpent tavern, maybe?
Maybe lead you to Helmite sanctuary? You want?
I say so if I sees him. Good lucks on you.
Maybe you go look?
Him probably no gonna come back.
This not problem for me. Big lucks to you.
I gotta hand it to you, friend, you did me a nice favor.
Of course, it would have been nicer to arrive with a few more people ALIVE! Nice try, though.
Even made it out with all hands. Now we just gotta avoid the plague... never ends, does it?
More live ones! Imagine that! Now, if it was just that fool Hector and my PARTS!!
Youuuuuu just watch yourself. If you're dead, so help me I'll make you deader!
Hmph! The dead ones don't talk back, so I guess you are okay. Can't blame a guy for being careful, though.
Hey! What are you doing with Hector? Tall-folk idiot was supposed to get us some wagon parts!
I tried, boss! Ain't no parts nowhere though. I swears it!
All right all right, relax, you lummox. Let's just figure out what we do now. Time to abandon ship, I'll wager. No parts means no wagon. Ah well.
You ain't seen a tall-folk named Hector, have ya? Sent him out for wagon parts and damned if he ain't just disappeared.
No need to get all huffy. If you see him, just tell him to get those wagon parts back here quick.
Don't know that. Maybe the parts are too big for him, but I ain't leaving my stuff until I have to, zombies or not!
I gotta wait for him to come back. I ain't leaving the wagon until there's no other hope. Plain and simple.
I don't get good luck. I get stuck in a zombie-filled city with a broken wagon and the scorn of my wife.
Thanks anyway, I guess.
Dang it down! Do me a favor? If you see him, tell him to get those wagon parts back here on the double!
Probably hiding because he DIDN'T GET MY PARTS, THE IDIOT!! Okay, okay, calm down. I just have to figure out what to do.
I'll protect my wagon 'til the end, but it'd all be easier if he would just get back here with my parts! I've got wheels to fix!
Dang it dang it DANG IT! Fool was supposed to bring wagon parts! Dead you say? Well, that tears it. Nothing more for it. I'm going to have to... leave the old girl.
Helmites, eh? No thanks. I don't believe a word of what those pious pie-faces are selling. I'm off on my own. Thanks, though.
That tavern doesn't have enough ale to make me forget abandoning what's mine. Thanks for all you've done, but I'm taking my chances on my own. Thanks anyway.
Looks like I don't have much choice now. Well, time to head off running, I think. No shuffling zombie can catch a halfling at full run, I say!
Yeah, thanks ever so much for your help. Off to the races I go, I guess. Is that something moving over there? Come on you undead freaks! Just try it!
The dead ones don't talk back, so I guess you're okay. Dead ones are probably smarter, though.
We've got to get to safety!
Can't help you. Goodbye.
Sorry, I don't have any wagon parts.
You can tag along, but don't get in the way!
I'll take you, sure. Where is he?
Not my concern.
I saw him. He's looking for you.
Me saw him. He look for yous.
Me not have any parts.
I no help. Bye bye.
This not my problem.
I take you to him maybe? Where he be?
Ugh! Okay, Me lead you, but yous don't get in way!
Who are you?
Who you?
Hector punch? Are you an imbecile?
You sound stupids.
Aren't you worried about zombies or plague?
You not scared of walking dead or plague-sick?
You stay here for a bit, all right?
Yous wait here, okay?
We'll find him. Come on.
We find him soon. You keep following.
Perhaps you are too stupid to be scared.
Maybe you too stupid to scare.
Hey, more people to talk to! Good, because me not want to go back to Aldo without wagon parts. Can't find none nowhere that will work. You see wagon parts?
You dead? Hector punch you if you are! No... you're alive.
Okay. I'll keep looking here. No... no good... these all broken. Maybe somewhere...
Aldo will be mad. He doesn't want to leave his stuff behind. He sure likes his stuff.
Maybe you could... uh... come with me to tell him there's no parts? He gets real mad sometimes.
Good good! Aldo is guarding his wagon in middle of Beggar's Nest. Uh... just don't let him bug you. He gets mad...
Oooh, he probably mad. Me can't find any parts, which means he can't move his stuff. He sure likes his stuff!
We got to find Aldo. Boy, he going to be mad.
We got to get to safety.
Good to be alive. Stupid wagon.
Me? Me Hector. Me work for Aldo and work hard. Gotta find wagon parts, but me only find broken stuff. You see any not broken anywhere?
Me sound like you. Yous got problems with that? Me just wanna find wagon parts for bossman Aldo, but me just finds broken stuff. Leave me be.
Me? Me not scared! Hector punch zombies good, and punch plague too if it try to fight me. Maybe. Me not see plague before.
Me just scared of Aldo. He needs parts for wagon, so me look. Not finding any anywhere. Just broken stuff.
Okay, but he get mad if it not soon.
Okay. Maybe there's parts here somewhere? Maybe.
Don't matter to me why. Me not scared of zombies, and me not scared of you. Me just want parts, so gimme or beat it.
Have you seen anything dangerous?
Farewell for now.
You shouldn't be staying here. I could lead you out.
Bad you stay here. Maybe I lead you safe place?
You seen danger? Scary things?
Okay, me go now. Bye.
Who are you? Why are you out here?
Who you? Why you here?
Greetings. Nice to see someone still alive out here. I'd prefer that we were talking somewhere safe, but it's still nice.
Other than legions of undead, a husband that puts his cart ahead of his family, and a plague that seems almost apocalyptic?
Nope, nothing. really. I've been too busy trying to stay alive.
Good day to you.
We'll be all right. Aldo will keep us safe. He's a good man. A bit too attached to the cart, I think, but a good man.
Ankle-biting undead sons of... I know you're out there. Just try it! Come on!
It's not such a nice wagon, dear.
You'll wish you were... uh... DEADER, you dead... undead... WHATEVER!
We can buy new things, dear.
Keep away from my stuff you undead freaks!
Should we die for this lousy furniture? It was your mother's and smells funny.
Zombie... bastards... why, I ought'ta... I'll feed 'em some speedy bolts o' death, I will.
Travel, you said. Move to the big city, you said.
As... thoughtful... as your offer is, I think I'll stay with my husband. He can form sentences.
You know, my old hound had that exact look on his face. All the time. Don't get me wrong, he was a SMART dog...
In answer to your masterfully constructed question, I have seen zombies, plague, and the madness of my husband. Danger enough?
Good day. Take care. Read the occasional book.
We've got to get to safety!
I blame the wagon. Not the plague, not zombies... the wagon.
Well, my name is Mattily. As for why I am out here, that's a very good question. Why don't you ask the cart?
Don't start, woman! I'm doing my best over here!
I'm sorry for my stressed tone, but I'm growing tired of waiting for a wagon wheel in a zombie-infested street. You hear me, Aldo?!
Save it, Aldo! I'm getting real tired of waiting for a wagon wheel in the middle of a zombie-infested street!
I'm more concerned about finding Hector. Aldo sent him for wagon parts and I'm worried for his safety. Family friend, you understand.
Oh, I'm sure we'll be fine. I see you have Hector with you. Now that he's here, we'll be all right. I was worried about him. Aldo! Look! It's Hector!
Talk to Aldo, will you? He'll want to know Hector is safe.
Farewell.
Marcus? Was he a mage, perhaps? Kept a Journal?
He's probably dead in the streets.
Ha! He's dead! I saw his corpse under a dozen zombies!
I am sorry, but he fell to zombies. I found his body.
I found his possessions. I could give them to you.
Actually, I was mistaken. I don't have his things.
He had this staff. Take it.
He had a journal. Take it.
I don't have anything else of his.
Heh, I have his things now. Let's talk price.
I wish I could help.
Then live in denial, fool. I told you what I saw.
I'm sure he will turn up.
Powerful? Maybe I should seek him out.
I have not seen anyone by that name.
Me no see no Marcus anywheres.
Brother dead, probably.
This Marcus, he maybe write stuff? Was he spell-chucker?
Bye byes. Me go.
Maybe me find powerful guy. Maybe me get stuff.
He be here sometime. No worry.
Me not want to say but... him dead.
He so dead! Weak and stupid and dead!
You be fool. Me say what is true.
Me wish could help yous, but can't.
I have dead Marcus stuff. Maybe you... pay for it?
Me have dead Marcus stuff. Maybe give to you?
Him have book he write. Take it.
Him have big staff. Here, you take.
Heh... whoopsies. Me not have anything.
Me not have nothing more.
Farewell.
Go bye.
What are you waiting for?
What you wait for heres?
You just did. Out with it. What do you want?
You did anyways. What you want, already?
Tell me of your brother.
You tells me about your brother.
Have you seen many survivors, or just zombies?
You see lotta survivors, or just dead guys?
Is this the only safe place he might have gone?
This the only safe place he maybe be?
It is a small solace, I suppose, but I am more accepting of his passage now. My brother was a good person, you know?
Even your uncouth kind are a welcome sight to me. Only zombies have populated the vigil for my brother.
You'll forgive me if I am a bit distracted. I have been hoping that... well, I need not burden you with my troubles.
Safe passage to you. You'll excuse me if I return to my vigil.
You don't know that. He is quite skilled, and I place more faith in my knowledge of him than in your simple insults.
That... that cannot be. I will not believe it. Not until I see his belongings with my own eyes.
I cannot believe...
I have been given much... All his things... I'm sure they will bring me comfort. I hope they will. I hope...
Please, take this gold. I know it is not much, but you have been a great help to me. I appreciate it.
I thank you. I can at least have this little piece of him back. It is no replacement but... it is something.
I thank you, though I am sure there was more. It will show up eventually, I'm sure. I hope.
I will not believe it until I hold his belongings. He is just beyond my sight, I am sure. You are mistaken.
I have no doubt. He could always take care of himself.
I would not approach him with that greedy look in your eye. He is well-mannered, but will not abide your intent.
Ugh... I suppose people of all sorts must find shelter here... even the likes of you. Greetings... I am Bertrand.
Hello there! I am pleased to see people of refinement can survive out there. My name is Bertrand.
I know you will make good use of it. Thank you again.
Are... you sure? You seem... capable of mistakes. I won't believe it. Not until I see his belongings with my own eyes.
A friendly face is a welcome sight. Only zombies have populated the vigil for my brother.
It is good to see the living out. Only zombies have passed during the vigil for my brother.
Greetings stragglers. Forgive my disappointment, but your arrival brings me no joy. Where are my manners? I am Bertrand.
You sound like you wouldn't recognize much that wasn't small and shiny. I'm sorry, I'm being rude. I've been out of sorts, lately.
Your ill-spoken words are a great comfort. Really. I trust his ability more than your simple assurances.
You mock me with your callous talk. I won't believe you, not until I see his belongings with my own eyes.
Go. Take your cruelty. Leave me to my vigil.
Your words are no comfort. I won't believe it until I see his belongings. I wont.
Please, leave me to continue my vigil. Please.
What do you know?! You can barely pour the words out of that barrel you call a head!
Hello there... You will find this place safe, though I don't know why I stay here... I know he is dead now...
The vigil for my brother is over. I know he is dead. I just... can't let go. I don't have closure.
Be careful out there. Many have fallen already.
I have been watching for people fleeing the zombies. I've lost track of my brother in all the commotion and I was hoping he would come here.
His name is Marcus, Marcus Penhold. I shouldn't be worried. He's quite competent, and the heirloom he carries is powerful, too.
I am sorry if I appeared to lead you, but as I said, I am distracted. I've been waiting for my brother. I lost him in all the commotion.
That is unfortunate... but I am sure he is well. I will hear of him eventually.
I'll feel better once I hear of him. I'm sure it won't be long.
Yes, that sounds like him. Have you seen him, then?
This is the most logical place for him to go. I hear the Shining Serpent is also fortified, but I don't think Marcus thought much of the place.
Not many are willing to risk traveling. This place is safe, but getting here may be beyond the abilities of many people.
Some people may also be afraid of gathering together because of the risk of plague. Isolation doesn't work as well against zombies, though.
Well, he is a spellcaster, if that's what you mean. Yes.
Go ahead, though I doubt it shall do any good.
Farewell for now.
Have your blessings had an effect on the progress of the plague?
Where is the Great Graveyard?
Will people be safe if I bring them here?
<StartCheck>[Insight]</Start> Is this the only haven? People could fortify elsewhere.
Do you know who is creating the zombies?
I welcome the offer, thank you.
You will forgive me if I do not indulge, thank you.
I am not interested in your hollow blessings.
No thanks. No blessing wanted.
Give me blessing if you want. Probably do nothing.
No want. Take a hike.
Sure. Give me blessing. Thanks much.
Bye now.
Blessings slow plague down yet?
People be safe if me bring here?
Uh, you know who make plague zombies?
Where am this Great Graveyard thingy?
Can you offer basic temple services?
Maybe you gots store of basic temple stuff?
More have come seeking shelter, I see. Do you wish to receive the blessing I offer?
Greetings, and welcome to this small house of Helm. Do you seek a blessing in this troubled time?
It is an anointing of the soul. You will feel the effects like any of willing heart might, I am sure.
And now, what has truly brought you to this place? You have a great weight upon you.
As you will, but these doors are open should you need. All are welcome to receive the blessing.
Not as yet, but hope is powerful. Each blessing eases the mind, even if unable to prevent destruction of the body.
The Great Graveyard literally overflows, but we will not give up. Hope will deliver this city. You will see.
The Great Graveyard is north of the Beggar's Nest, but you will not enter with ease.
It is very effectively barricaded. I know of no other entrances, unfortunately.
Definitely. This is a sanctuary against the undead. They cannot enter here, by virtue of the power behind my blessings.
I will see to the safety of all who enter, and will administer to them indiscriminately. All will be treated equally.
Bah! I offer hope. Some huddle in the filth of the Silver Serpent tavern, but that doesn't make it a sanctuary.
The zombies? I know little except that their disrespectful attack upon the city degrades the hopes of all Neverwintans.
However, if you find the one responsible, tell them they have helped even as they meant to do the city harm.
Fear of undead has brought many to this temple, just as the plague does. The number of blessings I give grows daily.
No, I can see that you are possessed of another purpose. What can I do for you?
Uh, yes. It is an annointing of the soul. You should feel the effects like any other, despite your... limited faculties.
No, I can see in your vacant eyes that you are here for something else. What can I do for you?
This may be hard for you to understand, but even though the death continues, the blessings ease both mind and spirit.
Only here will people get the blessings they need. Only here do we understand the plague.
As you will. Return if you wish to be set at ease with a blessing... though your thoughts seem quite inert as it is.
Drake and Harben are working out a defence for people still trapped by zombies. You should go help.
I saw some strange stuff around the old warehouse in the northeast, but Drake might know more.
There's a few places that still have people in 'em. Speak with Drake if you want to check them out.
I swear, the dead are rising faster than the plague is killin' people off! Gotta be connected somewhere.
The undead cluster around the Great Graveyard, and nobody can get close. Barricaded up good, it is.
The Helmites swear the city will be delivered through blessings. Bah! Drake and Harben will deliver us proper by killin' zombies!
Sure, the Helmite sanctuary keeps zombies away, but you have to listen to their "blessing this" and "blessing that."
That Desther and his Helmites believe their "pat on the head" blessing actually helps. Hmpf! Ain't stopped anyone getting plagued yet!
Harben and Drake are keeping folk busy, but the damn undead need to be stopped at the source.
Those guards at the gate canna even keep their own safe. Lost that young fellah Walters, I hear.
That Drake fellah, he's something else, eh? An undead hunter! Good to see SOMEONE taking it to 'em!
I coulda gone to that sanctuary instead of here, but I prefer sensible talk over their pipe dreams.
Saw some fool mage in red fighting instead of running. Full of himself, he was. Now the street's full of him too.
Came here from the soup kitchen before it got overrun. Damned guards couldn't help. They didn't even know where it was.
You're better off dead, you freak!
I'll leave you alone then. Goodbye!
You just have to get to a safe place. Do you know one?
It's okay. Follow me and we'll go someplace safe.
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start>> Settle down now, I don't mean you any harm.
Just stay here where you won't hurt yourself!
Okay, you runs to Helmite sanctu-thingy.
Look, do you know a safe place to go?
Look, just follow me and you'll be fine, all right?
You'll be fine. Just stay here out of trouble.
You just stays here, so you not get hurt.
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> You settle now. Me not hurt you. Honest.
You know about zombies at all?
Shhh... relax. I'm <Race> just like you. Trust me.
Be still. I'm <race>, like you. Not undead.
Shut up, you! No way for <race> folk to act!
Me <race> kind, like you. Be quiet.
Shut up! That's not the <race> way to act!
You know safe place to run?
Follow and me lead you to safe place.
You runs to Shining Serpent then.
You stay here away from trouble, okay?
Do you know anything about the zombies?
You knows a safe place for you to go?
Okay, just go to the Shining Serpent.
You're okay. Just get to the Helmite Sanctuary.
Me leave then. Bye.
Me just kill you! Too loud!
You okay. Me <race> kind just like yous.
Just follows me and you be okay, yuh?
Okay... okay, everything is okay... it's okay... thanks for... calming me down...
More undead?! More?! Get away or... I'll get the MUFFFINS!
GAH!!! Take the muffins and GO!! Muffins and go!!!
Get away, get away!
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> NO! NO! Too MANY! UNDEAD! EVERYWHERE!
Don't know... don't know! Just gonna RUN!!!
FOLLOW! Gotta follow... past the zombies... PAST THE ZOMBIES!!!
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> Wha... what? Who are you... Undead... there's undead everywhere.
Just stay here... okay... with the zombies... keep low... yeah....
Shining Serpent... right... okay... I'll run... I RUN!!
Uh... uh... there's a tavern... Shining Serpent I think... and, uh... the Helmite sanctuary. That too... maybe. Somewhere.
Follow... okay... okay, I'll follow you... You're safe... okay... following, yes indeed...
They're....EVERYWHERE!! EEEEARGH!!
Get away! EAAAAGHHH!!!
The Helmites... okay... Temple of Helm... here I go... here I GO!
You are <race>... Okay.... Okay... maybe you are okay. There's just... undead... everywhere!
It's a trick... a trick... I can tell they are mean... I know!! UNDEAD!!! EVERYWHERE!!!
Know anything... I don't know... I just see them everywhere. I'm sorry... I don't know anything.
I don't think I could have made it... without help... Zombies everywhere... Was it you? I'm just glad to be alive...
Just... leave me be. Zombies... everywhere. I almost died...
Well, you're safe now. Quit your crying.
I'm leaving. What are you doing now?
Who did Drawl make a deal with? Who did this?
Who is Drawl? A zombie?
Yes, the plague has taken its toll.
Like who?
Who you mean?
Yeah, plague bad for everyone.
You safe now so pipe down.
Who Drawl? Them be all zombies now?
Who Drawl make deal with?
Me leaving. What you do now?
Where are they?
Where they?
What happened to Drawl's rivals?
What happen to these rival guys of Drawl?
How did Drawl do all this?
How Drawl do this stuff?
Who are you to the Sword Coast Boys?
Who you? What you do with Sword Coast Boys?
I don't have many answers, but it seems like the Sword Coast Boys are out of action. Everything's calming down in this district.
What are you doing? I don't want anyone drawing attention here! It ain't safe out there, not with Drawl and his Sword Coast Boys making like corpses.
Your looks aren't much better than the zombies, but thanks just the same. Didn't want to end up like them.
I ain't safe. They'll come back. Once a Sword Coast Boy, always a Sword Coast Boy... even if you're dead.
I wasn't having anything more to do with them, not after what happened to Drawl's rivals. Now they're all dead, and Drawl's some kind of monster!
I ain't going anywhere! I ain't ending up like them... not even Drawl, if I can help it.
I don't know. At first I thought The Heavies had something to do with it. They're a gang of half-orcs, but now they are all undead too.
They're all wandering around the warehouse. It's like Drawl put them on display, like with all his rivals... making a point.
No way, Drawl and his lieutenants are worse. I saw 'em for a second... they ain't lumbering or slow... They look really evil now.
He was the leader of our gang, but I don't know who he's dealing with now. I bet he gave over everyone just so he could be powerful.
I wish it were just the plague. The Sword Coast Boys will do worse. These zombies were some of the gang I was in.
The Sword Coast Boys. These undead are... they WERE the gang I was in. I thought they would look out for me, you know?
Thank you for your help... I didn't want to end up like them.
Thank the gods it's a friendly face. I sure didn't want to end up like those boys.
Some of the guys, they wanted to try and get the gang out of town while the plague was going on. You know, save their skins.
Drawl was leader, and said everyone should stay. He said he had a deal that would make the gang really powerful. He wouldn't let anyone leave.
Then he changed into... something. Now... everyone is dead... zombies, but different. And Drawl, he's still leading them. Don't know how... He's got a powerful friend somewhere.
I tell you, he's got someone backing him. I don't know. Maybe... maybe it's got something to do with the zombies everywhere, and they wanted undead that still had a mind.
Not sure why they'd want Drawl, though. I guess he's real easy to please. I don't think he cares what happens to him, just as long as he's the strongest guy on the block.
I just hope he doesn't come looking for me. I wanna live a good long time.
The Sword Coast Boys? Drawl had them take over a warehouse as a new base. Don't know why he thought that specific building was so important.
That was just a little while ago. It's in the north central area of the district.
Me? I'm Krestal. I was just one of the Boys. I'm lucky that I'm not important enough to come after. Plague or no, I'd be over the wall if I was.
After what Drawl did to the others... and how they tracked Walters down after he left. I hope he's all right... I know Drawl's rivals ended bad.
You guard fools can go risk your necks, but I'm not ending up like them... not me.
Just thank your lucky stars I'm not a flesh-eating corpse.
I might check it out. What are you going to do?
You say the undead leave the house alone?
Any idea who lives at this house you mention?
Maybe I am, but I've undead to kill first.
I've been fighting undead. You need some help?
Me fight undead. You needs help?
Maybe me loot, but me kill undead first.
Bah! Just you lucky me not undead.
Who live there?
Undead don't go to this bad house?
Me maybe take look. What you do?
I found this ring in the cult hideout. Recognize it?
Me find ring in cult place. You know it?
Farewell, then.
Bye for nows.
Me found some ring in cult place. It his?
I found this ring in the cult hideout. Was it his?
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> Are you sure you don't have something more?
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> Maybe you give something more?
Give me more or you'll be seeing your brother real soon!
Give more or join brother right quick!
Why do you think that?
Why? What you think you know?
I don't have time right now.
Me not got time right now.
I have questions about this strange house.
Me want know stuff about strange house place.
I want to know some things about your brother.
Me gots questions about brother.
What's his name? What does he do?
What his name? What job he gots?
Could I have it?
Maybe you give to me?
I'll take a look. You just stay here.
You stay here where it safer, okay? Me look.
I wouldn't want you along anyway. Stay here.
Me not want worthless you along anyways. You stay.
Why didn't you give this out the first time you were talked to?
Why you not give this out first time you talked to?
Well, at least the zombies have stopped. Do you know anything about that? I'm worried for my brother. He was mixed up in some cult.
I'd just like to know where he is. Torin has never been gone this long. If you happen by the estate in the northwest... well... this is my problem.
I'm going crazy here. They are up to something at that estate. It's something to do with the undead... I just know it.
What do you want? There's squat I can do to stop you looting, if that's what you're here for.
I suppose you could be worse. I'm going after worse right now. I think I know something about these undead...
My brother has been acting... funny. He goes to a strange house just north of here. The undead leave it alone!
He's not himself... I think they took his mind. There's a group in there... a cult... and my brother mentioned some kind of... creature.
I... I don't know. I'd like to help find him, but I don't know if I could make it.
It's the strangest thing: They walk right around it, and don't attack the people going in. My brother said the creature keeps them safe?
No clue, but I know they don't get attacked by the zombies, and I know my brother is acting weirder and weirder.
Yeah? I could use your help if you are looking to kill things. I think I know something about these undead...
I could use some. I'm probably going to be dead in an hour. I... might know something about these undead...
I hope you're not looters. Not much I can do if you are, but I hope you're not.
I hope you're here as a friend. You look like decent folk, and I'd hate for you to have sunk to looting.
I need SMART help. I'm probably going to be dead within the hour. I... might know something about these undead.
He's dead... I don't know what to do...
That's... that was my brother's. He always had it with him... he's dead. I know it.
Keep safe out there.
Thank you. At least now I know... Here... you have been more than helpful. Take this...
I don't have much to give you... Just keep the ring. It reminds me of how he died, not his life.
I thank you... I don't know why you did this, you seem so harsh... but thank you.
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> I've a little gold. I suppose you could take it. Just go now, all right?
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> What do you want? I've nothing left. Just leave me... please.
Look, maybe I've got a little gold... I suppose you could have it... Just go, okay?
I'll tell you what I can.
I suppose. What do you want to know?
All right... just leave me, then. I guess I'll stay here. Not much I can do on my own.
His name is Torin. He studied at a mage tower outside Waterdeep for a while, but never stuck with it. He's been a little lost.
I think he wanted something that had quicker rewards. He didn't have much patience for books.
They don't want any visitors, either. He uses some sort of key to get in, but it's not a normal one. Some kind of magic thing.
I suppose. I hope that means you'll try and find him. I'm worried.
I would give it to you, but I don't have it anymore. I gave it away already, and I sure hope it helps find my brother.
Maybe... maybe if I was more useful I could have found him already... I don't know... I'll just stay here.
I suppose, though I really wish I could do more. I feel so helpless here. He needs my help. I know it.
The cult hideout is north of here. If you are going to look for him, that's where I'd start.
What? I'm sorry, I'm not used to all this pressure. My brother is missing... maybe dead... maybe worse... Give me a break.
Besides, nobody asked me for it. I just forgot.
I have this thing that he used to get in the hideout... well, I'm sure it's not important. What do I know?
I don't know anything more about it than that. It's all happened so fast... right about when the zombies started showing up.
I honestly don't know what he's talking about anymore, and now he's been gone for days.
You will have to speak with my commander.
I don't want to die.
Nooooooooo.......
Stay away from me.
Somebody save me.
How could the gods be so cruel.
Please don't hurt me.
Thank you for saving me.
Farewell.
Anything new you know?
<StartCheck>[Insight]</Start> Is the creature justified? Neverwinter would've used it in a spell.
Me want talk about reward.
Go over the basic run down of the area.
A Waterdhavian creature was in another district. Think there's one here?
Are there any safe locations in the district?
Is there an identifiable enemy behind this?
If I find out anything I'll let you know.
<StartCheck>[Insight]</Start> Are the undead linked to the plague? When did this start?
You know a bossman behind the dead?
There safe places in this district?
Water-whosian creature found in other district. One here maybe?
Me see what me find.
You go over simple stuff about area.
Me go now.
Have you had any updates? Any new information?
Tell me about the Sword Coast Boys.
You tell about local Cult thingy.
Tell me about this local Cult.
You tell about Sword Coast Boys.
Me tough and scary. You give more!
I'm very dangerous, and worth more than that.
Am I to be rewarded for my efforts?
Me get reward for doing stuff?
I found the Waterdhavian Yuan-Ti creature. It raised the zombies.
Me find Water-daisy creature. Snake Lady. It caused dead problems.
Reward time. Cough something up or I get nasty.
Me break faces if no get reward now!
Farewell.
Bye bye.
Thanks. Farewell.
Me thank you. Bye bye.
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> Come now. Don't I deserve more than that?
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> Me deserve more. You think so, right?
I wanted to discuss the reward?
<FullName> is my name. I'm helping Aribeth.
Me <FullName>. Me help Aribeth.
What is my name to you? Why should I tell you?
Why you care what name me gots? Why me tell you?
I've no time to speak right now. Farewell.
Me gots no time for you. Bye bye.
Do you know anything about the Waterdhavian creatures?
You know anything about Water-whosian creature things?
I killed the creature that caused the undead.
Me kill creature that caused undead.
Back to my other questions.
Back to other questions, okay?
What rumors you hear?
What rumors have you heard?
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> I don't think that would be very fair. I've paid what I can and there's not much more.
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> All right, but don't go wearing out your welcome. This is coming out of my own pocket. Beat it.
Thank you. Be safe out there.
A lad named Krestal fears that the Sword Coast Boys have made a deal with a strange creature. Their leader, Drawl, has become a powerful undead.
You must be with <CUSTOM520>. Do you need a recap of what I told them, or have you something to report?
Back again, hmm? Need a recap?
Of course, he may just be worried about his brother, and I can't spare anyone to investigate the estate. It's in the northwest if you want to look.
Gulnan... Where have I heard that... Oh boy. That name was on one of the crates brought from Waterdeep. It must be one of the creatures.
Gulnan... Where have I heard that... Oh boy. That name was on one of the crates brought from Waterdeep. It must be one of the creatures.
What the heck did we bring in that could cause a mess like this? I'll be asking about this when Castle Never is back open, that's for sure!
Seach that estate top to bottom. This Gulnan creature had to contact them somehow, and it wasn't by knocking on the door.
Don't go feeling sorry for it. Sure, some of the creatures were a little more... sentient than others... but there's more to it.
The spell to cure the plague isn't supposed to be lethal, and I heard some of these things came willingly, even out of charity.
Of course, rumors say one was imprisoned in Waterdeep, and probably saw the trip as a chance to escape. Don't know any more than that, though.
These are alarming tales, but I can't spare anyone to check out the warehouse the gang uses as a base. Perhaps you could?
What the heck did we bring in that could cause a mess like this? I'll be asking about this when Castle Never is back open, that's for sure!
You'd better check the Sword Coast Boys' warehouse in the Beggar's Nest north central. This Gulnan contacted Drawl somehow, and not by walking the streets openly.
That's you? I expected green recruits, but I've heard how you've been helping find those blasted Waterdhavian creatures already! Glad you've come.
You're one of the new guards? Land and lord, why didn't you say so? Your job will be finding the source of the zombie infestation.
I heard some things about the local Sword Coast Boys gang. Don't know a lot, but they seem involved.
We've been up to our necks in undead. Even deeper for short folk like me. The Beggar's Nest is just a mess, it is.
Aribeth has you chasing those things, hmm? Well, don't blab it around to everyone. If people hear that we lost a shot at the cure...
I'm sorry, but I don't know where those things might have gone, and I ain't even sure what they were. I got zombies to worry about now.
You're standing in one. The Helmite Sanctuary is another, though you have to put up with their soggy blessings.
I got nothing against them, I guess. Gives people hope, but all their splashing hasn't scared the plague away yet.
I wish I knew. Like I said, that will be your job. You find out who's behind this and take 'em out.
The plague was here before the zombies, though, and it was only a few days ago that the undead became a horde.
Don't know if the two are linked. Not all plague victims become undead, but the ones that do hardly hit the ground before rising.
Here's the thing. I know you're just supposed to keep the peace, but we're up against a wall here.
Keep your voice down, lunk-head. People hear about that and they may lose what hope they have.
Well, you're kinda standing in one, smarty. The Helmite temple is another, though you have to suffer their soggy blessings.
If I knew that I'd do something about it. All I hear about are the zombies. I've no idea who might be behind it.
You find out what's happening, and I'll make it worth your while over and above whatever Aribeth wants from you.
So off you go then. And make sure you talk to Drake if you haven't. He's an undead hunter from way back.
I may say something you already know. I can only repeat what the guards have heard. Some of this you probably did yourself.
Careful out there. And remember, I'll make your efforts worth your while.
Would you like someone to jot this down? You seem to have a problem with retention.
Not as such. We're still up to our armpits in dead things. You find anything out, let me know.
Seems Drawl, the leader of the Sword Coast Boys, has become a powerful undead. Killed his rivals... some of his own gang too. Something named Gulnan was behind it...
I heard some things about a local Cult, or some such. Don't know too much, but it seems they are a concern.
I heard some things about the Sword Coast Boys gang, and a little about a local Cult, or some such. I think they have something to do with the undead.
A boy named Jemanie suspects a local cult has something to do with the undead. He claims some sort of creature keeps their estate safe from the zombies.
I guess it's a snake worshipping cult, of all things. They are in league with someone named Gulnan.
We were short people to help and you filled the bill. You got your fair share, and now you should leave.
I knew you'd help us, by Whilliker's whiskers. I heard about what you did before, and knew you'd take care of business.
Well now, the details ain't my business, but you sure helped us. The undead are practically fallin' by themselves.
If you found anything important in that mess, report it to Aribeth. She's keeping score, or some such.
And thank you again. Good luck.
Fair enough. I know Aribeth is more keen on duty as its own reward. Me, I like coins.
Snake-Lady? A Yuan-Ti? Dang, they must be desperate for a cure if they were willing to risk messing with one of those.
I have no information on what to do with it. You'd best take it to Aribeth. She'll want a look at it.
A Yuan-Ti? The search for a cure must not be going well if they are willing to risk dealing with one of those.
No need to get testy. I had gold put aside for whoever helped out. You'll get your share.
Here's 500 gold for you, and an item that I was saving for just the right person. Yer a hero... and likable, too.
Here's 500 gold for your trouble. Not a lot in the way of items floating around, but the money will serve you well.
Here's 200 gold and a special sword of mine. Not much, I know, but still an interesting little trinket.
Well, you know, I WOULD do that, but there's this thing me and Drake have about bullies. We don't appreciate 'em.
I have already given out a reward. I am very grateful for any assistance, but we can afford no more.
Well then, what would a person of your manners be doing here? I've only a minute, so your introduction must be quick. Too much to do.
Who might you be, then? Speak up, speak up, I can't spend much time on pleasantries right now. Too much to do.
What manner of malcontent are you? Say who you are and why I should bother with you. I've got a lot to worry about right now.
You've got no time? Well, join the bloody club. Go on then, and don't come back unless you're someone willing to help.
And why wouldn't you? Goodness, you are making this unnecessarily difficult. Tell me or don't, but I have a lot to do.
Now, who might you be, then? I don't have a lot of time to talk. We're busy with clean up now that the zombie threat seems to be over.
It's a mess in here right now. We've got a zombie infestation, and it will be your job to root out what's behind it.
I'm sure you did, but I hear that the beast was already turned in to Aribeth. I'll have to give out my reward to that person.
Well, I don't know about that. I've already given out a reward for killing that beast. You'd best take your concerns to the person that claimed it.
Yes, I know, and I have already given you the reward that you deserved. We cannot afford any more.
There are rumors, sure, but nothing makes much sense right now, and I don't have time to talk to everyone.
What do you need to know?
Like I said, I haven't had time to talk to anyone about it, but a couple of boys have said they heard things. Krestal and Jemanie.
Don't know much about them. Krestal lives just north of the Helmite shrine. Jemanie lives over in the central west section.
I think Drake will probably tell you of them as well. He's trying to organize rescues. That's all I know.
I heard you turned it in to Aribeth. Good. She'll know what to do with it.
It's in the north central of the Beggar's Nest, but take care. Drawl has apparently killed off all his rivals... including many of his own gang.
Where threat from?
Me continue looking.
I will continue my investigations.
I will lend my assistance where required.
I'll poke around on my own without your guidance.
Tell me of any people that need immediate help.
I will look into it.
Tell me of Jemanie.
Tell me of Krestal.
Maybe somebody less squeamish should replace you.
I've seen how dangerous the undead can be.
Me know how dangerous dead ones are.
Maybe you scaredy-cat. Somebody probably be better.
Me help wherever me can.
You tell about people needing help.
Me look around without you helping.
Tell me about Krestal lad.
Tell me about Jemananama-whosis.
Me look into things.
Have you found any new information?
Gots new news at all?
Tell me about the Sword Coast Boys.
Tell me 'bout Sword Coast Boys.
Tell me about this Snake Cult.
Tell about Snake Cult thingy.
Where do you think the threat originates from?
Well, I must say that whatever you did in that bloody graveyard, it seems our immediate troubles are over.
There's still the plague, of course, but the undead threat seems to be on the wane in this district.
You should report to Aribeth with whatever you found. Oh, Harben may give you something special as well as reward.
I knew we could count on you to repeat your success in this district. I had heard good things about you.
Ahh, you must be with <CUSTOM41>. Will you need me to repeat what they asked me about?
Ahh, you have returned to me. Do you need me to repeat my earlier information, or have you something else?
An organization of malevolent fanatics, following someone named Gulnan. They are entrenched in an estate in the northwest of the Beggar's Nest.
She will have needed access to the cult, so there may be passages that lead to her or her lair.
You know the area now, so you spearhead the effort. She has taken advantage of a plague-ravaged city, and must be stopped.
Something was corrupting the young. A creature named Gulnan offered power in exchange for complicity.
Whoever she is, she will have needed access to the warehouse. Search for passages, and take the fight to her lair.
You know the area now, so you spearhead the effort. She has taken advantage of a plague-ravaged city, and must be stopped.
Ah, I have heard of the impact you are making in Neverwinter. Good to know you are on our side today.
Greetings. Harben told me to expect additional troops arriving. Let me tell you, you are much needed here.
I've never seen an infestation like this. Undead fester over time, but here, they rise before a corpse even cools.
What we need right now is some order in the streets. People need help, first and foremost. We need you.
Once people are safe we can find the source of these undead and get down their throats. I'm sure Harben agrees and will reward people accordingly for helping.
If you learn anything, keep us informed. We must know what we're dealing with, and if it's connected to the plague.
The lad Krestal and the lad Jemanie were spotted barricaded in their homes. More houses may be overrun.
Jemanie's home is in the west central section of the district. He has a brother too, but I have no news of him.
His home is in the central east of the district, north of the Helmite shrine. He is usually with a gang but they appear to have disappeared.
Ha! I wish that were possible. I fight undead. If you can add to my experience, then good, but we gain nothing as adversaries.
There is always someone better, but we gain more working together. We've enough enemies right now.
I've heard a thing or two about the Sword Coast Boys and a Snake Cult, though you probably already know this.
It was probably your efforts that brought this information to light. Forgive me if I repeat something you know all too well.
Unknown. We don't have the men for simple information gathering. It's vital we find out what is going on, and if it's plague-related.
I've heard a thing or two about the Sword Coast Boys, though you probably already know this.
I've heard a thing or two about a Snake Cult, though you probably already know this.
I haven't heard anything new. Sure could use someone out there to poke around and get some answers.
Krestal and Jemanie may also know of some strange happenings in the area, but we have not been able to interview them as yet.
What was this Drawl creature?
You're dressed like a city guard. Why were you captured?
You look like city guard. Why you trapped here?
Who this Drawl creature guy?
I have questions about Drawl.
Me gots questions about Drawl.
I have questions about you, Walters.
Me gots questions about you, Walters.
I have questions about the "others" you mentioned.
Me gots questions about "others" you mention.
I should get moving. What will you do now?
Me should get moving. What you do now?
I assume he wasn't always like this?
He not always like this, was he?
If he's just some kid, who gave him this power?
If he just some jerk, who give him power?
I need to ask something else.
Me ask something else.
Why did you quit the gang and become a guard?
Why you quit gang to become guard?
Where are you supposed to be stationed?
Where you supposed to patrol?
What happened to them?
What happen to those guys?
Back to my general questions...
Back to general stuff questions...
I think you should make a break for it.
You maybe make a break for it, okay?
Just wait here until I clear things out.
You waits for me to bash streets safe.
You should just run to the gate.
Yous just run there, okay?
No gang cause all this stuff around here.
What is going on around here?
What going on around heres?
A gang couldn't have caused all this trouble.
Who helped this Drawl?
Who behind Drawl for this?
Why would someone corrupt a gang like that?
Why someone make gang bad like that?
Should killing Drawl have stopped the zombies?
Should making Drawl dead stop zombies?
Thanks for getting rid of Drawl. He's kept me here for days. Just to show me up, I guess. My name is Walters.
He used to be a friend of mine, back when I ran with the Sword Coast Boys. Never forgave me for "joining the enemy" as a guard.
I AM a guard, but I used to run with the Sword Coast Boys. They never forgave me for "joining the enemy." Especially Drawl.
I guess he wanted to make an example of me after he... changed. I got off lucky, I guess... not like some others...
Don't worry about me! Just kill that fool Drawl! Get him!
I'll answer what I can, but we should keep it short. There are still zombies swarming the district. Killing Drawl didn't get rid of them.
About me? All right, but we should keep this short. There are still undead swarming all over the Beggar's Nest, and killing Drawl probably didn't get rid of them.
I'll answer what I can. Anything to help people not end up like the others in the gang did.
Well, Drawl was always a jerk. He had big plans for the Sword Coast Boys becoming a mercenary company, but he was lazy. It was all talk.
The only thing that changed was that he became a *powerful* jerk. He thought he was a lich or something. He was too stupid to see he was just a pawn.
He was bragging nonstop about someone. I think the name was Gulnan. I don't know what or who that is. Drawl wouldn't say.
Personally, I don't think he really knew. He was just happy to be tough enough to back up his threats for once.
I do know that he'd been in contact with this Gulnan a lot, so there's got to be a link between them around here somewhere.
Because it's a job with a future. Drawl promised a lot, but he never delivered. His plans never accomplished anything but petty crime.
Since I joined the guards I'd been trying to straighten him out, but he wouldn't listen. Always looking for the easy way, no matter the long term cost.
I was patrolling near the gate to the city core. They must have noticed I'm missing, but probably can't spare anyone to look.
I'll have to find my way back there eventually. Dangerous with the undead, though.
Ever since I left, Drawl really tightened his grip on the Sword Coast Boys. He didn't want anyone else leaving... not alive, anyway.
A few weeks ago, I guess some of the guys tried to convince Drawl to take the gang out of the city. They wanted to try and avoid the plague.
Go ahead, but we should keep this short. Killing Drawl didn't do much to stop the zombies.
The same thing that happened to all of the boys. Drawl made some deal to become... whatever it was he became, and the rest of them were killed.
All the old gang... gone. I'm just glad Drawl got what he deserved in the end. Good riddance.
I'll be here at the gate for now. I'm still a bit weak after being trapped in the warehouse.
I'll be staying here. I can't do much for the Sword Coast Boys in my current state. I gotta realize I'm not one of them anymore.
I'd like to get out of here, of course. I don't know if I could make it to the main gates on my own unless the zombies were taken care of.
Good luck out there. I hope you fix that "Gulnan" Drawl talked about. Get some vengeance for the dead.
You think? I suppose I could try. I'm pretty weak right now but... I guess I don't have much choice.
I suppose, but there are still a lot of undead swarming around. Drawl's benefactor is out there somewhere. I wish I wasn't so weak right now.
He's gone... I know it... Drawl is finally gone. Good riddance. He brought all my old friends down with him... The Sword Coast Boys... all dead.
Hello to you. I hope the day finds you well. Looks like things are finally settling down in the Beggar's Nest. The undead are gone.
Was it you that put an end to what was happening? Thanks, if it was. Is the way to the main gates safe? I'm a bit weak because of all the fighting that was going on.
Things are pretty quiet here at the gate now that the threat in this area is gone. Saves the guards a lot of worry.
I suppose it would be all right now. There's not too much danger now that the undead seem to be gone. Thanks for your help.
I agree. If you were in on destroying Drawl, you know that he had far too much power for the smalltime hood that he was.
The Beggar's Nest is obviously under siege by undead. I don't know what's doing it, but it sure made a mess of the Sword Coast Boys.
Drawl seemed to have made some sort of deal for the power he received. He corrupted the whole gang... some used to be my friends...
I don't know. He bragged about someone named Gulnan... said he was her "Lieutenant of Evil." I bet he gave himself the title. Adolescent garbage.
Whoever or whatever Gulnan is, the two of them must have had a way to meet. Have you thoroughly checked the warehouse? Some strange things went on.
Well, if they got some willing people, maybe they'd make better henchmen than mindless zombies. I don't know anything about undead.
It could be that they just wanted to cause chaos... or make people afraid that even people without the plague could turn on them...
I doubt it. Drawl couldn't have been behind it all. He was an idiot. A tough one, but still an idiot. He was pure patsy.
Stopping the zombies probably means finding this "Gulnan" creature Drawl was bragging about. Don't know anything about how to do that, though.
You cannot defeat me! Gulnan has made me immortal!
Yes, fight! You'll see! You'll see!
Who are you to come here?! Do your worst! You will see how futile it is!
You can never leave the gang... I will have Gulnan kill you last so you see everything fall!
See what you lost? I am powerful now! She has given me this!
You look like hell, man. Dead doesn't suit you.
You should never have left, Walters. Look at what I have now!
No! NO! Not the link! Her power must reach me! I am strong! I am strong with her help! I AM!!
This pillar of light radiates necromantic energies. Just being close to it makes you feel uneasy
I do follow the serpent.
Me like snakes
Goodbye
<StartAction>A wall of force blocks the way as an ethereal voice begins to speak.</Start>
Only those who follow the serpent may enter. Do you bear the proper sign?
Infidel! Only those who carry the token are true followers! You shall not pass!
I see you carry the symbol. Welcome <race> one, follower of the scale. All praise to our new matron! All praise to Gulnan!
There are outsiders present! The incantation is soiled!
The magic is tainted! Gulnan's servant will not be fully controlled!
Abandon the Spell! The outsiders taint it.
Ooooh, this isn't good.
You're not one of us!
You're a potential threat, so you can rot here.
Oh, what the hell. I'll see what I can do.
I am leaving. What should I do about you, hmm?
Cease your raving!
Relax, I will help, but I have some questions.
You relax. Me help, but gots questions first.
Shut up or me leave you.
Me leave. What me do about you, hmm?
Whatever. Me see what me can do.
You rot here 'cause you maybe be dangerous later.
Who are you?
Who you?
Scaled Worm? What do you mean?
What you mean, Scaled Worm?
How did you end up in here?
How you get put in here?
What do you think this Gulnan is?
What you think Gulnan is?
Where is she?
Where she go?
Back to my other questions.
Back to other questions, okay?
You would defeat her if released? She already beat you.
You defeat her if released? She beat you already once.
What god does she sacrifice to?
What god she kill stuff for?
Focus? What do you mean?
What you mean by focus thing?
Foul minion of darkness, you'll stay imprisoned here.
You bad, so you stay here like in jail.
I see her influence fading... Muuaahaha! She's gone! Gulnan of the pathetic little scaled worms is gone! Praise the Prince of Lies!
Yes! I shall rebuild the grand and glorious cabal of Cyric I had so long planned to unleash upon the city in its weakest moments... er...
What I mean, of course, is that the followers of Cyric will aid the city as best they can. Yes... yes of course they will. Let me out. Do it.
Tormentors! More of you walk free as I languish! Cyric, free me! The scaled worm Gulnan will not have my temple! She will not!
By the Black Sun, how could she fell me?! The snake gods are pitiful! Beneath the notice of mighty Cyric!
Oh, certainly! Bully the man in the cage. How sporting! As bold as the scaled worm that seduced my flock, and now takes their lives! The indignity!
Great, I'm at the mercy of a simpleton. Can you even understand what she has done? That scaled worm has stolen my flock!
Questions? Oh, certainly. After all, what else am I doing? Just languishing here while my flock are taken to the altar of a worm! A scaled worm!
Who am I? I am a follower of the great god Cyric! I am a servant of the coming Day of the Dark Sun! I am his will!
"Who am I," it barks. Can you fathom the greatness of who I follow, the mighty Cyric? Can you fathom his glory?
I am Jared, and I am also caged like so many worthless enemies of the Prince of Lies that I have put to their end!
My flock... my flock are usurped, but I shall not bow! I shall not bend! Cyric shall see to my freedom!
I was usurped, if you must know! She corrupted the weakest of my flock, and now the rest follow or join her legions of undead!
I am to be gutted upon her altar! ME! It's not right! Jared of Cyric does the gutting! Not some scaled worm!
Treacherous snake-woman! It calls itself Gulnan! I call it usurper! Cyric, why was she able to defeat me?! I follow the Word!
I suppose you mean physically? Yuan-Ti. Snake-beast wench. Dead, if I get my hands on her! I'll make boots from her flanks!
I WASN'T READY! She was sneaky! She was supposed to be weak! She's a scaled worm, damn it! Where did she get such power?!
In the crypts. She's using the undead... an army of corpses. I would be impressed IF IT WAS ME DOING IT!
What indeed! Not the god of her pathetic people, whatever name such a whelp goes by. Cyric would not have allowed that defeat!
She cheats! She's got some power on her side! One that dares ignore my true calling! One that abuses the focus I created!
Grrr... if you dared beg this knowledge at any other time I would skin you alive. It is not for outsiders to know... but...
I will not allow her to keep it... even if that means some pawn like you taking it from her. It is a tool, a darkly magic stone.
It makes the flesh of the dead... useful... for things. Take it from her! It is mine by right! It is pledged to Cyric, not her false lord, whatever it is.
Well, imbecile, you should fear the will of Cyric and appease him! Release his loyal servant so my dark work in his name continues!
Really, you should let me out. Such an action will speak well of you, and guarantee a swift, merciful death when my Lord rules all.
I shall build anew for Cyric! I will... I will use her beguiling techniques... yessss. Now... if someone would just LET ME THE HELL OUT!
What?! Pawn of order! You will all feel the wrath of Cyric in the end times! I will not be caged! Er... not for long, anyway!
A wise move... IF IT WAS ME MAKING IT! Let me out of here! Cyric let me loose that I might... I might...
Please? Come on!
Free! The will of Cyric shall descend upon this weakened city like... like... like some suitable metaphor I'll think of later! Oh yes, fear my coming retort! Uh... goodbye!
By Cyric, I would speak with you!
Ugh... visions... cannot lie!?
The plague is a gift! It grants an army for the taking!
Scales! Scales will defeat you!
I have seen the visions! You cannot deny the power!
Warmbloods! Vermin! No more than mice or rats!
Here is where you become my MEAT!
Hear my voice through your dead! You thought to use me, to sacrifice for a spell! I have used you to free myself!
You will join my legion of dead! I have seen the visions! The scaled ones will rule here! I will overrun!
The plague weakens you, but strengthens my army! It is a blessing! A gift! You cannot imagine the gift!
You cannot deny that the scales will rule! See the power I am granted?! It is incredible, and beyond even Merrshaulk!
Come if you must, but you will die! The visions cannot lie! I see the coming of the eye! The eye!
This is Bloodsailor territory. Get out!
Off in the distance you hear the sound of a door opening.
Could I ask you some questions?
Me want ask questions.
Goodbye.
Have you heard anything about a cure for the Wailing Death?
Did you know anything about the attack on the Academy?
How did you end up here tending the afflicted.
Have you heard any rumors lately? You know, gossip and the like?
You know stuff 'bout cure for sick?
What you know 'bout fight at Academy?
You be nurse. How you get your job here?
You hear gossip or rumors or stuff?
That's it? You haven't heard the rumors about a cure from Waterdeep?
You not hear stuff 'bout cure from Waterdeep?
Tell me what you've heard about Desther.
Tell me what you've heard about Aribeth.
Tell me what you've heard about Fenthick.
Tell what you hear 'bout Desther.
