Tell what you hear 'bout Aribeth.
Tell what you hear 'bout Fenthick.
What were they saying?
<StartCheck>[Insight]</Start> You don't like Desther much, do you?
What them say?
Aren't you afraid of contracting the plague yourself?
You not scared you get sick, too?
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> Come now, telling me won't do any harm.
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> Tell me. Will hurt nobody.
What can you tell me about the plague?
What you know 'bout plague?
I want to ask you something else.
Me have other question.
Can I ask you some directions?
Neverwinter big place. Me need directions.
Greetings, my <Lord/Lady>. How may I be of service?
May whatever gods you pray to keep you safe from the plague.
On your way, then. I've got too many sick and suffering to waste my time on long goodbyes.
Off with you, then. I've no time for the likes of you.
Your mind is feeble, my <Lord/Lady>. Never fear, I am used to dealing with patients whose minds have become enfeebled. I'll speak slow so you understand.
I really should be tending the sick, but for you my <Lord/Lady> I can spare a few moments.
I really should be tending the sick, but I can spare a few moments, <sir/madam>.
Make it quick - my time is better spent easing the suffering of my patients.
There's no cure for the plague - everybody knows that! All I can do is try to ease their suffering and make their last days less painful.
I heard Fenthick and Desther whispering about it once, but they clammed up right as soon as they saw me. That Desther gave me a foul look.
I was a midwife, before the plague. But there ain't many babies being born now - not live ones, anyhow. I heard Castle Never needed nurses to tend their sick and dying, so I came.
I've heard my share. Desther and Aribeth are always arguing and Fenthick's always trying to keep the peace.
Some people won't have nothing to do with the sick. They board themselves up in their homes and don't come out for no reason. And they still get the Wailing Death.
Is there something else you wanted to know? Or can I get back to my duties?
Aribeth doesn't like him, I know that much. He's got a sharp tongue and a sour face, but I think it's more than that. But it's not really my place to speak of such things.
Lady Aribeth's always telling Fenthick not to put so much faith in Desther and his Helmites. You know they're lovers? Fenthick and Aribeth, I mean. Of course you know. Everybody knows.
Poor Fenthick. He's caught in the middle between Desther and Aribeth, always ends up having to pick one side or the other when they argue about how to save the city.
Well I suppose that's about as direct as one can get.
You interested in more of my gossip, my <Lord/Lady>?
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> Desther and his Helmites showed up soon after the plague started, just in time to get locked inside the city when the quarantine hit.
Desther says they came because they heard about Neverwinter's suffering, but it seems like odd timing to Lady Aribeth. Or so she told Fenthick once.
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> Sorry, but I better not say anymore. Desther's just over there on the other side of the room.
A cure from Waterdeep? How they going to get it in here with Neverwinter under quarantine! Throw it up over the walls? You're talking crazy.
Is there something else you need? If not I really should get back to the sick.
Desther was saying the attack was all Aribeth's fault, and Fenthick was trying to defend her. That's all I heard.
Do you have more questions? If not, I really should get back to my duties.
He's sour, that one. A bitter man with a sharp tongue. But he's a man of the cloth, and his Helmites do good work around the city, helping the sick.
Desther's not a real friendly sort, but I guess that ain't no crime. I just try to stay out of his way.
Is there something I can do for you, <sir/madam>?
What do you want? And be quick about it - can't you see how busy I am here?
As much as most, less than some I suppose. I've seen my share of the dead and dying since I started to work here tending the sick.
I'm here to tend the sick and the dying, not play tour guide.
What do you want to know?
Yes, I suppose it would seem large to someone like you, wouldn't it?
The Helmites don't catch it from helping the sick, so why should I? The plague takes who it wants, when it wants. Nothing anyone can do about that.
None of them pay any attention to a quiet little nurse going about her duties, so I've heard all sorts of stuff about each and every one of them.
Besides, all you have to do is go outside Castle Never's front door. The Core District has every kind of shop, store or inn you'll ever need, I suspect.
You think he'd always side with Aribeth, being they're lovers and all. But Fenthick's an honest man, and when Aribeth is wrong he's not afraid to tell her so.
<StartAction>Speak the word "Halueth."</Start>
<StartAction>Leave it.</Start>
There is something strange about this bookshelf. There might be an opening behind it, but the shelf resists any physical attempt to move it.
I am in service to Aribeth as a guard, just like you.
Me works for Aribeth as guard like you.
Goodbye.
My purpose here is not your business.
You not need to know stuff about me.
I have been sent here by Oleff to see Briley.
Me sent by Oleff to speak with Briley.
Can I ask you questions about this place?
Maybe me ask you stuff about this place?
Can I ask you about the district or the plague?
Maybe me ask about district or the plague thing?
This area is in the care of the Temple of Tyr. May I inquire as to what you hope to find here?
Yes, yes. On your way, then.
I see. Recent academy graduate, hmm? Well, go on in. Guards are allowed, as are people with permission from Oleff in the Tyrran Temple.
I have been instructed to allow anyone associated with the city guard or the Temple of Tyr access to the dig below.
What are you doing here? State your intent to me.
I have been hired to make sure that nobody makes trouble here. If you won't tell me why you are here, then I won't let you pass.
If you have any questions regarding this place, I suggest you take them up with Briley below, or Oleff in the Temple in the City Core.
Ah, I see. Yes, you seem to have a letter from him. Hmm, aren't you one of the new recruits for the city guard as well? A recent academy graduate?
I'll make certain that only other city guards are allowed in as well. You make sure that nothing goes wrong while you're here, all right? Right.
Don't know nothing about it. I just guard what I'm told to guard. Looks like nothing but a hole in the ground to me.
I don't know this district very well. I think that's why I got this assignment. The other guards didn't want to be stationed here.
As for the plague, I know I don't want it and that's enough. Now get going, all right? I'm not supposed to be talking to people.
Inscribed on the chest are the words "A wall at arms length."
Inscribed on the chest are the words "Tooth of the forge."
Inscribed on the chest are the words "A splinter delivered in flight."
Inscribed on the chest are the words "Diamond of the forest, if the seasons never changed."
What do you have?
What you got?
Nothing.
What can I get you?

Me need Pass Coin.

I don't have enough.

What can I get you?

Well, the boys and girls in the backroom will be waiting for you when you can afford it. They're well worth the price.
When you get upstairs, just give this to the companion of your choice.
Moonstone Mask closed. Direct all complaints to <CUSTOM625>.

I want to ask you some questions.
Why can't I enter the estate?
Who be you?
Me got question me want ask.
Why me not go in big house?

Do you know anything about the Wailing Death?
Anything interesting going on here in Blacklake?
I'm looking for work.
You know stuff 'bout plague?
There be interesting stuff happen here in Blacklake?
Me look for work.
I'm sorry, <sir/madam>. Only guests of Hodge are allowed to enter his estate. The guards inside are under strict orders.
I'm just a guard trying to do his duty. Well, actually I'm not much of a guard. I was the butler, but the door guard fell to the plague.
I'm on duty, so I really shouldn't be chatting... but it gets awful boring just standing here. Usually I'm cleaning inside.
Ask your questions and I'll do my best to answer them.
Well, actually, I don't much care one way or the other. If you are set on entering, I'm not going to get in your way. I'm not really much of a fighter.
Huh - not too bright, are you? I'll speak slow so you understand.
Goodbye. Do as you will. I'm not paid enough to worry about this.
You better step back. Only those in the company of Mr. Hodge are allowed to enter his estate.
Get lost! Only guests of Mr. Hodge are allowed in, and as low as he might be, I don't think he would stoop to associate with your type.
I only know what everyone's been saying. We're all doomed unless Aribeth and her crew can find a cure.
Nothing you haven't heard before, I'd bet. Was there anything else?
Interesting? What would I know about interesting? This is the first I've been outside in weeks. I'm usually inside, minding the dusting and whatnot.
Who'd want to hire someone as dumb as you? Not that it matters, anyway.
I ain't doing any hiring myself, and I don't know anyone who is. I'm just a butler... guard too, I guess. Anything else you need?
I'm supposed to be the butler, after all. I'm only filling in because the door guard died of plague. I wouldn't go in, though. It's not safe.
Earth came first.
Earth was followed by Water.
Next came Air.
Fire is the end. Fire is my end.
This portal will not work for you.
Someone is already taking the test. You must wait.
Aye, you'd be a good one to watch in the ring. Just enough panache to win the crowd.
Hmph. People are mad they sealed off the Blacklake district to keep out the plague. As long as I'm inside I don't care.
Hmph! I'm surprised you are here. Weren't most of the louts like you put out when the barricades went up?
My word! Put some decent clothing on at least, <man/woman>!
You can't run around town without anything on! Are you mad?
Err... forgot to put on your clothing to<day/night>, did you?
Ran into some trouble downstairs, did you?
Whoah, don't get your blood in my beer, <lad/lass>.
That must have been some fight you were in. Did you take the prize?
You're a rather slow one, aren't you?
Sorry, but I've got no time to talk to mor... err, that is, I have to go.
I would chat, but I'd probably talk too fast for you.
Must you brandish that thing about up here? Save it for the cellars!
Stop waving that about, will you, <mister/missus>? Upstairs ain't the place for it.
Looking to put another notch in that weapon, <mister/missus>?
Welcome to the Den of Iniquity, holy roller...
A good <day/night> to you, my <lord/lady>. Is the temple sending contestants, now, too?
Ha, folks, we've got ourselves a holy <man/woman> to<day/night>!
Hmph. Best keep your magics to yourself around here, <sir/madam>.
Wizards and such are not very welcome in these parts.
You should have stayed in your tower, of wherever it is you folk come from.
It's always good to see a <race> face these days.
It's always a delight to see another <race> face around here.
Be wary of the humans in this town. They'll tax you extra for your <race> blood, I'm not joking.
Hello, miss. Might I say that you're looking mighty pretty today?
Always a pleasure to bump into a pretty lass like yourself.
We sure don't have many local girls who look like you.
My, my. Hello there, handsome.
If there were more men about like you, this town wouldn't be so boring.
(sigh) I suppose you already have a lady friend of your own...
Hmm, I don't know if the Board Laid Bare is the place for nice folks such as yourself.
Just between you and me, m'<lord/lady>, wouldn't you say the Wailing's put a dent in the merchants' coffers?
It's horrible, with the quarantine in place, they haven't been able to import my favorite ale.
It's cold for this time of year. I do pity the folks that have lost their homes to looting. I may even do something to help... but not until the plague is over, of course.
More plague-waifs cluttering up the place, I see. Excuse me.
Stand away from me, you, before I call the tavern guards!
You must be from up in the mountains... or maybe even further, right?
Ah, the Board Laid Bare's a good place for a savage brute like you.
Were you brought up by bears, perhaps? It smells like it.
Well, wonderful. More <race> scum wandering about. If that isn't all we need.
I have better things to do than chat with any <race> n'er-do-well who wanders by.
Oh, hello. You're one of those <race> folk, right?
Good <day/night> to you, <Master/Mistress>! How runs the tavern?
Good fight. You won your first badge.
Wow, your second badge. I bet you're going to go all the way.
You did it! You got the third badge. Claudus is going down!
I've never seen such a fight! I even got hit with the blood spray! I'm never going to wash again.
I love a good fight.
A new contestant. Come talk to me, I'm the coordinator.
All of the animal cages have opened.
<StartAction>Use the Transport via Plants scroll to transform the tree into a portal through which the animals in the zoo can escape when released.</Start>
<StartAction>Leave.</Start>
Before you stands a mighty tree.
Hello <FirstName>.
Lord Nasher's men will soon find a cure.
I wish I shared your optimism.
Begone peasant!
Got a silver?
*Grumble*
Damn freeloader.
You should be indoors.
It dosn't matter, we'll all catch it soon enough.
Get away from me, you may be diseased.
No more than you.
You can't loiter by the gate. Aribeth's orders.
I'm not trying to escape. I wouldn't have anywhere to go.
Would you accept Helm's blessing in this troubled time?
You have already blessed my entire family. Thank you.
I heard about your daughter. I'm sorry.
Ilmater will look after her until I join her.
I heard Desther is working on a cure.
He had better hurry. Every day someone I know starts the Wailing.
That's the one we were told about.
Get the cure reagent!
Kill the enemy!
We cannot fail in our task.
We must not fail in our task.
Kill the enemy!
Let me see your wares.
Me want to buy stuff.
Goodbye.
Step right up! I've got just what you're looking for. My shop ain't what it used to be, but I'm still a shopkeeper, nonetheless.
Whoever has been piling these disease-ridden corpses for burning has long ago fled. If you had a torch you could continue his work.
It will take a long time for these bodies to be consumed by the flames.
You must be one of the new city guard. Hopefully you can do something about those zombies in the Beggar's Nest.
You must be one of the new city guard. Hopefully you can do something about those zombies in the Beggar's Nest.
Hmph! You look like you must be one of them escaped convicts from the prison break in the Peninsula district!
What are you doing with no clothes?! You want to get sick and catch the plague?
Why are you naked? You must be plague stricken! Get away from me!
A naked plague victim! Don't touch me!
Those wounds look terrible! You better get looked after before you come down with the Wailing Death.
You're bleeding all over the place! Get some healing before your wounds get infected with plague!
That must have been some fight you were in. Don't those wounds hurt?
You aren't quite right in the head, are you? Maybe you escaped during the prison break in the Penisula district.
I heard the Beggar's Nest is crawling with zombies infected by the plague!
Not too bright, are you? Maybe your mind was destroyed by the plague! Get away from me!
Quit waving your weapon around like a thug! Criminals aren't running things around here - this isn't the Docks district!
I heard the Blacklake district nobles have a cure for the plague, but they won't share it with us common folk!
Think carrying that weapon will keep the Wailing Death at bay?
You're a priest! Why has your god let the Wailing Death kill so many of us!?
You're a cleric - why don't you do something about the zombies terrorizing the Beggar's Nest!
You're a holy <man/woman> - can't you make the nobles in the Blacklake district share their cure with the rest of us?
Hmph. Best keep your magics to yourself around here, <sir/madam>. Some blame sorcery for the plague!
There's anarchy in the Docks district! I heard criminals have taken over and the city guard are afraid to go in there now.
Heard about the prison break in the Peninsula district? As if the plague wasn't bad enough!
They say plague corpses walk the streets in the Beggar's Nest, feasting on the living!
The nobles in the Blacklake district have sealed themselves away from everyone. There's something strange there, mark my words!
Be wary of the humans in this town. They'll tax you extra for your <race> blood, I'm not joking.
A pretty girl like you should stay away from places like the Docks. They are rough at the best of times.
Them nobles are up to something in the Blacklake district. I hear they got themselves a secret cure for the plague!
We sure don't have many local girls who look like you - not since the plague killed 'em all off.
Ain't you handsome! Better stay away from the Docks - the thugs there will mess up that pretty face something awful.
Them nobles are up to something in the Blacklake district. I hear they got themselves a secret cure for the plague!
You're a handsome one. Just don't catch the plague, or your looks won't last long.
A word of advice: be careful. If you catch the Wailing Death, you'll not be among the living for long.
I heard there was a prison break in the Peninsula district. I wonder if the rumors are true.
I heard there was a prison break in the Peninsula district. I wonder if the rumors are true.
Them nobles are up to something in the Blacklake district. I hear they got themselves a secret cure for the plague!
Them nobles are up to something in the Blacklake district. I hear they got themselves a secret cure for the plague!
People like you belong in the Docks district - along with the rest of the thugs and ruffians!
You must be from up in the mountains... or maybe even further, right? The plague spread up there yet?
What a brute you are! You must have escaped during the prison break in the Peninsula district.
You're obviously a thug. Say, are you a member of that criminal organization that's taken over the Docks district?
Well, wonderful. More <race> rabble wandering about. Plague carriers are what your kind are!
The city guard can't keep order anymore! They don't even care that there was a prison break in the Penisula district.
Oh, hello. You're one of those <race> folk, right? Plague take all the <race> race, I say!
You must be one of the new city guard. Hopefully you can do something about those zombies in the Beggar's Nest.
You must be one of the new city guard. Hopefully you can do something about those zombies in the Beggar's Nest.
Hmph! You look like you must be one of them escaped convicts from the prison break in the Peninsula district!
What are you doing with no clothes! You want to get sick and catch the plague?
Why are you naked? You must be plague stricken! Get away from me!
A naked plague victim! Don't touch me!
Those wounds look terrible! You better get looked after before you come down with the Wailing Death.
You're bleeding all over the place! Get some healing before your wounds get infected with plague!
That must have been some fight you were in. Don't those wounds hurt?
You aren't quite right in the head, are you? Maybe you escaped during the prison break in the Penisula district.
I heard the Beggar's Nest was crawling with zombies infected by the plague!
Not too bright, are you? Maybe your mind was destroyed by the plague! Get away from me!
Quit waving your weapon around like a thug! Criminals aren't running things around here; this isn't the Docks district!
I heard the Blacklake nobles have a cure for the plague, but they won't share it with us common folk! I hear a lot of things, though.
Think carrying that weapon will keep the Wailing Death at bay? May as well spit in the Anauroch!
Sorry cleric, but I can't even begin to think the gods are good while the stink of burning corpses covers everything.
You're a cleric; why don't you do something about the zombies terrorizing the Beggar's Nest! This would never happen in Tethyr!
You're a holy <man/woman>; can't you make the nobles in the Blacklake district share their cure?
Hmph. Keep your magic to yourself around here, <sir/madam>. Some blame sorcery for the plague! They might banish mages to the Mere of Dead Men. Maybe.
There's anarchy in the Docks district! I heard criminals have taken over and the city guard are afraid to go in there now.
Heard about the prison break in the Peninsula district? As if the plague wasn't bad enough!
They say plague-corpses walk the streets in the Beggar's Nest, feasting on the living!
The nobles in the Blacklake district have sealed themselves away from everyone. There's something strange there, mark my words!
Be wary of the humans in this town. They'll tax you extra for your <race> blood, I'm not joking. Almost as bad as Calimport.
I heard pirates have taken over the Docks district. A pretty girl like you would be best to stay away from there.
Them nobles are up to something in the Blacklake district. I hear they got themselves a secret cure for the plague!
We sure don't have many local girls who look like you - not since the plague killed 'em all off.
Ain't you handsome! Better stay away from the Docks - the thugs there will mess up that pretty face something awful.
Them nobles are up to something in the Blacklake district. I hear they got themselves a secret cure for the plague!
You're a handsome one. Just don't catch the plague, or your looks won't last long.
A word of advice: be careful. If you catch the Wailing Death, it'll be *your* corpse we smell burning.
I heard there was a prison break in the Peninsula district. I wonder if the rumors are true.
I heard there was a prison break in the Peninsula district. I suppose we'll be burning more corpses if it's true.
Them nobles are up to something in the Blacklake district. I hear they got themselves a secret cure for the plague!
Them nobles are up to something in the Blacklake district. I hear they got themselves a secret cure for the plague!
People like you belong in the Docks district - along with the rest of the thugs and ruffians!
You must be from up in the mountains... maybe even the Spine of the World? The plague spread up there yet?
What a brute you are! You must have escaped during the prison break in the Peninsula district.
You aren't with those pirates in the Docks, are you? I thought they were only around the Nelanther Isles. Guess I don't know much.
Well, wonderful. Another <race> lout wandering about. Plague carriers are what your kind are!
The militia can't keep order anymore! The guards in the Core don't even care that there was a prison break in the Penisula district.
Oh, hello. You're <race>, right? Plague take all the <race> race, I say!
Could I ask you some questions?
Me want ask questions.
Goodbye.
Are you sure there isn't anything going on?
You not know about stuff? No stuff happening?
I thought bartenders liked to talk. Why not you?
Me thought bartenders talk lots. Why you not?
So you've just given up?
So you just give up then?
Hello there. Something I can do for you?
Bye then. Safe travels.
On your way. Farewell.
Ah, whatever.
Sorry, but it seems like you'd need the answers said real slow, and I don't have the time regardless.
Well, you seem friendly enough, but I don't really want to spend my time answering questions.
Sorry, but I really don't want to spend my time answering your questions.
Ah, beat it, you lout. I've no interest in answering your questions.
Oh, I'm sure there's plenty happening, but I just don't want to talk about it. I've heard enough, and I'm done dwelling on it.
Yes? Something you need?
What is it? Come on then, I don't have all day.
There's not much to say. I'm not trying to be rude, but if you're looking for real useful information I'm sure there's better places to find it.
I haven't given up; I'm just not letting these horrible things have power over me.
I mean, there's nothing I can do about what's going on, and I don't know enough to be truly useful, so why should I bother worrying?
People don't come here because they've solved all their problems; they come because they want to get away from them. Nobody here has a clue. I sure don't.
Could I ask you some questions?
Me want ask questions.
Goodbye.
What do you know about Lord Nasher?
What do you know about Aribeth?
Shouldn't the people be the first to hear about cure attempts?
What can you tell me about Neverwinter?
What you know about Nasher guy?
What you know about Aribeth?
Maybe people should be told plague stuff. Why they not?
What you know about Neverwinter?
<StartCheck>[Insight]</Start> Has he been seen in public recently?
Do you know anything about the plague?
You knows about plague, maybe?
Let's go back to my first questions.
Maybe we go back to first questions?
I've got another drink order.
There ya go.
Hmm? What do you want? I have to get back to work.
Goodbye. Careful out there.
Yes, yes. On your way, then.
Good riddance.
I don't really have time. I'm working right now. Do you understand that? You look a bit dim.
I suppose you can ask what you want, but I'm in this place all day and don't see much.
Eh, if you make it quick.
Go bother some gutter-girl, I don't have time for louts like you.
Oh, it ain't my place to talk about him. I see him at parades and stuff, but that ain't enough to know the man. Sorry.
Not much. She seems nice. She and Fenthick make a nice couple, though I'm sure they are too busy with the plague to get much personal time together.
Not me. I don't want to know. Might get my hopes up too soon and just get let down all the more if it fails.
I'm not sure what you mean by that. It's a decent enough city, I guess. Fairly old. Everything is a mess right now, of course, but plague will do that.
Do you have a speech impediment? Oh, nevermind.
Well, no, I suppose not. I ain't heard of him being out since the plague started. I imagine he's powerful busy.
Not really. Lost some good friends to it. I suppose Lady Aribeth and Lord Nasher are fighting it somehow, but people like me don't get told about that stuff.
Please make it quick. What do you want to know?
I don't need that kind of disappointment. It's not like I can do anything about it. Let the leaders lead. It ain't my job.
Really, I don't know much else. I just keep to myself. Is that enough of an answer for you? Are we done?
Could I ask you some questions?
Me want ask questions.
Goodbye.
You're sure you haven't heard anything?
What do you think of how the plague is being dealt with?
You sure you not hear nothing?
What you think about how plague thing is being fighted?
Who is Aarin Gend?
Why the animosity toward priests?
What do you mean by "strange creatures?"
Who this Aarin Gend?
Why you not like priest guys?
What you mean by "strange creatures?"
Have you heard anything interesting?
You hear abouts anything interesting or something?
Back to my first questions.
Back to first questions, okay?
Nevermind.
Maybe I should try and find this Aarin Gend.
Maybe me try to find this guy Aarin?
Here's your drink.
Thank you.
Barmaid, over here?
I'll be right with you.
Barmaid.
What would you like?
Another ale.
Right away.
Get meesh another drink! I'm thirshty!
I think you've had enough.
Eh? Not polite to interrupt someone's drinkin'. What can I do for you?
Bye then. Good on you.
All right then. Farewell.
Bah. Waste of my time.
I ain't got time for imbeciles. Ah, all right, what do you want to know?
I suppose. Don't know why you would want to know what I think, though.
I guess, but I don't feel much like talking.
Ah, like I care. Talk if you want. Maybe I'll answer.
Look, you seem like an all right person. Just leave me be. I don't know anything about any of this. I just wait to get the plague and die.
Bah! Can't trust anybody. I wish Aarin Gend were back in town. He gets things done with a quick slice to the throat, not priests and strange creatures.
Who is... ? You don't know Aarin Gend, spymaster? Some guard you are, if you really are one. Aarin Gend is the best officer Neverwinter has.
I don't hate all of them, but I'm damn tired of promises that ain't helping. Like those Helmite guys talking about blessings that just get you soggy.
Ah, I heard Aribeth and that lot were looking for some weird beasts that were supposed to be part of a cure.
Is there something else you wanted to know?
Like what? I ain't seen nothing but the inside of a bottle for days now. You should really go bug somebody that matters.
Whatever. What do you want to know?
What? You bother me just to blow me off? Take a walk, little <boy/girl>, you ain't making friends here.
I tell you, if he weren't off on some mission somewhere he'd be cutting a swath through this plague. Couldn't do worse than these fool clerics and creatures.
Don't waste your time. If you're at all important to Neverwinter you'll meet him eventually. Trust me, you won't find him if he doesn't want to be found.
Ain't seen nothing but empty words from anyone. The plague just keeps going.
Nothing's happened with that yet, so it's probably just as much of a lie as what the Helmites are spilling. I don't know nothing more.
Oh, I remember now. I heard about how to cure the plague and gain fabulous riches in the process. Yep, I heard how to solve everyone's problems.
Then I sat in this tavern and waited for some jerk to come ask me about it, so I could tell them and let them get all the glory.
Is that what you want, a solution for everything? Well, how about this: stop pestering losers in bars and go do something that matters!

Penhold Robes

This suit belonged to Melthius Penhold, a scholar who traveled the south in the last century. His unassuming manner led to a long and peaceful life, and a lineage of anonymity. These simple garments served his family well through the years, but did not propel them to any great height of renown. The last descendants of the Penhold line are two great great grandchildren: Marcus, now evidently deceased, and Bertrand, both of Neverwinter.

Plain Helm
The Head Gaoler's Journal

Day 2084 of my Duty Kurdan Fenkt ate another inmate today. Solitary confinement may be the only solution.
Day 2085 of my Duty Emernik fell asleep on the job again today. He has been reprimanded and demoted to storeroom duty on the main floor.
Day 2086 of my Duty Meeting with my cousin, Lady Tanglebrook, in the tunnels today. The poor woman has lost almost everyone to the Wailing Death and I fear there is little I can do to console her.
Lady Tanglebrook's Journal

...Everyone, everyone is dead. All I have left is my cousin Alaefin, the Head Gaoler. He has been so good to me in the past, even building a tunnel between his office and the estate so I could visit him without running the risk of actually walking the dangerous peninsula streets. How fortuitous that these same tunnels now protect me from exposure to the plague. I am going to meet with him later today, for I know a good game of chess shall cheer me up from this spiteful malaise into which I have fallen.
Hmm -- that was odd. I thought I heard something crashing around downstairs but when I went down there, there was nothing. Must have been the rats! Oh, how I hate living alone. I shall visit my cousin at once!
Prison Logbook

Entry 247: We guards are beginning to question Captain Alaefin's sanity. He has been out of sorts ever since he went to visit with his cousin, Lady Tanglebrook. The prisoners grow restless.
Entry 248: Someone has unlocked the prisoners and cursed Captain Alaefin is nowhere to be found! We have had prison breaks before but this is serious. I don't know if we'll be able to keep it under control...
Entry 249: Heh. This your pretty book, guards? Whoever reads this, we prisoners killed half your stupid guards and locked the rest away where they belong. Long live the Head Gaoler and may the Wailing get the rest of ya...
Prisoner's Journal

The Head Gaoler left my cell door open today... unlocked all of them on the block... Madman. Sure, I'm a criminal but I was a thief, that's all -- If I'm going to go free, I'm not going to do it alongside a bunch of cold-hearted killers like the lot of them. I've closed my door again, heard the lock click shut... I can hear them in the common room -- The Head Gaoler's rallying them to some cause, they're all shouting and cheering, it makes me sick. They're mad, all of them... I can hear them coming for me.
Journal of Marcus Penhold

This is the journal of Marcus Penhold, a young mage. The details of his life are uneventful, although the last entry is now likely more prophetic than the writer might have wished.
Excerpt: I have hidden with the rest in fear of the plague, but I have no such anxiety about some pitiful shambling zombies. My brother awaits at the shrine the Helmites maintain in the Beggar's Nest, but I will not be joining him. Finally there is something real to fight.
Devourer's Brain

This is part of the body of an Intellect Devourer, an aberration consisting almost entirely of brain matter. This beast was one of four different creatures brought from Waterdeep as components of a powerful spell to cure the Wailing Death plague. It should be delivered to Lady Aribeth with all haste.
Anonymous Letter

In place of a signature, this letter bears the mark of a stylized, reptilian eye. It strikes you as somehow familiar, as if you've seen it before, perhaps in a different context. You examine the text closer...
"Read this letter well. Commit its words to heart, for I am your Master and there are those who would seek to thwart us, the People of the Eye.
"Lady Aribeth has promoted some adventurers into the militia and sent them out to seek the creatures of the cure. They have already been successful once and they must not be so again. You must stalk them from every shadow, pursue them at every turn. Those creatures are to be set loose and hidden wherever they are out of reach.
"Do not fail me in this. Remember, I hold the power to grant you life in this place of death. Your lives are mine to deny.
"Long live the People of the Eye..."
This note should be shown to someone in authority.
Torin's Ring
This is a simple signet ring, bearing a small family crest. The inscription in the band marks it as a gift between brothers, from Jemanie to Torin. It is otherwise unremarkable.
Lock of Dryad Hair

This is a lock of dryad hair, an important component for the spell to stop the Wailing Death plague. The dryad this came from was one of four magical creatures brought from Waterdeep to participate in the cure attempt. All were lost in an attack, and Lady Aribeth eagerly awaits their return.
Clothing: Noble (Orange)
Clothing: Child (Orange)
Simple Key
Auction Announcement

This document details an auction to be held at the Seedy Tavern in the Docks district. It does not reveal exactly what will be for sale, but it does seem to suggest that anyone interested in surviving the plague should attend. It also mentions that anyone bringing this to the attention of the city guard will be dealt with in "a manner that suggests finality." The seal at the bottom is apparently that of the Bloodsailors, a group of pirates.
There is a map on the back that shows the whole of the Docks District. The Seedy Tavern is one of the larger buildings along the northern edge. (your automap has been updated...)
Dara'nei's Locket
Opening this locket reveals an inscription from Vengaul Bloodsail to Dara'nei. "If separated we be, this locket shall unfurl the Silver Sails and float you to safety in my arms."
Masterson Family Amulet

The Masterson family rose to moderate nobility through persistent mercantile efforts, rather than royal bloodlines or great achievements. Nevertheless, William Masterson did dabble in the occasional dungeon excursion, and a number of his more interesting finds became heirlooms passed to his three generations of offspring. This amulet is one of several marked with his crest, though he never revealed where he acquired them, and made little use of them once retired in Neverwinter.
This amulet bears a small ornate crest typical of the merchant nobilty. The family name of "Masterson" is present on the back face of it.
Instructions from Callik

This note is from Callik, the traitorous lieutenant of Vengaul Bloodsail. It appears to be instructions on how to access the sea caves through the city aqueducts.
Excerpt: When you have pulled what information you can from Vengaul's wench, join us in the Aqueducts. The entrance is in the very northwest of the Docks District, through an old maintenance building. I believe I know an alternate path to where the old fool keeps his secret stores. The Cockatrice should be there, as well as whatever else he has been keeping from us. Time to take our due! Use the hand signs below to pass the seal on the aqueduct gates. Keep this note with you! I doubt you could remember the signs without it!
Callik
(A complex series of hand motions is detailed below. You will definitely need this note present to reproduce them accurately enough to pass the gate.)
Smugglers' Coin

Smugglers' Coins are the currency of the Docks District black market. They are made with drops of blood-red glass, each pressed with the image of a ship and a cutlass. The exact value of these "coins" compared to gold is debatable, and seems to vary primarily on the prominence of the person using them. Despite this wild fluctuation, many thieves prefer them, knowing that a person buying with Smugglers' Coins is usually not concerned about where the merchandise is coming from.
Shining Knight Ward
This ward stone allows the bearer to enter the back room of the Shining Knight Arms and Armor blacksmithy.
Clothing: Common (Rust)
This key allows access to the storeroom on the first floor of the prison in the Peninsula District.
Prison Storeroom Key
Tanglebrook Estate Key
Prison Key
A key for the estate of Lady Tanglebrook along the northern shore in the Peninsula District.
Tanglebrook Key
This copied key will open any door on the prison's second floor. It's flimsy, however, and quickly crafted. You doubt you will be able to use it more than once.
Prison Key (2nd Floor)
Judging by the insignia etched into the cold metal, this is a key to the main doors of the Peninsula district prison.

This is Meldanen's personal key, and it probably fits every lock in his estate. It also has a small magical rune on it, matching a similar one just visible on the lock of the cage that houses the Dryad.
Meldanen's Master Key
Meldanen's Silver Tooth
This is Meldanen's silver tooth, unceremoniously ripped from his jaw. It is a gruesome trophy.
This key grants access to the Meldanen Estate in the Blacklake district.
Key to Meldanen Estate
Journal of Meldanen

This book is full of tightly-scripted dates and notes, a journal kept by the wizard Meldanen. Most entries are short and to the point, regarding his various magical experiments and some of the creatures he has paid to have smuggled into the city for his examination.
Most recently, however, his entries become much more interesting:
Excerpt: The gods have smiled on my destiny. I had heard a little about the creatures being brought to the city from Waterdeep, but thought little of my chances of even laying eyes upon them. Lo and behold, however, I discovered a dryad from that very shipment wandering the streets of the district, lost and frightened after the battle in the Academy. It was glad enough to accompany me and I have caged it for the moment until I decide what to do with it.
Excerpt (the following day): I have decided to experiment upon this dryad and find a cure for this plague on my own. Think of all the gold the panicked nobles of this city would offer for a cure! It is too bad that the dryad must be sacrificed, however... she is comely, if inhuman.
Excerpt (Several Days Later): I cannot get the dryad out of my mind. Thoughts of her are with me always. Today I attempted to draw blood from her to fuel my experiment and found I could not hurt her even that much. Has she enchanted me? Or am I simply lonely for such beauty? I cannot think clearly. Still she recoils from my touch... I must win her love, I must! I will not release her from the cage until she feels as I do!
This key allows entry to the west wing of the Meldanen estate.
Meldanen West Wing Key
This key grants access to the cells of Meldanen's prison in his estate.
Meldanen Prison Key
Clothing: Wizard

One of many staffs created by the mage Meldanen. Over his career he supplied gold to a small industry of adventurers that would bring him exotic materials for his workshop. In his later years he was not so charitable, and occasionally set two or more groups against each other to secure the most reasonable prices for himself. Recently he stopped the practice altogether, preferring that as few people knew of his experiments as possible.
This staff was the weapon of the sorceror Meldanen, and is likely imbued with magic.
Staff of Meldanen
Armor: Halfplate (Multicolor)
Clothing: Pants only
Clothing: Bloodsailor (Vengual)
Clothing: Bloodsailor (Fancy)
Cockatrice Feather

This cockatrice feather is a spell component for the magical attempt to stop the Wailing Death plague. The bird-like beast it came from was one of four magical creatures sent from Waterdeep to be part of the cure attempt. They were all lost in an attack as they were brought into the city. This feather should be delivered to Lady Aribeth with all haste.
Silverware
Clothing: Common (Brown)
Clothing: Child (Red)
Clothing: Child (Blue)
Gulnan's Journal

Excerpt: The sheep of Cyric fell swiftly. Fools. And to think their pathetic leader Jared was going to smash the altar to keep its power from me. Perhaps I should just kill him. It would quell the last of his followers, although they already seek to appease me. My own sect of snake-worshippers, how amusing! Soon I won't need to cower in the Warrens with their precious Necromantic Focus.
It is an interesting device, I will grant Jared that. I have used it to create an army of undead, and I learn more about it each time I link with its power. Its pillar-like appearance disguises how fragile it truly is, and despite its power I must constantly watch that my undead servants don't inadvertently damage it with their clumsy flailing.
In Service of Cyric

Excerpt: Cyric, why have you allowed me to be so weak? That conniving Yuan-Ti wench has taken our beloved focus, the altar that I constructed to show your glory, the glory of the Dark Sun! Now she kills what few loyalists I have left, and raises them as undead with its power! Great Prince of Lies, I must smash the focus before her army grows too great with its misuse! How dare she drag it to the depths of the Warrens! She wastes its potential on plague dead! Her scales will be plucked one by one! I will rend...
It appears that whatever writing implement Jared was using broke at this point.
Drawl's Journal

Drawl apparently had big expectations of what serving Gulnan would get him, but if this Gulnan truly wanted her servant to be anything more than a pawn, she probably would have placed more emphasis on grammatical aptitude when making her selection.
Excerpt: My minions shall address me as: High Eminence of Evil Overlorder Invulneron The Black Dark - this one's good!
The journal of The Black Dark, Master of the Necromantic link to Gulnan! Nobody can pass while the link strengthens me! I am invulnerable, and recording my thoughts for posterior-ity just like a real overlord! I am so tough! Nothing can stop me now! I sacrificed the whole gang for Gulnan to grant me power... but I'm dead too, sort of. Does that mean they could still come back? And, wait, am I writing this for me to read? I already know all this stuff. Journals are stupid. And necromantic doesn't mean I have to kiss her, does it?
In Service of Gulnan

This journal tells of the changes that this cult went through once a creature named Gulnan was captured. It deals mostly with how the Cyric loyalists were ousted, allowing for the writer to move swiftly up the ranks.
Excerpt: Things are very different now, though they might not appear as such from the outside. We still follow blindly, and a number of us are still slain for no reason, but I finally believe a potent entity is acting through our master. Gulnan seems surprised at her own power, but her desire for conquest has erased any questions from her mind. I welcome her intensity, and her strong use of the focus. Jared was more interested in lining his pockets than causing true havoc, and he would never have dared use his precious fragile altar to focus necromantic energy and create an army of undead as Gulnan has. She is well worth following, this Yuan-Ti, even into the depths of the Warrens below.

This small blade has the name "Zelieph" inscribed near the hilt. It is otherwise unremarkable, likely more a utility knife than a prized weapon. A simple everyday tool, although it was probably an important part of this Zelieph's life.
Zelieph's Dagger
Zelieph's Ring

This simple ring is inscribed with the name "Zelieph," alongside the initials "SCB." It is an unassuming accessory, meant to be worn everyday without calling too much attention to it. Even so, it was likely an important part of this Zelieph's life.
Cockatrice Bite
Cockatrice Hide
Estate Ward Stone
This wardstone allows the bearer to bypass whatever magic protections have been placed on the entrance of an estate in the northwest of the Beggar's Nest.
Armor: Splint (Yuan-Ti)
Clothing: Cyric

This key was found among the servants of Gulnan, a creature that appears to be behind the undead infestation in the Beggar's Nest district. It looks like it fits a large lock, probably on one of the ancient doors in the Warrens of the Damned beneath the Great Graveyard.
Ancient Key
Crumpled Note

This note is disjointed and sloppy, as though the author wrote it after suddenly waking from a deep sleep.
Excerpt: I have gained much since the Academy was attacked. I did not see who freed me, and I don't care. Strength has come to me strangely... quickly. There is definitely some greater power at work in Neverwinter, and it favors me this day. I have seen it in the dreams... I see the eye... I don't know what it means, but I know this: if the Neverwintans want me for their cure they can carve the contribution from my corpse! So sayeth Gulnan!
Yuan-Ti Heart

This is the heart of Gulnan, a humanoid snake-like Yuan-Ti. Gulnan was one of the Waterdhavian creatures brought to Neverwinter to be part of the magical attempt to end the Wailing Death. She used the confusion of an unexpected attack to escape and cause untold horror in the Beggar's Nest. Aribeth awaits the delivery of this foul remnant, in the hopes that it may yet help provide a cure.

This ring is little more than a simple metal band, with a short inscription on the surface identifing the owner as "Torin." There is also a message around the interior, naming the person that apparently gave the ring as a gift. "Your brother, Jemanie."
Armor: Splint (Dull)
Clothing: Noble (Blue)
Clothing: Helmite (Torn)
Armor: Chain (Ruined)
Armor: Leather (Grey)
Clothing: Courtesan (Green)
Rare Earth Clay

A careful mixture of earth makes this small bit of clay ideal for use as a reagent in magical study. There may once have been a rather long description of this item pressed or carved into its surface, but it appears to have been deliberately smudged.
Cloaktower Badge 1
Cloaktower Badge 2
Flask of Water

Written on a piece of tape that is stretched across the flask: "For while the water should have generally been proud, having existed far longer than many of those within this world, it could not exist without a solid foundation to settle in upon - and for that, it remained humble."
Puff of Fog

This small container appears to hold a swirling puff of fog. The following message delicately inscribed on the surface: "When air became, in its youth, jealous of its place in the world, it sought out ways to assert its power. It floated high in the night air, and obscured the view of the stars from those that lay beneath it. But soon it filled with water that became too heavy, and it came crashing down to rejoin with those who came before - an embrace that left it no longer uncertain of its place within the world."
Kindling Wood

Carved upon this bit of kindling wood is the following phrase: "And the fire was angry that it could not overcome the rain above. The air taunted the fire, knowing that fire needed the air to live. Such is the way of those who have come late in life."
Gauntlet Award: First Round

Badges like this are given to would-be gladiators participating in the Gauntlet fighting club beneath Neverwinter's Board Laid Bare tavern. This particular award signifies that the bearer has defeated the lowest ranked fighter in the competition. Higher ranked battles can occur, but only if this badge is presented when the challenge is made.
Gauntlet Award: Second Round

Badges like this are given to would-be gladiators participating in the Gauntlet fighting club beneath Neverwinter's Board Laid Bare tavern. This particular award signifies that the bearer has won their second battle in the competition, and may now challenge fighters of still higher rank. The badge must be presented before a challenge can be recognized.
Gauntlet Award: Third Round

Badges like this are given to would-be gladiators participating in the Gauntlet fighting club beneath Neverwinter's Board Laid Bare tavern. This particular award signifies that the bearer has defeated all comers, and is now eligible to challenge for ownership of the club. The badge must be presented before a challenge can be recognized.
Gauntlet Championship Award

There is only one badge of this type. It signifies that the bearer is the Grand Champion of the Gauntlet fighting club beneath Neverwinter's Board Laid Bare tavern. The owner of this item has defeated all comers, including the group's founder, and has taken the Board Laid Bare tavern as their prize.
This key opens the door to the back room of Neverwinter's Board Laid Bare tavern, thereby granting access to the Gauntlet combatant's club below.
Gauntlet Key
Gauntlet Pass

This chit will allow the bearer passage into the secretive Gauntlet combatant's club beneath Neverwinter's Board Laid Bare tavern. It must be presented to the bartender and will be exchanged for a key.
Halueth's Rusted Armor

This armor once belonged to Lord Halueth Never, but it has barely survived the ages. It was exposed to a damaging amount of moisture over time, although you can still see the quality it must have once had. There is light etching throughout, including a faint image of the symbol of Tyr. It remains an important artifact for Neverwinter, even if it should never see combat again.
Halueth Dig Logbook

This book details the initial search for the tomb of Halueth Never. It is unfinished, the writer obviously falling to the plague before he could include many details, but it does point to the possible locations for three tombs in addition to the one in the Peninsula District.
Beggar's Nest: Great Graveyard Docks District: Northwestern quarter aqueducts Blacklake District: Southwestern quarter
The directions are vague, but the book does mention that each tomb is likely sealed with a magically protected door. A riddle of some sort is the "key" to each. The solution to the Peninsula tomb door was "Emerald," which was answered by actually placing an emerald in the container immediately next to the door. It is worth noting that this action seemed to destroy the item, making it an expensive discovery.
Text of the "Emerald riddle" on the Peninsula tomb: Diamond of the forest, if the seasons never changed.
Ancient Chronicles of Halueth Never

This aged tome details the latter life of Halueth Never, and the trials that he overcame to found the city of Neverwinter. Much of it is written in an archaic script that will likely take Tyrran scholars years to decipher.
Clothing: Talonite
Jones' Key
Archeologist's Key
Letter from Oleff

This letter bears the seal of Reverend Judge Oleff Uskar, and indicates that the bearer is in his service. This letter is to be presented to Briley, a young cleric guarding a tomb in the Peninsula District.
Jacob's Quill
This object bears an inscription in delicate writing. "Jacob in service of Tyr. Truth be revealed in your words."
Ancient Symbol of Tyr

The meticulous carving that went in to this item is evident even through the dust of ages on its surface. This would be a very valuable artifact to the Temple of Tyr, even without the provenance of having possibly belonged to Lord Halueth Never.
Tamora's Brooch

This brooch is not the best of quality, but the inscription on the back likely means it has tremendous sentimental value to someone.
"Yours always. I will return - this I swear. Keep a good thought for me."
The message is dated 1360DR, so it is more than a decade old.
Clothing: Courtesan (Teal)
Clothing: Courtesan (Red)
Clothing: Courtesan (Purple)
Clothing: Courtesan (Purple)
Clothing: Noble
This key grants access to the fabulous Rumbottom Estate in the Blacklake district.
Key to the Rumbottom Estate
This key grants access to the Hodge Estate.
Key to Hodge's Estate
This key enables the bearer to enter the backroom of the Moonstone Mask.
Moonstone Mask Back Room Key
This looks to be a skeleton key, and is likely good for almost every lock in the Androd Estate.
Androd Golden Key
Letter from Ophala
This letter is from Ophala Cheldarstorn of the Moonstone Mask. It directs Oleff of the Temple of Tyr to examine the bearer and certify that they are plague-free.
Writ from Oleff
This writ certifies that the bearer is plague-free. It is signed by Reverend Judge Oleff Uskar, and directed to the attention of Ophala Cheldarstorn of the Moonstone Mask.
Order of Closure

This paper bears the signature of Reverend Judge Oleff Uskar, and orders the closure of the Moonstone Mask for health reasons in this time of plague. This action is to be carried out upon delivery of the note to Ophala Cheldarstorn.
Note From Hodge

This note from Hodge is intended for Ophala Cheldarstorn, and consists of an almost steady stream of profanities and curses. Apparently they have been exchanging such sentiments for a great deal of time, and he is none too pleased with having had to flee his refuge yet again. Standard fare for vanquished foes.
Pass Coin
This coin is the recognized currency of the Moonstone Mask, and entitles the bearer to approach one of the men or women working in the back room.
Portrait of Sir Reginald Rumbottom III

This portrait is a rather unremarkable likeness of Sir Reginald Rumbottom III. The only things that stand out about it are the strange markings on the back of the canvas. They are largely illegible, but the name "Ophala Cheldarstorn" does appear to be among them.
Gaudy Statuette

The workmanship responsible for this item is questionable, at best. A small plaque declares it to be a partially nude representation of Ophala Cheldarstorn of the Moonstone Mask, but you cannot see how it could be an accurate likeness.
Gilded Urn

This urn makes a rather cheap attempt at appearing stately, and may have once held the ashes of a respected but poor merchant or minor noble. More recently it has held delicious-smelling after-dinner mints. It bears a dent that could have come from gripping it at the lip and delivering a swinging blow to the back of someone's skull, likely leaving his or her head in much the same condition as the urn. Strangely, "Best wishes, Ophala Cheldarstorn" has been scratched into the base of it.
This wand is infused with elemental fire, allowing the user to cast a single Burning Hands spell. It will only function in the testing chamber of the Many-Starred Cloak guild tower.
Elemental Wand of Fire
Many-Starred Cloak

These masterfully crafted cloaks, stitched on both sides with glittering stars, are the guild emblem of the sorcerers and wizards of Neverwinter's fabled Cloaktower. Loyal to Lord Nasher, the Cloakwizards are vital to the city's defense and carry themselves with the appropriately cautious air that such a duty entails.

This wand is infused with energy from the elemental plane of earth, allowing the user to cast a single Stoneskin spell. It will only function in the testing chamber of the Many-Starred Cloak guild tower.
Elemental Wand of Earth
Scented Fetish

Nyatar created this item to aid in rescuing the animals in the Blacklake zoo. It grants the bearer very specific use of certain ranger and druid abilities, allowing communication with the captive animals.

This wand is infused with energy partially from the elemental plane of water, allowing the user to cast a single Slow spell. It will only function in the testing chamber of the Many-Starred Cloak guild tower.
Elemental Wand of Water

This wand is infused with energy partially from the elemental plane of air, allowing the user to cast a single Color Spray spell. It will only function in the testing chamber of the Many-Starred Cloak guild tower.
Elemental Wand of Air
This key apparently opens a number of locks within the zoo operated by Montgomery "Sureshot" Weatherson. Nyatar's animal companion stole the original, and Nyatar made copies.
Zoo Key Copy
This key belongs to Eltoora of the Many-Starred Cloak. It allows entry to the various workshops the mage guild has established around the city.
Eltoora's Key
Transport Via Plants Scroll

This magic scroll is to be used near the large tree outside the zoo in the Blacklake district. It will transform that single large tree into a portal through which the animals of the zoo can escape. After they are through, the druid Nyatar will see to their well-being.
Clothing: Thug
Map of the Peninsula

This map of the Peninsula district is well annotated and easy to memorize. The mapmakers' art has gone largely unrecognized in Neverwinter. Lord Nasher has forbidden the mass production of such documents, for fear they might aid enemy spies.
Map of Blacklake

This map of the Blacklake district is well annotated and easy to memorize. The mapmakers' art has gone largely unrecognized in Neverwinter. Lord Nasher has forbidden the mass production of such documents, for fear they might aid enemy spies.
Map of the Docks

This map of the Docks district is well annotated and easy to memorize. The mapmakers' art has gone largely unrecognized in Neverwinter. Lord Nasher has forbidden the mass production of such documents, for fear they might aid enemy spies.
Map of the Beggar's Nest

This map of the Beggar's Nest district is well annotated and easy to memorize. The mapmakers' art has gone largely unrecognized in Neverwinter. Lord Nasher has forbidden the mass production of such documents, for fear they might aid enemy spies.
Armor: Plate (Neverwinter Nine)
Clothing: Neverwinter Militia

This is the somewhat garish uniform of the Bloodsailors pirate guild. By wearing this, a person might be able to fool a casual observer into thinking they are a Bloodsailor. Other actual members would probably see through the deception, however, as such groups are usually very adept at recognizing their own people.

Talismans such as this border on the power of artifacts. Drawing from the soul of the wearer, these magical devices focus and hone intentions to an extreme level. The good become more charismatic and wise, while the evil become more cunning and manipulative. Examples of these items are varied in form, suggesting multiple creators at different points in history.

This ring and several of its type were originally crafted to protect the sons of King Castter De'wess, though the creator is unknown. History records that the rings remained within that family for at least 13 generations, though they were all apparently lost within the space of one. Enmity between the King and the family of the creator may be to blame.
Ring of Protection
Armor: Plate (Dark)
Clothing: Spellcaster (Blue)
Ring
Villain's Object

This weapon was fashioned to the tastes of Melthius Penhold, a scholar who traveled the south in the last century. His unassuming manner led to a long and peaceful life, a similarly uneventful death, and a lineage of anonymity. His staff is of modest ability, and that quality mirrors his honest family history. The last descendants of the Penhold line are two great great grandchildren: Marcus, now evidently deceased, and Bertrand, both of Neverwinter.

Weary is the traveler who must walk the winding road. Blessed by priests of Shaundakul the Windrider, these boots are crafted to make the road rise up to meet you and to keep the wind forever at your back. Numerous versions exist, their power varying largely in accordance with the priest who blessed them.

These items at first appear to be simple wrist or arm guards, but they surround the wearer with an invisible field of force, and grant protection as though actual armor. They are likely from the armory of some disbanded militia.

Gauntlets of this type were likely developed in Kara-Tur to aid masters of the martial arts. Legends speak of such masters from the Far East bringing these items with them on their journeys, though details remain sketchy.

Ice-cold to the touch, these bolts have a short message imprinted on the shaft:
Warning: A Touch of Frost.
Any target hit by a bolt of this type suffers a chance of being stunned, though how likely and for how long a duration is determined by the power of the bolt's creator.
This potion will greatly increase strength when consumed, its transmutation magic enhanced by scrapings from a bull’s horns.
This potion sparkles with transmutation magic, greatly increasing dexterity when consumed.
A potion of endurance combines various magical components to increase stamina and overal health, though it will not heal damage.

This ring and several of its type were originally crafted to protect the sons of King Castter De'wess, though the creator is unknown. History records that the rings remained within that family for at least 13 generations, though they were all apparently lost within the space of one. Enmity between the King and the family of the creator may be to blame.

...Everyone, everyone is dead. All I have left is my cousin Alaefin, the Head Gaoler. He has been so good to me, even building a tunnel between his office and the estate, so I can visit him without running the risk of infection on the streets. I am going to meet with him later today, for I know he can cheer me up from this spiteful malaise into which I have fallen.
Hmm -- that was odd. I thought I heard something crashing around downstairs but when I went down there, there was nothing. Must have been the rats! Oh, how I hate living alone. I shall visit my cousin at once!

Forced into retirement by deteriorating skills, Telenn was a powerful warrior who spent his time studying wizardry and training local youths in combat. Combining his skills, Telenn created amulets that allowed his students to train using real weapons without risk of injury. This worked so well that Telenn gave up the quiet life, and resumed his adventuring life, necklaces in tow.
Fenthick's Suit

This Cockatrice feather is a spell component for the magical attempt to stop the Wailing Death plague. The bird-like beast it came from was one of four magical creatures sent from Waterdeep to be part of the cure. They were all lost in an attack as they entered the city. This feather should be delivered to Lady Aribeth with all haste.

This note is from Callik, the traitorous lieutenant of Vengaul Bloodsail. It appears to be instructions on how to access the sea caves through the city aqueducts.
Excerpt: When you have pulled what information you can from Vengaul's wench, join us in the sea caves. The entrance is in the very northwest of the Docks District, through the city aqueducts. I believe I know an alternate path to where the old fool keeps his secret stores. The cockatrice should be there, as well as whatever else he has been keeping from us. Time to take our due! Use the hand signs below to pass the seal on the aqueduct gates. Keep this note with you! I doubt you could remember the signs without it!
Callik
(A complex series of hand motions is detailed below. You will definitely need this note present to reproduce them accurately enough to pass the gate.)
Smugglers' Coin

This note is disjointed and sloppy, as though the author wrote it after suddenly waking from a deep sleep.
Excerpt: I have gained much since I made my escape from those blasted pens at the Academy. Strength has come to me strangely... quickly. There is definitely some greater power at work in Neverwinter, and it favors me this day. I have seen it in the dreams... I see the eye... I don't know what it means, but I know this: if the Neverwintans want me for their cure they can carve the contribution from my corpse! So sayeth Gulnan!

This book details the initial search for the tomb of Halueth Never. It is unfinished, the writer obviously falling to the plague before he could include many details, but it does point to the possible locations for three tombs in addition to the one in the Peninsula District:
Beggar's Nest: Eastern quarter Docks District: Northeastern quarter Blacklake District: Southwestern quarter
The directions are vague, but the book also mentions that each tomb may be sealed with a magically protected door. A riddle of some sort is the "key" to each. The solution to the Peninsula tomb door was "Emerald," which was answered by actually placing an emerald in the container immediately next to the opening. It is worth noting that this action seemingly destroyed the emerald.
Text of the 'Emerald riddle' on the Peninsula tomb: "Diamond of the forest, if the seasons never changed."
Halueth's Tomb: An Archeological Logbook
Inscribed on the chest are the words "Diamond of the forest, if the seasons never changed."

The meticulous carving of this item is evident even through the age-old dust upon its surface. This would be a very valuable artifact to the Temple of Tyr, even had it not once belonged to Lord Halueth Never.

This bookshelf at first appears unremarkable, but close inspection reveals that it does not sit flush against the wall. Additionally, a small breeze seems to come from beneath it. You get the sense that there may be something of interest behind.
Inscribed on the chest are the words "A splinter delivered in flight."
This greataxe has an enhancement bonus to attack and damage, but does not bear the mark of a specific craftsman.

This armor once belonged to Lord Halueth Never, but it has barely survived the ages. It was exposed to a damaging amount of moisture over time, although you can still see the quality it must have once had. There is light etching throughout, including a faint image of the symbol of Tyr. It remains an important artifact for Neverwinter, even if it will never see combat again.

Cloaks of this sort are crafted from a simple but protective weave. The original design may have found its origins within the earliest of arcane guilds, but the current makers of such items are varied and widespread.

The design of the average Wand of Frost owes much to the once mighty legions under Auril the Frostmaiden and, to a lesser extent, some of the more obscure elemental lords. Few producing them today are among those faithful however, and most contemporary versions are the product of arcane rather than divine spellcasters.

It is a popular bit of lore that the first wizard to encapsulate magical projectiles within an object like this was apparently drawn and quartered, accused of releasing the staples of arcane power to the masses. Most mages and sorcerers scoff at this, citing that if every crafter of wands were killed today, magic would indeed be a very exclusive club.
Thurin
Door
Door Lever
North Wing Lever
South Wing Lever

Entry 249: Heh. This your pretty book, guards? Whoever reads this, we prisoners killed half your stupid guards and locked the rest away where they belong. Long live the Head Gaoler and may the Wailing get the rest of ya...
