People will think he did. He supported Desther.
Fenthick has followed Desther? Let's hope he went to stop him.
What will happen to Fenthick?
What are you going to do?
I'll go as quick as I can. Maybe I can catch up.
Where does this portal go?
People maybe think he did. He always supported Desther.
Fenthick followed Desther? Maybe he go to stop him?
What gonna happen to Fenthick?
What you gonna do?
Where this magic door portal thingy go?
Me go fast and maybe catch Desther!
Goodbye.
What is involved in the ritual?
Will things be getting back to normal now?
I have questions about your fellows.
What the spell like? What will happen?
Maybe stuff get normal when this spell get done?
Me gots questions about other peoples here.
<StartCheck>[Insight]</Start> I imagine he's more used to a stand-up fight.
Is there anything I should do? What happens now?
Me do anything now? What's next?
I'm glad this mess is over with. When will I be rewarded?
Me glad this mess is done. When me get reward?
How is Lord Nasher faring?
Lord Nasher okay? How he doing?
Me gots questions about the spell thingy.
I have questions about the ritual.
What form will the cure take?
What the cure gonna look like? Shiny?
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> What concerns you, Aribeth? Tell me.
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> Why you worry? It okay to tell me.
I am a fellow elf. Tell me what your worry is.
Me elf like you. Me maybe understand why you worry?
Let's go back to my other questions.
We maybe go back to other questions?
Has your opinion of Desther changed any?
You like Desther any better now?
Will your relationship with Fenthick improve now?
You maybe get along better with Fenthick now?
The gods are powerful. Why not rely on them?
Gods are big. It not smart to rely on them?
If Desther and his Helmites are fake, where are the real ones?
If Desther and Helmites is fake, where the real ones?
Fenthick says that he gave his ward key to Desther.
Fenthick give his castle key thing to Desther.
There is no time! You must find Desther! I can maintain the portal for now, but you must hurry! If you find them soon enough, maybe...
Maybe Fenthick's actions will be overlooked... maybe he will be forgiven before the city looks for... vengeance instead of justice...
Do not say such things! It cannot be! He was mistaken! He was fooled! He was... He was... damn him...
People won't let this pass. They have been denied a cure and they will want vengeance on the traitor and anyone that helped him... I... won't be able to protect him... I won't...
Perhaps... perhaps delivering Desther will mitigate things. Find him alive if you can. Find Fenthick and get him to... I don't know... I don't know what will help now.
The city guards are needed elsewhere, so this task falls to you. Go, before the portal falls!
What was he thinking? If he had a part in this... it hardly matters now... He looks like he fled with Desther. The people will not accept this action!
Hurry, get through the portal while I can still maintain it! Find the cure! Get Desther and... and Fenthick too. He may be under a spell or... I don't know.
Can you imagine? I must wish Fenthick harm rather than face the possibility that... that he might have known of this.
I... I don't know. People will think he's in league with the greatest threat we have ever known... I don't know...
He was mistaken... he was an advocate for a traitor. People will not understand his naivete... his trust. Could you blame them for finding a scapegoat?
I'll... I'll maintain the portal as long as I can, but it may be a while before we can send guards through. You'll have to go on your own.
I'll also try to make this sound better than it is... I can't hide Fenthick's blind trust of Desther... but if I explain it in context... Maybe...
I don't know... it's hard to tell. I can't see through Desther's magic. It probably leads to wherever he and his false Helmites originally came from.
I must say, I knew you would be instrumental in this cause. You've always presented the confident look of a <man/woman> of action.
Yes, farewell for now. There is much I must do to prepare for the casting to come. The incantations are very complex.
Well, several of our Tyrran priests have already begun preparations. Their meditation will allow the different components to be combined smoothly.
I'm certain they can speak for themselves, but I will answer any questions you have.
Yes, I would agree. He is... archetypal. We are almost certain the plague was an attack, but he has no idea what kind of villain would stoop so low.
It is a bit of a shocking revelation. I wish we still lived in a time when the possibility of someone doing this was uknown and unthinkable.
If you don't mind me saying, you have proven valuable beyond the average exterior you present. None of this would have been possible without your help.
I have to say, I was not impressed when I first met you, but you have done much to prove me wrong. Your help has been invaluable.
You needn't worry about anything. Your efforts got us this far, and now the ritual will take care of the rest. Following that, I will see to your reward.
Greetings, <FullName>. Preparations are well under way for the ritual. If all goes well, we will have the cure in just a few moments.
For now, you can leave what must be done to us. You've earned the right to bear witness, however, and I'm sure the others would say the same.
Such impatience does not suit you. You will see the fruits of your labors when the ritual is complete.
Well, I guess my original estimation was closer to the truth than I might have thought. You will be rewarded when the ritual is complete, mercenary.
Desther, Fenthick and I will all begin the main incantations as soon as we are prepared. If all goes well, we'll have the cure in mere moments.
None too soon for Lord Nasher; the plague has weakened him considerably. I think he almost considers it a personal insult to be seen this way.
You should speak with the others. No doubt they will each have their own feelings about how our situation has changed.
You have yet to speak with Desther or Fenthick. I'm sure they would like to congratulate you. No doubt they also have their own opinions about the cost of getting here.
You should speak with Desther and Lord Nasher. No doubt they will both have their own ideas about the cost of getting to where we are.
You should speak with Fenthick and Lord Nasher. I am certain they would want to congratulate you.
You have yet to speak with Fenthick. I'm sure he would like to congratulate you.
You haven't yet spoken with Desther. I'm sure he has opinions on your performance he would like to relate.
You have yet to speak with Lord Nasher. I'm sure he would like to extend his congratulations and thanks. You have earned the honor.
Yes, I think the time for talk has passed. You have spoken with everyone and we are ready. The ritual will commence now.
I will try to explain. Is there anything specific you wish to know?
Well, we have prepared a small container. The mixture itself will be fairly unspectacular to look at, despite the importance of it.
Oh sure, <FirstName>, the container we've provided is nice and shiny. Now, have you any more brilliant questions to ask?
Well, once we have the cure in hand we will determine the best way to get it to the most people as soon as possible.
It will take time, so we'll treat the most severe cases of plague first, regardless of station. I just hope... well... we'll worry about other things later.
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> We are very near our goal but... I can't help but worry about the effects of the plague. There is a great scar across Neverwinter.
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> It's not really appropriate to speak of these things right now. It's not important. We will deal with everything as it comes.
Now, is there anything else? You should speak with the others if you have not done so. They would congratulate you, too.
Already I see the distrust. The mood of the city has changed. When all is done, the people will want someone to blame, and I don't know if we will find anyone.
Will you be able to undestand, I wonder? A great scar has been carved across the heart of Neverwinter. Perhaps you also see it?
(ahem) I shouldn't ramble on like this when we are so close to a cure. This is a happy day, and we got here because of you.
As you will. What do you want me to say?
You should really ask him that. He despises being thought of as weak, and would much prefer to be involved in any talk of his health.
I would ask whether your opinion of him has suffered. It was your efforts that brought us this far. His claims of action seem based on your results.
While you searched, his Helmites blessed. While you fought, his Helmites blessed. The comfort he brought will pale next to the actual cure you have provided.
Of course, he is needed for the final ritual, so I cannot dismiss him entirely. Fenthick also serves as his advocate, so he must be deserving of some respect.
This time has been... difficult, and our difference of opinion made it more so. Fenthick and I have had little to speak of besides the plague.
I understand why he vests so much hope in Desther, but I could not. I know the power of faith, but you need to back it up with action.
I am a paladin of the Just God, Tyr. My sword is edged with belief, but it is MY arm that must still swing it.
I simply feared that if we waited for faith alone to save us, we would have more martyrs than survivors.
Hello again, <FullName>. I have a moment to talk, but as soon as you have finished speaking with everyone we can begin the ceremony.
I don't know. Perhaps Desther killed them. It seems impossible. He came from Helm's Hold... if that great hall has fallen... this is an even greater tragedy.
This is a huge undertaking... it seems like Desther has done all this to promote the plague... but why?! So many dead... now the Hold?
I am aware. Our guards here are very observant. There will be consequences, but not for now. There are more important things at hand.
We will watch Desther carefully, but he is needed for the incantations and I will not risk his temperamental nature and spoil our chance for a cure.
Fenthick takes foolish risks, but I will not allow any harm to come from this. The plague will not divide the living.
Desther claimed he came from Helm's Hold in the east, but I don't know how that could be true. They would have no part of a plot like this.
Wherever the portal leads, I am sure it will be dangerous. He must know we would send someone after him. Be careful.
Quickly, you must defeat the invaders!
I will attempt to hold the portal open. It's up to you to stop these madmen!
Goodbye.
What will you do after the plague is cured?
I have questions about your fellows.
What you do after plague cured?
Me gots questions about other peoples here.
Me gots questions about the spell thingy.
I have questions about the ritual.
Why did you have Fenthick give you his Castle Never key?
Why you get Fenthick to give you his Castle Never key thing?
<StartCheck>[Insight]</Start> Magical risk, or tempting the wrath of Aribeth?
Just happy to help. We all sought a cure in our own way.
Me glad to help. We all wanted the cure, right?
I'm a hero. That's what we do.
Me just a hero. Heroes do stuff like this.
I did more than you can claim. I got results.
Me do more than you. Me get results.
What do you intend to do?
What you gonna do?
You must admit that it seems odd.
It still seems odd. Kinda strange.
Back to my initial questions.
Back to first questions, okay?
Of course, now it is time for you to step aside. The ritual will not require you. You may watch as we create the plague cure, but do not interfere.
Yes, let me concentrate on the ritual to come. Goodbye, <FullName>. I'm sure you are proud of all you have done.
My interest in these people is shrinking as we near the end of the plague. You would do better to speak with them yourself.
Well, hello <FullName>. I imagine you are well pleased with yourself? This is your doing, after all.
You should speak with each of the others before we begin the ritual. They will likely want to congratulate you. Very important, I'm sure.
You have yet to talk with Aribeth or Fenthick. I'm sure they would like to congratulate you. If they are speaking. We'll begin the ritual when you are done.
You should speak with Aribeth and Lord Nasher. No doubt they'll agree on the importance of what you have done. We'll begin the ritual when you are through with them.
You should speak with Fenthick and Lord Nasher. I am certain they would want to congratulate you. We'll begin the ritual when you are through with them.
You have yet to speak with Fenthick. I'm sure he would appreciate it. Not getting much attention at home, I hear.
You should speak with Aribeth. I'm sure she would consider it a slight if you spoke with me and not her. We'll begin the ritual when you are done.
Oh, I believe you have yet to speak with Lord Nasher. You should do so before we commence the ritual. He is your Lord, after all.
Very well. I believe it is time for us to proceed. Let the ritual commence!
Then I suggest you study magic for a few more years. You are not a part of the spell, so I see no point in having you mimic the incantations.
With a cure in hand, my reason for being in Neverwinter will be gone. I will be returning to Helm's Hold for a time. Beyond that is my own affair.
I will speak if you wish, but you should really spend some time with each of the others before the ceremony. They will want to congratualte you, I'm sure.
That is my affair. I explained my need to Fenthick and he saw the wisdom in it. Getting the proper result from the ritual requires a certain amount of risk.
Perhaps, although it was definitely your thuggish actions that brought us to this point. You outstepped my Helmite brethren very effectively. Bravo.
I'm sure. You made my Helmite brethren look quite ineffective by comparison. The importance of what we were trying to do was called into question.
Oh, I don't question your results, but I hoped to have more of a say in the outcome. My Helmite brethren and I have a lot invested in this.
Well, that is certainly part of it. Aribeth dislikes me, and it makes her difficult to deal with. I'm not sure what Fenthick sees in her, really.
I doubt she can provide a real proven reason for her distrust. Fenthick is more understanding. He knows that faith is a powerful tool.
I am going to fulfill my promises and make sure the cure is successfully created. There is no other purpose to this ceremony.
Perhaps to you, but this whole ritual is beyond your understanding. You may rest assured that the cure will be successfully created.
We will invoke energy both arcane and divine, and when we are done there will be a cure for the plague. That is all you need to know.
As you will. Do try to hurry.
Goodbye.
What will happen during this ritual?
I have questions about your fellows.
What gonna happen in spell?
Me gots questions about other peoples here.
I was happy to be part of the team.
Me glad to work with everyone.
How is Lord Nasher faring?
Lord Nasher okay? How he doing?
Why you kinda stop saying something? What you not say?
Why did you hesitate to tell me something?
What form will the cure take?
What the cure gonna look like? Shiny?
Let's go back to my other questions.
We maybe go back to other questions?
Will your relationship with Aribeth improve now?
You maybe get along better with Aribeth now?
Desther will not create the cure alone. Others are involved.
Desther not make cure by himself. Others is helping.
I did the important part. Desther sat on his hands.
Me did important stuff. Desther just talk lots.
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> You can tell me. I've proven myself trustworthy.
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> It okay to tell me. Ain't me proven good to trust?
I am <race>, just as you are. I'll understand.
We both <race> kind. Me understand good.
Tell me or I'll rip your head off!
You tells or me smash you flat!
Have you done something to help him?
You done something to help him somehow?
Is there precedent for this? Will it work?
You understand it? It really work like that?
Doesn't that leave the castle unprotected?
That not make Castle Never weaker?
What would Aribeth think of this?
What Aribeth think of this, hmm? You not tell her?
<StartCheck>[Insight]</Start> Perhaps you see what you want to see.
You keep secrets from her. That isn't a clue?
Yous keep secrets from her. You being dumb.
You found the Waterdhavian creatures, allowing Desther and his Helmite brethren to concentrate on helping the spirits of the people. Now he can construct the cure and all will be well.
Yes, it is best that I concentrate on what is coming. I will have to be very careful not to disturb the incantations Desther utters during the ritual.
Oh, I would not presume to speak for them. If you wish to know what they think, I'm certain they would welcome your questions.
Yes, I knew you could be trusted, just as I knew Desther would prove critical. Even now he... well... let's just say he is helping, despite what others think.
Hello there! A grand day, isn't it? And you... you are to thank. It was your effort that allowed us to progress this far.
Can you believe it? In a few moments this great trial will be over. The plague will have a cure.
You should speak with the others. Each will have valuable insights into the ritual to come, I am sure.
You should speak with Desther and Aribeth. While their views of the coming ceremony are no doubt different, it would be wise to speak with both of them.
You should speak with Desther and Lord Nasher. While their views of the coming ceremony are no doubt different, it would be wise to speak with both of them.
You should speak with Aribeth and Lord Nasher. They would want to thank you for your service, I am sure.
You have not yet spoken to Aribeth. She would certainly like to offer congratulations before we begin the final incantations.
I see you have not yet spoken to Desther. His insight is always valuable. You should seek his confidence before we begin.
I see you have not yet spoken with Lord Nasher. You have played an important part, and should allow him to express his thanks.
Yes, it is time that I joined the incantations. We are moments from the cure, I am certain!
Oh, it was nothing, really. Something better left unsaid. It is a matter for Desther and I alone.
I don't really know. I would like to think it would be an inspiring beacon of magic and hope, glowing with divine energy and radiating healing warmth.
The Tyrran priests have already begun the incantations. Aribeth, Desther and I will join them when we are all ready.
We should have the cure soon after. I hope it will work on the advanced symptoms. There are so many people infected.
As you will. What do you want me to say?
He has kept his gallant posture throughout, though I worry for him. He will not show a need for help. He may be far weaker than he seems.
What? I'm not sure what you mean. Certainly we have been occupied by the events of the plague, but I wouldn't let our minor disagreements color my love of her.
You think she feels differently? I haven't seen any signs of it, and I certainly know her well enough. She's just concerned for the sick. You are mistaken.
Greetings again. I can spare a moment, but we should begin the ritual as soon as you speak with everyone else. With my help, Desther will... well... it isn't important.
Really, Fenthick, now is not the time for such talk. Others will not understand like you do.
Of course, of course. It is better that we look forward. In but a few moments we will have the cure!
I don't like your tone. You are just like the others. You don't realize the importance of what he has done.
Even now, that kind of attitude keeps his hands tied. I have had to... well... Suffice to say, it has been hard getting Desther the resources he needs.
But enough of this squabbling. In a few moments we will have the cure. This great trial is almost over.
I realize that, but he has done so much more. I really don't expect you to understand the weight of his involvement... the risks he takes.
Misunderstandings have plagued him from the start. I've even had to... well... Suffice to say that it has been hard getting him the resources he needs.
You would think so, but even Aribeth does not understand. I don't know how to put it into words. I have had to act on my own.
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> Yes, yes you have, and I will not push you aside. I have seen my companions do that too much already.
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> I don't know. I wish I could trust you, but this matter is perhaps best left between Desther and I.
You see, Desther has been pushed out of the plans for this ceremony. His efforts to help are ignored. My companions mean well, but they are too untrusting.
I think the strain of the plague has taken your patience, friend. I know you wouldn't try to hurt me, not in the heart of Castle Never.
We are so well protected that the guards would be here in seconds. It's almost oppressive. It prevents the best of us from doing what we must.
Again, I almost say too much. The business I have with Desther should stay between him and me.
It's a small thing, really. I mean, he needs to help for the cure to work. He shouldn't be held back by suspicions now. He's proven himself.
You see, for the cure to work, he needs to draw magical energy from the Temple of Helm. It's apparently very dangerous... it might kill him...
Aribeth and the others would never allow it, so I gave him my key for the wards protecting Castle Never. The magic of Helm will aid in our spell.
Of course not. I would never endanger the castle. Desther will simply channel a little Helmite energy to help the cure be as potent as possible.
Desther has assured me that it is all very sound reasoning. It is a simple thing that will ensure the cure is as potent as it can be.
There is no danger. The wards are still in place. No one can enter or leave without alerting those of us with keys.
Aribeth... I love her dearly, but her eyes have been closed by the horror of the plague. I must do this for the good of us all. You will see.
Of course, the size of the container we prepared seems inadequate for such a miracle. I may be a bit over excited.
I have done what I must for the good of us all, and I believe all of my actions will be vindicated in the end.
As I have said, some people just have trouble understanding matters of the spirit, even those that seem wise in every other aspect.
An empty statement. You are merely another doubter, trying to see the worst in everything. Well, I refuse to fall in step.
Aribeth knows my feelings, just as she knows Desther is genuine. This plague has cast everyone into the dark. I will try to help them to the light.
Farewell.
Should Desther be killed?
Maybe Desther should die?
I go for now.
Why you think he follow Desther?
Why would he follow Desther?
Goodbye.
Will things be getting back to normal now?
I have questions about your fellows.
Maybe stuff get normal when this spell get done?
Me gots questions about other peoples here.
Me gots questions about the spell thingy.
I have questions about the ritual.
Let's go back to my initial questions.
We maybe go back to first questions?
Fenthick says that he gave his ward key to Desther.
Fenthick give his castle key thing to Desther.
Desther appears to be a traitor. What are your thoughts?
Desther a traitor. What you think of that?
What do you think of what Fenthick has done?
What you think about what Fenthick do?
Who were the attackers that Desther allowed in?
Who them guys Desther brought to attack us?
Let's go back to my first questions.
Maybe go back to first questions, okay?
What's Fenthick really done? Nothing outright criminal yet.
Fenthick really that bad? He not do real criminal stuff yet.
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> Investigations in the Docks suggest you knew Vengaul Bloodsail?
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> Stuff in Docks district say maybe you know Vengaul Bloodsail?
<StartCheck>[Insight]</Start> New villains, but not the kind you are used to.
<StartCheck>[Insight]</Start> Does that extend to each other?
I grow tired of people standing in front of me when villains walk freely with our stolen cure! Find Desther! And Fenthick! I will have an explanation!
Treachery! We are betrayed, the cure is gone, and I am to believe Fenthick had a part in this as well?! I will have someone's head over this!
You, <FullName>, must bring Desther to justice. We must find him and demand his explanation! Fenthick's as well!
Go quickly while Aribeth can still maintain the portal. Neverwinter... *I* must have an explanation!
Desther is deserving of death, as are any accomplices, but I must know why this was done, why my Neverwinter was attacked.
And we still need a cure... The ritual was not interrupted, so Desther must have the untainted result. It must be retrieved.
Once I have the cure - once we ALL have the cure - then Desther will be judged, his plot and masters exposed, and punishment will be dealt.
I have seen Neverwinter crippled with plague. I have seen attempts to poison. Now I see attacks that cause panic and confusion... it is too much.
I've no trust left. If Fenthick aided in this attack, he will stand accused with Desther and meet swift justice. The people will demand it.
You are an elf as well, so this will be familiar to you. The human mind is jarring to your kind. You are longer lived; your changes are gradual and long-term.
Desther was a friend yesterday and an enemy today? A lifetime for such a change would be drastic to an elf. I suppose a day is unthinkable.
Fenthick and Aribeth are young elves. I cannot justify what Fenthick appears to have done, but perhaps he doesn't comprehend how quickly a man can change, or seem to.
It was explained to me that the human mind is jarring to an elf. They are much longer lived, and their changes are more gradual. They think long-term.
I don't know his reasons for following Desther, but I have learned a few things about elves in my dealings with them over the years.
His actions seem foolish. He will be judged harshly if his reasons do not satisfy. I would give him the benefit of the doubt, but I lack the patience I once had.
I can't imagine the motivation of this man. Obviously he wants us to suffer, but the reason why escapes me.
I don't know what to say about this. If Desther has been against us all along, his villainy has affected all of us... every plague victim...
We suspected the plague was artificial, that it was an attack of some sort, but I can't believe someone in our midst would actively prevent us from curing it...
Neverwinter is going though a difficult time. It is good to know that we can count on people of quality to assist us.
Farewell, <FullName>. Once again, I am grateful for your service to Neverwinter. There are very few who could have done what you did.
If you wish information about my trusted advisors, I suggest you ask them yourself. They have been instructed to be cooperative.
I am pleased that we could count on the average wayfarer to rise up and help Neverwinter in this difficult time.
It is surprising to see how you have risen to the defense of Neverwinter. I doubt I could have recognized the potential beneath your crude manner.
Well, you must be <FullName>. Aribeth has told me of your actions. I must say that I appreciate what you have done.
Oh, and don't forget to speak with the others. I'm sure they would like to tell you how you have helped.
You should speak with Desther and Fenthick before we begin. I'm sure they would like to congratulate you.
You should speak with Desther and Aribeth. I'm sure they appreciate what you have done.
You should speak with Fenthick and Aribeth. You have helped them immensely.
Fenthick awaits you. Speak with him, and then we will begin the final incantations.
You've yet to speak with Desther. He'll no doubt appreciate you being here. You made this possible.
Aribeth has yet to thank you. Speak with her, and then we will begin the final incantations.
Yes, it is best that we commence with the ritual. Ready yourself, <FullName>. The plague ends with this.
Thank you, <FullName>, but that will be handled by Aribeth, Fenthick, and Desther. The details of it need not concern you.
Things will not be normal until we have captured and punished the culprits behind the plague. I have never seen my Neverwinter injured so.
I will allow it, though I would request that you make it brief.
Greetings, <FullName>. I can spare a moment, but I don't have much to say. You should speak with everyone else so we can begin the ceremony.
I would ask you not to push into the affairs of my trusted advisers. Fenthick has my full confidence, and by his word, I trust Desther to act responsibly.
Do not concern yourself with it. Castle Never is well fortified, and nothing shall disrupt the ritual. The cure is all that matters now.
From first glance they appear to be some of the Helmite brethren that were dispensing blessings around the city. I suppose if Desther was false, then they were as well.
I will have my guards examine the Helmite temple, and try to understand what these people were hoping to accomplish. I charge you with finding Desther himself.
There is little time for questions now, but I will answer as best I can.
<FirstName>, Neverwinter is a fair city, but tragedy like this can change much. The citizens will demand justice. They will want the head of their enemy on a pike.
They will not be kind to apparent collaborators. Whatever his true motives, Fenthick spoke on behalf of Desther many times, so he is already tainted by association.
If his reasons do not absolutely satisfy, I do not foresee a happy end to this matter. Aribeth will know what is coming. I think we all do.
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> Vengaul? Yes, I had reports of his activity in the Docks. We used to clash during my adventuring youth but... things have changed.
I would have sought him out, but not while I am... weak. To face him now would taint the battles we've had before. I've new villainies to deal with.
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> I've had some association with the scoundrel, but this is not the time to discuss it. The plague is not his style. He would be disgusted by it.
No, they aren't. These cowards scuttle behind the scenes as we shrivel and die to a plague like some creeping old age...
(ahem) Well, Vengaul may want to bring back the old days, but I have responsibilities and... I will not indulge him.
You are referring to the disagreements between Aribeth, Fenthick and Desther? Yes, they have had different ideas about how to fight the plague. I demanded it.
I have no use for advisers and officers who merely parrot each other. I wanted every option covered, regardless of whether everyone was in agreement.
And now it's clear Aribeth was right to suggest that you help, and Fenthick was also wise to advocate for Desther as aggressively as he did. The cure will soon be ours.
This priest is in deep meditation preparing for the ritual. He ignores you.
This priest is still quite shaken up about the events that have just happened. He is unable to put his feelings into words.
It's working! Concentrate!
Soon... very soon.
It's done... it worked! We have the cure!
Now, my brethren! Attack!
Desther! What treachery is this?!
(laughs) You have no idea what opposes you. You should have just laid down and died!
No.... NO! Desther! Wait! Let me help! No!
Yes, Fenthick, *I* have the cure.
W-what do you mean?
I have no need of you. Die as you should!
I have questions I want answered.
Me not need yous. Die!
Me gots questions for you!
I want some information about these Old Ones.
Me want info 'bout Old Ones.
Where can I find Desther?
Where Desther?
Go on. Just get out of here, coward.
You just run away now, worm.
I've decided to kill you after all.
Me kill you after all.
I've beaten you once. You'd better talk.
You talk or me get mad! You no want me get mad!
Back to my initial questions now.
Okay, back to first questions.
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> There's no harm in telling me now. You are through here.
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> You done here. It no matter is you tell me now.
Either you start talking or I start removing your fingers!
You talk or me hack off you fingers!
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> You aren't holding anything back, are you?
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> You holding back on me, maybe?
You're holding out on me! Come clean or I'll burn your ears off!
You know more! You tell or maybe me burn you good!
Who do you serve?
You know anything about any guards or traps nearby?
Who you serve?
You know about guards or traps around here?
Get out of my sight, coward.
Get lost, scared little worm!
I want to ask about Helm's Hold.
Me ask about Helm's Hold.
Why did you come here?! Why kill everyone?!
Why you do that? Why you come here and kill?!
I have to get moving. I wonder what to do with you.
Me got to move on. What me do with you, hmm?
Why was Neverwinter supposed to fall to plague?
Why Neverwinter gotta fall to this plague?
Who promised you this? Where are they?
Who tell you this stuff? Where you hear it?
You will die here! My masters command it!
I... I bow to you. Please, spare me. My masters have failed to protect me as promised...
What?! But... you can't! I will die fighting!
What... what do you want to know?
Where... where are they? They said I would never fall... I surrender! I surrender!
I can't tell you what I don't know. I was told to report to Desther. He is our leader here. He serves the will of the Old Ones.
Thank you... I will not trouble you again. My masters... they haven't delivered what they promised.
I... I don't know. He's here somewhere. He is above me. I don't ask questions.
I swear I don't know! He's in the Hold somewhere!
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> I... I know, but there's nothing left that I can say except... well, I think Desther is trying to raise some more protection.
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> There's nothing left to tell that matters. I just want to leave. I was promised protection and I didn't get it.
Well, there might be a few things. **DETAILS**
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> Maybe there's this other thing. **DETAILS 2** That's all I know - honest!
Please! I'll tell you whatever you want! **DETAILS 2**
The Old Ones. They are the Scale and the Eye. All will serve them and be protected... or so Desther told me...
I told you I don't know anymore! I just want to go! I just want to go! Please! Don't hurt me!
What about it? There isn't much to tell now that we've killed everyone.
I was told they wanted a base to support people sent to Neverwinter. I wan't told why. I was just supposed to help infiltrate this place.
I followed orders. Desther went to Neverwinter and we made sure nobody could get word from any real Helmites here in the Hold.
I am no threat, I swear it. I won't hurt you, or anyone else.
He's doing some kind of ritual to gain power, since I think he's been abandoned just like me. He probably thinks the Old Ones will be impressed...
You'll have to stop whatever spell he's begun before you fight him. He won't fall easily.
I don't know much else about them. I was promised protection and wealth when the end came to Neverwinter. That was enough for me to follow.
I don't know. I was just told that the plague served the Old Ones, and that weakening Neverwinter would prepare it for the battle to come.
I thought some of it could be lies, but they paid me and promised me more, so I did what Desther said. I'm... I'm sorry. I'm a fool.
The cult of the Old Ones recruited me while I was traveling. I don't know where they came from or where their base is.
All I know is they wanted the plague in Neverwinter to last as long as possible. It wasn't my business to ask why. They don't like questions.
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> Come on, I'm just the hired help. Just let me go. I don't know anything really important. I don't.
That's all I know! I swear it! I swear!
Where has Desther gone?
Don't play games! You are in league with him!
Fenthick, what have you done?
Aribeth is waiting for you. Waiting for an explanation.
Why me not kill you right now?!
We'll let a court decide that. Or a mob.
What you do, Fenthick?
Bah! You in league with him!
Where Desther go?
A court decide that stuff. Or maybe a mob.
Why shouldn't I kill you right now?!
Do you know who he is working for?
You maybe know who Desther work for?
Where is he now?
Where he now?
Why didn't he want us to have the cure?
Why he not want us to get cure?
I must find Desther. What do you intend to do?
Me go find Desther. What you gonna do, hmm?
Aribeth waits for your reasons. She gots questions.
What are these Old Ones?
Desther spread the plague? How?
Desther spread plague? When he do that?
But what initially caused the plague? What started it?
Okay, but what first started the plague stuff?
Old Ones? What they?
Let's go back to my previous questions.
Back to other questions, okay?
I followed Desther to help him... so he could prove that he was worth trusting. I followed... to save my conscience...
Here I am... the fool. My stay here... with the dead... has taught me more in a few hours than... than I deserve.
He's a traitor. Desther. I helped him, and then followed hoping his deception was a mistake. I thought he would... He will return! Won't he?
No... yes... I don't know! He'll come back! To help the people! The people... I calmed their fears... when they doubted...
He'll be back! He couldn't lie! How could he lie?! All this time?! When people had their doubts... I calmed their fears...
The blessing is a gift, I said. THIS MAN CARES, I SAID! I killed them... I killed them all by believing in him...
Unless... unless I help him and he comes back... if he comes back then I was right... I helped them...
He deceived us... betrayed us... but if I help him and he returns to Neverwinter, I helped them...
No, I can't go. I... I can't. I can't face my love... my Aribeth...
Leave me... I'll wait for the guards... I swear it... but I can't see her... I can't.
I... I don't know. There's nothing I could do except... except try to help. If he recants, everything will be fine...
I... I don't know. I can't go back... not yet. You... you can find him. Find Desther. Make him recant. Make him say he didn't betray us.
Make him say I didn't let people die because of him...
I suppose it will come to that. I will wait for that judgment. I swear it. I will wait here. There's nothing else I can do...
Leave me... I'll wait for the guards... I swear it... There's nothing else I can do...
I don't know. He is no Helmite. The true brethren of Helm's Hold are dead... murdered... just to provide him with a false identity when he came to Neverwinter.
He says he is one of the "People of the Eye," a cult following the "Old Ones," but I can't tell anything else from his ranting. It's like he's a different person... he has to be.
Somewhere inside... trying to raise undead to fortify this place. He has few followers left, and no more are coming. He claims he is being cast aside.
He won't say... he is fanatical... raving... like he wants his blasphemies to wash out the Helmite words he let me believe...
The plague... he gloated that he was sent to Neverwinter to spread it! His masters wanted it to last as long as possible! They wanted us all to die...
He rants like a madman. Murderous. Heretical. I don't know this Desther. How could he have hidden this from me...
The... the blessings... THE BLESSINGS... tainted... foul. Each blessing that he and his false Helmites gave was tainted...
He could have poisoned the harbors... the whole water supply... but the blessings raised false hopes, so people would be even more desperate when they finally did get the plague.
Such cruelty... carefully designed to destroy our wills... and I trusted him. Made other people trust him... their deaths are on my hands too...
I don't know... Desther was only sent to Neverwinter after the plague started. Whoever his masters are, I don't think they were prepared at the time.
Whatever these Old Ones are, they have abandoned him. He screams that he deserves protection, but none is coming. Whatever his purpose was, it is over now.
Desther just says he was supposed to prolong it... to stop our cures. There's something about the way it kills people... something they wanted to last as long as possible.
All those people... and I let him do it. I made people trust him.
I will say whatever you want... I have hurt so many. I made everyone trust him... I believed in him. I let this happen...
Who commanded Desther to do all of this?
I am grateful. Will you help me find him?
Who are you? How do you know these things?
Why does Desther surround himself with undead?
How can I get inside the Hold?
How maybe me get inside Hold?
Why Desther making all kinda undead?
Who tell Desther to do this stuff?
How you know this? Who are you?
Thank you. Maybe you help find him?
Lash out if you will. Neverwinter will learn to accept its fate, even as Desther is allowed to be taken.
Yes, you come seeking the traitor, the bringer of disease... You are a fierce beacon of life amidst his undead.
The walking corpses are a new addition, though the... good... people of the Hold have been silent for some time.
The "False Helmites," they forced the good away, but now even they are not enough for Desther, and he creates a hasty army of dead.
I am not here for your questions. I give this insight of my own accord. If that is inadequate, walk away.
Desther fortifies here because his role is nearly played out. He is abandoned. He has no bridges left to burn.
The dead are plentiful, so he surrounds himself with corpses. It won't be enough. His death is ordained and his life is forfeit.
I am not here to aid, I am not here at all. I speak so you know that none of this can be escaped.
Desther has served his purpose and now tries to defy his fate. Neverwinter will learn to accept such things, even as you are allowed to take him. Remember well this lesson.
I am not here to answer your pathetic questions, imbecile. This is of my own accord. If that is inadequate, walk away.
This bridge used to lead to Neverwinter. It has recently been destroyed, however, and will take a number of days to rebuild.
This way is barred! The Old Ones will be obeyed!
You cannot enter! I will stop you, and earn a reprieve!
Desther fights to live and serve! I will live and serve with him! We are the People of the Eye!
Back! The Hold is ours, in service to your masters to come!
Easy now, just tell me your name.
Just stay here, out of the way.
If work calms you down, how about we do business?
Know anything about the cult?
Can you tell me why Desther is doing this?
Who are you? Answer!
Who is you! Speak!
You calm down. What your name?
Do you know why Desther do this?
What you know about the cult?
If you like work, maybe we do trading?
You stay here where it sorta safe.
Can't I just work alone? Like a normal day? No death, no cult, no Desther...
Don't kill me! I'll do what you say, just don't kill me!
I'm... I'm Johnny. Me and dad, we run the Hold storehouse. But... Some cult took over a few weeks ago. People of the Eye?
They killed lots of Helmites, but left us alive to work... and now the boss, Desther? He's raising their dead bodies! Everywhere!
Now dad is dead and there's zombies and stuff... I just want to work... I just wanna sort the nails...
Yeah... yeah... I'll just... organize the shelves... or something...
Simple business... okay, I can do that... but, it's gotta be fair or I'll get in trouble... if this blows over, anyway.
They... they were here as spies, I think. Then one day they just killed almost all the brothers. Except Dumal.
I don't know who they are. They worship something called the "Old Ones?" Must be some northern cult, maybe.
I don't know! He marches in saying something about being cast aside, saying he isn't getting any more help, and now he's raising the dead.
I heard him yelling while I hid. He said he wouldn't be abandoned. Said he had plans to prove himself.
You are one of Desther's men? Not a trapped Helmite?
You'll get no sympathy here, invader.
Tell me where Desther is!
Who are your Masters?
Why was Desther abandoned!
Tell me about your masters!
What if I let you out?
Tell me about Desther or I will kill you!
Maybe I'll talk to you later. Insane fool.
You with Desther's mens? Not true Helmite?
You get no sorrys from me, invader.
Tell where Desther is!
Who your masters?
Why was dat Desther abandoned?
Tell me about your master guys!
What if me let you outs?
Tell me about Desther or me kill!
Maybe me talk to you later, crazy fool.
Heheh. You know, I would have thought that killing the Helmites of this place once would be enough... but no...
Next thing you know, they're raising up all over! Lucky thing I trapped myself in here. Yeah... LUCKY!! DAMMIT!!
Desther's men? Desther's!? Desther is a tool like everyone. Like you. Some of us are just happy to serve.
His time is done. He should have accepted the glorious role he was given. He only delays the inevitable.
Invader?! I know the truth! You know nothing! We are all tools for the greater glory! You, me, Desther!
You... you will pay as well. And Neverwinter. The past comes to haunt, and you will be the dead ones soon enough.
No more truth for you! No more! You'll learn what you need as you are fed through it! HAAAAAhaaaaahahaa!
You? You want more? You get nothing! NOTHING! My masters will punish you all for the past! For the Future!
An honor to die for the Old Ones! Desther needs to learn this! The People of the Eye must serve! You too! All of Neverwinter will!
Your time comes! Your time comes! After mine, after Desther's, but not before Neverwinter! HAAAAAhahahahaha!!!
What? Yes! Yesssssss! Open the door! Set me free and I will... uh... follow you. Yesssss!
Yesss... free! FREE!! I will tell the Old Ones of your foolishness and weakness! Your time comes! It COMES!!!!
Forever? Sealed Forever!? It changes nothing! NOTHING!! You'll pay! All of Neverwinter will pay!
What do you know of this cult?
I have to find Desther. I have to go.
What have you heard? What happened here?
Who are you? How did you get here?
Who you? How you get here?
What you heard? What happen here?
What you know of cult?
Me gotta find Desther. Me go now.
I hope your battle goes well. Do you need me?
Greetings, I am Dumal, Watchknight of Helm. It is good to see a face of reason amidst the ravings.
I suppose being caged is better than torture, but at least during those sessions I could pass out if I tired of their rhetoric.
Madness! These "People of the Eye" are all fanatics, content to be a cog in their master's machine, even if it makes no sense!
They attacked Neverwinter for no reason, or at least no reason they have been told! The plague would never have lasted without them.
They might be based out of the north, but I've never heard of the "People of the Eye" or their "Old Ones" before.
I'd come with you but I wouldn't be any help. I'm too weak. If you have any other questions, I'll be here until the fighting stops.
Screams, mostly. I think something has gone wrong for these cult invaders. I think their agents in Neverwinter are being abandoned.
Desther led them, but he is no longer needed, for some reason. Next thing you know, he's raising undead all over. It's disgusting.
Looks like he's trying to gather power for himself, but I doubt this "Old One" cult will be impressed. Whether he's one of these "People of the Eye" or not, they seem done with him.
The Hold was my home until it was infiltrated. A third of our number were spies... betrayers. It was terrible.
They killed most of us, but we weren't even their target. It was just to support an attack somewhere else.
A day ago "Desther" returned, and seemed to have a new plan. I thought I was dead for sure, but I think he's forgotten about me.
This Pedestal has an indent where a gem may be placed.
Let nothing living remain! Helm's Hold is dead! All the world shall follow!
Nothing can stop our masters! Nothing!
The masters in the enclave will hear about this!
Desther be damned! It is an honor to die for the Old Ones!
Fight! Let the Old Ones know you are willing to die!
Your attack will change nothing! All the world will fall!
What ritual, infernal creature?
Speak, but no tricks!
I will not speak with such as you, demon.
I will think about it.
If I did this, you would be in my debt.
So you can add to the havoc? Never!
Was there a reward?
Now die, evil beast! Feel my wrath!
I want the magic item.
I'll take the magic weapon.
Grant me some of your power.
Nothing! Nothing! I change my mind!
What ritual you mean, beasty?
Okay, you talk, but no trick!
Me not deal with demons!
Maybe me think about it.
You would owe me if I did this.
You just cause more chaos. Me not help!
Me promised reward?
Now you die, evil beastie!
Grant me your insight.
Give me insight from you.
Maybe you answer more questions?
Me want magic item.
Me want magic weapon!
You give me some power.
Me change mind! Not want your help!
What cause plague?
Where is my enemy?
Where my enemy?
What caused the plague?
Who does Desther protect?
Who Desther protect?
I want ultimate power. How do I get it?
Me want ultimate power. How me get it?
Will you answer more questions?
Chaohinon of the Void bids you welcome. You need not fear me, for I am bound well and good.
You are not those who summoned me. Perhaps... perhaps you would finish the ritual that they have let lapse?
As you will. I have patience. Someone will listen. I am but a minor evil.
I wouldn't dream of it. You are far more capable than those who brought me to this place.
A simple matter, well within your capability. You are far superior to those who brought me here.
You see, they have let their petty squabbles interfere with more important concerns. They leave my summoning unfinished.
I was to crush the guardian spirit of this place, and I have done so. For this I was promised release.
If you are willing, there is a book of ritual in the study to the south. A Black Grimoire. Complete the ceremony and I shall be free.
If you must, but actions lead to glory far more often than mere thoughts.
I see you are familiar with these sorts of transactions. Free me and I will reward you well. Do it.
I languish here. Am I not pathetic? Will you not help me free myself of these bonds? Complete the ritual...
Hmmmmhehehehe....
Wretch!! SPECK!! YOU WILL PAY IN THE END!! YOUR FUTURE IS MARKED!! YOU WILL SUFFER!!! SUFFERRRRR!!!
FREE!!!! WWWHHHHAAAAAAHAHAHAHHAHAAA!!!
WHAAAAHAHHAHAAAA!! Now that IS funny. You are not worth my time! Goodbye, fool!!
Hmm? Ah yes, my... little... friend. Let me ask what you wish of me. Something... appropriate. Yessssss...
Perhaps I will tempt you? A magical cape, an ensorcelled double-axe, or a taste of power for a VERY limited time?
Changed your mind? Fine, accept no reward, but I am already free!! Deals such as this are difficult to rescind.
I do, however, like the taint of you. You have what I offered, but allow me to gift you with something more.
My obligations are done. I am free of what tied me to this place. I leave you to your trials ahead.
And that shall be all. Make adequate use of my gifts, mortal. My kind are not normaly so charitable.
Well, you are a bright one, but it is well within your capability. You are better than those who summoned me.
I wouldn't dream of trying to circumvent your impressive faculties. You are far the superior of those who summoned me.
Free... FREE!!! HAHAHAHHAAAA!!!! Now... what to do on my first day out... hmm....
Something for the black of heart? Yes, we are alike in some ways. I will offer something... more.
Name your payment. Is it a weapon, a magical trinket, a portion of my power for a VERY short time, or... my insight?
Hmm.... you are not the one I spoke with previously... No matter! My rare gratitude extends to all!
Ah, you seek knowledge from the infernal. I like that. I shall answer, and you may do what you will with the answers.
You seek Desther. You must suspect he did not create the Neverwinter plague, though he spread it and delayed the cure.
He follows a cult, but they are also constructs beneath your true foe. The power that backs them... is strange.
Desther is here, found easily enough. The master above him... I do not know. Power veils my sight... It is... strange.
Envy. Wrath. Humans stepping where they shouldn't. All the classics. What the plague DID, however, is the unique part.
Plague-dead could not be raised, their essense falling away. Healers could not help because the body rotted AROUND the soul.
Where it truly came from is beyond my knowledge, a fact that disturbs me and should scare the hells out of you.
That fabric of being did not disappear. Someone or something has gained what these victims lost. The plague fed its master.
Himself. He is no longer useful to whomever was his master. The plague has run its course. Your cure is done and in his hand.
Now he tries to deny fate, and may succeed. The power he tampers with is... unpredictable, even to me.
Oh, ambitious. We have a lot of people like you where I'm from. We like making you dance.
So you want ultimate power, hmmm? Well, to achieve that, I suppose there's a few things that would need doing.
First, you would have to destroy the threat to Neverwinter. You'll be dead, otherwise, and that wouldn't be a good start.
After that, maybe slay the gods with your hatred, enslave the hells by will alone, and march your legions of chaos to the very heart of the universe.
Of course, if you aren't capable of sorting out the details, you wouldn't know what to do with ultimate power if you had it.
No. I am not your personal font of knowledge, and I am not bound to serve you any more than I have.
I sense that you distance yourself from extremes. Bah! Creatures of whimsy are no more welcome than those of pure intent.
I will take the magical item.
Me take magical item.
I will take the weapon.
Me have the weapon.
Grant the power of Helm to aid me.
Grant power of Helm to aid me.
Nothing. I want nothing from you.
Nothing for me, I think.
Grant me your insight into events.
Tell me what your insight sees.
Where is my enemy?
Where my enemy?
Who is Desther's master?
Who Desther's master?
Why was Neverwinter attacked?
Why Neverwinter attacked?
How do I bring peace to the world?
How me bring peace to the world?
Will you answer more questions?
Maybe me ask more questions?
I am returned to preserve the heart of this place. The demon who suppressed me is banished, and I am free.
You have allowed the will of Helm to return, yet your nature is tainted by evil. We shall be cautious allies.
You have done as your conscience commanded, and have allowed the will of Helm to return. Your motives are pure.
Your nature is indeterminate. Are you aiding the balance, or merely acting on a whim? I am your cautious ally.
I offer this assistance: An enchanted ring, an expertly crafted bow, or the strength of Helm to aid you.
To you I grant something extra: A enchanted ring, an expertly crafted bow, the aid of Helm, or my insight of what comes.
Accept the gifts of Helm. Use them to guard and in the fulfillment of duty. Few are rewarded in this manner.
But such is your purity that you will receive a further boon. Accept this not lightly, for you have recieved a true blessing.
I must go elsewhere, and fortify against the coming darkness. Go forth, and do what must be done.
It is your choice to refuse the gifts I offer. I would have chosen otherwise, but this fight is not yet mine.
You seek guidance from the divine. That shows a presence of mind I find lacking in many. Ask and I shall answer.
The plague became an attack only after being unleashed. Desther did not start it, but he did spread it and delayed the cure.
The Wailing attacked the spirit, rotting the body around the soul. The essense of the victim fell away, along with the hope of others.
That fabric did not disappear. Someone or something has benefitted from what was lost. The plague has fed its master.
I have no true answer as to why. I cannot see. That worries me. It worries me.
Fear, anger, desire. He is a slave to each of these. The master that commanded him is no longer his master. Desther is abandoned, his usefulness at an end.
Now he defies fate. The power he tampers with is strange. It is ancient, and I cannot see the hand that moves it.
A broad question. Desther is near, and easily found. Those behind him are shrouded, unknowable in their strangeness.
I see layers of evil, seeded with hate, but the foundation is unknown. I can't see the beginning, but I fear what may come.
I cannot. Such sights are tiring. I hope this has proved valuable. There is little else that I can do.
I've seen many a road paved with such dreams. Unfortuantely, not many travelers end up where they intended.
That said, I imagine destroying whatever threatens Neverwinter will bring a great deal more peace than exists currently.
In the global sense, bringing peace means either appeasing the needs of - or, more likely, destroying - everyone.
If I thought you were capable of this, the fight ahead of you would be altogether different and, likely, against me.
I was chosen! I will not be replaced! I will not obey!
I will not play my part! I will not step aside! The plague will continue!
Your city dies because of me! The cure will not be yours!
Abandon me, will they?! I will not be sacrificed!
I will show them how used up I am! I will show them!
My fate is my own! Not Maugrim's! Not yours! Not the Old Ones!
You have come. Fight, then, and we shall see who rules destiny this day! I AM READY FOR YOU!!
<StartAction>Complete the Ritual.</Start>
<StartAction>Banish the Demon.</Start>
<StartAction>Do nothing.</Start>
<StartAction>Summon the Guardian Spirit of Helm.</Start>
With the Black Grimoire you may either complete the ritual or banish the Demon.
With the Demon banished you may use the Book of Helm to reinstate the Guardian Spirit.
Could I ask you some questions?
Me have questions, yuh?
Goodbye.
Shieldmeet. What's that?
Why do you think the place "shut down?"
You're sure Desther's back?
What is this place?
Shield-meat. What that be?
Why you think this place "shut down?"
Des-ter back for sure, then, yuh?
Uh... What this place called?
Anything strike you as odd this Shieldmeet?
Shield-meat strike you funny this year?
Which way did he go?
Which way he go?
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> "Good man" Desther's a traitor. Lord Nasher sent me to hunt him down.
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> That Des-ter guy be evil. Mister Nasher send me to hunt 'im down.
So you know Desther, do you?
So you know this Des-ter guy, yuh?
How do you know they're not all dead?
How you know they not dead?
By Jiminy, how many of you are in there? You must be friends of good man Desther.
Travel well...
Mind the crops on your way through...
Aye, an' keep yer pinching fingers clear of me crops, too.
A touch daft, are you? No matter.
Helm willing, I reckon you and I could wag our tongues all day...
Hmph. Any friend of Helm is a friend of mine - He watches over my crops, he does.
Well I reckon a few questions won't harm an old fella like myself... Helm protect me if I be wrong.
Why, it's a plantin' festival for folks like me. For the Helmites, though, they come to the keep and figger out how to protect us over the comin' year.
Fear o' the plague, I reckon. Not very befittin' of Helm, if you ask me, but mebbe stayin' in all the time helps 'em protect us, somehow.
Right as rain. I was headin' down to catch some riverfish for tomorrow's supper when he and his priest friends showed up right where you're standin' now.
Why, this here's the road up to Helm's Hold, where all the priests live. There's no better lord than a Helmite, I say, 'cause they'll always protect you in hard times.
Up to the keep - The only way anyone can go, now that the bridge is out.
There anythin' else you wanted to know?
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> By Jiminy, you're serious? Now I *told* my wife there was something funny 'bout good man Desther.
When he left for Neverwinter, he had me and my ox tear down the bridge behind him. He said it was to protect me from plague-bearers breaking quarantine.
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> You're not going to fool me with that sorry tale! I reckon I know a plague-bearer when I see one...
Aye, I remember wakin' up to hear shouts and the sound of fightin' comin' from the keep. Just thought the priests were in their cups after all the festivities.
Is there something else you need, then?
Well fancy that... I reckon you're with good man Desther, then, aren't you?
Good man Desther told me there might be trouble... Guess you're it.
'At I do. I first met good man Desther the night of Shieldmeet. He must be an important fella, 'cause the whole place shut down when he left for Neverwinter.
Now that he's back, mebbe things'll start gettin' back to normal 'round here.
Priests an' paladins get reassigned all over. If they're in Baldur's Gate one year, they're in Neverwinter the next.
Why, that was a fine bridge, too. My father built it and I'm the fool who tore it down... Toadstools!!
Good man Desther had me and my ox tear down the bridge after he left for Neverwinter - said it would protect me from the likes of you.
Go back to where you came from, Wailer!
Neverwinter's in the other direction - at least it would be if good man Desther hadn't had me get my ox and... I prob'ly shouldn't of said that...
I'm still makin' deliveries there, though they're not going through as much as they used to. They ain't coming to the gate no more, either.
I leave a half-stocked wagon outside the keep every week an' they leave me an empty one to swap to, with enough gold to make it worth my while.

Hail, <FirstName>! You have provided a great service to all of Neverwinter in these trying times.
As a token of Lord Nasher's gratitude, he thought you might want to bear witness to the cure's creation after all of your hard work.
Before the ritual proceeds, however, the four assembled would each like the chance to speak with you and offer their personal thanks for what you have achieved.
Go on, speak with them -- I must inform the town crier of the good news.

Black Grimoire

This aged text feels cold to the touch, and your fingers are numb after handling it. Within its tainted pages are revealed the methods by which a person can summon forth the most heinous of creatures. Interestingly, there are also instructions on how to banish evil once summoned, should it prove too troublesome for the caster to deal with. This book would have to be used in very controlled circumstances, lest it have no effect, or worse, an uncontrolled one. Merely having it in one's possession will allow the use of a properly prepared altar.
This key allows access to some of the holding cells beneath Helm's Hold.
Cell Key

This Gem is inscibed with the symbol of Helm, and the image of his fist sweeping his enemies aside. You also see a pedestal that the gem is supposed to sit upon, possibly near the entrance to the Helm's Hold Keep. You are not sure how so much detail could be held within one gem. Perhaps it is merely a focus, magically causing the images to form in your mind.
