How much are your rooms?
Could I ask you a few questions?
Bed cost how much?
Me have questions.
Goodbye.
Just what is going on in Luskan, anyway?
Have you heard of any cults in the city?
Is there anywhere I can find work here?
I need some directions, actually.
What go on in city?
Have you heard of any cults in the city?
Me look for work. What you know?
Me not know way around city. You help?
<StartCheck>[Insight]</Start> Is there any correlation between the plague in Neverwinter and the fighting, here?
Maybe I could ask you something else.
Me want to ask other question.
Where is the nearest temple?
Is there someplace nearby to buy equipment?
Where can I find the Host Tower?
Where close temple?
Need to find store.
Where me find Host Tower?
Who are you?
Who you be?
How does one get into the Host Tower?
How you gets into Host Tower?
Do you know what started all of this?
Tell me about the High Captains.
Why doesn't someone put a stop to this?
Have you heard any rumors?
What start all this? You knows?
Tell me 'bout High Captains.
Why nobody stop fighting?
You hear rumors, maybe?
Tell me about the Arcane Brotherhood.
What is Arcane Brotherhood?
How do you get into the Host Tower, then?
How you gets to Host Tower?
Tell me about Baram.
Tell me about Kurth.
You tell me stuff 'bout Baram.
You tell me stuff 'bout Kurth.
What's this about necromancers?
Can you think of anyone who might know more?
What you says? Necromancers?
You knows someone, maybe, who tell more?

A stranger to Luskan... and a <race> <man/woman>, besides. The Cutlass Inn certainly hasn't gotten many visitors since the High Captains sealed the gates and the docks... allow me to welcome you, <sir/madam>.

Greetings, <sir/madam>. You are... from the northern forests, then? Normally I don't allow barbarians to stay at the Cutlass Inn, but since the High Captains sealed the gates and docks, I've had little enough business.

I won't ask how you got into Luskan, <brother/sister>, but a holy <man/woman> is always welcome in the Cutlass Inn. The gods know I've seen little enough business since the High Captains sealed the gates and docks... I can use all the divine favor I can get.

Greetings, my <lord/lady>. Have you come to find refuge at the Cutlass Inn, like most of these other folk? Business has been poor since the High Captains sealed the gates and docks, so I'm more than pleased to welcome you.
Another lost soul seeking refuge at the Cutlass Inn, is it? Since the High Captains sealed the gates and docks, I've had little true business... allow me to bid you welcome, <sir/madam>.

What's this? Another stray looking for refuge at the Cutlass Inn? Ehhh, fair enough. The gods know since the High Captains sealed the city, I've seen little enough business. Make no trouble while you're here, however.
As you wish, friend. Do be careful in the streets.
Aye. Be wary if you head outside.
Yes, yes, off you go. Don't get killed out there.
Sorry. I'd like to accomodate you, but the inn is packed to the rafters with refugees as it is.
Aye, ask if you wish. I suppose I've not much else to do.
I suppose there's no harm in it. What would you like to know?
Oh, dear. Why do I suddenly have visions of yet another room demolished? (sigh)

Ah. Well, that's the big question, isn't it? The High Captains have been fighting for weeks, now, each trying to kill the other. They've gone completely crazy, I've heard, each trying to take power in the city for himself.
Hmmm. Now that you mention it, word about the plague arrived here right after the fighting started. That's the excuse the High Captains used to seal off the city.
They also started drafting every able-bodied pirate and smuggler that was stuck in the ports into their forces. The amount of men that have died here so far probably puts that plague to shame, I bet.
Hmph. There could be all sorts of religious cults here in Luskan, friend, and nobody would bat an eye about it.
My. That's pretty succinct.
Hardly anyone is working. The city has more or less ground to a halt, for all the fighting. If you're the adventurous sort, though, I suppose there's people who'd want things done, still.
Maybe talk to mistress Londa. Or Elynwyd. They're both folks here at the inn who are desperate to find loved ones. Maybe they'll hire you, I don't know.
Ha ha ha! Oh... you're serious. You do know that the city's under siege, practically, right?
I wouldn't suggest walking the streets, but it's up to you.
You'd want the temple of Tyr...it's quite a ways to the west from here. I'm not sure if any of the priests are still alive, though. So much for justice.
Maybe... but chances are they won't have much that hasn't been ransacked by the High Captains' forces. Mirabar is closed off, so I would suggest one of the merchant houses in the northwest.
Well... it's on an island off to the northwest. The bridge to it is guarded by both arms and magic, however. You won't be able to get inside... not that anyone would want to.
The fighting mostly bypasses my inn, so it's fairly safe if you wish to stay here. Supplies have been scarce... but I'll serve you as best I can.
The name's Aruph Thunderfist, if you must know. I be the proprietor of this inn... although it's not much to look at, with things the way they are.
Normally we'd be bustling with all the sailor folk and other travelers that would come through the city. At the moment, all I've got are locals who are taking refuge from the fighting.
I've got a few meager rooms available, still, and some watered-down ale... but not much besides. That's more than most have, however.
Why would you want to get into the Host Tower? No, wait... I don't want to know.

Half the city has been burnt down between all the fighting. The pirates in Mirabar have completely blockaded the area. Word is that the High Captains got sorcerers summoning monsters to fight for them... it's been complete chaos.
Nobody does. The High Captains have always been at each others' throats, but they've never resorted to pitched battles in the streets and creating monsters.
Maybe the Arcane Brotherhood wants there to be only one High Captain. Not sure. Everyone knows the Brotherhood is the real power, here, but they haven't done a thing about all the fighting.
Oh, aye, sorcerers they are. They live in the Host Tower on their island just off the coast. Powerful, mysterious bunch... everyone knows they're the real reason Luskan has the power it does.
Nobody knows much else about them, though. They don't let anyone on their island... and word has it they speak only to the High Captains.
Why they're letting all this fighting go on is anyone's guess. It's not like we can ask them to put a stop to it.
You don't get into the Host Tower, that's just it. There's a bridge to their island up in the northwest part of the district, but you won't get across it unless the Brotherhood wants you to.
I suppose the High Captains would know more about it. They're the only ones who might even want to go out there, believe me.
There used to be five of them. Since the fighting started, three of them have died... or gone missing. I suppose nobody really knows.
There's only two of them left: Baram and Kurth. The two of them have gone mad, I've heard, doing everything they can to kill the other.
High Captain Baram is a slippery one. I'm not surprised he's survived. He used to have his base down in the slums, but that was burnt down long ago.
Some people say he's retreated down into the sewers with the rats. Don't know how much stock I put in that, though.
He's the most powerful of the High Captains... or he was, I suppose. His tower was near here to the west, but that was destroyed last week.
I'm told he's taken his Bloody Hands and barricaded himself in West Harbor. The district's all closed off so I'm not even sure how one would get in there now, if you cared to.
Like who? Luskan ain't part of the Lords' Alliance. The lords are probably praying that the whole city goes up in flames.
The High Captains each have hordes of soldiers under their command... nobody can stand up to them. Except maybe the Arcane Brotherhood, but they've done nothing.
Some people say High Captain Baram's gone and allied with a pack of necromancers... that he's summoned all the undead in the streets.
Some say High Captain Kurth is working with the Brotherhood to raise an army to take over the North.
Others say Luskan has the same plague as Neverwinter does, but here it's driven everyone mad. I say that's just crazy talk, though.
You see what I mean, though? You can't listen to that nonsense. Truth is, nobody knows what's going on.
If it makes you feel better, I haven't heard anything about cults. Necromancers, perhaps, but no cults.
Oh... nothing, really. Some say the High Captain Baram has aligned himself with a group of necromancers. Hence the undead in his forces.
Not sure that the Arcane Brotherhood would stand for that, though. Of course, for all I know, they may be necromancers themselves.
About cults? Maybe the priests at the temple of Tempus, if they're still alive. Otherwise I can't think of a one.
Back already? What can I do for you, <sir/madam>?
Could I ask you some questions?
Me want ask questions.
Goodbye.
What is going on in Luskan?
What going on in city?
Do you know anything about cults in the city?
You knows about cults here, maybe?
Can I ask you some directions?
Me new to city. Need directions.
Where is the nearest inn?
Where is the nearest temple?
Is there a place to buy equipment nearby?
Just give me an overview of the area.
Me look for place to sleep.
Me look for temple.
Me need place to buy stuff.
Just tells me 'bout area.
Actually, I'd rather ask you about something else.
Me have other question.
I need some more directions.
Me need more directions.
What do you mean? Kurth's? Baram's?
What you mean? Who Kurth? Who Baram?
Who are you?
Who you?
I am not anybody's.
Me not belongs to no one.
Kurth's.
Baram's.
Another assault, is it? I'll kill you first!
You want rob me, huh? Me kill you!!
What brothel?
I'll do what I like!
Me does what me likes!
The Arcane Brotherhood?
What is Arcane Brotherhood?
Where is this Host Tower?
Where wizard tower?
You don't think they rule the city anymore?
You thinks they no rule no more?
Tell me 'bout High Captains.
Tell me about these High Captains.
Can nobody stop the fighting?
Nobody stops fighting?
What have they done to Luskan?
What they do to city?
Let me ask you something else.
Me asks something else.
Tell me about Baram.
Tells me 'bout Baram.
Tell me about Kurth.
Tells me 'bout Kurth.
Hail! You don't look like one of Kurth's or Baram's soldiers. Best stay off the streets if you can, then, stranger... it's not safe, as you can plainly see.
Aye, be safe.
On your way, then.
Aye, I'll be watching you.
I see. A little on the slow side, are we?
If you like, go ahead.
I suppose so.
(sigh) Go ahead and ask.
Hail, <sir/madam>! You aren't one of Kurth's or Baram's soldiers, are you? You don't seem the type.
Ho there! Be you Kurth's or Baram's?
Aye, where do you need to go?
Yes, I suppose it would seem large to someone like you, wouldn't it?
The Cutlass Inn still operates, I think. It's to the left of the main gate, just south of here.
Hmmm. I had heard the temple of Tyr was sacked, but that may not be true. Go to the far west where the merchants are... the temple is there.
Aye. There be a few merchants off in the west part of the district. They be poorly-equipped, though, and until the Mirabar district is opened up they'll stay that way.

Well, let's see. You have Miss Bela's here, on the island. To the north is the slums. There are still some merchants to the west. Much of the remainder of the city is closed off. Most of the streets are dangerous... so be careful.
Where to?
Hmm. You really are a stranger, then, if you don't know what I speak of. Most sane folk of Luskan stay indoors, now, if they know what's good for them.
Me? The name's Gregor. I was hired by the brothel, here, to try and keep some of the worse elements roaming the city from making their way to our doorstep.
Well, that's good. Be careful if you're out in the streets, <sir/madam>. As I'm sure you've seen, they aren't safe with the fighting going on.
Hmph. Do what you like, then. I'll have none of your trouble spilling into the brothel, however, you got that?
Another thug? Well, I'll stop you!
Miss Bela's, of course, on the island here. Kurth and Baram both have an interest in keeping it open... but there are enough vandals and thieves about, regardless.
Hmmm. Can't say that I do. The Arcane Brotherhood is quite thorough in ensuring there's no groups of great power other than themselves.
A group of wizards who hole up in the Host Tower and control the city. Or, at least, they used to. They aren't telling the High Captains anything, now, as far as we can tell.
You haven't been here for the fighting? It's been going on for, oh, a couple of weeks now. Out of the blue the High Captains started trying to kill each other.
Nobody knows why... most think they've gone insane. Each of the High Captains has their own army, however, and they've been tearing Luskan apart.
It's on an island to the northwest, by the mouth of the river. There's one bridge across, but nobody can cross it without the Brotherhood's leave... magical wards and all that, I suppose.
Hard to believe that anyone rules the city anymore. The wizards don't come out... they could be dead, for all we know... and the High Captains have all gone mad.
There were five of them, before... all pirate lords set up to rule the city together at the pleasure of the Arcane Brotherhood.

Now it seems they're going to fight until there's only one left standing... or Luskan is in ruins, maybe. Just two are left, now, as far as anybody can tell... High Captain Baram and High Captain Kurth.
Look around you. Many people have been drafted into their armies and killed... or just slaughtered in the streets.
Homes have been sacked and burned. The ports are completely shut down, the gates have been sealed. We're all trapped here in this mess.
Hmph. I'm sure the northern lords outside of Luskan are cheering all this on; they won't stop it. The Arcane Brotherhood might, but they haven't done anything.
Baram is a sneaky one. I didn't think he'd make it this long... especially after Kurth torched his base down in the slums.
Nobody knows where he is now. His wererats are everywhere, though... and everyone says he has more monsters and even demons under his control.
He was the most powerful High Captain before, no surprise he still lives. Baram still managed to burn down his tower, though.
People say he's gone and walled himself up in the West Harbor district, and nobody can get in or out of there. Don't know if that's true, though.
What is true is that his men, the Bloody Hands, are vicious killers. If they see you on the streets, they'll think you're with Baram. Avoid them.
Momma says we gotta stay here for a while. Daddy was killed by the soldiers.
You seem nice, <mister/misssus>. Can I be like you when I grow up?
They burned our house down. Now we live in an inn.
There's monsters in the streets. I seen 'em.
My sister is missing, now. Momma says that she may be gone forever.
Them captains are tryin' to take over the city. I don't know why.
I don't like you, <mister/missus>. Go away!
You leave me alone, or I'm gonna tell my mommy!
We don't have nowheres to live any more. I watched my house burn down, I did.
What kind of wares do you sell here?
Can I see your merchandise?
I'd like to ask you some questions.
What you sell?
Me want to buy stuff.
Me have questions.
Goodbye.
Have you heard of any cults in the city?
What's going on in Luskan?
I need some directions, actually.
You hears of cults 'round here?
What go on in city?
Me need directions.
Who are you?
Who you?
What invention is that?
What invention you means?
Why, yes... I've heard of you.
Uhhh, yup... me hears of you.
Can I ask you some questions about this invention of yours?
Me asks questions about inven-shun, maybe?
Where is this laboratory of yours?
Where this lab you talks about?
How did this 'Contrapulator' work?
How machine works?
Could your machine be fixed... and used?
Could me fixes machine? Uses it, too?
I believe I have fixed your invention...
Me thinks I fix your machine...
I'd like to ask you something else.
Me asks other question.
But how do you use the machine?
How you uses machine, though?

My, oh my! I can't remember the last time I saw another <race> face in these parts! So good to meet you! Come, now... I haven't my full selection available, but what wares I have will still dazzle you!
Oho! How rare to have a personage of such fine quality come to my shop! Due to war, pestilence and an unforeseen shortage of crates, my stock isn't what it was... but I bet you'll still be impressed!
Hello there! Come in, come in! Take a gander at my various wares! They may be depleted from the war, but I've still a variety to knock your knickers off!
Ah... er, hello there! Most of my finer items have already been stolen, but you're certainly welcome to try your hand at stealing what remains, <sir/madam>! That is... if you're here to steal at all.
Oh, this and that. Magical things I've collected over the years, plus more than a few I've made myself! I am a most notorious inventor, after all. You've no doubt heard of me.
Why, certainly! Come... and prepare to be fascinated!
Oh. I'm afraid I'm not much on things that go on outside my store. As an inventor, I spend most of my time at work... except when the outside world intervenes, heh heh.
Do come again, my <lord/lady>!
Leaving so soon? Well, don't get killed! Ha ha!
What, so soon? Well, good luck to you!

Cults! You mean... strange worshippers of demons and such? Hmm... I spoke to a mole in my lab that said there were strange necromancers in the sewers. No doubt where all the ghouls came from. But otherwise, no... haven't a clue.
Is there something else you wanted to know?
The name is Colmarr, purveyor of fine magical goods and inventor extraordinaire! I'd be more than happy to show you my most recent invention, if it... ah... wasn't broken.
A fan! How delightful! So the name of Colmarr the Uncanny has spread beyond the boundaries of this sleepy little town, has it? Good to know!
Ahhh, I'd love to show you my most recent invention. It's a grand, grand thing, truly! However, its... ah... broken.
I finished it only a week ago... my finest work, in fact. Named it 'the Fantabulous Contrapulator'! Not too much, do you think?
It has the ability to turn out any number of fantastic magical potions, a wide variety according to customer specifications. I would have made a fortune had cruel fate not intervened!
Picture this: there I was, sweating away at the final touches to the Contrapulator, eager to show it to my jealousy-filled colleagues and end their mocking once and for all. Suddenly, a crash!

Hideous undead creatures stormed my secret laboratory, shredding everything they found... including my beloved invention! I tried to stop them, but they were too much for me... and, umm, awfully intent on taking a bite, if you know what I mean.
So I ran for it and barely escaped through a magical hole I always carry with me. Ahhh, alas... I cannot go back to my lab until all this fuss is over. And my invention is ruined. (sigh)
Well, I'd certainly hesitate to reveal the details of my patented theories on magical physics... but otherwise, certainly! Ask away!
Hee hee. Normally I wouldn't tell anyone where my secret lab is... but I suppose it doesn't matter *now*, does it?

It's down in the sewers... and no doubt in quite a state of disarray. If you find it, don't think less of me for all the mess. Oh, yes, be wary of all the ghouls down there, too. Don't know where they came from.
Let's see... how shall I put this in layman's terms?
The sewage water under the city has some... unusual properties. Could be because of the Host Tower... could be that some dragon died here long ago... could be my imagination, hard to say.
*Anyway,* I've found a way to distill the more magical elements of the sewer water and transform it via the Contrapulator into magical potions! Brilliant, isn't it?

Well, were the machine working, it would have four levers... each one to add a degree of elemental essence into the mix. A pinch of fire, a dash of earth... either pull the lever or leave it in place. Once you have all four levers set, pull the chain to start the potion creation.
Use the levers properly and mix the right elements... and poof! Instant potion! Healing, invisibility, giant size, hair restoration... you name it! Aren't I a genius?
The exact ingredient for which potions, however... well, I hadn't time to determine that yet. Please do be careful. And don't break the chain if you pull it... it's quite fragile.
If you want to try, you're welcome to. It would be quite a delight to return to my lab and have my machine once again intact!
From what I remember, the ghouls ripped some of my levers. The machine is otherwise intact, so I would wager if all four levers were fixed the machine would work just fine.
It only has enough fuel in it for, oh, maybe thirty potions or so. I won't be able to synthesize any more fuel from the sewage until spring run-off... just so you know.
Er... you? Hee hee hee... that I'd like to see!
All right. What can I do for you?
You don't say! Bravo! Bravo!! My work can continue! At last, I can show up those priggish little bastards at the university! I'll show them, I'll kill them all!! I'll - -
Er, oh... nevermind that last part. *Cough! Cough!*
I wish I could give you a better reward for putting my machine together... I hope a discount at my fine store will do. Thank you again!
You can indeed! Of course, as the fixer of my Fantabulous Contrapulator, you'll also get a substantial discount!
Oh dear! I'm not very good with finding my way about. I once got lost trying to find my way to the little gnome's room!
No offense, but you'd be better off asking someone else how to get about.
Well... there seems to be a lot of fighting. It's all rather horrid. Some beastly humans came in here just the other day and robbed me silly.
Beyond that, I don't know. I get most of my information from Aunt Binny's letters... and I haven't received any mail from Neverwinter for weeks!
Greetings again! So nice to see you!
Might I ask your name, friend?
May I ask you some questions?
Who are you?
I would ask a question of you.
Tell me who you are.
Yeah, whatever. I have a question.
Who you?
Me have questions.
Goodbye.
I am called <FirstName>.
My name is <FullName>. Pleased to meet you.
You don't need to know who I am.
Me is <FirstName>.
Me called <FullName>. Is nice to meet you.
You no need know me.
What's so terrible about today?
Do you know of any work around here?
Can you tell me what's going on in Luskan?
I need some directions.
You tells me what go on in Luskan?
Me looks for work.
Me needs directions.
What bad about today?
Perhaps you could tell me who you are?
Who you?
What do you mean?
Why is Kurth holding her captive?
Where is she being held? Do you know?
What would the reward be if I rescued her?
I could rescue her for you.
Sorry, but I'm not interested.
Why sister captive?
You knows where she held?
What reward for rescue, maybe?
Me could rescues her.
Nope. Me have no interest. Too busy.
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> I'm sure I can get your sister back safely.
Fine, if you don't want my help, so be it.
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> Me get sister back safe, no problem.
Fine, me go then.
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> All right... but don't you think some coin up front might be suitable for my trouble?
Fine. But I want some coin now. Cough it up before I search your corpse.
I'll do what I can.
Evaine will be returned safe and sound, I promise.
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> Me think some coin now be good idea, no?
You give me coin now. And me means now, or else me get angry.
Me do that.
Evaine come back safe, me promise.
Tell me again how to find her?
I found Evaine in Kurth's fortress, but she isn't with me at the moment.
I am so sorry, but... I'm afraid that Evaine died while I was freeing her...
Yes, I've word. She's dead. Them's the breaks.
Not yet, but I'm working on it.
Yeah, yeah, I'll get around to it eventually.
Say where sister is again? Me forget.
Me find sister in Kurth's fortress... but she not here right now.
Me so sorry... but she die when me try free her...
Me free sister, but she die on way. (belch!) Oh well.
No, but me working on it.
Me get around to it sometime, maybe.
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> Are you sure you can't? This is your sister, after all.
Cough up some more gold, or I kill your sister now.
That will be fine.
There's no need for the reward. You've lost enough.
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> Me thinks you could try. Sister important, no?
No good. You gives more or me kills sister now.
This is okay.
No, me no need gold. You loses enough.
Sorry, no, I'm not with <CUSTOM1071>.
Yes, I'm with <CUSTOM1071>.
Me not with <CUSTOM1071>, nope.
Yep - me with <CUSTOM1071>.
Maybe I could help, if you tell me what you're talking about.
Me could help, if you say what me need do.
I've spoken to Kurth. He still has her and claims she is alive.
Me talks to Kurth. He say he gots her and she okay.
I did what Kurth demanded... but he reneged on our deal.
Me do what Kurth want... but he still no let her go.
She suffered plenty at Kurth's hands... and he has paid for it with his life.
She did not suffer, no... but Kurth is dead for what he did.
She suffered, yes. Kurth remains alive, however.
She did not suffer, no, and Kurth is not dead.
Sister suffer, yeah... but Kurth be very dead for it.
Sister not suffer. Kurth be dead anyways.
Sister suffer, yeah. Kurth no dead, though.
Sister no suffer. Me kills Kurth anyways.
I don't think you want to know.
Me not think you wants to know.
She died screaming like a stuck pig, heh heh.
She die screaming like stuck pig! Ha ha!
Kurth has agreed to release Evaine if I do something for him.
Kurth wanted me to kill Baram, but I refused.
Kurth say he give Evaine if me does something for him.
Kurth want me to kill Baram, but me say no.
I'll try, Elynwyd.
Me try to, yeah.
I don't think so.
Me no think so.
Ahhh, h-hello, there, <sir/madam>.
Goodbye, friend.
Aye...
(sigh) Go, then.
Oh. Yes, my name is Elynwyd. Elynwyd Direlean. Um... and you are?
Who... ? Oh. I guess... my name is Elynwyd. Why do you want to know? Who are you?
(sigh) I guess I should expect that kind of rudeness, in a place like this. Not that I have much choice. My name is Elynwyd, <sir/madam>, if you must know. And you are?
I suppose I am happy to meet you, <FirstName>... though I wish the occasion were brighter. Is there... something you wanted of me?
Ah. Now we know each other, then. Please pardon my mood... this is not a good day.
I would be more pleased to meet you were it not such a... terrible day, <FirstName>.
I... thank you, <FirstName>. Please, this is such a terrible day... is there something you wanted of me?
I suppose that on a day such as this, that's true enough. Is there something you wanted, <sir/madam>?
(sigh) I am in no mood to play games, <sir/madam>. Not today. Please... please just leave me be.
Aye. If you wish. Although... I am not myself, today. I do not know how much help I shall be.
If you must. This is a dark day, however, and I am not very talkative. What do you wish to know?
Considering what a dark day this is, that hardly makes me feel any more charitable. Ask, if you must.
What's going on? The High Captains are trying to take Luskan for themselves, of course. They do whatever they please in this city. And it's... it's the innocent... they're the ones who have to pay!
I see. Please... ask someone else for directions. I'm just... not in the mood today.
My sister... my dear Evaine... is being held by Captain Kurth, the most powerful of the High Captains fighting for control of the city.
If... if you're looking for work, maybe you could help me. I would pay you, if you did.
I don't even think you would understand. Oh, why not?
Evaine is... she is a beautiful woman. When his men raided our home and took most of my wealth, she caught his eye and he took her, too. I dare not... imagine... what he has done to her.
My sister has some skill with magic... I would have hoped it would allow her to escape Kurth on her own, but that doesn't appear to be the case.
Kurth and his men took most of my wealth for their own use... but I still have some of it. I would gladly give all I own for Evaine's safe return. All of it!
I... yes, I see. I did not expect to find anyone... not in Luskan... who would be willing to help me, to be honest.
Now please... leave me be, if you cannot help. It is too difficult to discuss.
You... do seem like one who knows <his/her> way with a sword. I do not wish to endanger Evaine further... but, oh, if there is a chance for her rescue...
I... I thank you for the offer, but while you do seem trustworthy, I would be placing Evaine's life in your hands...
I thank you for the offer, <sir/madam>, but... I mean no offense, but I'd be entrusting the life of my sister to you. Who knows what could happen to her if you fail?
Thank you for the offer, <sir/madam>, but I must find some other way.
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> I... I suppose I have little choice. The fact that you offer to save her at all is more than most would do. If there is even a chance for her rescue, I must take it...

I... I have been told that near Kurth's ruined tower there is a gap in the wall which may lead into West Harbor. I have been too frightened to try it, myself, but perhaps you... perhaps you could attempt it.
Here... I'm giving you a ring that belongs to Evaine. If you find her, she will likely be so frightened... this will let her know that I've sent you. Perhaps it will help.
Find Evaine, please... I beg you! Find her... or tell me what has become of her. I will die if I do not know!
Have... have you found Evaine? Is there any word of her?
Ah... greetings, <sir/madam>. You are... with <CUSTOM1071>, yes?
That... I appreciate such a promise. I pray that you find Evaine and return her to me... she does not deserve the cruel fate I fear awaits her!
Thank you, thank you! I shall pray for her safe return!
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> I... yes, I suppose... I do not have much. Here is... 100 gold pieces. Please... take it and save Evaine! Go quickly!
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> That is not very fair of you to ask. I have lost almost everything I own. I will give the rest of it to you... but only if Evaine is returned to me.
I... I... well, of course. Here is 100 gold pieces... I hope that suffices. Please... take it and find her!
I can only pray that you find her quickly.
I see. I suppose I have pinned my hopes on someone who could care less, then? Please... find Evaine before something truly happens to her! I can only pray that you will.
I... notice that you do not have my ring. I hope you have not lost it.
I see that you still have my ring. Good... Evaine will be relieved when you show it to her, I am sure.
I do not know exactly where she is, as I said. But I am told there is a gap in the wall near Kurth's old tower that leads into West Harbor. Have you found it?

You... you've found her? Don't tell me that you left her there! Or... or worse, that you've left her somewhere in the streets! Something worse could happen to her! What are you waiting for? Please, go and bring her back!
I... I see. I suppose there is... no reason why Evaine should be any more fortunate than anyone else in this city, is there?
What?! Dead?! How could you... ? No... I suppose it is not truly your fault, is it? There is no reason Evaine's fortune should be better than anyone else in this town.
Dead?! No! I knew I should never have trusted you to do this! I have little doubt you killed her yourself!
Thank you for nothing, then. I have lost everything I own and now my sister is dead as well. Her blood is on your hands!
T-tell me, <sir/madam>... did she suffer? Has Kurth... has he paid for what he did, at least?
That... that is all you have to say? My sweet, sweet sister is dead and... ? (sigh) But... why should Evaine be any more fortunate than the rest of this city, aye?
I... see that <CUSTOM1071> has given you my ring. Has the task of finding Evaine also been turned over to you? Have you any word of her?
That is good. I assumed that you were... well, you look like a <man/woman> who can handle themselves. No doubt <CUSTOM1071> needs the aid in finding Evaine, after all.
I... I can scarce believe it! You have returned Evaine to me! I had almost... almost lost hope.
Evaine explained to me your rescue after she appeared. How can I ever thank you, my <lord/lady>? Here is the 300 gold pieces... I only wish I could give you more.
I... you wouldn't! How could you?! Ahhh, what else was I to expect in this city? Here... take it. Take all the gold I have. 375 gold pieces... I have nothing else to give you.
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> Obviously you are correct I would rather be poor and destitute than have Evaine killed. Here is 375 gold... though it is truly all I own.
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> I am no longer a wealthy man, <FirstName>... would you take my last coin? My previous offer will simply have to suffice.
Come, then, Evaine. I believe I have arranged a way out of this hellish city... let us use it at once.
Take it, then. You deserve far more, my <lord/lady>.
You... are far, far too kind, my <lord/lady>. Far too good for this city, at the very least. I hope the gods smile kindly on you for all that you've done.
I really must be going. I have arranged a way out of this city once and for all... I intend to leave as quickly as possible.
I have paid him a fortune in ransom... begged him, even, to release her... but he refuses. There is no authority for me to turn to... Kurth does as he pleases. I fear I shall never see her again.
Oh, my apologies. It's just that you look like... well, that is, I assumed <CUSTOM1071> might have recruited you to help with my, ah, situation. Oh, please don't mind me...
I suppose there would be no harm in that.

I... do appreciate your offer, <sir/madam>, but <CUSTOM1071> has already offered to try and return Evaine to me. I would not want you to attempt her rescue... only to find that someone else has done it.
Of course... were you the one to bring Evaine to me, I would gladly pay you the reward, instead. What is important is that Evaine is safe... that is all I care about.
Please... do excuse me. I worry so much for her safety, this is... difficult to talk about.
Ahhh... hello, again. Might you have heard anything of Evaine? I know it is much to hope for...
Kurth once had a tower not far from here, but it was burnt down in the recent fighting. My Evaine could be dead... and if not, she is wherever Kurth has moved to.
I... good. I hope the bastard rots in hell. E-excuse me, then...
That is... good to know. Thank you, <sir/madam>. Now, please... excuse me...
I... I see. Than I shall see that he pays for what he has done. Somehow. E-excuse me, please...
I... I suppose it is good that she did not suffer, then. Thank you for that much, at least. As for him... I shall see he pays. Somehow.
I see. No... perhaps I don't, at that. Excuse me, then, I... must go.
You... are a very cruel and evil <man/woman>. I am very sorry I ever met you.
She is alive! Thank the gods! Can you... can you get her away from him? Is there some way?
Please! Do something, don't leave her there! I beg you!
Thank you! It is... good to know that she is still alive, at least. Thank you for telling me that much.

Hello there, ye handsome thing, you.

Get on with ye! Thinkin' ye're the gods' gift t' women! Hmph!
The High Captains have gone an' sealed the gates... to keep us in, I think, not to keep anyone out.
The Captains are all mad, I say! They've got demons in their armies, that's what's tearing up the city!
Don't you trust any of the High Captains' men. They'll each think ye work for the other and attack on sight.
Don't be a fool and go out into the street. An' if ye do, do it quickly.

Please leave me alone, <sir/madam>. I do not wish to speak and I have nothing left to steal, I assure you.
Please forgive me, my <lord/lady>, but I am in no mood to speak. I am sure others here will accomodate you.
I beg you to leave me be, my <lord/lady>. I have nothing to say and nothing left to steal, I assure you.
You have my sincere thanks. I only wish to be left to my grief.
Did you not hear me? I wish to be left alone, <sir/madam>. Please respect that.
I am... or, rather, I was... the Countess Londa Whitesnow. That means nothing anymore. Now I am merely... Londa.
(sigh) I see you intend to be persistent. Very well. You wish to know what is wrong? I shall tell you... though my story is not a unique one, here.
That... that is not what I meant at all. In fact, it is quite the opposite. I was once Countess Londa Whitesnow... but now I am... merely Londa.
I am grateful. I only wish to be left to my misery.
You know nothing of me, and obviously you would not understand if you did. Indeed, I have no gold for myself or anyone else any longer. Now begone, and leave me to my misery.
The title is nothing. I would have gladly given it up, and all the wealth that went with it, to still have my family. They are all that gave the others meaning.
That evil man, High Captain Baram, invaded our home with his soldiers. He desired all our wealth... to pay for his army and his war, no doubt.
My husband objected, naturally. Without even a thought, Baram... he... cut my husband down. Murdered him.
I still remember his laughter as he took my children... all nine of them... and turned me out of my home. Once he was done with it, he burned it to the ground.
Now my husband is dead, and that fiend holds my children. I know nothing of their fate and have nothing left and nowhere to turn. That is my tale, <sir/madam>.
Aye, it is very sad. I would do anything to have my children back, but Baram will not even see me... and no one can help.
You speak crudely, but it is true enough. I would do anything to have my children back... but Baram will not even see me, and no one can help.
Forgive me, but that fact currently pales compared to all I have lost. Please... leave me to my misery.
Aye... life is 'tough' for everyone in Luskan, and we should all just bear through it, is that what you mean? Just... leave me be, <sir/madam>.
Could you? I would give anything to have my children saved from that fiend, or to at least... at least know that they are all right!
I could reward you. I have no coin here, but... my husband had some saved. I know where it is, and I could tell you. It would be enough, I think.
I am no fool. If that is all there is that will get someone to find my children, then I will never give it up beforehand.
I... I see. Then leave me alone.
I am glad to hear it. Have you any questions for me, then?
You have given me a glimmer of hope. I... I wish you the best of luck.
His men once had a base in the slums... but that was burnt down more than a month ago as the war in the streets went on.
Where he has gone since, I... simply do not know. Some people say he lives in the sewers, now, but I truly hope not.
No. I have heard no news, and Baram will tell me nothing. He is the only one who would know where they are.

I... wish I knew. Perhaps he has some sinister purpose in mind for them... I do not even want to imagine it. I am hoping he has already sent them somewhere or released them and I simply do not know where they are.
Aye. The other High Captains who he has fought with these long weeks. Only Kurth remains... but no one is sure where he is. Kurth would want Baram dead, it is certain.
You have heard my sorry tale, <sir/madam>. Is that not enough?
You... return. Have you found my children? Are they safe?
I had gotten my hopes up, seeing you. Please find them! I cannot bear not knowing where they are!
But you are in no hurry. I... I see. I suppose I can expect nothing more from you.
That is a great relief... though until I see my children in person, I have my doubts as to whether the fiend is telling the truth.
Is there any way my children can be rescued? Do you know?
When you find out more, please tell me. If they are truly safe, I cannot bear to be apart from them! You must rescue them, I beg you!
Nor do I blame you. I certainly could not ask you to do such a thing. But... surely there must be some way to free them!
Can you not... sneak into his base, or wherever Baram is? Break the door down, I don't know... just find them, I beg you!
You have? I... dare not ask what it is. Whatever you do, free my children and I will be forever grateful. If they are well, I must see them!
No! No-ooo! Please, my <lord/lady>... do something! I cannot come this close and not find them! Please find my babies!
They... ate them?
D-dead? No... no, I don't believe it...
Fine? I... but why not? Bring me to them, then! I must see them!
He... sent them to orphanages? Outside the city?
No. I refuse to believe it. I won't! You have no proof, none, that what you're saying is true!
Bring me something... anything... that proves what you say and I'll... I'll believe it. Please, my <lord/lady>... I'm begging you!
But you have... little Tomlen's bear. That's his, without a doubt.
So... what you're saying is... true.
And I... shall... wait here. Yes.
No. You won't get it. I want the proof!
Ah. I... forgive me for... doubting you...
You wretch! You evil, pathetic <man/woman>! You want my husband's coin, do you?! Is that all you desire?! Then here... take the key to his vault!
Excuse me, <sir/madam>. I must... I must go.
Now I... I must... go. I... excuse me...
Th-thank you for... telling me... the truth. Here is the key to my husband's vault. It is in the sewers... in a long passage north of the water.
Now I must... I must go. I... please, excuse me...
I must go. Please... let me go.
Could I ask you some questions?
Me want ask questions.
Goodbye.
What's going on in this city?
What happen in city?
Why are you so frightened? I said I wouldn't hurt you.
Why you so scared? Me say me not hurt you.
Can I ask you some directions?
Me need directions.
Where is the nearest inn?
Where is the nearest temple?
Is there a place to buy equipment nearby?
What's around here?
Me look for place to sleep.
Me look for temple.
Me need place to buy stuff.
What around?
Actually, I'd rather ask you about something else.
No, me have other question.
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> I am an adventurer looking for information; I don't mean any harm.
Get out of my way! I'll take whatever I want!
I was just leaving.
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> Me adventurer. Mean no harm, only look for information.
You get out of way! Me take what I wants!!
Me was just going.
Tell me about these High Captains.
Tell me 'bout High Captains.
Is there nobody to stop all this?
There nobody to stops it?
What wizards?
Err... hello there. Everything all right?
Aye, be safe!
Be careful on those streets. They'll kill you if you're spotted.
Aye, go, go!
I see. A little on the slow side, are we? No matter, I guess.
Questions? What do you want to know?
I... suppose so.
Err... aye. I can... answer a question.
Back again? Did you... need something?
Uh... what... what do you want?
I... uh, sure...
Oh! You... you don't want to stay here! P-please! There's... there's the Cutlass Inn. It's to the left of the main gate... they says it's still open.
There weren't many. Tyr has a temple, on the west side...
Most of the stores are gone, or empty. I don't know.
Uhh... there's Miss Bela's. That's a brothel, if you're... well... if you want to know. It's across from the gate. Not sure what else you'd want to see...
Did... you want something else?
Ahhh! Not again! Leave me alone!!
Don't hurt me! Please don't hurt me!!
Someone help me! Please, for the love of the gods!!
Please! You... you don't look like them soldiers... you won't hurt me, will you?
Ahhh! Don't... don't hurt me! Haven't we had enough?!
Aiiieee!! Don't kill me! I don't want to die!!
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> I... suppose you don't seem the bad sort. You just startled me so! With all the soldiers rampaging around, I assumed...
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> I don't believe you! You're just like the other soldiers, you are!! Here to rob me or kill me!!
Aahhh! Robber!! Get away, get away!!
Thank Ilmater! Just go, go!!
Well... what did you want from me? Why are you here?
I... I know. It's just that the soldiers have been rampaging through the streets for weeks now...
They take whatever they like. If they think you can fight, they force you to join one of the High Captains' armies... or they kill you.
And... and gods forbid they think you're working for one of the other High Captains...
N-nobody knows, for sure. Some weeks ago, the High Captains just started... started trying to kill each other.
Each one of them has their own army, and they've been fighting in the streets night and day. Buildings burned, people slaughtered... everything's falling apart!
Worse, now that so many are dead... there's monsters come to the streets. Big rats and walking dead. Some says the High Captains use them for their armies, too.
I don't... know much about them. There was five of them, and they was all pirate lords, or used t' be. They've gone mad, everyone says.
Maybe each of them wants to control the city? I don't know... but they're killing everyone and they don't care what happens to any of us.
N-no... who? Maybe the wizards? I don't know.
The wizards of that Arcane Brotherhood. They lives in a big tower on the island at the mouth of the river.
I don't know any more abouts them, I swear! They... they're just supposed to be real powerful, that's all.
P-please don't hurt us! We're jus' simple folk, this is our home!
The soldiers came here just the other day. Took almost everything we had.
The High Captains' men... they've been goin' around, forcing anyone who can fight to join their armies. Or they kills 'em.
Don't go out in the street. There are monsters out there... giant rats that turns into men!
Luskan is cursed! There are undead... things... in the sewers! Everywhere!
It's them wizards in the Host Tower! They're trying to kill us all!
The High Captains have been fighting for weeks now. Half the city's been burnt up or butchered.
Take whatever you want of ours, just... just don't hurt us!
It's all I can do to keep my family from being killed or robbed. There's thieves and looters everywhere... almost everyone else who ain't hiding has been cut down or eaten.
I saw one of Baram's men... he changed into a rat-man, he did! I saw it!
The Bloody Hands are the worst. They'll kill you rather than look at you, they will!
A lot of people say that you can take refuge in the Cutlass Inn. Not even sure we would survive the trip...
Have they opened the gates yet?
Have they opened the gates? Or the ports? We so want to leave...
We'd leave, but... we hear that plague has spread everywhere!
It's the plague, isn't it? It's come from Neverwinter and driven everyone mad!
They shut the gates... and the harbors. The pirates closed off Mirabar... we're going to starve here, I know it!
Please don't harm us! We're no threat to you, m'<lord/lady>!
You don't look like such a bad sort. You're not here to rob us, are you?
I... please, we've nothing. We been beated and robbed so many times... we just wants to be left alone!
Don't hurt us! I beg you, please leave us be!!
Could I ask you some questions?
Me want ask questions.
Goodbye.
What's going on in this city?
What happen in city?
Why are you so frightened? I said I wouldn't hurt you.
Why you so scared? Me say me not hurt you.
Can I ask you some directions?
Me need directions.
Where is the nearest inn?
Where is the nearest temple?
Is there a place to buy equipment nearby?
What's around here?
Me look for place to sleep.
Me look for temple.
Me need place to buy stuff.
What around?
Actually, I'd rather ask you about something else.
No, me have other question.

I was just leaving.

Back again? Did you... need something?

I... uh, sure...

There weren't many. Tyr has a temple, on the west side...
Most of the stores are gone, or empty. I don't know.
Uhh... there's Miss Bela's. That's a brothel, if you're... well... if you want to know. It's across from the gate. Not sure what else you'd want to see...
Did... you want something else?
Ahhh! Not again! Leave me alone!!
Don't hurt me! Please don't hurt me!!
Someone help me! Please, for the love of the gods!!
Please! You... you don't look like them soldiers... you won't hurt me, will you?
Ahhh! Don't... don't hurt me! Haven't we had enough?!
Aiiieee!! Don't kill me! I don't want to die!!

<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> I don't believe you! You're just like the other soldiers, you are!! Here to rob me or kill me!!

Well... what did you want from me? Why are you here?

They take whatever they like. If they think you can fight, they force you to join one of the High Captains' armies... or they kill you.

Each one of them has their own army, and they've been fighting in the streets night and day. Buildings burned, people slaughtered... everything's falling apart!
Worse, now that so many are dead... there's monsters come to the streets. Big rats and walking dead. Some says the High Captains use them for their armies, too.

I don't know any more abouts them, I swear! They... they're just supposed to be real powerful, that's all.

The High Captains' men... they've been goin' around, forcing anyone who can fight to join their armies. Or they kills 'em.
Don't go out in the street. There are monsters out there... giant rats who turns into men!
