The High Captains have been fighting for weeks now. Half the city's been burnt up or butchered.
Take whatever you want of ours, just... just don't hurt us!
It's all I can do to keep my family from being killed or robbed. There's thieves and looters everywhere... those who ain't cut down or eaten.
I saw one of Baram's men... he changed into a rat-man, he did! I saw it!
The Bloody Hands are the worst. They'll kill you rather than look at you, they will!
A lot of people say that you can take refuge in the Cutlass Inn. Not even sure we would survive the trip...
Have they opened the gates yet?
Have they opened the gates? Or the ports? We so want to leave...
We'd leave, but... we hear that plague has spread everywhere!
It's the plague, isn't it? It's come from Neverwinter and driven everyone mad!
They shut the gates... and the harbors. The pirates closed off Mirabar... we're going to starves here, I know it!
Please don't harm us! We're no threat to you, m'<lord/lady>!
You don't look like such a bad sort. You're not here to rob us, are you?
I... please, we've nothing. We been beated and robbed so many times... we just wish to be left alone!
Don't hurt us! I beg you, please leave us be!!
What kind of wares do you sell here?
Can I see your merchandise?
I'd like to ask you some questions.
What you sell?
Me want to buy stuff.
Me have questions.
Goodbye.
Have you heard anything about cults in the city?
What's going on in Luskan?
I need some directions, actually.
You hears of cults, maybe?
What goings on in city?
Me need directions.
No, I haven't. Tell me more.
I would like to ask another question.
No, me not know 'bout dat.
Me have other question for you.
The nearest inn.
The nearest temple.
The docks.
Tell me about the High Captains.
Tells me of High Captains.
The Arcane Brotherhood?
What is Arcane Brotherhood?
Who is winning?
Who wins? You knows?
It is good to see a friendly face here, my <lord/lady>. Since the fighting began, supplies have been scarce and customers even rarer.

You must have taken quite a risk to walk the streets of Luskan. With all the fighting, I have received little in the way of supplies and less in the way of customers... but I shall serve you as best I can.
I hope you're not another of the High Captains' brigands come to rob us! We've had enough troubles since all the fighting began... true customers seem to be rarer than gold!
To tell the truth, I haven't much... it's been weeks since the last caravan. I do have some odds and ends that the local thugs haven't seen the need to appropriate just yet, however.
I would be delighted to show you what I have. Come, follow me for but a moment...
Aye, let me show you what I have. Stand away from the merchandise, however... I'll not lose more to thievery!
Eh? Brain-addled, are you? Well, that would explain why one of the High Captains hasn't drafted you.
There's little else for me to do, so ask what you will of me.
Ah. This should be interesting.
Do be careful if you leave the district, my <lord/lady>.
Aye, fare you well.
Off you go, then.
No. Perhaps you could ask the priests at the temple of Tempus about that, however.
Now, then... I have an errand to run. So, unless there is something else...
Is there something else you wanted to know?
Going on? Well the fighting between all the High Captains should be obvious enough. No doubt you know all about that, however.

I see. Well, now... there were five High Captains once. Not long ago, they all began to war with each other right out in the streets. Odd business, especially with the Arcane Brotherhood not lifting a finger to stop it.
Why am I not surprised?
Aye, where do you need to go?
The Cutlass Inn is just south of the gates. I am told that is still open.
Hmm. There be a temple to Tyr close by. Not sure if the priests yet live, however.
Ah, the docks. Mirabar has been sealed off by the pirates, I think. West Harbor, too. Until the High Captains re-open the city, there is to be no sea traffic to speak of.
Well, let's see. Three of the High Captains have all fled... or been killed. That leaves two of 'em still fighting: Kurth and Baram.

Each of them has their own little army and is tearing the city apart trying to kill the other, as I'm sure you can see for yourself. Rumor used to be that the Arcane Brotherhood told them what t' do, but that doesn't appear to be the case anymore.
They live in the Host Tower... over there on an island at the mouth of the river. They control the city... or, at least, they used to.
Nobody ever knew much about them or saw them at all, so it's no surprise that nobody knows what's happened to 'em now.
Who can tell? I know who's losing, though. The whole city. If you aren't being kidnapped and forced to join one of the High Captains' armies, you're being slaughtered in the street.
By the time all this fighting is over, there'll be nothing left to rule. I hear Neverwinter has a plague... we should be so lucky!
I am in need of healing.
Do you have any healing or clerical supplies that you could sell?
Could I ask you some questions?
Me need healing.
You have supplies and stuff to sell?
Me have questions.
Goodbye.
Tell me about what's going on in Luskan.
What has happened here?
What happen here?
Tell me what goes on in city.
What is all the fighting about?
Do you know of any cults active in the city?
Is there no one who can stop all the fighting?
What fighting all over?
You knows about cults here, maybe?
Nobody can stops fighting, huh?
Why do you think that is?
Why you thinks that is?
You are welcome in this house of Tyr, <brother/sister>... or what remains of it. I am afraid many of my brethren have either been killed or have abandoned us.
Welcome, <brother/sister>. You are welcome in the house of the Maimed God. Few of us remain here due to recent hardships... I only ask that you do not add to them.
The Maimed God bids welcome to a proud defender of good, my <lord/lady>. Would that our temple were in a condition to give you proper hospitality... few of my brethren remain here, now.
Are you a supplicant to the Just God, my <lord/lady>? I bid you welcome in Tyr's name. Few of my brethren remain here, however... I am unsure I can be of use to you.
Greetings. This is the house of Tyr, the Blind Overlord... or perhaps I should say it was. We have been robbed of much and most of my own brethren no longer remain here.
This is a house of worship to the Just God, and one that has seen much in the way of hardship. Pray do not add to it and come in peace.
You have survived some battle in our streets, have you? Then you have earned Tyr's blessing. It is the least that I can do to aid you.
Fare you well, <brother/sister>. Tyr's blessing upon you.
Tyr grant you justice.
Aye, go in peace, <brother/sister>. Know that the Just God watches you, his judgment swift and final.
When the temple was attacked, much of our supplies were taken. The acolytes who remain have helped me gather some tinctures and potions and such... come, I will show you.
I will answer you what I can. What do you wish to know?
Do we have... ? Oh yes, I believe I understand now.
I can only wonder what manner of questions one such as you might concoct... but no matter.

I can only pick up what pieces remain with the few acolytes I have left and push on. Fortunately your Lord Nasher has been very kind in his donations... housing Aarin Gend and you others is the least we can do.
I suppose it is not surprising, considering your intellect, but allow me to repeat myself.
That is a very large question, friend. What is it about the city that puzzles you?
Might there be something else you need?
Nobody is sure. There were five High Captains who ruled the city... at the bidding of the wizards of the Arcane Brotherhood, perhaps, but all five of the pirate lords held power.
Nobody except for an invasion by the Lords' Alliance... or the Arcane Brotherhood's intervention, perhaps. For whatever reason, they remain unmoved by all the violence.
Hmmm... cults, do you say? I was told of any one of a number of small sects that were active in Luskan. None of any true importance.
There is not much of a temple left, though once this was once a fine temple to the Just God in the north. Nowhere was a champion of justice needed more.

When the High Captains began their war against one another, each expected the warrior priests of our temple to aid them. We sought to help all and not ally ourselves only to one... and therefore met only suspicion.

We were attacked several times, but only recently did the temple fall. I was away from the temple, but upon my return I was told that sorcerers and soldiers had suddenly appeared and slain most of my brethren and looted the temple.
What few survived the battle had been taken prisoner. I know naught what has been done with them. Perhaps they have been pressed into service as the High Captains wished.
Several weeks ago, without warning, the High Captains began a war to eradicate each other. Our temple is not the only casualty in the strife that ensued.
My master did express concern, once, that several of the High Captains were associating overmuch with a cult dedicated to the evil goddess Auril... but I know little more of it.
Who can say? The Brotherhood have always kept to themelves in the Host Tower. No-one but the High Captains themselves ever sees them.
What do you sell here?
What sells you?
Can I see what you have?
Me sees what you has?
Can I ask you questions?
Me wants to ask questions.
Goodbye.
Aye? I've little enough stock left... and barely enough metal t' forge. State yer business or move on.
Aye, then, off ye go an' leave me be.
I used to have one of the finest armories in Luskan. As it is, I've been forced to set up shop here with a... rudimentary stock.
I'll sell what I has, though, before them thugs come an' take it from me o'er my dead body.
Aye. Ye can look but ye can't touch... 'tis all of the finest manufacture.
I be not in the mood to answer your questions. Find someone else t' bother, if ye not be a paying customer.
The High Captains are killin' each other, they are. Don't you be one to get in their way.
The Bloody Hands came an' burned down my home... took everything I had. May the gods damn them all!
Don't let anyone hear ye talk about the High Captains. Ye'll wind up dead, ye will.
What? Were ye robbed of all yer clothing by the soldiers?
Put some clothes on, <man/woman>. Ye're not in the brothel, are ye?
Did ye forget something, <lad/lass>? Like clothes, mayhap?
Ach, ye were fighting, I see. Did the monsters outside get to ye?
Maybe ye should see someone 'bout them nasty cuts of yours.
That must've been some tussle you were in. Most folks'd be dead in yer shoes.
I've got a cousin who were slow-witted like ye. He's dead, now.
Best a simple <man/woman> like yerself keep off the streets.
Don't go into the streets, <lad/lass>. It be dangerous. Ye know that word? Danger?
I've seen enough weapons being waved about. Put yers away.
Stop shakin' that about. Ye're makin' me nervous.
People are scared enough here as it is. Put that away.
Don't see too much holy folk 'round Luskan.
Maybe prayin's what we should be doing. Luskan's gone to hell, it seems.
You're a holy <man/woman>, ain't ye? Ye come to help us?
Lotta good yer magicks do us. Bloody Brotherhood is behind all o' this, I swear.
Ye're not part of the Arcane Brotherhood, are ye?
Ye should go back to the Host Tower. We don't need yer kind 'round here.
Ye're a might fine-lookin' lass. Ye come from Bela's, aye?
It's good to know there's still some fine women who ain't been killed.
Maybe I could buy ye a drink, lass?
The Arcane Brotherhood is behind all o' this... they've risen up zombies and werewolves and are tryin' to kill us all!
If I were you, friend, I'd stay off the streets. Until this is over, none o' us are safe.
I hear some of the pirate crews blockaded the Mirabar trade district once the ports were closed.
The High Captains have gone mad! They've put monsters in their armies and are going to kill each other while Luskan suffers!
What? Driven out of your home by rampaging guardsmen, were you? Join the club... nobody's stopping these madmen.
Get away from me, you! I've had me fill o' assassins and thieves stalking the streets!
Ye must be one of them Uthgardt peoples, aye?
City's closed off, an' somehow ye barbarian types still find yer way in.
Careful, now. Big <man/woman> like yerself will be snatched up by the soldiers in a second.
We don't welcome ye <race> folk in Luskan, much.
Better not go out in the street, you. They kills any <race> kind on sight.
I saw one of the Bloody Hand killin' some <race> travelers just yesterday.
Please, I have always been loyal to High Captain Kurth, don't hurt us.
Don't hurt us, I serve only High Captain Baram.
By the gods, the undead have come for us! Please save us powers above.
Where does the bridge go?
Where bridge go?
What kind of authorization do you need?
Uhh... what I needs to cross?
I'll cross the bridge if I like.
Me crosses if me wants to!
I have a pass right here. I am an ambassador from Mulhorand.
Me has pass. Me is ambassador of Mulhorand.
Fine, I'll go.
Okay, me going.
Arcane Brotherhood?
Surely there must be some other way across?
There must be other way to goes there.
How do you get such a thing?
How you gets that?
You won't be allowed across the bridge without authorization, citizen. Please step away.
On your way, then, citizen.
Don't return, if you know what's good for you.
This bridge is the only egress onto the island where the Host Tower of the Arcane Brotherhood sits, <sir/madam>.
Aye, an organization of wizards. Some say they rule Luskan, but if they do, they do so secretly. We rarely see or hear of them.

Not hardly. The wizards protect their privacy with magic. You can't sail a boat to the island or tunnel there or even cast a spell to take you there... no passing, period. Not without their say so. That, at least, is what I'm told.
You need written permission by the Arcane Brotherhood themselves, affixed with their seal.
(sigh) You don't. It's only given by the wizards to the High Captains and dignitaries invited to see them.
I wouldn't suggest it. Even if you got past us... which I doubt... there are powerful wards on the bridge. You need the pass to get past them.
Or this is what I'm told. You're free to make the attempt... if you wish.
What?! Let me see that...
You? An ambassador? Hmph. Let me see that...
Well... it's affixed with the seal. That's magical, so it can't be forged. Very well, then, <sir/madam>, my apologies.
The Brotherhood have had quite a few dignitaries arriving within the last couple of weeks, but none from so far away. No matter. You may cross.
You are free to cross the bridge, ambassador.
You must be with the ambassador from Mulhorand, yes? You are free to cross the bridge.
What is this place?
Can I ask you a question?
I want something to drink.
Nevermind.
What place this?
Me ask you question?
Me want to drink.
No, me need nothing.
Yes, I'm from Neverwinter.
Yeah, me from Neverwinter.
I'm not from Luskan, that's true.
Me not from Luskan, yeah.
No, I'm a local.
No, me from here.
What's going on in this town?
Have you heard of any cults in Luskan?
Who are all these people here?
Might I... interest you in a good time, lass?
What go on here?
You knows 'bout cults in Luskan?
Who is all these peoples?
Maybe me shows you good time, eh?
Goodbye.
Aye? Something ye need? We haven't much.
This be the Cutlass Inn. Ye tellin' me ye're from out of Luskan? I haven't seen a strange face since the battles started.
From Neverwinter? Huh. Even with that plague o' yours, ye should have stayed there. Luskan's no place fer anybody, now.
I thought they gone and sealed the gates. Well, mind yerself in the streets. The soldiers will kill anyone they sees.
Your home burned down too, I expect, aye? Well, speak to Aruph, then. This place be as good a refuge as any.
We've watered-down ale. Mayhap there's some wine, left... though the soldiers came days ago an' took most of it.
I'll find what I can and be back. If ye're in a hurry, go an' talk to Aruph.
Don't mind me none, then. I'm just here to serve the customers. Such as they be, I guess.
Aye, if ye be quick.
'Tis the damned High Captains warring on each other, sure enough. They been tearing apart the city fer weeks, now.
Ye can't walk the bloody streets... each side will think ye're working for the other, and will kill ye on sight. They loot and burn and murder as they please.
I think the whole city's gone mad. Half o' Luskan's been torn apart, an' nobody knows why.
Cults? We've enough problems, m'<lord/lady>... cults would be the least o' them.
Normally we'd be full to the bloody rafters with yer usual sort of pirates an' smugglers... these folk all be locals put out o' their homes.
The soldiers don't bother us none, for now, so the inn's a decent place fer refuge. Aruph's too kind to charge them, neither.
Ach, I get enough o' that from the pirates who used t' wander through here. Keep yer hands t' yerself.
If ye has more questions, ye should talk to Aruph. I has things that need doing.
Aye, on yer way, then.
Baram will be the last High Captain standing. Just you wait an' see.
Ye're one of Baram's, aren't you? Good... maybe later we'll teach Kurth's men a lesson, here, no matter what the High Captain says.
Those fellows are fools to follow Kurth. Baram will win, in the end.
I heard Kurth's in league with a priestess of Auril. That's where all the monsters we fight with are comin' from.
I can't believe Baram is dead. It can't be true... he must be in hiding or something...
Well, Baram's army isn't disbanding. Word is that someone's going to lead us soon.
Baram isn't dead. Don't listen to all the rumors. He can't be killed, I seen him stabbed so many times an' he always healed.
I bet one o' Kurth's men over there did it. They should pay...
Ye're a nobody. Fit only t' be slaughtered in the streets.
What, you one o' Kurth's? Foolish <man/woman>.
This place is Baram's. Leave, 'fore ye gets hurt.
I get one o' the girls, next. Ye'll just have t' wait until the rest of us are done.
Kurth an' his Bloody Hands are holed up in West Harbor... an' if they're smart, they'll stay there.
Go on, get out of here. This is our place.
Kurth's men shouldn't even be allowed in here...
Go away. I'm busy, here.
Baram says no fighting in the brothel... otherwise we'd kick those Bloody Hands but good, show 'em who's boss.
I have to report to Baram tonight. I hate going into the sewers... all those disgusting ghouls everywhere...
What? You some rogue they let in off the street?
Bah. Get away from me... I'm talking to my brothers, here.
Take a hike.
Could I ask you some questions?
Me want ask questions.
Goodbye.
Tell me more about these High Captains.
When did all this fighting begin?
Isn't there anyone who can put a stop to it?
How can you run this place with all the fighting going on?
You tells more 'bout High Captains.
When all this starts?
Is nobody who can stops it?
How you haves place with big fighting all around?
Tell me about these wizards.
You tells more 'bout wizards.
Tell me about what's going on in Luskan.
You tells me 'bout Luskan.
I want to ask you something else.
Me have other question.
Can I ask you some directions?
Luskan big place. Me need know way around.
How do you get around the city safely?
Where is the nearest temple?
Is there a place to buy equipment nearby?
I'm looking for a good tavern.
How you gets around safe?
Me look for temple.
Me need place to buy stuff.
Good place to drink?
Actually, I'd rather ask you about something else.
Me have other question.
I need some more directions.
Me need more directions.
What kind of place is this?
This what kind place?
Who are you?
Who you?
How do I go about seeing one of them?
How me sees one?
They work here of their own free will?
They works here 'cause they wants to?
I can't say I approve.
Me not approve.
Who are these men?
Who these men?
My goodness! It's huge!
Goodness! Is very big!
I'll take that, thank you.
Me takes that, thanks.
Big deal.
Is no big deal.
My name is <FirstName>.
Me called <FirstName>.
My name is <FullName>. Pleased to meet you.
Me name be <FullName>. You nice lady.
I'd prefer you didn't.
No. Me no tell you.
Err... pickles?
Uhh... pickles?
I'll look around.
Me looks around.
I think I agree with you.
Me agrees with you.
I could not care less, one way or the other.
Me not cares, either way.
I support Kurth.
Me supports Kurth.
I support Baram.
Me supports Baram.
I want to ask something else.
Me want asks something else.
Hullo there, darling. Do make yourself welcome.
Leaving so soon? Be careful, then, sweet thing.
Fare you well, darling!
You can find the door, can't you? Off you go, sweetie.
Oh, you're a sweet thing, aren't you?
You go right ahead and ask me your questions, darling.
That's what you're doing already, isn't it? Ha ha! Nevermind me... you go right ahead.
You can always ask... whether I answer is something else altogether.

Well, let's see. There used to be five of them, naturally. Most of them have died off or run off... who can really tell anymore? Only Kurth and Baram are left, two of the nastiest fellas you never want to come across.
Hmm... only a few weeks ago. Has it only been that long? Yes, I think it has. Simply amazing. It was about the same time that we heard about the plague in Neverwinter, I think.
Them wizards in the Host Tower could, I suppose. Looks like they don't want to.
It's not like I have much of a choice, darling. The High Captains all want a place that keeps their men happy... so they make sure that we don't close down.
Do you have a speech impediment? Oh, nevermind.
Why, hullo there, darling. Come for a bit of fun, have you?
Hullo, darling. This is a house of refinement, I'll remind you... we'll have no trouble, now.

That is a mighty big question, darling. The simple answer is that the High Captains one day decided to see which of them would be the one and only High Captain and began to kill each other and the city.
Where you looking to go, sugar?
Do I look like a signpost? Mmmm... oh, you're too sweet. Ask away, honey.
Sure thing, sugar.
Oh, you poor dear! How lost you must get some time, I declare!
You don't, sweetie. Oh, there's some safer places... the market is still pretty safe, and I hear the soldiers leave the inn alone, mostly. It's moving between the areas that gets you into trouble.
There was a temple to Tyr off in the western part of the district. Some soldier told me they ransacked the place, though. Might be nothing there any more.
The Mirabar trade district is closed off, I hear, but you could still try the market. It's off in the northwest, by the slums. You take your chances going there... it's not very safe.
Ha ha! You could always have a drink here, sugar. If you like, though, I hear the Cutlass Inn is still open. They won't have much to serve you, though.
Sure - where do you need to go?
This? This is a palace of pleasure, dear <man/woman>. There are men and women who can take your mind away from the terrible world outside... for a time.
My name is Bela, darling. I keep my boys and girls safe and the customers happy. If you're ever unhappy, you come see me... I'll change your mind, you'll see.
Now you have me at a disadvantage, however. Might I know your name, hmm?
Ha ha! You would have to speak to one of them yourself, my dear <man/woman>. If they have the time, and they like you... well, then the two of you can take things from there.
All of my girls and boys spend their time upstairs. You can go up there, if you like. If you stay down here... well, do be careful around some of these men.
Naturally they do, darling. There are far worse ways in Luskan to make a living than to spend your time surrounded by luxury and fine company.
If you don't believe me, however, you are certainly free to ask them yourself. Just don't make trouble, that's all I ask.
Ha ha! Well, my dear <man/woman>, nobody said that you had to. The marvelous thing about a door is that it's as good for going as it is for coming, wouldn't you agree?
Of course... one could say the same thing about a man. Mmmm.
Hmph. Most of these brutes are soldiers for either High Captain Kurth or High Captain Baram. They take after their commanders, as well, for they fight continuously.
I declare, it is all I can do to keep them distracted enough not to tear each other apart and destroy my good home.
It'll be far, far better for us all when those High Captains get it all over with and kill each other once and for all. Mmm... but perhaps I shouldn't talk so. What do you think of them, darling?
Speaking of which... take a look at the rock on this here ring my latest beau gave me? What do you think, mmm?
Listen, honey, goodness had *nothing* to do with it.
Don't get your leathers in a bunch, sweetie. When I say it's a rock, I mean it's a rock. Looks pretty, though. So did my beau, but I don't date cheap men.
It was a big deal... to my beau. After borrowing all that gold, I hear you'll find his tongue in Ten Towns and his toes in Athkatla. Sad story, I know, but you'll get over it.
But we're getting off the topic. You were busy disapproving, as I recall. Something else you wanted, then, darling?
You're not from here, <FirstName>, are you? I like that in a man. I may have to snap you up myself.
Sweet name you have there, girl. Don't let the brutes down here know it, or you'll be hearing it in drunken ballads for hours. Trust me on that.
Ooooh, a real charmer. I like that in a man. I bet you wouldn't pass out drunk before I even knew we were started, would you darling?
You got the manners, girl. You ever decide to change professions, you come and talk to me. Don't kid yourself: the jewelry is fabulous.
Dark and mysterious. Hmmm, you're giving me goose-bumps, darling. I should snatch you up for myself, mrrowwr.
Mmmm, the boys are going to love you, I see. Teach them manners and show them who's boss... you'll have them eating out of your hand, trust me.
But that's neither here nor there. Is there something that Bela can do for you? We have satin, we have wine, we have pickles... anything you like.
Don't get lost, then, darling. We once found a halfling in the cellar after a week, poor fellow. He was still smiling, but that's a different story.
It's for the gnomes. They like their pickles sour and their women tall. Don't ask me why.
Boys will be boys, I suppose. I'm willing to bet that you want to know more than that, though, hmm?
It'll be so much better for us once they kill each other off once and for all. Hmm... but perhaps I shouldn't talk like such. How do you feel about them, sugar?
Now there's a smart <boy/girl>. I knew you were gold the minute I laid eyes on you, yes I did.
You know... since you feel the way you do, you might want to go and talk to Rhaine. She's one of my girls upstairs.
You know... since you feel the way you do, you might want to go and talk to Oreth. He's one of my boys upstairs.
Shhh... don't ask why, sweetie. Just trust me.
You go right ahead, darling. I'm all ears.
It'll be far, far better for us all when those High Captains get it all over with and kill each other once and for all. Then me and my poor girls and boys will be safe.
Ha ha! You must have walked into the city blindfolded, then! You go ahead and be mercenary if you like, darling... I like you that way.
Oh? Well... to each <his/her> own, I suppose. Kurth is, at least, a bit more civilized. Champagne still gets you drunk, though, sugar.
Oh? Well, to each <his/her> own, I suppose. That Baram reminds me of a wee sneaky rat, he does... but maybe it's just li'l ol' me.
Oh, you know. Them Arcane Brotherhood fellas who live in their tower on the island. They're supposed to be powerful, but nobody knows much.
I certainly don't. There's a bridge that goes out to their island, but nobody can cross it. And they don't come out here. So that's that, I guess.
And besides... a very happy soldier is a much, much better thing than a very unhappy soldier. You take my meaning, sugar?
We still have to give most of our gold to each of the High Captains to keep the peace, but it's a better living than most these days.
And don't you be one of them foolish ones that thinks the sewers are a safe way to travel. There's all sorts of things let loose down there... where they came from is anyone's guess.
Welcome to my little home. Have a drink!
Now, now, boys... let's all pretend to be gentlemen.
Keep it down, boys.
Don't make me spank you, fellas. I like to keep things civilized.
Let's keep things friendly, boys, or you're gonna have to leave.
Shouting won't get you upstairs any faster, fellas. Have another drink.
I'm keeping an eye on you. No funny business... not yet, anyway.
Leave the carrying on and hollering for the bedroom, fellas!
Neither.
Kurth.
Baram.
None of your business.
Uhh... nobodies.
Is no business of you.
Who are they?
Who them?
Ho there, <sir/madam>. You with High Captain Kurth or High Captain Baram?
Good enough. If you have any problems, you talk to Miss Bela, got it?
Fine. Just keep in mind that there's plenty of Baram's men here, too. I'll have no trouble here, I'm warning you.
You got a problem with that, you speak to Miss Bela. Otherwise you can do what you like.
Fine. Just keep in mind that there's plenty of Kurth's men here, too. I'll have no trouble here, I'm warning you.
Fine. There's lots of both factions here, though... this is neutral ground, on the order of the High Captains themselves, so I'll have no trouble.
You got a problem with that, you speak to Miss Bela. You don't, and we won't have a problem. Got it?
Greetings to you, <sir/madam>. Miss Bela bids you welcome to her home. Might you be with High Captain Kurth or High Captain Baram?
Who do you take me for, a fool? Look... both factions are here, so I'll have no trouble from you. This is neutral ground.
You, there... you better not be here to cause trouble. You with High Captain Kurth or High Captain Baram?
Erb sure has gotten himself into a pickle upstairs.
Could I ask you some questions?
Me want ask questions.
Goodbye.
What is all this fighting about?
Do you know anything about cults in the city?
When did the fighting begin?
Do you know of any work I might find?
What all fighting about?
You knows 'bout cults here?
When fighting starts?
You know where me finds work?
Do you know anything else about it?
You knows more, maybe?
Can you tell me about Luskan?
What you tell 'bout Luskan?
I want to ask you something else.
Me have other question.
Tell me about this place?
You tells 'bout this place?
Where would I find Oreth?
Where would I find Rhaine?
Where me finds Oreth?
Where me finds Rhaine?
You're one of the brothel girls, then?
I'd like to hire you.
How is it the brothel is still open?
Tell me about Miss Bela.
Let me ask you something else.
You brothel girl, then, huh?
Me wants hire you.
How brothel open still?
Tells me 'bout Miss Bela.
Me ask something else.
What do they demand?
What they demands?
Hello there, sugar. Something ye need?
Going so soon?
Don't get lost, now.
On your way, then.
Poor baby. You want to ask me a little question, do you?
Oh, I suppose so. Since you asked so sweetly.
Hah! I suppose none of the lads would mind if I chatted for a moment.
If you're quick about it. I haven't all day.
Well... we used to have five High Captains who ran the city. Nobody knows why, but they began a war to determine which of them would be the last one standing... if they don't burn down Luskan first.
Only a few weeks ago, I think. It was very sudden. Three of the High Captains have disappeared or died... or so the rumors go.
Work? Ha ha... the entire city is huddled down in the middle of a siege, practically, and you're asking about work? I suppose everyone has to earn their coin.
Is there something else you wanted to know?
Well... some say that the Arcane Brotherhood is behind it all. They're a bunch of wizards out in the Host Tower on the island off the shore, but nobody knows much about them. That includes me.
Something else you wanted to know?
Do you have more questions?
Something ye wanted, hun?
Aye? I've a whole room-full, here. You'll have to wait.
You're a stranger, are you? What do you want to know?
What do you want to know?
You're looking for Oreth? Well... he's in his bedroom, of course. Oreth doesn't entertain guests like the rest of us.
Since all this fighting started, he's been 'reserved' for the High Captains... and not by choice. There's nothing he nor Miss Bela can do about that, though.
Rhaine's in her bedroom. She doesn't entertain guests like the rest of us do, though, if that's what you have in mind.
Since this war began, Rhaine's been 'reserved' for the High Captains themselves. Not by choice, either... though there's nothing she nor Miss Bela can do about that.
There's not much to tell. Miss Bela would be the one to ask, I'd think.
Fine, fine, go ahead.
I am. The house is packed full, if you haven't noticed, so you'll have to wait your turn.
The soldier boys tend to take their turn whenever they want, too... unfortunately. So you may be waiting longer than you like. Nothing we can do about that.
Hmmm... no doubt. Can't help you there. Full house, and the High Captains' boys come first whether we like it or not.
My, but aren't you a strange one? I'd love to accomodate you, my dear, but I've got a line of customers a mile long. Another time.
Because the High Captains want it open. They can send their boys here to relax and demand whatever they like from Miss Bela.
Gold, naturally. As well as the use of whichever courtesans they wish... for whatever purposes they like.
Hah! Miss Bela is a kind soul, really. She's kept us all safe, so far. I hope this fighting ends soon... it's been quite a stress on her.
Cults? No, I haven't heard anything about such a thing. Although here in Luskan there could be a dozen cults and they might go unseen.
Yvette's off in her room, of course. Miss Bela gave her some time off, thankfully. As for Erb... well, if you really want to, you'll find him wandering about the lounge, here.
I don't know. If you're looking for something to do, maybe talk to Erb or Yvette if you haven't already. Yvette, especially... poor girl.
Ye'll have to wait yer turn, honey. Out ye go.
Did I ask ye to come into me room? No, I didn't. Please leave.
What are ye doin', coming in here?! Get out! Out!!
You'll have to wait forever if ye're looking for a turn... if you haven't noticed, Bela's is packed.
You know, I hear that Kurth and Baram own this place. Took it over.
One of the girls told me High Captain Baram has one of Bela's courtesans all to himself. She visits with him every night!
I was told High Captain Kurth has one of the courtesans here visit him every night, in secret. Only reason the place stays open!
Be careful downstairs. A fight'll break out soon and burn the place down... just you watch.
Hmmm... I wonder how much that Miss Bela'd charge for a night?
Most of us here play a little diamondback while we wait for our turn. Care to join us?
Blast it! Lost most of my money in diamondback... can't even afford to stay, now.
Nice place to come and forget about all the fighting for a while.
I'm stuck in this hellish city until the ports are opened again.
I hear High Captain Kurth has closed off the West Harbor district. No way out of Luskan, now.
They say Baram's down in the sewers... but I know for a fact that the place is full of monsters, so that can't be true.
Don't let the guards catch you in the streets. If they don't know you, they'll kill you.
You're a sweet thing! You one of the new girls?
One of the girls here got pregnant, I hear. Bela's got almost no girls who are working.
Well... lookit you. How about it, sweetheart? Take me to your room?
How much you charge for a night? I'll pay double.
Greetings. Nice to meet you.
Sorry... I'm a bit busy at the moment. No time to chat.
Who asked you? Move along!
Get outta here!
Hey! This is my time! Get yer own!
Can't a man be left in peace? Get your own lass!
Who are you?
I'd like to ask you some questions.
Who you be?
Me want ask questions.
Goodbye.
Do you know what's going on in Luskan?
I'm looking for work, if you know of any.
I need some directions.
You know what goings on in city?
Me look for job. You got one?
Me need directions.
Why are you so upset?
Why you upsets?
Where is the nearest inn?
Where is the nearest temple?
Where can I go to buy equipment and supplies?
Maybe I could ask you something else.
Me want find inn.
Me want find temple.
Me need buy 'quipment and stuff.
Me got other question.
Tell me about the job.
You says me more.
Why do you need the ring?
Can't you just buy it from her?
Isn't this stealing?
Okay, I'll do it.
Why you wants ring?
Why you not just buys it from her?
This be stealing!
Okay, me do it.
I have some more questions about this job.
Any chance I could get an advance on this job?
Me got some questions 'bout job.
Me want money up front to do this.
Why do you need the ring?
Tell me again where I can find Lady Jadale.
Isn't this stealing?
Why you wants ring?
You say again where Lady be.
This be stealing.
I want to ask you again about getting the ring for you.
Me want ask you again 'bout getting ring for you.
You mentioned something about a job before.
You was talking 'bout job before.
I have the ring right here.
Me got ring here.
I seem to recall some mention of a reward?
You said you give reward for ring.
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> It wasn't easy to get this, you know. I think you could spare a little more.
You better cough up some more coin or you won't even live long enough to regret it!
Thanks - it's been a pleasure doing business with you.
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> Me work hard for this. You give more gold, yes?
Me want more gold! Give more or you be sorry and you be dead!
Me happy - me like work for you.
I suppose the reward is adequate.
Me guess reward be okay.
Surely you could spare more for a fellow gnome?
You give me more cause we both be gnome, 'kay?
You're one of the brothel's men?
You brothel-man?
I want to hire you.
Me wants hire you.
A... chest connoisseur?
Uhh... you was chest con-... con-oh...
I've never heard of a place called Culver.
Me no hears of Culver.
Uncle Fedard who?
Who Uncle Fedard?
I see. Everyone died, then?
Oh. Everybody die, huh?
That's quite a story.
That some story.
I doubt that's true.
Me doubts is true.
No, I'm not interested.
No, me have no interest.
Are you insulting me?
You mean to me, yuh?
Upset about what?
Upset? Why that?
Why, hello there my pretty little peach. You certainly don't strike me as the normal variety of crone I've become accustomed to servicing. Who am I to look a gift horse in the mouth, though, eh?
Ah, yet another young woman to chance upon the skills of a gnome in his prime!

Hmmm. I see the streets of Luskan are scraping the bottom of the barrel again when it comes to the availability of women in search of a good gnome. No matter! I've taken on more difficult jobs in my lifetime, let me tell you!
How sweet. You've come back to bask in the glow of gnome in his prime, have you?
Back again, are you? They all come back to me eventually... even the bounty hunters, though we won't get into that.
How goes the search? Tell me you have the ring... my third toe has been itching like mad, and that means all this fighting could stop at any second.
I really must be going... there's a bread box down in Mirabar with my name on it.
Farewell, good <sir/madam>. May fortune smile upon you always.
Farewell to you then, <sir/madam>.
Erb Jansen's the name, of the Culver Jansens originally... but, then, that branch of the family are really exiles from the Thunder Mountain Jansen clan, so perhaps I shouldn't be bragging about it.

Still, it's quite a tale how my family made its terrible trek all the way to Culver. Nary a turnip to be found on that trip, let me tell you. Even more remarkable is how I ended up in this job, considering my former career as a chest connoisseur.
Naturally. Everyone does, you know.

I know that the military leaders of the city, those High Captains, are all trying to kill each other and take over. Beyond that I haven't a clue... I'm not the most political gnome this side of the Anauroch, you know.
There's not much more for me to say. My apologies... I'm usually more talkative, it's just that I'm so upset right now.
Very well, I suppose I can try to help you out. Where exactly do you need directions to?
The Cutlass Inn is still open, I think. Just left of the gate.
Anywhere else you need to get to?

Err... that's a good question. I tell you, if cousin Xerxes was still running his little shrine in the slums, I'd direct you there. Beyond that, you might find a temple in the merchant area off to the west.
You might try the merchants off in the river. I doubt they'd have much for sale, though. Colmarr's is still open, however... he's an enterprising little gnome, if a bit daft in the head.
I suppose there's some time before my wine is refreshed. Go ahead and ask.
No surprise there. I imagine someone like you is always getting lost.
Well, you certainly get right to the point!
Well, now, call me a halfling... but I actually have a job you could do for me. A little errand that is a mite dangerous to perform with the streets the way they are.
Ah, you remind me of my wee nephew, Gertie. He has a way with words, too, and sucks his thumb every chance he gets. At sixty-five, however, he's a bit old for that.

How shall I explain this? Well... one of my clients, a handsome noblewoman by the name of Lady Jadale, has something that belongs to me. Technically I suppose it belongs to her, since I gave it to her... but I want it back.
Heh heh... well, you see... the gift was a bit of impetuousness on my part. Lady Jadale's husband is a rather powerful man, a fact I forgot at the height of passion.
It's a ring, a little favor that I bestowed upon her that has my name enscribed. Just get it away from her and back in my hands and I'll be a happy little gnome.
So are you interested in the job? Whoever brings the ring to me will be well rewarded, I assure you.
Hah! The Lady was overjoyed when I gave her the present... and quite angry when I asked for it back. She says she's quite fond of the ring. Fonder than she is of me, at present.
That is why I need someone else to get the ring. Right now she won't even speak to me.
Not necessarily. The ring was a gift, and I'm just being rude. It's a matter of life and death, though, so I'm okay with that.
What you do to get the ring is your business. I just need it back, and will pay someone to do so.

Excellent! You'll find Lady Jadale's home not far from here. Go back towards the city gates and turn right... you should see the Cutlass Inn by the south walls. Lady Jadale's home is just west of the inn.
Do be kind to her, though, if you can. I don't wish any harm on the dotty woman... I just don't want any harm to come my way.
Do come back to me once you've found that ring, <sir/madam>. I'll be looking forward to it.

An advance? In this town? The chances of me seeing you again once you walk out the door would be less than those of my cousin Gilbert surviving the mooning of that red dragon. A ballsy move on his part, but foolish nonetheless.
Oh? Go ahead, then.
Heh heh... well, you see... the gift was a bit of impetuousness on my part. Lady Jadale's husband is a rather powerful man, a fact I forgot at the height of passion.
Now, I suppose you might have some questions before you set out after my ring?
You'll find her in her home on the north side of the district. Remember... don't hurt her, if you can avoid it. She's human, so it's really not her fault she's short a few marbles.
Not necessarily. The ring was a gift, and I'm just being rude. It's a matter of life and death, though, so I'm okay with that.
Perhaps it's just my overwhelming sense of deja vu, but I could have sworn I'd already given you a job. My ring, remember? Or had you already forgotten?
Something else you wanted?
You don't say! Here I was thinking you'd no doubt fish me some plastic junket out of the bottom of a box of porridge, and yet you come through with flying colors! Amazing!

How did you ever manage to convince the woman to give it up? Nevermind... I probably don't want to know. As my blind Aunt Binny said when she married unfortunate old Uncle Bucktooth: 'ignorance is bliss.'

Yes, of course! I did say that, didn't I? Never let it be said that Erb reneged on a promise... unlike my poor, deranged and thrice-married Aunt Fanny. Hmmm... where was I? Oh, yes. Here's 500 gold pieces for the ring.

I must admit, I didn't have a good feeling about this when we started... sort of like when you swallow a copper piece by accident. The whole thing had trouble going down. But here we are and nobody's choking! How would 350 gold pieces sound?

I knew you were the successful type, right from the moment I laid eyes on you. "Erb," I thought, "this <man/woman> could be bigger than Uncle Bigbottom!" And that's big. So here you go... 650 gold pieces for the ring.

<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> I suppose you probably do deserve something extra. I don't imagine Lady Jadale was all that pleasant to deal with. When she gets excited she's a bit pluckier than a griffon without its tail feathers. Here's another 100 gp.
And now I must take my leave for a brief while, in case Lady Jadale tries to look me up or worse. It's really a good thing gnomes are short and easy to hide. Farewell, my friend!
N-now just settle down. There's no need to get upset. No need for violence or any unpleasantness. Here, I've got another 100 gold. Take it - it's yours. But that's all I have.
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> It's sweet of you to try and swindle me, but the reward is worth far more than the ring already.
(sigh) I suppose it falls on me to ensure that we gnomes are more successful than everyone else. Very well, then... here's another 100 gold pieces for your trouble. Don't spend it all in one place.
The word is 'connoisseur', my vocabularily-challenged friend. One who can discern that which is finer. A magnificent artist with unmatched taste.

Ah, yes, those were the days, weren't they? The making of proper chests was once a noble profession. They were pieces of art, I tell you, and not these flimsy things they make today that any two-bit <race> thief with half a mind could pick. Not that I'm insinuating anything.
As a young little gnome in Culver, all I thought about were fine chests and the living I would make off of them. Alas, it was not to be. Pleasuring women is all I'm about, now.
Well, of course not. Since the great Turnip Famine of '45, there hasn't been a Culver.

I most certainly am! An expert at making the lasses smile. Ever since that fateful day when Miss Bela spotted a naive young gnome wandering into this fine city with nought but a sack of turnips on his back, in fact.

At first I thought I was only a guest, here... a well-treated one, I might add... although the tips struck me as a bit odd. Overall it's been a fine job. I'm far better off than Uncle Fedard Jansen ever was.
Of course not! What a grisly story that would make. Everybody was quite hungry, though, and certainly *thought* they would die. Going too long without a proper turnip is agony enough.

No, no, it was the much-maligned Uncle Pinto who sold the rights to some human for a sack of turnips in one of his craving fits. They went and re-named it to 'Waterdeep' or some nonsense, last I heard.
Well, some gold may have been involved... but all Uncle Pinto ever talked about was the turnips. Considering the bumper crop we had next year, he took a lot of flak for that trade. Pity.
Isn't it? Of course my relatives drove Uncle Pinto out of town for such foolishness. They thought two sacks should have been the minimum.
Now, then... was there something you needed?
That's what they all say, these days. I told him that winged contraption would never fly. For all I know, he's still at the bottom of that canyon.
Oh, really? That'd be a first for this young gnome. Tempting as the offer might be, I'm too upset to take on any new clients at the moment.
Sweet of you to offer, my dear, but I'm afraid I'm a bit too upset to take on a new client at the moment.
When Lord Jadale returns, I don't need his wife sporting my ring. He's rather renowned for his temper and I'm rather fond of my legs, short though they may be.
The Lady Jadale is, shall we say, rather oblivious to the fact that her husband might not be too fond of me when he discovers the ring. She has less sense than an elf in a shoe store, I tell you.
When Lord Jadale returns, I don't need his wife sporting my ring. He's rather renowned for his temper and I'm rather fond of my legs, however short they may be.
The Lady Jadale is, shall we say, rather oblivious to the fact that her husband might not be too fond of me when he discovers the ring. She has less sense than an elf in a shoe store, I tell you.
All right, all right... have it your way. Jenny Janson was picky, too, and she ended up a poor spinster in a small hovel with all of three teeth to her name. The choice is yours.
Naturally not. My charm is such that even the prettiest of ladies seek me out... so you're not to blame for wanting quality merchandise.

I'm asking myself: is this lad here for a conversation or does he have some gnome-fetish that I dare not even ask about? I'm hoping for the former, but being a quality gnome like myself, anything is possible.
Saying that you and I are both gnomes is... well, I suppose the genetic similarities are there, but it's a frightening proposition for me, nonetheless.
Here's an extra 100 gold pieces if you'll just keep that nugget of information to yourself.
I already told you that story, I'm pretty sure... and you agreed to get the ring back for me. Or have you forgotten?
Please be quick, I must continue my duties.
I am a female courtesan.
I have been told that you dislike Baram and Kurth.
I'll take Baram's.
I'll take Kurth's.
Hello. If you would like to talk more, follow me.
Now that we are alone, what can I do for you.
You are correct, those two have made my life a living hell. I can give one of the keys I use to get into their bases. Either Kurths' or Barams' but not both: They would suspect my treachery.
Boy, it sure is too bad about Yvette upstairs.
Heh. Look at Baram's men cowering over there. Kurth'll have mopped the floor with them in no time.
Ye're one o' Kurth's, aye? Aye, I think ye are. Good. If Kurth's going to be the true High Captain, he needs all the recruits he can get.
Those curs of Baram's are going to pay for burnin' down our tower, they will!
There's been hordes of them... creatures in the streets. I thinks Baram's in league with necromancers, summonin' ghouls an' such.
With Kurth dead, we'll... well, we don't know what. Got an army now with nobody to lead it.
Word in the Bloody Hands is that even though Kurth is dead, we ain't disbanding. Someone else is gonna lead us... don't know who, though.
Kurth's dead! I wonder who had the guts to do that...
I'm gonna find the fool who killed Kurth and make them pay, I will! Right after that fool o' Baram's over there...
Stand off, ye bloody cur.
What're you? One o' Baram's, I expect? Kurth will kill you all, I bet.
The Bloody Hands will rule the city soon enough, they will, heh...
Go on, get out of here. You're not one of Kurth's, which means ye're less than spit to me.
Huh. Who are you supposed to be?
We've driven Baram an' his men down to the sewers. They should stay there, if they're smart.
Baram's men shouldn't even be allowed in here...
Get lost.
I'd smash yer face in... but we ain't allowed, in here.
I gotta go back to West Harbor soon. Maybe I'll take the short-cut in that hole in the wall by the old tower.
Who let you in here?
If I see you on the streets, ye're dead.
Leave me be, fool.
Hello, I am available for courtesan duties.
Who are you?
Who you?
You don't seem happy about that.
You not looks happy about that.
Can I ask you a question?
Me asks you question?
Bela told me to see you.
Miss Bela say me shoulds talk to you.
Where do you mean?
What you means 'elsewhere?'
Goodbye.
And if someone were willing to help you... ?
And if somebody say they okays with helping you... ?
Just what do they make you do?
What they makes you do?
Can you tell me about the High Captains?
You tells me 'bout High Captains, maybe?
So you're weak, what else is new?
So you is weak. That not news.
Where do I find Kurth?
Where do I find Baram?
Tell me about Kurth.
Tell me about Baram.
Can they be reasoned with?
Where me finds Kurth?
Where me finds Baram?
Tell me 'bout Kurth.
Tell me 'bout Baram.
Can Captains be talked to?
How do I find Kurth, then?
How do I find Baram, then?
How me finds Kurth, then?
How me finds Baram, then?
Nevermind.
Naw. Forgets it.
Yes, give me the key.
No, I don't need any key.
Yeah, me needs key.
No, me not wants key.
Yes, give me the key.
No, I don't need any key.
Yeah, me needs key.
No, me not wants key.
Why do you think she'd send me to you?
Why you thinks she sends me?
I said I thought the High Captains should be stopped.
Me says High Captains shoulds stop.
We were discussing the High Captains.
Miss Bela and me talks 'bout High Captains.
I don't know why you've barged into my room, but whoever you are: I'm not entertaining today. I'm required to go... elsewhere.
My name is Oreth. While I am one of Miss Bela's courtesans, I don't work here anymore... thanks to those damned High Captains.
Hmph. I'd just as soon see the High Captains both dead and in the gutter rather than cater to those sick bastards. I have to do what I'm told, though, and smile about it.
That means that I have to go to Baram or Kurth... whichever decides he has a use for me... and do whatever they wish.

I'm glad to help Bela, but those men... I wish someone would do something nasty to those men. If I were braver, I'd try to kill the High Captains myself. That would only get me killed and Miss Bela in trouble, though.
No you can't. I'm not really in the mood for chit-chat. I don't suppose you'd mind just leaving me be?
I mean not here, where I should be. I mean wherever those damnable High Captains want me to go, that's where.
Aye, I'm sure you can see yourself out.
She did? Why would she do that?
Then I'd say I might be able to help them. I know the back routes into both of the High Captains' bases.
Put on a show for them with one of the other girls here, Rhaine. Or worse... I'd really rather not discuss it.
Get out of my room. I don't need your kind of company.
I suppose I know plenty about Kurth and Baram. What do you want to know?
He's a madman. He's always been hungry for power, they say, but even his men think he's gone completely mad, now. He will stop at nothing to get what he wants.
All he thinks about is killing Baram and taking over the city, talking about how glorious it will be. I don't believe he actually even thinks about what this all has done to Luskan.
Baram is... a cunning man. He relies on guile more than strength, and doesn't consider any act too low or desperate to perform.

He's allied with necromancers... there's undead all about his base, making his men nervous and jittery. Even Baram, himself, seems strange... I think he's done something to himself. Something unnatural.
Maybe. You might be able to talk to them, if they thought you could help them kill the other High Captain. I doubt they'd keep any deal you made, though.

Baram has a base within the sewers of the city, full of his troops and undead monsters conjured by his sorcerer allies. The main gate is through a sewer entrance on the island east of and south of here.

His base is heavily fortified, but not impregnable. There is a back entrance that is not well-known about... it's a sewer grate entrance just to the west of the brothel, by the stores. It's the entrance I use when I must go to him.

Kurth is in the West Docks district. His men come out of a gap broken in the wall. I don't suggest that you use that. There is an opening in the ruins of his old tower. It's what I use when I must go and see him.
You need a key to get into his base through the tower door. You can have it, if you wish. I don't know what you're plans are, but I bet you that bastard won't like them.
I have a key which could help you gain entrance... if you'd like it.
That's all I can tell you about that, however.
Then I suppose there's nothing more to say, is there?
Suit yourself. Something else you wanted to know?
Take it. It's a copy I had made. Careful, however... if any of Kurth's guards see you entering there, they'll presume you're an enemy and try to kill you.
Kurth deserves to die, friend... if you get the chance, don't hesitate. More Luskanites than I will thank you dearly for it.
Here... this should unlock the gratings there for you. It's well-watched, though, and using this key will ensure Baram thinks you're an enemy.
I don't presume to know your business, but kill that little rat if you can. I'll be happy to know it when his days are at an end.
Back again? Look, I've already told you what I have to do... what do you want from me?
Back again? I've given you a key. I hope you'll use it to kill the High Captains... or whatever it is you have planned. What else do you want?
I don't need to talk to someone like you. Get out of my room.
Who are you?
Who you?
You don't seem happy about that.
You not looks happy about that.
Can I ask you a question?
Me asks you question?
Bela told me to see you.
Miss Bela say me shoulds talk to you.
Where do you mean?
What you means 'elsewhere?'
Goodbye.
And if someone were willing to help you... ?
And if somebody say they is okay with helping you... ?
Just what do they make you do?
What they makes you do?
Can you tell me about the High Captains?
You tells me 'bout High Captains, maybe?
Why don't you do something about it yourself?
Why you not do something?
Where do I find Kurth?
Where do I find Baram?
Tell me about Kurth.
Tell me about Baram.
Can they be reasoned with?
Where me finds Kurth?
Where me finds Baram?
Tell me 'bout Kurth.
Tell me 'bout Baram.
Can Captains be talked to?
How do I find Kurth, then?
How do I find Baram, then?
How me finds Kurth, then?
How me finds Baram, then?
Nevermind.
Naw. Forgets it.
Yes, give me the key.
No, I don't need any key.
Yeah, me needs key.
No, me not wants key.
Yes, give me the key.
No, I don't need any key.
Yeah, me needs key.
No, me not wants key.
Why do you think she'd send me to you?
Why you thinks she sends me?
I said I thought the High Captains should be stopped.
Me says High Captains shoulds stop.
We were discussing the High Captains.
Miss Bela and me talks 'bout High Captains.
Who... who are you? Look... I don't entertain here right now. I... am reserved to go elsewhere, whether I like it or not. So please leave me alone.
Rhaine. My name is Rhaine. I... I have to go, soon. Could you leave, please?
I am no fan of the High Captains, and I would rather not serve their whims if I had a say in it. I do what I'm told, however.
Oreth and I have to go to the High Captains' bases to put on a show... or do whatever else they want. We despise it, but there's nothing we can do about it.
Miss Bela does her best to help us, but there's nothing she nor we can do about it. I just... I just wish someone would visit a painful, horrible death on those men. Then this would all be over.
Please, no. I'm not in the mood to talk. I have to leave soon and I... need to prepare myself.
Somewhere else. Somewhere I don't want to go, but don't have a choice.
Thank you. All I wish is to be left alone.
She did? Why would she do that?
I'd gladly tell them whatever I knew, then, if it would mean those bastards' deaths.
Sometimes they throw me to their men. Sometimes they... I... would rather not talk about it.

I'd gladly kill them, if I could. I can't, however, and that would just get Miss Bela into more trouble than you or I could imagine... and I won't do that. Please... just leave me alone! There's nothing I can do and no one can help me!
Aye. I know more about them than I would ever care to.
He's a madman. He's always been hungry for power, they say, but even his men think he's gone completely mad, now. He will stop at nothing to get what he wants.
All he thinks about is killing Baram and taking over the city, talking about how glorious it will be. I don't believe he even actually thinks about what all of this has done to Luskan.
Baram is... a cunning man. He relies on guile more than strength, and doesn't consider any act too low or desperate to perform.

He's allied with necromancers... there's undead all about his base, making his men nervous and jittery. Even Baram, himself, seems strange... I think he's done something to himself. Something unnatural.
I don't know. They might make a deal with you, if they thought it would put them ahead of the other High Captain somehow. Whether they'd bother keeping that deal is another matter entirely.

Baram has a base within the sewers of the city, full of his troops and undead monsters conjured by his sorcerer allies. The main gate is through a sewer entrance on the island east of and south of here.

His base is heavily fortified, but not impregnable. There is a back entrance that is not well-known about... it's through a sewer grate just to the west of the brothel, by the stores. It's the entrance I use when I must go to him.

Kurth is in the West Docks district. His men come out of a gap broken in the wall. I don't suggest that you use that. There is an opening in the ruins of his old tower. It's what I use when I must go and see him.
You need a key to get into his base through the tower door. I have a key which could get you inside... if you want it.
I have a key which could help you gain entrance... if you'd like it.
That's all I can tell you about that, however.
Then... please just leave me alone.
All right. What else do you want to know?
Take it. It's a copy I had made. You must be careful, however. They know me... but Kurth's men will assume you are an assassin if they see you inside the base.
I don't know what your plans are, truly... but I have a feeling that Kurth won't like it either way.
Here... this should unlock the gratings there for you. Be careful... they know me, but they'll think you're an assassin if they spot you.
I don't presume to know your business, but kill that bastard if you can. I'll be happy to know it when his days are at an end.
Back again? Look, I've already told you what I have to do... what do you want from me?
Back again? I've given you a key. I hope you'll use it to kill the High Captains... or whatever it is you have planned. What else do you want?
I told you to leave me be! Go on, get out!
Who are you?
I'd like to ask you some questions.
Who you be?
Me want ask questions.
Goodbye.
Do you know what's going on in Luskan?
I'm looking for work, if you know of any.
I need some directions.
You know stuff 'bout Luskan?
Me look for job. You got one?
Me need directions.
What problem is that?
What is little problem?
Tell me about the job.
You tells me 'bout job.
Why does he want the baby?
I can't just take the baby from her father, either.
You think you could be a proper mother?
I could help you.
Why he wants baby?
Me no want take baby from father, either.
You think you could be a proper mother?
Me coulds help you.
I have some more questions about this job.
Any chance I could get an advance on this?
Me got some questions 'bout job.
Me want money up front to do this.
Why does he want the baby?
I can't just take the baby from her father, either.
You think you could be a proper mother?
Is there anything else about this job you're not telling me?
Why he wants baby?
Me no want take baby from father, either.
You think you could be a proper mother?
There be more stuff 'bout job you not tell me?
I want to ask you again about getting your baby for you.
Me want ask you again 'bout getting your baby for you.
You mentioned something about a job before.
You was talking 'bout job before.
I have your baby with me.
Me gots baby here.
You're one of the brothel girls, then?
You brothel girl, huh?
What's the problem?
What problem?
You don't seem like the type.
You not looks like you belongs here.
So? I want to hire you anyway.
So? Me wants to hire you still.
No, I don't want to get involved.
No, me not wants to be involved.
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> It wasn't an easy task. Don't you think a bit more would be suitable?
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> Me work hard for this. You give more gold, yes?
No it's not. Give me all of it or the kid dies, girl.
No it not enough. Give all or baby dies!
Is that all? I guess I'll take the baby back to Galrone.
Is all? Okays, me takes baby to Galrone again.
Keep your gold for the baby. It was my pleasure.
Keeps gold for baby. Me not wants it.
That would be fine.
Me okay with that.
No. I guess I'll take the baby back to Galrone.
No. Me takes baby to Galrone again.
I suppose it will have to do.
Me guess it okay, then.
You're right. The original reward will do.
You right. Reward is okay.
No, no, keep the gold.
No, you keeps gold.
I am sure. In fact, I have 250 gp. Take it and be safe.
Me sure. Here... 250 gp. Take and be safe.
I... hello, my <lord/lady>. I apologize, but I am not... entertaining anyone today. My heart simply isn't in it.
Greetings, <sir/madam>. Why have you come in my room? I am... not entertaining, today. My heart simply wouldn't be in it.
How dare you just come into my room! I... I am not entertaining anyone. I can't, my heart just... wouldn't be in it.
You return. Is there something else I can do for you, <sir/madam>?
You've come back? Er... what do you wish of me?
Have... have you found my baby? Have you any news?
I must be on my way now. Please excuse me.
Fare you well, then, my <lord/lady>.
Aye. Goodbye to you.
My name is Yvette. I have been entertaining here at Miss Bela's for only a short time.
But... I'm sure I am no one that would interest you. What could you want from me?
I'll do my best to answer, <sir/madam>.
I am no expert in such matters, <sir/madam>. The fighting has been going on for several weeks, now... it's quite horrible. I wish it would just stop.
I don't know much else. Maybe Miss Bela could tell you more? She is so smart and kind... she's been so helpful with my... little problem.
I don't know my way around Luskan, myself. You might be better off asking Miss Bela... or maybe Erb. Erb could help you. You'll probably find him out in the lounge.
All... all right. Ask me what you wish.
Well, you certainly get right to the point!
You... want a job? Maybe you could help me, <sir/madam>. I haven't anyone else to turn to... perhaps I could hire you?
You... want me to... oh, I understand.
I... had a baby, <sir/madam>. With a client. I didn't mean to, but it happened, and my little daughter was the joy of my life when I had her.
I don't know. Galrone is a haughty and... and sometimes cruel man. I didn't think he'd even want to know about the child, nevermind want it.
The father, however... Galrone... he does not believe I would make a proper mother. He took my daughter away and will not return her. I wish... I would pay you to get my child back.
It frightens me to think what he might do to her. Please... if you get her back, I will reward you.
But... it's my baby, <sir/madam>. I don't think Galrone even wants her... I think he just doesn't want it known that he has a... a bastard child.
He won't talk to me and won't let me see her at all. Please help me, <sir/madam>, and I'll give you what gold I have.
I could, I know I could. Miss Bela has put aside much of the coin I've... earned here. I want to leave Luskan and go back home... to raise my daughter proper.
I've enough money to pay you and... and still make a good life for her. Please, please help me!
Oh, that's wonderful news! Galrone is in a house to the north, in the slums... though I've no idea if he's remained there with all this fighting.
Please do whatever you can to get my daughter back... just don't hurt Galrone, please, if you can avoid it. He... he is still my child's father.
Please come back with my baby when you find her.
Miss Bela warned me not to give my gold away. You... you will get a reward once I get my daughter, <sir/madam>. I won't give it out before then.
Oh, of course. What do you need to know?
I don't know. Galrone is a haughty and... and sometimes cruel man. I didn't think he even wanted to know about the child, nevermind care for it.
It frightens me to think what he might do to her. Please... if you get her back, I will reward you.
But... it's my baby, <sir/madam>. I don't think Galrone even wants her... I think he just doesn't want it known that he has a... a bastard child.
I could, I know I could. Miss Bela has put aside much of the coin I've... earned here. I want to leave Luskan and go back home... to raise my daughter proper.
I... I suppose you should know that Galrone is a very wealthy man. He has many guards, and had influence in Luskan before all this fighting started. I don't know his situation now, though.
You said you would find my baby. I... don't know of anything else beyond that.
Maybe Miss Bela could tell you more. She is a very smart lady.
You found her! Oh, thank you, thank you! How did you ever manage to convince Galrone to give her up? Oh, I don't care! All that matters is I have her back once more.
Aye, but... I have not been for long. Miss Bela has given me leave, as well, until I... until things are sorted out. I cannot bring myself to be with anyone at the moment.
I suppose. My family died before all the fighting began. Miss Bela gave me a home here... she has been very kind.
Alll... all you brutes are the same! Get out of my room, please... Miss Bela gave me leave. Talk to her, if you have a problem with that.
I see. Yes, of course you don't... that is, thank you for at least considering it. Now, if you could... leave me alone, <sir/madam>, I'd appreciate it.
He won't talk to me and won't let me see her at all. Please help me, <sir/madam>, and I'll give you what gold I have.
I've enough money to pay you and... and still make a good life for her. Please, please help me!
My gold doesn't seem enough of a reward... but it's all I have to give you. I... can spare 500 gold pieces. I... hope that is enough?
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> I... suppose so. It will mean less for us, but... without your help, I wouldn't have my baby to begin with.

No! You... you wouldn't! Here, then... take it. All of it. I... I will simply have to find... some way of supporting her back home.
No, don't do that! I... here, I shall give you more! It means much less for the baby, but... but I cannot give her up again.

Take it, then. I don't know what I would have done without your help.
I have to go, now. Miss Bela arranged for someone to take us out of the city, to start our lives anew. Thank you again!

Oh, thank heavens! Please tell me you're not one of Kurth's men!
You... aren't one of Kurth's soldiers, are you? You don't seem like the type.
P-please don't hurt me! I haven't tried to escape, I swear it!
Yes I am. My name is Evaine, and Kurth has held me here by force since he took me from my home more than a week ago. Does this mean... you would free me from this cell, my <lord/lady>?

I don't have any weapons, my <lord/lady>... and the magical wards on the door prevented me from casting spells. Please, my name is Evaine... Kurth has been keeping me here against my will. Could you not release me from here?
That... that is quite a relief! My name is Evaine, my <lord/lady>. Kurth has been keeping me here since he stole me from my brother's home weeks ago. I never thought anyone would come!
Oh, please, my <lord/lady>! Please don't leave me in here! I'm begging you! Kurth has... put me through so much, I cannot stand another moment of it! Please let me leave this cell and escape!!
Kurth and his men raided my brother's home weeks ago, where I was staying. They took most of his wealth and burned everything. Then... then Kurth decided he would take me, as well, for his own.

I... am certainly no threat to you, and I've no reason to lie. All I want is to get out of this horrid place and for Kurth to leave my brother and I in peace. Please, my <lord/lady>... could you not release me from this cell?
I... have no money of my own. My brother, Elynwyd, might be able to reward you if he still lives. I do not know if he is even still in Luskan, however.
I... I have magic that I can leave by, now that the wards on the door are gone... if you allow me to leave, that is...
Lying? About what? Oh... about being a prisoner.
Aieee! Help me, someone! Please!!
V-very well, then. It is enough that I can finally leave this place, I suppose. If you find Elynwyd, I am sure he will reward you, my <lord/lady>...
Who... who are you? You don't look like one of Kurth's soldiers.
Then you... you're here to rescue me?
But how do I know that? Kurth keeps testing me... he says he will kill Elynwyd if I even think of teleporting away.
That... that ring. That's Elynwyd's ring! Oh, thank the gods!
I... I think so, yes. I can use my magic to leave... now that the ward on the door is gone...
All... all right... I won't go anywhere...
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> Elynwyd sent you? I... I believe you. Perhaps it is all right if I escape, now... thank the gods!
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> No, I don't believe you! Leave me alone, I'm too frightened!
No, no! Please don't hurt me! Leave me alone, leave me alone!!
Aiiee! All... all right, I'm coming! Please don't hurt me!!
Please... I just want to get back to Elynwyd!
Thank you so much! I thought Kurth would have me as his slave forever! It gives me hope to know there are still heroes in this world.
My brother pleaded for Kurth to let me go, but Kurth just laughed in his face. He said he would keep me for his... his pleasure... if he wanted to.
That fiend said he would kill my brother if I tried to use my magic to teleport away. I've been... trapped here, forced to do his bidding... ever since...
I... can leave, then? Oh, thank the gods!
I have to go... thank you again, my <lord/lady>.
Kurth has been keeping me held here in this cell so I can't use my spells to teleport away. Now that the wards on the door are gone, I can leave on my own... if you'll let me.
Thank you for releasing me, my <lord/lady>! I am very grateful. Please find Elynwyd when you have a chance... I am sure he can reward you.
You... you don't have to take me anywhere, though, my <lord/lady>! I... I can teleport away, now that the ward is gone from the door. I'll go, now... I hope you're right...

Greetings, stranger. You've been rather the trouble-maker, haven't you? You've cut through my men rather efficiently. I can respect that.
In fact, I could use someone as strong as you to get rid of Baram for me. Not an easy task, I grant, but I'd reward you well. What would you say to that?
Ahhh, that's a shame really. Do let me know if you change your mind.
Well, let's see. I have a few magic items here that might interest you... they are worth a great deal. Plus 1000 gold pieces on top of that?
All you'd have to do is bring me Baram's head. Would that interest you?
I'd be more than willing to answer your questions... *if* you agree to kill Baram.
Oh? You don't say? I find that hard to believe... High Captain Suljack was supposed to be dead, as well, but I've had it on good authority he's quite alive.
You wouldn't happen to have his head, would you? I'd consider that definitive proof.
So you've already spoken to Baram... and the little rat had the same idea I had, did he? Well, well. What do you plan to do, then, stranger?
The elf girl? Why... yes, I do. Quite a pretty lass, that one. Why would she interest you?
Hmmm... you want me to give her up, do you? Very well. Bring me Baram's head and you can have her.
Fair enough. What about my original offer, then? Baram's head in exchange for the reward... ?
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> Greedy, are we? Ha ha... I could learn to like you. Very well: 1250 gold pieces, no more. What do you think now?
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> Now, now, stranger... 1000 gold is a lot of coin, and that's *if* you can do the job. Are you interested or not?
The which? Ah... you mean the Host Tower of the Arcane, don't you?
Now why would you want to get into there? I suppose it's no concern of mine... if you wish to kill yourself, it's your business.
Regardless, I'm not about to cross the tower by giving you my own papers. Baram has his own, however... accept my offer and you can take his, if you wish.
And should you get any ideas about continuing your path past this portcullis... I'd forget them, were I you.
Well... you can certainly try. Attempt to open this portcullis and you'll discover just what defenses I can muster.
Hah! I'd be willing to answer your questions, perhaps... if you weren't working for that little rat, Baram. So what's it going to be?
Well, then... either that shows your good sense or Baram's wasted his coin.
Either way, you've come quite far enough. Attempt to come pass this gate and I'll just have to assume you intend to carry out your agreement. Understand?
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> Hmmm... I just might, at that. What is the little rat paying you?
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> Hah! I wouldn't trust that you'd keep your end of the bargain for a second!
I see. Well, then... either you're more loyal to the rat than he deserves or simply too dumb to choose the right side.
Is that so? I can offer you more, then... 1500 gold pieces. Plus a magic item or two, to make it interesting. All for Baram's head... what do you say?
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> Fine. 2000 gold pieces. Plus a magic item or two, to make it interesting. All for Baram's head... what do you say?
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> I'm sure he's not paying you so much. I will, however... 1500 gold, plus a few magic items, all for Baram's head. What do you say?

Regardless, I'm not about to cross the tower by giving you my own papers. Baram has similar ones, however... accept my offer and you can take his, if you wish.
The which? Ah... you mean the Host Tower of the Arcane, don't you?

Fair enough. What about my original offer, then? Baram's head in exchange for the reward...?
Good to hear! Let's hope you can settle the matter for me... and then all of us will be that much happier.
