The which? Ah... you mean the Host Tower of the Arcane, don't you?
Now why would you want to get into there? I suppose it's no concern of mine... if you wish to kill yourself, it's your business.
Regardless, I'm not about to cross the tower by giving you my own papers. Baram has similar ones, however. Once you're finished with him, take his... and I'll certainly not wonder where it's gone.
The elf girl? Why... yes, I do. Quite a pretty lass, that one. Why does she interest you?
Hmmm... you want me to give her up, do you? Very well. But only once you've brought me Baram's head. No sooner.
Then why even bring her up? She certainly isn't the first woman I've taken for my... personal use.
Very well. I hope to see Baram's head soon.
Is that so? I see. Rather foolish decision, if you ask me. Let me know if you change your mind.
Ask away.
Aye? What do you wish, then?
Ha ha! That's a rather forward question, isn't it? Most people simply assume I want to rule the city... or have gone insane.
It's far more than that, naturally. The High Captain who survives to the last will become Luskan's war leader... and that shall be me.
Now that would be telling. I'm sure you'll know soon enough.
Only a little. There has been a bloody power struggle within the tower as of late, and a new Archmage Arcane has arisen.
I've met the mage once, only. His name is Maugrim... quite an interesting fellow. Seems to hate Neverwinter something fierce, it seems.
In the sewers, of course, where we drove him to. He's got himself walled up in a little fortress down there, surrounded by necromancers.
The only good entrance I know of is east of the slums, across the bridge. That is, no doubt, heavily guarded.
Little. You should know, however, that Baram has infected himself with lycanthropy. I don't call him a rat for nothing.
He's spread the disease to most of his men, as well... and no doubt has had his necromancers whipping up undead like mad.
How he arrays them all in his fortress, I'm not so sure of... but you should be aware of what you'll be facing.
Back again, are you, stranger? Have you changed your mind and given my offer some thought, perhaps?
Oh... one more thing, stranger. No matter what deal we have, should you try to enter my base I'll assume your intentions are hostile. But of course we needn't worry, yes?
Ahhhh, so the stranger returns! Do you have news?
Ahh, that is a shame. I was so looking forward to feeding Baram's head to the dogs. Perhaps soon, yes?
A-ha! So it is pleasant news you bring!
You'll have to forgive me if I'm a bit skeptical. I've been told that Suljack is dead, and yet I have it on good authority that he's alive and well... despite all attempts to the contrary.
You have, have you? I think you've been trying to play me all along. Well, then, stranger... good for you. Well done.
However you think your schemes will turn out, attempt to take one foot into my base and you will quickly discover otherwise.
Oh *did* he? Somehow he found the time to negotiate with you while you fought him, I take it? Why are you even telling me this?!
You've made a very... big... mistake, fool! Turn around right now, while you yet live... for if you step a foot past this door you shall suffer the consequences!
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> You're walking a thin line, stranger. (sigh) What is the rat paying you now?
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> Absolutely not! I will not be played like a lute!
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> Gah! Fine! 3000 gold pieces... but no more! I will be played no further... do not even *think* of bringing up the subject of your reward again!
For that kind of coin, I expect the job to be done forthwith! Go and do it before I lose my patience!!
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> Bah! You are lying to me through your teeth. I'll give you 2500 gold and not a copper more!
(sigh) Very well. 2000 gold pieces it is... but no more. I will tolerate no more of your playing us one against the other.
(sigh) Very well. 2500 gold pieces it is... but no more. I will tolerate no more of your playing us one against the other.

For the reward you've been promised, I expect to see Baram's head... soon. Go and do it before I change my mind about you.
Ah. Well, until I see the rat's little head up close, I'll not believe he's dead for a second.
So if Baram is actually dead, I'm sure you won't mind running back to wherever it is you left him and fetching his head for me, now, would you?
Perhaps you thought I was joking when I said I wished Baram's head. I'm not... run back to wherever you left him or you'll receive no reward.
It should not be a difficult matter... unless he's *not* dead at all. Either way, I can offer you quite a reward for doing so.
Really? Do show me.
Ahhhh, yes... that is, indeed, Baram's head. I'd heard the rat had been recently killed, I simply wasn't sure you were the one who'd done it.
So be it, stranger... you've earned your reward. Here is the gold you were promised, and the items. Take them and go.
What about her? Oh... you didn't actually think I was going to release her, did you? Foolish <man/woman>!
The girl's been a source of endless pleasure and amusement. Since I'm the last High Captain, I can do what I like... and I'll be holding onto her, thank you.
As for you and I, our business is done. Off you go... before you get hurt.
Now, now... that wasn't part of our agreement, was it? And even if it was, I doubt I'd be releasing her now, anyway.
You know of her? Well, no matter. If you're thinking of getting her released, I'm afraid that's simply impossible, no matter what your feelings might be to the contrary.
And why would that be? You've been given what you were promised. Be thankful I don't have you hanged for murder.
As the last surviving High Captain, the city is mine... and the army that goes with it! Ha ha ha! At last!!
We are very done. Now that I am the last High Captain, I have plenty of business to attend to. You have done well... now off you go.
Oh? Don't be a fool, stranger. I am the last High Captain and I have much to plan for... be smart and run along, now.
Oh, but it is. Come into my base and you'll be killed, to put it simply. Now... if you'll excuse me, I have things to attend to.
Take one step in here and you'll be gutted like a rat. I am no Baram, after all. Now... if you'll excuse me, I have plans to make.
Good. Go and do... whatever it is you're doing. If you'll excuse me, I have plans to make.
We have no further business, you and I! Take one step into my base and you'll pay the consequences, fool!
Our business is done. Begone!
Are you a prisoner here?
Stand back! I'll have no tricks out of you!

Yes... I used to be in Kurth's army, but... but I tried to flee when he went insane. I suppose I should be thankful I'm even alive. Do... do you think you could free me, my <lord/lady>?
I'm unarmed and unarmored, my <lord/lady>. And even if I wasn't, I wouldn't fight for Kurth anymore. He threw me in here when I tried to flee. Do... do you think you might free me?

So... you'll let me go? You're not going to hurt me or anything?
I don't know much, my <lord/lady>... but I'll tell you whatever I can.
I don't know. I haven't got a thing to attack you with... and if you let me go, I'll just leave! All I want to do is get away from here, I swear!
I don't have any gold. Kurth didn't leave me with anything at all. I... I guess I could tell you about this place, some, or maybe about Kurth...
I think so. I'd rather die trying then sit around waiting for Kurth to let some demon eat me, or... or worse.
Lying? About what? Oh... about being a prisoner.
Ahhh! I... I haven't anything to fight with, even! Someone help me!!
Th-thank you, my <lord/lady>. All I want is to be away from this war and this hellish city. And Kurth... I hope he gets what he deserves!
That... that's very kind of you, my <lord/lady>, but I couldn't ask you to do that. I'll bet you're heading toward more of Kurth's men, too... and that's the last place I want to be.
High Captain Kurth has gone mad... he'll do anything, kill any of us, to kill the other High Captains. I... I tried to flee, to get away, and he caught me and threw me in here.
I guess the wizard wouldn't give it to Kurth, because the High Captain had us invade the place and kill the old man.
He's a really strong fighter, my <lord/lady>. He's gone mad, too. I'll tell you right now, though... he won't negotiate with you once you're in here... he'll be out for blood!
He killed plenty others, so I don't know. He said something about... about giving me to some demon, though. I... I don't want to think about it...
No... no, not really. Although there was this fellow who visited the High Captain one night, now that I remember. Kurth called him Maugrim. All this business began right after that.

Somewhere beyond the jeweled door... you know, the one across the main hall outside the prison. You should be careful, though... there's all kinds of monsters back there. Big ones. They just keep coming through the portal.

I... I think one of them was a priestess of Auril, I'm not sure. There's some soldiers Kurth recruited... and some demons... lots of demons. They all come through a portal that was made by the wizard who lived here before Kurth took over.
There were a few. I don't know what happened to them, though. There was a girl, too... what was her name? Evaine? Kurth kept her close... haven't seen her in a long time.
I served as one of Kurth's soldiers... from before this whole thing started. There aren't many of us left... most of his army is made up of... of monsters and demons now.
Not too much. This whole place used to belong to some wizard, I think. The wizard has some portal that he could bring demons and such through... and Kurth wanted it.

A fitting name for one as fascinating as you, <FirstName>. (sigh) I only wish my mind could dwell on more pleasant conversation. Is there something I can help you with?
Thank you <FirstName>. I only wish I could give you all of my attention. My mind is focused on darker thoughts. What can I do for you?
A man of mystery. While I love an intrigue, today is just too bleak a moment in my life to give you proper attention. Can I help you?
I could think of nothing more pleasant than to while away a day chatting with you... if only it was not such a terrible day.
I guess I could, although my mind is occupied with worry about this terrible day.
On this dark day I'm not sure I can answer any questions coherently, but I will try.
I wish I could help you, kind <man/woman>, but my mind is overwrought and it is very difficult for me to focus on anything other than my own troubles.
Oh dear. When I saw you, I thought maybe this is the <man/woman> to save me from this terrbile day! I am so distraught, I couldn't possibly think clearly enough to give you directions.
It is so horrible. I was supposed to bring my little brother Neva into town to buy him a birthday present for his tenth birthday. He was so excited he kept running ahead of me.
Oh my, but you are a brave, powerful adventurer aren't you! If you want a job, maybe you could help me?
My poor, blunt, slightly dense friend, I guess I could tell you.

I imagine it is because he had his birthday money in his purse. He had 10 gold pieces to spend for his birthday. That is a lot, so the bandits probably figured he was from a wealthy home and they want to ransom him.
Yes. I quietly followed them to some standing stones in the hills just outside of Charwood. I thought for sure they would catch me, but I was lucky.
I have 300 gold, which I would reward anyone who could save my baby brother.
Oh, my poor brother. (sigh) I did think that maybe you would prove to be my hero. I guess I will have to find one who truly has a brave spirit.
Go away if you will not even try.
My hero! Thank you so much for being brave. I must admit, that if you are able to rescue my baby brother, there are rewards besides gold that I would be willing to discuss.
I know Neva is being held at a bandit camp near some standing stones just outside of Charwood, but I have no idea how many people are holding him or what exactly to expect.
Please hurry. Bring him back to me safely.
Well met, <CUSTOM1001>. Have you had any progress? Have you found Neva yet?
Hello, are you with <CUSTOM1001>?
Thank you so much, my bravest. I shall pray for your swift and safe return.
Bless you brave one. I shall pray for your swift and safe return.
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> Obviously I have hired the right <man/woman> for the job. You should be well prepared with 100 gold to assist you.
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> How mercenary of you! I will give you the reward I have promised when you return with my brother. Now go be a hero!
I can't believe how commanding you are. I hope we can discuss that later, but for now I will give you 100 gold.
Please find him quickly. I enjoy speaking with you, but I could be much friendlier if I wasn't so worried about Neva.
Neva might be dead soon! Please hurry, if only so that you can claim your reward.
I notice you don't have the ring that I gave you. I certainly hope you didn't lose it... Neva might fear to join you if he thinks it is a trap.
I am glad you still have the ring I gave you. Be brave my hero!
It is in the hills just outside of Charwood. If you search carefully you should find it.
I see that <CUSTOM1001> has turned Neva's ring over to you. Are you the hero helping me now? What can I help you with?
I guess my brother could use all the help he can get. How can I assist you?
He is at a bandit camp near some standing stones in the hills just outside of Charwood.
Please be quick my hero. I will pray for you.
But Neva could be dead soon. I hope you will hurry, if only to claim your reward.
I'm sorry, but I really must be leaving. Excuse me.
I'm sorry. I just thought you might have been asked to help me.
I guess more help is better than less.
Thank you so much for offering, kind <man/woman>, but <CUSTOM1001> has already agreed to help me.
Of course if you were the one to rescue Neva, then you would be the one to claim the reward. I would also like to add that gold is not the only reward I might offer a brave man like you.
I must go now. Please hurry, my brother's life is dear to me.
You are back so soon? Have you found my little brother?
I have no desire to speak with you. Leave me.
He ran over a hill, when all of a sudden I heard him scream. I ran as fast as I could to the top of the hill, but as I got close, I could hear men's voices.
I dropped to the ground and peeked over the crest of the hill. Neva was surrounded by a group of thugs. They picked him up and carried him off, laughing to themselves.
I simply don't know who to turn to. The guards are busy with their own troubles and I need someone who can rescue him quickly.
<StartCheck>[Insight]</Start> Who's "they?"
Don't waste my time.
What do you wish, exactly?
I don't know about 'hero...'
What you wants?
Me no big hero...
Outta me way!
That's very nice of you... thank you.
No, keep it. I don't need it.
It very nice of you. Me thanks you.
You keep ring. Me not needs it.
Very well. Thank you.
Can't you take no for an answer?
Okay. Me thanks you.
Back off - me say no.
Give me one good reason not to look into the cult...
Who says I'm looking into cult business, anyway?
I think you'd better mind your own business...
Are you part of the cult? What do you know about them?!
Yuh? Gimme a reason not to look into cult, den...
Uh, me no int'rested in cult bus'ness, yuh?
Me think you better mind yer own bus'ness, yuh?
Thanks for the advice. I'll keep it in mind...
Yuh, thanks for advice. Me keep it in mind...
I am <FirstName>. Why do you ask?
Me <FirstName>. Why you want knowing?
Is there a point to this?
There be point to this, maybes?
Yes, that's me.
Yeah, that me.
Just what is it you want, exactly?
Just what you wants?!
So far as I know, there is only one <FullName>.
Me thinks me is only <FullName>.
I've told you who I am. Now, stop with these questions.
Me says name already. You stop ask question so much.
It was a group effort, but yes, I was involved.
Me not is only person, but yeah, me helps save day.
Why does it feel like you're prying into my personal matters?
Me wonders why you thinks this is your business.
That's what I've heard. I don't know many details.
Me not know all story, but me hears that, yes.
Look, is there a point to all of these questions?
Me wonders where this going. So many question.
Yes, Aribeth de Tylmarande. I am working for her.
Me works for Aribeth. She is nice paladin lady.
I don't feel comfortable answering a question like that.
Me doesn't like that question. Me not answers.
This seems to be an excessive amount of questions, doesn't it?
Why me gets asked this many question? You write book?
I'm sorry, but you've asked entirely too many questions. I cannot answer further.
Me can't answer this many question!
Whoa, they told me you were ugly but... Ah, no matter. You're the hero of Neverwinter, I suspect.
They said you was plain-looking all right, but you're the hero of Neverwinter, that much is sure.
Wow, they told me you had a fine face but... gosh, you're the hero of Neverwinter, that much is sure.
What?...uh, the folks around the inn, that's all I meant.

I'm sorry, I... just wanted to make sure it was really you. I want to thank you. I've family in Neverwinter, and you saved their lives when you cured the plague. I wanted to give you this ring as a token of my gratitude.
Hmm, guess heroes don't have to be bright, do they...
I don't know if it is magical, but it's always brought me luck. I hope it brings you luck, too. Thank you again, <FirstName>... and farewell!
But, uh... it is a very nice ring! Please take it! That's why I wanted to find you, after all, to give it to you for all you've done!
Very well, I guess you're not as much of a hero as I had thought. How rude!
I beg to differ - you saved an entire city from a certain and horrible demise. Surely such a person deserves consideration as a hero.
Hey ugly, I think you'd better stop looking into this cult business...
Look, I think you'd better stop looking into this cult business...
Hey friend, I think you'd better stop looking into this cult business...
All I know is that you're in way over your head, <FirstName>. Consider yourself warned, 'hero'!
You saved Neverwinter, you're the big hero, everybody loves you. Why gamble all of that away? The odds aren't in your favor, anyway.
Don't be a fool! You've been nosing around, asking questions. The entire North knows what you're up to by now.
You do that. Ignore my advice and suffer the consequences. Consider this your fair warning, 'hero'!
Oh, it's very much my business, actually. We won't tolerate your interference any further. Consider this your fair warning, 'hero'!
I warned you but you just wouldn't listen.
Err... well, I suppose I should know for sure that you are who I think you are. I don't want to make a mistake, after all.
Really! You are actually <FullName>, then, yes?
So... you are the <FullName> from Neverwinter, yes? The hero who saved the city? You do look the part, but I must be sure!
Did you cure the plague? I mean, were you one of the ones rounding up the reagents and everything?
Is it true that there was a cult behind the plague, then? That this cult had fabricated it?
Isn't that awful? Who would ever do such a thing? I suppose you're here looking for those cultists, then? With that paladin of Lord Nasher's?
What about Aarin Gend, the spymaster? Is he trying to coordinate the search with Aribeth for whomever unleashed the plague? What do you know so far?
I'll be seeing you.
You don't seem stunned at all. What is your name?
Why thank you, kind sir. Mind if I ask you some questions?
Well, thank you. Why don't you tell me your name?
Thanks for the compliment. Could you answer some questions?
You expect me to buy that line? What's your name?
Yeah, whatever. I have a question.
You be nice! Tell me you name?
That nice. Me have questions.
Goodbye.
They call me <FirstName>.
My name is <FullName>. But please just call me <FirstName>. It is a pleasure to meet you Tarran.
My name isn't important right now.
Me is <FirstName>.
Me called <FullName>. But you call me <FirstName>. I glad meet you.
You no ask name. You not need know.
What's so terrible about today?
I wish I could help you, but I am in need of a job. Do you know of anything?
Have you heard anything about the cultists who started the plague in Neverwinter?
I'd love to hear about your troubles, but just now I need some directions.
You tell me 'bout cult who start plague?
Me need good job.
You no whine! You help me find stuff.
Oh mister, why so sad?
I am sorry your day is so dark. Might I ask for your name?
Who you?
What dark subjects are those?
Why do you think the bandits took him captive?
Do you know where the bandits took him?
Are you offering a reward for his rescue?
I would love to rescue him for you.
That's rough, but I'm not really interested in getting my throat slit by a gang of thugs. Goodbye.
Why bad guys keep brother?
Where they take brother?
You pay for rescue maybe?
Me tough guy, me rescue brother!
Me too busy for rescue. You find someone else.

I'll do it, but words don't have any value. I want some gold up front to prove you have any. Now!
I will do my best.
Neva is as good as rescued. Do not worry good man.
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> Me need gold first, please.
Me no think you have reward. You pay some now to show.

Neva be safe soon. Me get him.

Not yet, but I'm working on it.
Don't rush me. I'll save him eventually.

No, but me working on it.
Me do soon, or maybe later.
Tell me where he can be found.
You tell me where he be.

It would be my pleasure. My name is Tarran. And what do they call you, besides perfect?
You seem like a very lonely person. My name is Tarran. What is your name?
A beautiful name for a beautiful woman. I only wish I could fully appreciate such beauty on a terrible day like today.
Thank you <FirstName>. I only wish I could give you all of my attention. My mind is focused on darker thoughts. What can I do for you?

I guess I could, although my mind is occupied with worry about this terrible day.
On this dark day I'm not sure I can answer any questions coherently, but I will try.
I know little of that, and my mind dwells on other dark subjects. I can answer you no better I'm afraid.
My dear <lord/lady>. While my mind is plagued with the troubles this day has brought, I am afraid my directions would be completely incoherent.
I am ashamed. I was supposed to bring my little brother Neva into town to buy him a birthday present for his tenth birthday. He was so excited he kept running ahead of me.
I take it that you are an adventurer? Perhaps I could employ you to assist me with a serious problem?
I will tell you, though I fear you may not understand.

I imagine it is because he had his birthday money in his purse. He had 10 gold pieces to spend for his birthday. That is a lot, so the bandits probably figured he was from a wealthy home and they want to ransom him.
Yes. I quietly followed them to a camp near some standing stones in the hills just outside of Charwood. I would have gone in myself, except for this wounded hand.

He ran over a hill, when all of a sudden I heard him scream. I ran as fast as I could to the top of the hill, but as I got close, I could hear men's voices.
Being alone, I dropped to the ground and peeked over the crest of the hill. Neva was surrounded by a group of thugs. They picked him up and carried him off, laughing to themselves.
I would try to rescue him myself, but I wounded my hand last year and am unable to hold a sword properly. The guards are busy with their own troubles and I need someone who can rescue him quickly.
Master Maugrim don't like meddlers... But Vardoc take care of dat.
Nothing. I'm good.
Nuttin'. Me good.

The elf, Elaith.
The wizard, Wanev.

Me get ale, yuh?
I've got another drink order.
There ya go.
What would you like?
I know you're good, honey. I was just thinking you might be thirsty.
All right, but no loiterin'.

Our regulars are made-up of Elaith, Wanev, Alhelor, Ander, Albie, Darktongue, and Peren. Alhelor's a merchant, Wanev's a wizard, and Ander's just a boy. The rest think of themselves as adventurers. 'Cept Elaith. He's just an elf.
Sure thing, hon. Anything else?
If you say so. Anything else?
He's a dangerous-looking one, ain't he. Not mean, though - Just protective of that little girl of his. Anyone else?
Yeah, looks like he's left. I wasn't on duty but one of the girls said there was a commotion, a bit of magic, and he was gone... Anyone else?
Lecherous old bastard, he is! Keeps staring down my blouse every time I wipe tables. Anyone else?
Aye, he's gone for the night, thank goodness. Must have found some fool lass to take home with him. Anyone else?
Him? He showed up shortly before Sir Karathis led all those poor boys astray. A bit of a werewolf hunter himself, it seems. Anyone else?
He left a while back, looking tired. Check with Ander, I'm sure he has a better idea where old Alhelor went. Anyone else?
Poor chap, that one. Had all 'is friends turned into werewolves and now he hangs about here, helping that Alhelor pawn his wares. Anyone else?
He ain't here, is he... That's strange. Ever since the incident, he's been scared to set foot outside the place. Anyone else?
The little guy? He's new here, like you. Seems like a nice enough fellow, if a little too smart for his own good sometimes. Anyone else?
He checked out a little while back. He seemed obsessed with the goings-on in Thundertree, so maybe you can find him there. Anyone else?
The dwarf fellow, right? Yeah, he's new and cheap as a rat-ridden bed! Five ales and counting and not a single tip! Anyone else?
Hmph. He left without settlin' his account. Said he had some leads in Luskan. Good riddance, I say. Anyone else?
Aye, now there's a gentleman if ever I knew one. Always a please and thank you, ma'am, and a few extra coins on the table. Anyone else?
He said he was off to see the Wood. Told me he'd be back soon but no word of him. I hope the good fellow's all right. Anyone else?
Coming right up...
I'm afraid we have to cut you off until you've sobered up a bit.
Sorry, you don't have enough gold on you.
Sure. Let me tell you who they are, and then you can tell me who you're curious about. Sound fair, handsome?
Sure. Let me tell you who they are, and then you can tell me who you want the gossip on. Sound fair?
We're playing werewolves!
Aaaah! It's Karathis the werewolf!
My brother says there are criminals and werewolves about but I bet you could give them a whupping.
Okay, me go now, den.
Goodbye.
Me have questions, yuh?
Yuh, okay, me go now.
Wanev? Who he? Where he at?
Me want buy magic things and other stuff.
Who's Karathis?
Who's Wanev and where does he live?
What happenin' here in town?
Kara-dis? Who he?
Could you answer a few questions for me?
Does Port Llast have a ranger or druid I could speak with?
Where can I find an inn?
Where can I hire on some adventurers?
Know where I can find a priest?
Where can I find a store around here for magical or regular supplies?
So what's been happening around town lately?
<StartCheck>[Insight]</Start> So what's a girl like you doing in a town like this?
Thanks, that's everything.
Me tree-friend. There other tree-friends here? Ranger and druid?
Me want place to sleep and drink.
Me want helpers for adventurin'.
Me want healer priest.
Do you get a lot of adventurers in town?
You gots other adventurers?
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> Who's Shaldrissa?
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> Who this Shaldrissa you mentioning?
Could you help me find a few places?
Me need help find places.
I'm looking for some people.
Me look for certain people.
I have some other questions.
Me gots other questions.
He was so handsome, all of us girls were so in love with him! He said he was a werewolf hunter and he took the boys out on a raid.
My pa's friend, Haljal, runs the Cracked Anvil between the crossroads and the river. I don't know much about adventuring stuff but I'm sure he'd have what you need.
Everything's been different since Karathis took Urth and the other boys away. Nothing feels safe here anymore.
Another day, another adventurer. You don't look as tough as some of them have looked, though.
Hmn. You definitely don't look as tough as some of the other adventurers that have come through here. What do you want?
You, on the other hand, look tougher than any of the adventurers that have been through here so far. Or at least nicer. Not that I care.
Very well... and what might they be?
Bye.
He has a tower out toward Charwood somewhere, but I haven't been there.
He's a disgusting little wizard who keeps a cottage here in town. He's always trying to convince us local girls to visit.
And that won't change as they get older, either... You'll get used to it, dear.
There's Ballard. He's in the grove to the northeast. He says the birds sing songs about me sometimes.
The Alliance Arms, up at the north reach, is the only inn in town. The ale's no good but the conversation's always good... Ma doesn't like it when I go there.
Mm, the Mayor runs a mercenary outfit at the barracks, near the town's center. They double as the town guard when things get rough around here.
Sure. Neurik runs the temple at the crossroads and he's really nice... I like it that your Lady Aribeth is here now, too, all tough and graceful and the like.
Oh, sometimes I dream of going places. Most of us girls have spent a night or two at Wanev's just to see what it's like...
Don't get too dirty. Your mother doesn't want to spend every evening getting the stains out of your clothes.
What do you know? You're just a girl!
Yeah, and one day I'm going to be Mom to a brat like you, aren't I? Tyr has no mercy...
The boys are being dumb!
And you're surprised by this?
They never play games that we want to play!
More so now that Neverwinter has the plague. All the sick people or scared-y people come here now. I don't like it. You people stink. No offense.
Hey, you... about me being mean a little - I was just playing with you; you're pretty neat. But don't let it go to your head. Bye!
Can I get a drink, please?
Um... excuse me. Can I get a drink?
All righty, there you go: one "yummy" drink.
Ooh, I feel all sorts of light-headed. Woops! Hee hee. I like it. Can I get another drink, please?
I think you've had enough.
Are you sure your Mr. Eisenfeldt approves? Fine, what will you have?
The same thing you've been bringing. These drinks are so yummy!
Back in a moment.
I'll be with you in a moment.
Don't go too far. I'll probably want another!
Shaldrissa is probably the only one that likes your type, anyway. She thinks you're all going to take her away. If it would shut her up, I wish it would happen.
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> She's just some girl that can't be happy with where she is now. But one day she'll get her wish.
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> And why would I tell you? Why not go find her and talk to her yourself. She's around somewhere. I'm sure she'll be oh-so-excited.
She'll wake up with dirt in her hair and clothes that smell awful and she'll come crying back to Port Llast.
We all make fun of him behind his back but we still go to the cottage. It's much bigger and more exotic on the inside than it appears to be from outside. Must be magic, I guess.
What are you looking for?
Who are you looking for?

As for magical supplies, there's this creepy place behind the Alliance Arms up on the hill. Some of the boys throw ale jugs at it at night, sometimes, but I'm always too scared. I hear there's a witch there.
The only one who came back was Ander. He's at the Alliance Arms, if you want to hear the story.

Cow's still sick then, is she?
Ayup. I reckon it's just the weather we've been having but better safe than sorry.
Better safe than sorry. Have a potion, then, and Tyr be with you.
Howdy Missus.
Why, aren't you all charm after a day of gallivanting about town.
Haljal says he'll fix the plow tomorrow and I picked up a potion for the cow. See? I been busy.
Busy flirtin' with the barmaids at the Alliance Arms, too, no doubt... Well, make sure you take the plow in to Haljal tomorrow, then.
Did you milk the cow?
She wouldn't let me. She's all sick, remember?
Just checking, is all.
Yes, papa.
Did you bring in the wood, son?
Sure did, pa. I did it this morning, honest.
You're not lyin' to me again, are ya?
Papa! I brought it in, I swear. The gnomes must have taken it!
You and yer gnomes. I don't wanna hear another word of it, all right? Now get about yer business.
So what did you do today, kids?
We played monsters. I got to be the wolf man!
You did not! You were playin' soldiers an' thieves. I saw you!
Was not!
Was too!
I don't care, girls have cooties anyway!
Yes'm.

<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> The Eisenfeldts have grown all sullen since they lost their boy, Urth, that's all. Never leave their farmhouse. I've been tillin' their lands for them when I can - I don't know what else to do...
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> Now don't you go tryin' to pry it outa me. A man's entitled to his private thoughts, ain't he?
As if this town didn't have enough bullies... The Eisenfeldts have grown all sullen since they lost their boy, Urth, that's all. They never leave their farmhouse.
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> Now don't you go tryin' to pry it outa me. A man's entitled to his private thoughts, ain't he?
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> I think they're keepin' secrets from you Neverwintans and don't want anybody nosin' about. Mark my words, you can't trust a Luskan half as far as you can throw an ogre.
A few pails short of a honey wagon, are you?
A few pails short of a honey wagon, are you?
Shove off - I've got work to do or the Missus will have me hide.
Eh? Oh, you're that hero they be talkin' about. Whaddaya want?
Howdy, friend.
All right, I've got work to do anyway.
We be simple folk here. Take your ego elsewhere.
A few pails short of a honey wagon, are you?
What kind of questions?
Aye, Ballard keeps a grove in the northeast corner of town. Has more concern for his bears than my cows, mind you.
You can find the Alliance Arms just south of the north gate. Gets a little rowdy every now and then but the servin' girls are nice.
There's the mercenary barracks in the northwest end of town. Mayor Kendrack runs the show there.
There's a place up atop a hill in the northeast that sells magical supplies, but I haven't ever needed to go up there.
Neurik heads the temple in the northwest of town. He's Tyrran - a good man - gives me potions sometimes to help my cow when she goes sick.
Rumor is that Luskan's sealed its gates to anyone comin' in. Some figger they came down wit' the Wailing but I thinks different.

Well, there be Alhelor the wolf-hunter's mechant and Mr. Craulnober who both spend their time at the inn. You should go and speak with them. An' then there's the Eisenfeldts but... but I'm no gossip, you hear?
As if this town didn't have enough bullies... Look, I just think Luskan's keepin' secrets from you Neverwintans, that's all. They don't want anybody nosin' about.
What are ya lookin' for?
Who are you looking for?
As for normal equipment, the Cracked Anvil in the west of town be the only real store here.
My mommy says there's criminals loose all over the place.
My mommy says everyone is dead in Neverwinter.
You look funny!
Girls are better than bo-oys!
My brother's werewolf game is so stoopid.
The boys were playing 'Soldiers and Thieves!' Jimmy was playing Stirge the Baby Thief but he couldn't think of any good riddles!
Get away from me, you're creepy.
The boys were playing 'Soldiers and Thieves!' I saw them!
Okay, me go now, yuh?
Out of my way, money-grubber.
Nevermind.
Me have questions, you answer, yuh?
Urgh, you in me way...
Uh, me go now.
I don't like thinking about snapping your neck but that won't stop me...
No, you tell! You tell or me crush you!
<StartCheck>[Insight]</Start> If you're a sword for hire, where else have you served?
You mercenary. Me pay you, you follow, yuh?
Me want healer priest.
Thanks, that's everything.
Me tree-friend. Der other tree-friends here? Druids an' Rangers?
Me want place to sleep and drink.
What type store around here?
Any other towns nearby?
Could you answer a few questions for me?
Does Port Llast have a ranger or druid I could speak with?
Where can I find an inn?
You're a mercenary. That mean you're for hire?
Know where I can find a priest?
What kind of stores do you have around here?
Are there any other towns in the region?
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> What can you tell me about Luskan?
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> Luskan? What that like?
I need some directions.
Me need directions.
I'm looking for some people.
Me look for certain kind of people.
Could you answer some other questions?
You answer other stuff?

For regular items, try the Cracked Anvil, east of the barracks, along the road. It stocks all of the basic items you'll need. Haljal has some special stuff set aside for his fellow dwarves, too, I hear.
That said, some of my pals here in the barracks still have a taste for adventure and are hungry for work. It's the building behind me here.
Well, there is Charwood to the south. Never been there myself, though. They're a quiet folk, from all acounts, and don't stray far from home.
What can I do for you, citizen? Always ready to help a hero.
You look like more of a troublemaker than a hero to me, but I guess they say you are, so who am I to argue...
One of the Mayor's Merry Men, at your service!
I suppose I could.
Watch your mouth, citizen.
Stay out of trouble, citizen.
That's 'cause your brow's blocking the view, pal...
You're the boss, citizen...
Check the northeast of town, a fella named Ballard.
A few of us maintain quarters at the Alliance Arms - south of the northern gate into town. The ale's not great but the sheets are clean.
Not me, I've had my fill of monsters. Mayor Kendrack pays my room and board and I guard Port Llast from drunken sailors and whatever monsters wander by. That's enough excitement for me.
Temple of Tyr in the northwest part of town, there. Pretty hard to miss.
I was in Neverwinter for a while before the Wailing and even working a pirate gig in Luskan before they kicked all of us foreigners out.
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> When I left, the High Captains were fighting tooth and nail against each other, vying for the Arcane Brotherhood's attention. I doubt it's any different now, either.
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> Sorry, not something I like to think about much...
Whoa, stand down citizen. I don't like thinking about it but I don't like an uproar, either.
When I left, the High Captains were fighting tooth and nail against each other, vying for the Arcane Brotherhood's approval. Things probably aren't much different now, either.
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> Admittedly, it's good to share my stories with a <race> companion.
When I left, the High Captains were fighting tooth and nail against each other, vying for the Arcane Brotherhood's attention. I doubt it's any different now, either.
What are you looking for?
Who are you looking for?

Then there's Eltoora Sarptyl's up on the hill in the northeast corner of town. A lot of the townsfolk don't like that it's there but, to be honest, it's put a lot of money into people's pockets around here.
Who are you?
What's the discussion about here?
Who you be?
Why you not make nice-talk with other guy?
Goodbye.
Let me go talk to the dock master.
That's it. You're going to Neverwinter, or I'm doing some damage.
I spoke with the dock-master, and I want you to change your mind.
Me goes and talks with dock-master.
Me hurts you bad, if you no go Neverwinter!
Me spoke with dock-master. Me wants change you mind.
Nevermind. I'll talk to him again.
<StartCheck>[Insight]</Start> What if I pay you to cover your costs?
Tell me the truth. I want details.
Me wants hearing whole story. True stuff, yeah?
I don't really care. Goodbye.
(yawn) Was you speakings? Me leaving. Bye.
But I know it is. I'm *from* Neverwinter.
Me talks to dock-master again.
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> Me wonders if you think of starving peoples. Starves so you get rich.
Me from Neverwinter. It's okay. Me fixed plague.
Actually, let me go talk to the dock-master.
Me talks with dock-master, again.
300 gold. Take it or leave it.
Me offers 300 gold. You take, yeah?
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> 50 gold should cover the costs, yes?
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> 100 gold will make you go Neverwinter, yeah?
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> 100 gold... will that get you to Neverwinter?
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> Me gives you 50 gold to take to Neverwinter.
